title: Friendly, safe, big rooms and a great location
text:
Perfect location for 5 night stay. Big room with plenty of storage, great bathroom with very powerful shower. Stayed on 6th floor, light and airy. Was street noise early hours but expected as in New York and the Chelsea Flower district.
Felt safe whatever time of the day or night walking around the area.
Reception staff were fabulous, very friendly and helpful. If returning mid/late afternoon there were complimentary fresh cookies and champagne or wine for guests.
Breakfast was buffet style, plenty of choice and kitchen staff were also very friendly. 
I would 100% recommend this hotel.

title: We had a wonderful experience at The Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea! We will definitely be back!
text: My husband and I traveled to NYC to see a Knicks game and MJ the Musical 01/16/25-01/19/24. Due to the proximity of The Fairfield Inn Chelsea to MSG we decided to stay there. What a great choice it was! We were so impressed with the attentiveness and care of the staff to our needs. From suggesting restaurant options, assisting with parking when the garage associated with them wouldn’t take our SUV,  to Tina who was so kind to us each morning as she managed the complimentary breakfast service each day and then there was the Assistant General Manager, Yasayra Rivera, who went the extra mile in helping carry our luggage out to our vehicle in the frigid temperatures and snow upon checkout! We will definitely stay there again!

title: Centrale e tranquillo
text:
Piccole stanze ma ottimo servizio. Posizione ottima e buona colazione.  Personale gentile e disponibile. Pulizia discreta. Buon contesto in una strada piena di fiorente. Silenzioso. 
Tranquillo e familiare. Nessun problema. Ci torneremo.

title: Free veggie sausage patties for breakfast!
text: A nice surprise, a basic king room with no view but larger than many in NYC. Well maintained, clean, nice bathroom. Mattress let the side down a bit being a bit lumpy, but I still had a good night's sleep. Was delighted to discover veggie sausage patties in the free breakfast. Breakfast would benefit from some vegan spread too. I would definitely stay here again.

title: A comfortable place with terrific staff
text:
My wife and I spent 3 nights here and it was an excellent experience. One hopes for a clean room in good condition. For a lower priced place in NYC anything above this is a bonus. We have stayed at other places in this area, such as the Hyatt Place a few blocks away. This was far better. The room was large enough. We even had a closet (as opposed to Hyatt Place) and a desk with a comfortable chair. The bathroom was a little inconvenient as the door was wide and room so small that you had to kind of navigate to get in and out. However, the plumbing was excellent and this was just a minor inconvenience. 

We were pleasantly surprised that breakfast was included. We had missed that on the website. It was fine. It is nice to be able to get a cup of coffee and a bite to eat to start your day.

What made the stay so excellent was the staff. Every person we interacted with from check-in to check-out was very pleasant and not in that superficial way where they say good morning while looking at their shoes. These people looked you in the eye and went out of their way to assist you. For instance, one morning my wife had her hands full with coffees and a little breakfast to bring up to the room. The front desk clerk saw her struggling to call the elevator, came around from the reception desk, pressed the call button on the elevator. She then waited and when my wife entered the elevator she went in and pressed the floor button for her. We also had a minor leak at one point in the bathroom and they immediately sent someone to fix it.

For NY, this is an inexpensive place but it was really a pleasure.

title: Just what I needed!
text: Selected this hotel on whim, based on proximity to a venue for work. Best decision ever! Very clean and inviting place. Great breakfast options. The room was somewhat spacious and had heating, thankfully. I can't complain. A few hours luggage storage after checking out really helped. It was not only my first trip to NYC, but my first outside my country. It was everything I could have hoped for. No hassles. I travelled here in January so the prices were very decent. Will definitely consider making this my regular NYC hotel when I can afford it.

title: Wonderful experience at the Fairfield Inn & Suites by Marriott New York/Chelsea
text: The experience of me and my group was EXTRAORDINARY. Incredibly friendly staff, friendly, kind, ready to help you feel like a part of the family in the hotel. Excellent location of the hotel, clean, tidy, safe. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

title: Hôtel surcoté
text:
On a aimé : 
- L'emplacement de l'hôtel proche du métro, dans un quartier agréable,
- Petit déjeuner varié,

On n'a pas aimé · 
- Une climatisation vieillissante et extrêmement bruyante qui souffle un air glacial capable d'enrhumer un ours polaire !
- Un matelas inadapté à la taille du sommier plus petit, d'où cette désagréable sensation de chavirer la nuit.
- Une salle du petit déjeuner... trop petite.

title: Hôtel de passage mais pas de long séjour
text:
Hôtel très bien situé dans la 28ième rue, personnel agréable et merci à la jeune fille de l'accueil pour le français, chambre bien mais donnant sur la rue donc hyper bruyante (à peine 2H de calme dans la nuit) ! 
Petit déjeuner américain en buffet bien mais le tout plastique c'est bof !
Ménage de la chambre fait tous les 2 jours c'est moyen vu le prix de la chambre !

title: Poor experience
text: The room, theoretically for 4 people, was so small that it was impossible even only opening the laggages. The toilet stopped working and needed to be fixed. The roller shutter broke and was never repaired. On top of it, the room was cleaned only once in 6 days and we needed to ask for new towels every few days as they were not renewed. Breakfast is made by very poor quality food in a space which is undersized compared to the number of customers.

title: Good choice
text: One morning there were 2 semi-vagabond people sleeping on the rooftop patio, and I strongly recommend the hotel make the rooftop require a key card. It would also be nice if the roof was a no-smoking area. Otherwise, the location was wonderful! All the staff were top notch. The larger size room was plenty spacious. The breakfast was great. We'd definitely stay again.

title: Top Notch Hotel with a Staff to match!
text: The staff decorated the room for my Daughter's birthday and went above and beyond to make sure their stay was top of the line.  Christina and YaYa are true professionals who take great pride in their work.  The rooms were clean and comfortable.  The service from all the employees was second to none.  I would recommend this hotel to all those staying in NYC.

title: Ein wirklich schönes Hotel welches ich definitiv öfters buchen werde
text: Freundliches und sehr hilfsbereites Personal. Frühstück war Continental. Das fand ich für mich persönlich sehr gut. Kaffee (Starbucks) und Heisses Wasser gab es den ganzen Tag über. In der Lobby ist noch ein Getränkespender mit infused cold Water. Dazu ist dort noch ein ganz kleiner Shop mit Getränken (non alcoholic sowie Bier und Wein. Insgesamt war das Hotel sehr sauber für amerikanische Verhältnisse. Eiswürfelmaschine war in der Lower Lobby. Unser Zimmer (Cityview) war ausreichen groß. Das Highlight zusätzlich ist das Rooftop des Hotels mit einer sehr guten Aussicht. Von dort kann man sogar die Spitze des Empire State Building sehen. Insgesamt würde ich das Hotel immer wieder buchen. Sehr Zentral gelegen. McDonald’s 24/7 direkt nebenan. Links runter hat man die Metro Up und Downtown. Ca 3 Minuten zu Fuß. Dies dann durch den Fower District. Dies ist noch ein Highlight in dem Betondschungel. Man kommt aus dem Hotel und beide Seiten der Straße sind vollgepackt mit Blumen der Blumenhändler dieser Straße. Gerade in Warmen eine Erholung für die Augen und die Nase. In direkter Nähe sind auch noch ein Deli, New York Gift Shop, 2 7Eleven, Pizzerien, Starbucks (an der Metrostation) usw.

title: Great hotel in NYC flower district
text:
The welcome and professionalism of the team at the hotel was very good….they really do care and try to make your stay as comfortable as possible.(Special thanks to Tina and Val making our breakfasts, Mercedes the receptionist who always greeted us with a smile and advice and Christine the supervisor for assisting us with my bed issue).
The hotel is in a brilliant location …in the flower district with great restaurants around.
A five minute walk away takes you to three subway stations so you can access everywhere in the city and with penn station only a seven minute walk…All Airports on cheap ,efficient public transport….an hour to all door to door!
We felt very safe staying at the hotel.It was clean and very quiet….everything you expect from a great Marriott Fairfield hotel and excellent value for money.

title: Perfect
text: Excellent location [however in NYC, there are many excellent locations], surrounded by many flower shops, and within walking distance of many attractions. It is a short walk to Madison Square Garden, as well as a reasonable walk into Midtown. and going the other way a reasonable walk to Greenwich, Soho and Lower East side.  The rooms were very nice, clean and updated. We opted for no room service for our three night stay, which was absolutely no problem. Breakfast was perfect. Plenty of choices and convenient to get you going in the morning. Staff was very helpful and courteous. I’ll told everything was perfect and as expected.

title: Great time in lovely Chelsea
text: The Fairfield Inn & Suites is located in the beautiful Chelsea neighborhood. Rooms are perfectly clean and the front desk staff was very helpful with a special shout out to Yaya, Briana and Mercedes.

title: Great stay in New York
text: We had a great stay in New York. Very friendly staff that helped us superbly with our checking in (compliments to Cristina), good rooms with comfortable beds. Rooms (and beds) are not big, but big enough for a city trip. Rooms kept nicely clean (cleaning on request).  The location was very good, metro close by and many great sites on walking distance (we walked a lot) We enjoyed the breakfast, with good coffee. Tip, get some nice NY take away food and eat it on the rooftop outside

title: Good location, friendly staff, clean and at the flower market.
text: Great location close to Penn station and subways. Really nice to wake up and be in the middle of the flower market! Room was super clean and serviceable, staff was friendly and helpful and efficient. Breakfast was among the better at hotels in this class.

title: Good hotel!
text: This was a really good hotel as  compared to other NYC hotels.  If you're  not familiar with  NYC hotels, hotel rooms  are typically very small.  Ours was slightly larger than other NYC hotels that  I've stayed in but there are no fridges in the room (but I think you could request one) and no rooms with connecting doors.  It was very clean and the staff was extremely nice and accommodating. Christina O., Nakima and Briana were all amazing.  They were very friendly and helpful throughout our stay.  There was a lounge area that you could hang out in 24 hours which was great especially with the rooms being small.  The breakfast is included which I love!  It was also very good with a large variety of items including scrambled eggs (they had cheese on the side that you can add), bacon (the next day they had veggie sausage) make your own waffles, bagels, muffins, cereals etc.  The location was also very good as it was in the middle of the Flower District so our street was very pretty.  It is close to the High Line and Hudson Yard and not far from Times Square.  I would recommend staying here.  It was a little pricier than other hotels (but breakfast was included) Thad I looked at but overall a really good experience.  I would recommend staying here.

title: Perfect stay in the city
text:
The room was clean, beds comfy. Nice breakfast with hot options which was a huge cost savings. The hotel is in Chelsea, less than a block to the subway. It’s on a street with lots of florists and landscapers;
Fresh beautiful flowers lined the street daily. Much less crowded in Chelsea, and quiet. Coffee and water was available all day, and everyone at the front desk was super nice. Rooftop was a nice area to relax. Wonderful stay all around.

title: Not the worst, solid average
text:
Pros- decent breakfast and somedays they even had free cold water available for your day of exploring.
Centrally located and easy access to subway
Beautiful flower shops throughout entire street 
Area felt reasonably safe even after dark 
Staff was attentive for things like fridge for our room, clogged toilet, extra towels, blankets etc
Cons- room was teeny, tiny
Beds in a double rooms were not full, they were more like an oversized twin and not made for two person sleeping arrangements.
No pool, no restaurant
Roof top closed 
They serviced our room even when our DND sign was Up

title: Great Location, Great Value
text: Great stay, for a great price in New York. The location could not be better. We upgraded to a larger room, and it was very nice and comfortable. We were able to walk to many wonderful places, and we were close to several subway lines and bus routes through Manhattan. The staff was very nice and very helpful. The breakfasts were not gourmet, but there was plenty of everything. We loved being in the heart of the flower district and seeing all the beautiful flowers every day. The cost  was very reasonable for such a great stay in Manhattan.

title: Jason at the front desk helped resolve the issues we had. Great experience overall.
text: Not many people need wired internet - but we did on this trip. It didn't work. Jason sent a tech up to the room to investigate. There was a broken cable and the jack on the Ruckus internet box was not enabled. The tech referred us to a phone number to another tech that Marriott subcontracts that we had to call to enable the box for "security reasons." Then we were referred to a few more people. After ~20-30 minutes of playing with broken cables and making phone calls, we gave up and went to our client's office. That said, Jason at the front desk did everything he could do to resolve the issue and gave us points to compensate for the problems. He was the best! Everything else, except one towel that had what appeared to be stained with old makeup on it, went great. Unlike other reviews, the room was very quite and the view was great!

title: Fantastic staff
text: Christina at the fro t desk remembered my name and called out a friendly greeting every time I saw her.  Val in the breakfast area was attentive and kind. We had an issue with our tv reception and Victor fixed it ina professional manner.  It is an easy walk bro Madison Square Garden and Uber or taxis were readily available.  Subway is an easy walk too so easy location out of the gray of Times Square.  The garden pizza at Andiamo pizza was quick walk for first night.  Great value hotel stay in NYC.

title: Great location, clean rooms and friendly staff!
text: Amazing stay … super convenient location, clean rooms and very friendly staff! Free breakfast was a nice addition. Christina at the front desk was so welcoming and personable! Keep up the great hospitality.

title: Brief work related stay - very good!
text: I arrived during busy check-in time & Christina handled every guest in line with efficiency and a SMILE. Room clean, location perfect for subway 1 train, internet great. SO MANY FLOWERS on the street!  Who knew this was the flower district!?!  Pleasant surprise

title: Front Desk Agents are AMAZING
text:
This is a very simple yet cozy hotel. The price is great for the location! Besides the already mentioned proximity to touristy places, you have plenty of fast food and groceries a stone’s throw away (Target’s right around the corner). 

The TRUE highlight however was how kind Christina Ortiz was. She was super helpful and lovely on the first chaotic day I had in NYC, went above and beyond. Not only that, I received a TON of packages during my stay and not only was she super patient with me, she always had a smile on her face and was in a great mood. Anyone who has had to deal with tourists knows this is hard to do every single day!! I’m staying here again soon and chose it a 2nd time solely because of her.

title: Non potevamo chiedere di meglio. Sopra le aspettative
text:
La struttura è ottima, centrale e con accessi a due delle principali metro a pochi passi. La pulizia viene fatta sotto richiesta del giorno prima, impeccabile. La colazione internazionale è davvero ben fornita, unico "neo" avrei gradito un qualcosa al cioccolato ma è una mia preferenza. Per il resto, sia il personale addetto alla colazione che al check-in è stato fantastico. 
Christina alla reception ci ha aiutato anche nel darci indicazioni per attrazioni di NY.

title: incredible staff and rooftop view
text: This is an amazing hotel with greatest staff. After my family enjoyed a remembrance weekend at the nearby Millennium UN Plaza Hilton property, two members of our party came here to spend another night in the hotel. My sister and I joined my nephew and sister in law with our meal on the rooftop space. Lovely view. So many laughs and fun. Thank you Faatima and rest of staff for making us feel so blessed.

title: Friendliest and most outgoing staff ever!
text:
The staff at this hotel says it far apart from so many others I visit while traveling often for work. Fatima was so kind and welcoming throughout our stay. She made us feel at home and was an absolute delight to converse with. While I was there for pleasure, I travel often around the country for business and rarely do I receive the outgoing and friendly attitude she presented. Her sense of humor and positive energy were noticed, not only by myself and the other gentleman that stayed in the room, but also the group of friends that came in to visit a couple times. Her greetings when entering AND exiting the building were very appreciated and helped begin AND end our weekend adventures in the city on a high note. Again, it is more uncommon than common to be treated this way in today’s society. A true breath of fresh air she is in this world that could use more like her. 
 
Secondly, Jaeda was the person to greet me upon arrival. While I only had a couple interactions with her, she was also very kind, friendly, and had an energy about her that enhanced my experience and made me feel incredibly welcome. Jaeda’s friendly attitude and professionalism were exceptional and should be noted. 
 
The entire staff at this facility should be acknowledged and rewarded for the environment they are creating. It was clear that everyone I encountered at the hotel was positively affected by the surrounding atmosphere.

title: Wonderful Time
text: My wife and I visited NYC for fun over the last weekend. We had a wonderful stay at The Fairfield Inn in Chelsea. We felt safe, everything was clean, we were upgraded to a larger room, and we felt very welcomed by the staff. I would highly recommend staying here if you are traveling to NYC. There is a Starbucks around the corner, as well as a 711, Mcdonald's, and a great bar across the street, and it is very accessible to the subway lines.

title: Fairfield Chelsea Great Place
text:
Had a good time in NYC. The Fairfield Inn in Chelsea was great. Janessa and her Marriott team were very accommodating. For the price, you can't beat the location, it is in the heart of the action. Also, the breakfast which was included was amazing.
I would definitely stay there again.

title: Not All Rooms are Created Equal
text: I have stayed at this hotel twice. I returned because I had a good experience the previous time. This time was different. This time, I could hear the other guests while in their rooms. The bathroom seemed to offer a smaller surface space for toiletries. The bedding was substandard from what I had experienced seven months ago. I may have to reconsider my next stay in NYC.

title: Reasonable value, but some details are overlooked
text:
3.5 stars from me. Hotel is about what you'd expect in a mid-range hotel in NYC. Very good location near lots of subway lines. Typical breakfast buffet for this type of hotel, which is great to get you started on a long day of exploring. The staff were super nice, and in the evenings they put out cookies. 

The room itself was only ok. I expect small rooms in NYC, so not surprising that the bathroom was just big enough to open the door and the closet was tiny and barely held a small rollaboard suitcase. That didn't bother me. 

But the room itself was poorly furnished. The room had ONE floor lamp for the entire room placed in a corner near the TV, no bedside lamps at all.  It was really dark in there. And even though I had a larger room with a small empty corner, there was not even a small easy chair or anywhere to sit other than the bed. The desk chair was really old, torn fabric, wobbly and uncomfortable. It almost felt like some stuff had been taken away and not yet replaced. A few cheap lamps or a chair would not cost much and would have improved the experience.

title: Excellent value, great service, awesome location
text: I was very, very pleased with my stay at this hotel from February 14-17, 2023. I was greeted by Christine, who was extra personable, and so helpful. I loved her attitude! My room was small, but very comfortable and well equipped, a great bargain for NYC! The breakfast buffet was very good and Tina, who works there, went to extra efforts to make me vegetarian sausages so I could have a great breakfast with my dietary needs! They also had soy milk for coffee, which I really appreciated. It is in a great location, in the florist district, and so many restaurants around, and easy access to everything! My stay was very satisfactory, and I will certainly stay there again!

title: Enjoyed our stay and will be back!
text:
We had a great time. It was our first time in NYC with me, my husband and 10-year-old son. We were greeted by Christina at the front desk who was friendly, and knowledgeable and checked us in quickly. She always greeted me by my name and with a smile! The hotel is in a great location across from other hotels and in the middle of the plant nursery district. It was nice to be greeted by all the flowers and plants each morning. The hotel is also close to the subway - just at the corner. We walked to the Empire State Building and Madison Square Garden. Lots of food (great ramen place just next door) and pharmacies nearby as well. There is a small "market" in the lobby where you can buy snacks and drinks.

Hot breakfast buffet each morning which offered juice, oatmeal, DIY waffles, scrambled eggs, sausage (they even had veggie sausage one day which  was a plus for us since we are vegetarians!!), cereal, toast, muffins, apples, tea and coffee. A great way to start our day and not have to worry about where we would get breakfast. Buffet was clean and staff were good about replenishing items. 

Hotel room was spacious but we did have the executive room - which is just like a regular-sized hotel room elsewhere but I guess in NYC is considered a little bit bigger than the typical small rooms. Room was clean, vinyl plank flooring instead of carpet, large TV with lots of movie channels included, and a very comfy bed.

Overall, we had a great stay and will definitely be back. Christina, thank you again for such stellar customer service during our stay. You are a gem and we look forward to staying her during our next visit.

title: Christina Ortiz is great!
text:
Amazing and beautiful location.
The front desk was SUPERB- Christina Ortiz was there our entire stay. Give this staff member a raise! She was kind and worked hard to please us. She loves her job and reps the company well!

title: Fatima at front desk.  Really good find.
text: this hotel is very centrally located in Midtown.  I don't normally like midtown, but this hotel was a very nice find n such a busy area.  I was most impressed by the front desk lady named Fatima.  What a warm and welcoming first impression she gives when you first enter the lobby.  While waiting on mhy uber or my son, I saw that this  interaction with everyone she encountered was the same whether they were first arriving, leaving or just returning to the hotel.  The hotel itself is clean, comfortable and accessable to lots that New York has to offer. it was a nice find.

title: Good Location, Great Staff!
text:
Great location. Very friendly staff (Christina at the front desk was excellent!). 

Good selection of choices at breakfast as well. 

One of the best mid-range Marriott properties I have stayed at in the city.

title: Nice hotel with great service
text: I had a nice stay at this hotel last week. The front desk lady Christina was warm, welcoming and making you feel home. The room was nice with a big window, a rare feature in NYC. The price was reasonable. There're many flower shops around and it's close to the Korean town. I'd stay here again.

title: Nice hotel, am looking forward to staying here again!
text:
Hotel was perfect, breakfast area and staff, too!  Clean, kept up, very professional staff.
Best value in NYC. Only thing I'd change is to advertise the beds as full/double. They are not queen size. The entire hotel industry is doing this and it's wrong.

Also read your reviews on TripAdvisor.  I did, only issues those reviewers have is the light bulbs are not bright enough.  Crazy, I brought a brighter bulb assuming this was an issue, it was!  I changed bulbs and the room was bright!  Not a big expense!

Access to the roof top is great! This is a really nice hotel, am looking forward to staying here again!

title: Great location and staff
text:
I was really please. The value was great and location was in a good spot, near to all central. The room was a decent size, great shower. Breakfast was included daily and hot drinks available all day.

The staff went beyond their job role to help me and were really welcoming. I'd go back and recommend the hotel to others.

title: One to remember
text:
Words can’t express how much this trip meant for my daughter and me. Our first trip to NYC and after searching the internet reading review after review of the right place to stay I found this one. Mainly because of location, breakfast and cost of stay. I couldn’t be more happy if my decision. 

It’s perfectly located in Chelsea. We got the king executive and the size was great! Our train arrived about an hour before check in and Jaeda greeted us with a smile, held the luggage and even gave us perfect spots to visit before our event that night. When it was time to get out luggage and check in, she remembered which one was ours and quickly brought it safely to us. 
Every time we left the hotel we were happily greeted with a welcome back. 
I had forgotten my toothbrush 🤦🏼‍♀️ but the hotel saved me there! The breakfast was incredible, hot coffee, eggs, meats and waffles! 
I had requested a view in the room, and was given just that. The staff here is amazing. So sweet, which I didn’t expect. 
Jaeda and Janessa are the perfect staff here. I really can’t say enough good things about this hotel. It made our trip, and definitely one that my daughter will remember forever.

title: Lovely stay in a great part of the city
text: Really loved our stay at The Fairfield Chelsea/ Timesquare. The location is great as we are walking distance to the shops and Broadway plays, but not in the middle of all the chaos. We were surrounded by flower shops which made the walk to and from the hotel more lovable. There were also nearby stations that can take us to uptown and downtown, so we were able to make the most of our stay. The room is clean, well lit, and definitely larger than your usual NY rooms. We’ll definitely stay here again when we visit NY! Plus who can resist having free breakfast for 2 with your stay. Pictures are the view from our room facing W28th.

title: Dream Stay provided by Dream Team
text: If you find yourself exploring Chelsea in Manhatten, and why wouldn’t you: there is a lot to see and do [see below]; you need a great base from which to relax and energize and strap on your walking shoes. Fairfield Chelsea should be at the top of your list. It is situated right in the midst of it all. But really, it is the awesome team of Cristina, Fatima and Tina that make it extra special. The place is a well-oiled machine, no matter the crowd. The whole place is immaculate, comfortable, professional AND friendly – a rare find. The rooms are well appointed, attractive and did I say clean – a first priority for us. The Breakfast Buffet is a delight, with so many hot and cold choices that are replenished regularly, and again, kept spotless, even with unruly children running around. The price is very fair. As a bonus, you stroll through “ a series of gardens,” as soon as you go out the front door and pass through all the plants and flowers on 28th St. You are near a wide variety of places and things to see and do. A small sample: You can walk to the amazing High Line and Little Island [perched on top of all those golf tees] Parks; as well as stroll or bike ride the Hudson River Park; take a cruise from Chelsea Piers [recommending the NY Architecture cruise]; visit the Whitney Art Museum, Pier 57, FIT and plenty of art galleries and even walk to the Intrepid Sea, Air, Space museum; enjoy a performance at the Joyce Theater. Of course, being in NYC, eateries abound and some of them in those cute covid-inspired outdoor venues. At the end of exhilarating and exhausting days, you can return to your oasis of peace at the Fairfield Chelsea.

title: Great stay
text: The hotel was nice, but the staff made it such a good stay! They were very helpful with all my questions and just nice to talk to. The location was great. Could smell fresh flowers as soon as you walk out of the hotel. Breakfast is simple, what you would expect, but a nice perk! We will definitely stay here again next time we are in the city.

title: Good location, better staff
text:
The hotel location was very good for our family stay. Near Empire State and walking distance to Rockefeller, Times Square, Madison Square Garden. Convenient subway stops nearby and lots of food options.
We had a 3 twin suite with single sleeper sofa - beware, it is fully as uncomfortable as you would expect.
Breakfast was ok. Fresh fruit, selection of breads, eggs, protein, DIY waffles.
The stars of this property are the staff. Over our five days, they remembered us by name, asked about our days, took care of us, answered every questions we (and other guests) had and never once asked for our room number.  From housekeeping to front desk to breakfast, the entire team was polite, friendly and personable. 
I cannot say enough good things about coming back to a hotel at the end of long, cold and often wet days and being greeted and treated as a friend rather than another room number.

title: Staff great! Hotel not so much
text:
Hotel needs work. Bedroom only had 1 night stand lamp. Heating system has problems, possibly the thermostat on our hvac unit, microwave at breakfast is broken. (How hard is it to replace a microwave??) No mini-fridge in room. 
Staff is great. Friendly, energetic and helpful. Doing the best they can with a poor hotel.

title: Awesome Front Desk Staff
text: I have never written a review, but I stay at this property a couple of times a month and find the front desk staff to be incredibly friendly and welcoming.  Thanks Christina Ortiz for making me smile!

title: Christina Ortiz made our ENTIRE trip!!!!  Best hospitality I have ever experienced anywhere I've traveled!
text: Christina Ortiz was the total highlight of our entire trip!  Her kindness, professionalism, compassion and wonderful personality made our stay incredible.  She is one of a kind, and in all my years of traveling (overseas and in the states) I have not met a more personable, loving person.  I would recommend this hotel to anyone solely because of Christina.  That is not to say that the rest of the staff was INCREDIBLE!!! Every single person we came into contact with was so nice and helpful!  The hotel upgraded us for our stay, and allowed us to have a (very!) late checkout.  We were in the Macy's Day Parade and had traveled all the way from Colorado.  The hospitality we received at this hotel was so memorable, it was one of the highlights of stories told when we got home.  I would recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to NYC!  Housekeeping did an incredible job, the breakfast staff as well!  Shoutout to Alicia Pagan as well!  So kind and professional.  I cannot say enough nice things about this hotel.  We will definitely be back!!  STAY HERE WITHOUT ANY DOUBT IN YOUR MIND! : )

title: Voyage à New York
text:
Super hôtel, personnel très sympa ! Nous avons passé un excellent séjour dans cette belle ville. Merci tout particulièrement à Christina toujours avec le sourire pour nous accueillir et pour répondre à nos demande.
Famille Roy Durix

title: Friendliest Front Desk in NYC
text: Jaeda and Christina are the two friendliest and kindest front desk folks I've met in many, many, many business trips to NYC. They show genuine care and respect for every guest who walks in and go out of their way to make people feel appreciated and at home here. Great service.

title: Best value in Manhattan!
text:
I had my best stay here during my two-month business trip along the East Coast. The hotel is very conveniently located on a quiet block in the bustling Chelsea neighborhood, within walking distance to many of the most iconic landmarks in NYC. 

The room was on the smaller side like most hotels in Manhattan, but it was clean and tidy, with everything I needed for my stay.

The staff were all nice and accommodating, always ready to help the guests. A big shout out to Christina, who spared no effort to ensure the quality of service. Her contagious smile and kindness surely make my stay a very pleasant one.

title: Great staff, but please get some mini fridges.
text:
First of all, shout out to Christina and the rest of the staff at Fairfield Inn Chelsea, they were very friendly, and patient. We had a lot of packages and requests, and the staff was always quick and helpful.

All the things wrong with this hotel is not their fault, the heating is janky, the lighting is this horrible dim fluorescent lamp so forget about doing any complicated makeup work here ladies, there's no safe or fridge and this is the first hotel I've ever been to without either of those. I honestly would give this place a five if management invested in normal lightbulbs, mini fridges, and safes.

title: Pleasant stay at Fairfield Chelsea
text:
Staff were very friendly and helpful. Christina Ortiz at the front desk was a delight. Accomodations were great. Room was clean and pleasant. I appreciated the complimentary waters.
I would happily stay here again.

title: Best value in NYC.
text: Great value, nice room, excellent staff. Recognized my Ambassador status. Perfect location in the heart of Chelsea. I highly recommend this hotel for business. Apparently the hotel will be upgrading the gym with new equipment in January 2023.

title: Genuinely sincere woman running the show.
text: The staff here is so pleasant. Alicia and Jaeda at the front desk were honestly and naturally sincere and genuine. While visiting the breakfast bar I encountered Val from the kitchen and she was a genuinely altruistic person. Our rooms were clean thanks to Ingrid who is running that show.

title: Home away from home
text: The Fairfield has small, but adequate rooms, the best showers, and the perfect location for exploring ManhAttan. But what really makes it stand out is its friendly staff. Christina worked the evening shift at the front desk for our entire stay, greeted us by name whenever we arrived or departed, and made us feel at home in a city of strangers.

title: All good!
text: The location is really good!  We had a huge room on the 2nd floor overlooking all the flowers outside the many flowershops in this part of the street - and straight view into the Kung Fu Academy across the street. We slept so good in the most comfortable bed!  The roof top terrace was perfect for relaxing with a drink after a long day out and about the city. There were so many delishous choices in the breakfast buffet! We were very happy with our stay there!

title: Good choice for travellers.
text: Would have been easy 5 except for bathroom door open inwards into a very small bathroom space. Staff excellent, service excellent, situation central to everything. Plenty of good local restaurants. Room met all requirements especially fast free internet.

title: Great hotel in NYC
text: Great hotel with fantastic location (close to subways main lines, surrounded by flowers shops and central enough to walk to major attractions). The staff is lovely, smiling and helpful, it makes you really feel like a valuated guest. The breakfast is nice and replenish regularly. And the rooftop is perfect to unwind after a long day. I will definitely come back.

title: Great stay for business trip
text: We had amazing customer service from Christina checking in and out.  Super welcoming, kind and professional.  We had a lovely stay.  Nice size rooms for NYC.  Convenient location. Would definitely stay here again.

title: Birthday trip
text: This hotel provided great service to us. I have to shout out Christina from the front desks  because as we walked in she gave us a warm welcome. She also found out it was my birthday and left gifts in the hotel room whilst I was out. Would come here again!! We booked a king room and the rooms were fairly big with  nice views.

title: Great stay and great staff at Fairfield Inn Chelsea - kudos to Sydney Thompson at the front desk!
text: Had a great stay at Fairfield Inn by Marriott at Chelsea. Sydney Thompson at the front desk was awesome. The other staff members at the front desk were great too. They all greeted me whenever I got back to the hotel. Felt like home. Very courteous, helpful, and even helped me seamlessly extend my stay. I chose to extend my stay because the hotel was great. Perfect for friends. Convenient location right near the 28th Street Station. Great breakfast and the staff at the breakfast was also very nice. I recommend the larger king room.

title: Great experience thanks to amazing stuff
text:
Stuff has been very helpful special Kudos to Christine that have made.my stay so.much better.. 
A little loud because of.the noise outside. But room was spacious, comfortable and clean.  Great location too

title: Awful expereince. Stay away.
text: The hotel is in poor condition,especially  room 706, I am surprise they even rent the room out. The room is located right outside the elevator , the smoke detector is broken and taped over, there is a sign in the room that says the steam from the shower can set off the smoke detector. No toilet paper holder, the TP was placed on the toilet tank. When we were walking back to the hotel after dinner, we saw rats running around outside the hotel doors. Not just 1 rat but there was a congregation of them, around 6-7, I screamed so loud that I scared the  people around us. I made a bad decision n selecting this hotel. This hotel should not be a part of the Marriott family.

title: Incredible staff
text: I was blown away by how kind the staff was.  I called Fatima the day before I arrived and told her it was my anniversary and asked if they could put some roses in the room and her colleague Alicia not only put two dozen roses in the room by decorated the entire room.  I’ve never had service like that at any hotel in the world.  Thank you!

title: Enjoyed my stay.
text: The staff is excellent and the best part of the stay.  Everyone was friendly including maintenance, kitchen and front desk.  Christine was welcoming and helpful - always calling me by name, granting late check out and getting me a cab.  The breakfast spot was light with good coffee.  The rooms are small but classy and well appointed.  Location is a bit off the main roads as reflected in the price, but not a game changer.

title: Great Customer service
text: While the hotel is an older one with smaller rooms my average stay was upgraded by the customer service Christina Ortiz provided.  She went above and beyond to make our stay great.  Thanks!  I would recommend this hotel because of Christina.

title: Hôtel très bien situé
text: Vraiment bien situé pour visiter, très central. On peut marcher à plein d’attraction à voir, ou il y a un métro juste au bout de la rue. Il y a des boutiques de fleurs autours,  alors ça donne un charme. C’est un coin que je qualifierais de moyen pour Manhattan, j’ai vue des plus beaux secteurs et moins beaux aussi, mais pour le prix nous étions vraiment content avec notre choix. Le déjeuner était bien et tellement pratique.

title: Excellent customer service
text: The entire staff at the Fairfield Manhattan/Chelsea were phenomenal. Very friendly and helpful. Christian Ortiz, front desk agent was amazing.  The hotel is clean and well taken care of. I look forward to staying here again

title: Pleasant but basic
text: The 28th street location , between 6th and 7th is also the home to many other major name hotels, and the location is convenient.  The 1 subway is a short walk and the block is in the flower district - many flower outlets. Felt safe and crowd on streets not threatening except for one late night encounter Got upgraded to a larger room, which is not really large.  Would recommend larger room. Elevators are fast and functional. TV acess to all of Showtime.  Price of room attracted me.  Staff is friendly.  Had minor plumbing issue that was fixed timely. better places but pricier.  Quiet but on high floor

title: Great room and experience
text: I will be trying to book this hotel again the next time I visit the city. The room is spacious for an NYC hotel. It had a mid-size ironing board and iron, which is hard to find in a hotel. My only concern for the room was the shower door did leak on the floor, but it was not terrible. While getting breakfast in the hotel, there was some broken glass that fell on the atrium of the dining area. I am not sure where it came from, but alerted the staff member at the front desk. The staff was so courteous from check-in to check-out. It is one of the best NYC hotel experiences to date. Thank you.

title: Super convenient location
text: Cannot beat the location at this price. The room is small but it was clean and was perfectly adequate for our needs because we were out sightseeing anyway. Its very convenient to Chelsea attractions, Times Square, and Central Park. They offer breakfast every morning, and rotate several items so you don't get tired of the same options. Hotel was great about letting us store our bags before check-in and was responsive to other requests. There is also a park with a running track nearby so if you don't want to hit the treadmill or wade through the crowd it is a nice option. Would definitely return to this spot.

title: Manhattan Adventure - home base
text: This hotel served as a perfect home base for our weeklong Manhattan adventure. The hotel is clean and the staff super friendly; rooms are small, but we didn't spend much time in the hotel, other than to sleep and eat breakfast (included). Easy walk to subway to get uptown or downtown, easy walk to Penn Station and Times Square. We'd stay there again in a heartbeat.

title: Recomendo
text:
Hotel bem localizado no Distrito das flores.
O comércio no entorno do hotel é muito bom e tem estação de Metro bem próxima.
Ótimo café da manhã.
Quarto limpo, espaçoso comparando com os quartos em NYC.
Atendentes gentis.
Um especial elogio a funcionária Fatoumata, que com seu profissionalismo e delicadeza, cobre o hospede de atenção. Ela consegue fazer o hospede se sentir em casa.
Certamente voltaremos ao Fairfield Inn & Suites Nova York Manhattan/Chelsea.

title: Fantastic staff
text:
My room wasn't ready in time but Sydney and Mai Ajah went above and beyond holding my bags while I ran around the city. They really took care of us when we got back. Amazing experience. Will recommend to all.
Take care of them! They are gems and deserve a raise!

title: Great Visit! Great Staff!!
text: My wife and I were coming to visit our daughter in May and we had last minute airline cancellations with lots of stress.  I called the hotel from the airport to see about adjusting my reservation and I was very fortunate to have had Mai answer the phone.  She listened to my dilemma and immediately rearranged my reservations with a cheery voice and relieved a little of my stress.  We were able to come the next day and every employee we ran into from the kitchen crew to housekeeping were always very pleasant.   We were fortunate enough to meet Mai and made an instant friend!   My wife and I decided to make an impromptu visit 3 weeks later in June and realized there was no need to look at other hotels in the area as we were so impressed with our previous visit.  On our second visit, this past weekend, we were greeted by Sydney and Tamar, who were just as friendly and helpful as Mai.  We were fortunate to see Mai again as we checked out and once again she remembered us and engaged in great conversation!  We would highly recommend this hotel for its clean rooms and most importantly, GREAT staff!   Thanks for making our past two trips a great experience!!  Jon R

title: horrifying mattress, lovely staff
text:
The worst mattress I have slept on in years (including extensive travel in developing countries).  It sagged almost to the base board, popped and springs were popping out the side.  Arriving late at night after a 9+ hour international flight, i didnt have the energy to ask to change rooms.  Also street is super noisy and desk lamp was broken.

The staff was lovely,however.  Rooftop lounge a nice touch.

 A working mattress an operational room is my basic expectation for a Marriot - however.

title: Comfort on Business with Stellar Front Desk Staff
text: I travel regularly on business across the US and Europe and had to write this review to give a huge shout out to Mai-Ajah Keel at the Front Desk of the Fairfield Inn Chelsea in NYC.  Not only does she run that desk with poise, professionalism and care, but you can see she takes immense pride in what she does and the happiness of her guests.  She treats guests like they were her own, which is rare in this day and age.  Having grown up in a family that's been in hospitality for generations, I see so much potential in Mai.  I only hope the Marriott organization realizes this quickly before they lose such amazing talent.  Mai is the kind of young hospitality rockstar that Marriott should invest in big time.  Spend 10 years teaching her the ropes at better and bigger hotels and she'll run one of them for you one day.  THANK YOU, MAI!  Keep it up.

title: Phenomenal hosts
text: Mai and Tamar were incredible hosts. They went out of their to make sure I’d be comfortable, especially as someone who needs to spend a lot of time on the road. Mai got me an upgrade for 2/3 nights to a suite after I mentioned I’m a light sleeper, and that made a huge difference as I was prepping for a conference.

title: Ok hotel, but has some of the best staff in all of New York.
text: I stayed here with my family to check out New York and visit some family. The hotel was ok. Breakfast was ok and rooms were lacking some of the normal amenities Fairfield hotels have. But the staff went above and beyond to make our stay enjoyable. Sydney and Brianna (I think that’s their names) were the absolute best staff I’ve ever had the pleasure of being served by in my whole life. They did everything, from free cookies, to checking in on us when something went wrong, to even giving me a little gift basket made from items from the little on-site shop for my birthday! Hotel would be a 2-3 stars but because of the amazing staff, it’s a 5 in my book.

title: My experience at Fairfield Inn Chellsa Manhattan New  York
text:
The purpose of writing this letter is to compliment your hotel staff for their wonder service. Thanks to your staff for making it such a comfortable stay at your hotel. I was there for 6 days with my wife and for all these days I was attended with utmost warmth. I was impressed to see the prompt room service delivering towels, pillows so on, despite the peak in business season. Every need was catered with utmost perfection making us feel so important, they all treated us as if we were a guest in their own home.
I would like to compliment your entire staff for being so professional. With smile on their faces, they have been really very impressive in their service. And I would like to visit your hotel again for this outstanding experience. In fact this is the only hotel I will stay in Manhattan; I have cancer so I go to Sloan Kettering often. I would highly recommend this hotel they offer so much for an affordable price, Best breakfast coffee, lemonade offered all day, a beautiful Roof top offering a nice getaway to enjoy the skylight. 
Sincerely,
Mark Gibson

title: In love with hotel Best ever
text: The service of sydney thompson is amazing we coming from miami to try this we crazy about it .... el mejor hotel en el área de manhanttan downtown con el mejor servicio gracias a Sydney thompson por su attecion y a todo el stuff del hotel estamos muy contentos con el hotel

title: We loved our stay!
text:
We loved our stay at Fairfield Chelsea, the location is perfect. Everything was clean, had an amazing breakfast and a really nice staff, specially Tina who was really kind.
My mom and I enjoyed NYC right from Chelsea.

title: Visit New York
text:
Ottima posizione per metro ed attrazioni.
Camere piccole ma confortevoli.
Tenete conto della colazione che non è spesso proposta in altre strutture.
Consiglio di chiedere pulizia camere, altrimenti qualche volta saltano (è nella norma anche in altri hotel).
Personale sempre disponibile

title: Perfect home base for a NYC weekend!
text: Just stayed here for two nights for a weekend NYC getaway. Great location, very helpful staff. Mai-Ajah and her team do a fantastic job taking care of guests - giving directions, stowing your luggage if you need to, making sure you like your room, etc. Top notch service, reasonable price for the location and amenities, clean rooms just big enough for the weekend. Breakfast pretty typical Fairfield buffet; very clean and organized, good coffee. Also- killer roof top terrace (no bar or anything, but nice views and a great place to take your coffee or drink up to to hang out). And REALLY fast elevators!

title: NYC trip
text:
The accommodation (from the outside rather inconspicuous because it stands between many flower shops) is very close to the 5th AV and Broadway where all the action of the city begins. Subways are accessible from both sides of 28th Street so you can get everywhere very quickly by train. From check-in to check-out, we received a very warm welcome from the staff and manager, which made our stay more enjoyable right away. Everyone is really eager to take care of any concerns.
As per the description, you could get ice cubes 24/7 (due to lack of mini bar in the room) from the LL and various teas and cafe from the ground floor. Food was limited to certain dishes but tasty very good.

The only shortcomings were:
1.the tiny bathroom with very small sink and undermount box - we had a 4-person room whereby we suffered very much from lack of space. We were always brought only 3 towels although we emphasized every time that there were four of us in the room. 

2.the dining room is unfortunately much too small in relation to the number of rooms and the guests accommodated in it at the same time - so that there was a big rush and waiting times for a free table almost every day. A hint or a request to the guests to leave the dining room as soon as they have finished eating would perhaps be a good consideration. Unfortunately, there were many guests who - although they saw the waiting people - froze in front of their cell phones although they already had empty plates in front of them. 

All in all, we felt very comfortable and well taken care of here and give a clear recommendation. We say THANK YOU and hope to see you soon! :)

title: Great customer service
text: This is less about the hotel itself than the customer service. Mai (-Ahjah Keel) was so kind and helpful during my visit. She was able to get me an early check in and also helped with extended checkout, doing the best she could do help with both. She was friendly and wanted to make my visit as smooth as possible.

title: One Of The Best Hotel Stays I've Had in NYC
text: We all know that hotel rooms in the mid-range price in NYC are going to be small, but this property did a great job making a small room beautiful and comfortable.  My room was on a high floor with an amazing view, the bed was comfortable, I enjoyed free cable TV, a wonderful staff and a delicious (free!) breakfast in the morning with an amazing variety of food.  The value for this hotel was the best I've found in NYC.  I'm so glad I became a Marriot Bonvoy member -- I'm sold on this chain!

title: Warm and Friendly Hotel Stay
text: My 11 year old daughter and I flew in early morning from Boston.  We got to the hotel and were met with an exceptionally kind and accommodating property manager.  The same day we were greeted by dining room attendant, Tina, in the lounge area who, over the course of our stay, was engaging and kind to my daughter.  She made us feel so welcome and always put a smile on my daughter's face.  The food area was always clean and a pleasant place to enjoy breakfast.  The room we stayed in was very clean.  For the price and it's location, this property offered great value.

title: La peor eleccion
text: No pudimos tener peor experiencia!. Sucio. Muy sucio; luego de 4 noches nadie habia limpiado la habitacion, ni siquiera dejaban toallas limpias, o retiraban la basura. Teniamos que bajar a retirar los residuos, pedir toallones o jabon para la ducha. El personal de mostrador es amable, pero no teniamos solucion. No funcionaban los enchufes, y nos tuvieron 5 dias sin respuesta. El desayuno es pesimo, y reiterativo. Afortunadamente pudimos cambiar de hotel, donde fuimos atendidos como uno espera y donde a pesar del covid recibimos una atencion adecuada.

title: Very good especially for the price
text:
I first turned up my nose when my hubby told me this is the hotel he booked especially considering we walked past some newer hotel properties but so much for my preconceived notions as this place was lovely.  We showed up quite early (12:30 PM) and our room wasn't ready which was no big deal at all.  Would have been amazed if they'd had a room for us then.  The woman at the desk offered to store my bag.  We accepted and off we went to spend our day.  We returned quite a bit later around 9.  My bag was easily retrieved.  We were given a room on the 18th floor as an upgrade due to our Marriott status.  The room was very quiet and had two bathrooms, a king bed, and a sitting room.  My one and only complaint was the bedroom area could have used a little more lighting.  We had plenty of hot water in the sinks and shower which is amazing on the 18th floor, too.  The room was clean.  The elevators worked very well.  

Breakfast was also included and this was no tiny little breakfast.  The spread was ample and fresh.  My one complaint is the main food area did get crowded by the middle of our breakfast so we sort of rushed up as we were uncomfortable with the Omicron COVID spread rates.  Of course you can't mask while eating.  The vast majority of diners came into the area wearing masks and wore them while getting their food.  I only saw one person who entered the dining area unmasked.

Recommend with no hesitation.

title: The Perfect Hotel!
text:
Check-in was very smooth and the person checking us in was exceptionally helpful especially in advising us of where to park, as we arrived after the valet service operation hours. It's also very comforting to stay in a hotel that requires proof of vaccination. 
Our room was very clean and the bed was exceptionally comfortable. We love the fact that there is no carpet! 
When we needed a bath mat and more towels, the front desk person was very helpful and friendly. After locating fresh towels for us, she promptly returned my call to say she had the towels ready at the front desk. However since she was the only one on duty she asked if I would mind to could come down. I didn't mind in the least! We were grateful for the service (because the shower leaked a bit, and we used the hand towel and a bath towel to clean it up). 
The view is beautiful and the location was perfect for our needs. 
We were grateful for the delicious coffee in the lobby even though we got up too late to enjoy the breakfast service.
This is a fabulous location and I give it an excellent rating!

title: Tiny room but exceptional service
text:
I can't complain in the scheme of things, since I only paid $165 before taxes for what turned out to be a tiny (but exceptionally clean) hotel room at this Fairfield Inn & Suites.  The value factor was strong.

Even though I'm a Titanium Bonvoy member, I did not get an upgraded larger room. 
 Being so close to Madison Square Garden and well priced, there wasn't much choice of available rooms on the day I checked in.  Plus they only supplied one towel set, so I had to ask the front desk for an extra set, which was readily supplied.  I also asked for extra housekeeping service on my second day, which was provided completely.  My hotel room bed was a bit soft and seemingly old, but I slept well, and did not experience any outside noise.

The fitness room has 4 cardio machines and is in decent condition.  But there are no cloth sweat towels.  Only paper.   Breakfast is sonewhat disappointing.  No eggs (not even hard boiled).  Only hot pork and vegan patties.  Oatmeal is weak.  But make your own waffles were terrific.  Coffee, juice, yogurt and various breads are plentiful.  

The front desk service is outstanding.  I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again for the price paid.

title: Don't Stay Here
text:
I checked into my room and was going to bed when I noticed no pillowcases on any of the pillows.  Called the deskclerk on my mobile as the room phone was broken.   She said "I'll see what I can do."  Got the pillows but an hour later an employee tried to barge into my room using a pass key, allegedly to check if everything was OK.  Called the desk clerk who said "what do you want me to do?"

I thought Marriot stood for quality but apparently not

title: Favorable experience
text: Location is convenient to Penn Station, FIT, and the subway. Right in the middle of the flower district, which was an interesting experience. Staff was mostly very nice and helpful. The morning breakfast selection was actually better than we  had expected. The room was clean and comfortable, but for some reason, there were only one desk lamp and one nightstand lamp, which made it too dark to read on the other side of the bed. On the negative side: we got to the room and there were only one bath towel and one hand towel. We had to ask manager for more towels, which were delivered. And we were also told there would be housekeeping the second day we were there, but no one came.

title: Excellent service and clean rooms!
text: My stay at Fairfield was great. It’s conveniently located by a subway station, the rooms are clean, and above all the service is great.  Check-in was a breeze and the agent who checked me in was very nice and welcoming.  The gym was nice too and I enjoyed squeezing in a workout during my short trip, it had everything I needed.  I left one of my AirPods in my room and the GM was quick to offer to ship it back to me all the way in Texas once I inquired about the lost item.  I 100% recommend this hotel if you’re looking for a nice clean place to lay your head at night for a quick trip to the Big Apple!

title: Brilliantly managed by Janessa
text: Janessa Williams, Assistant General Manager, of this property is by far the most amazingly efficient and professional example of the Marriott level of excellence. We arrived less than a week after Ida had flooded much of the city, Janessa (on duty alone), made us feel like honored guests and VIP's, as she did with every person checking that I observed. I am hopeful that Marriott is aware of the absolute gem that they have in Ms. Williams. My husband and I travel to many hotels and find mediocrity in many of them, it is a true joy to find such a bright light in the flower district of NYC. The hotel was clean, well stocked, and super organized, by Janessa and the breakfast host Tina, who I  was greeted by on Sunday. morning. Careful safety and health measures were followed, with vaccine cards required, thank goodness. This hotel is a haven for those who want the best of NYC, surrounded by flowers and managed by Janessa.

title: Horrible hotel! Horrible service! Horrible experience!
text:
This hotel is by far the WORST property I’ve ever stayed in. I understand that COVID has made things more difficult for hotels; but no towels for 2 days??? Rude and arrogant hotel employees??? And on and on and on. There are some basic things that have no connection to - or cannot be attributed to - the virus / pandemic.
HATED OUR STAY HERE!!!

title: Nice Staycation
text:
The good:
Location is perfect. No problem finding places to eat or drink. 
The people at the front reception are very nice.They try to help and make pleasant conversation. 
The breakfast area is a good place to go and do work on your laptop.
They readily offered a late check out with no extra charge. 
Rooms were very clean
The bad
Just wrapped breads and fruit for breakfast. 
Coffee is a little weak
Other that that, really is a good place to go. Centrally located and fun people at reception.

title: Great Stay but not many amenities
text: I really enjoyed my stay but do not expect much in the way of breakfast. This is happening at a lot of hotels right now. The service though is really great. The nicest people you will meet in New York for sure! Not very large rooms but functional. Really great area. You are in the middle of the most flowers I have ever seen. Great places to eat. The Manager must be a runner as she was advising us of running routes but we wanted to drink. Great prices. I would and will go back!

title: Book somewhere else
text: I stayed at so many Fairfield Inn's over the years mostly in small towns and always had good experiences. I like the simple but convenient and comfortable style of the hotels. So this time I was in NYC and had to make a last minute reservation and booked this hotel due to its location. What a terrible mistake I made. This hotel has no similarities or standards of a typical Fairfield Inn. I rejected the first room and the second room I was offered was even worse. Very dark room looking at rear side of the hotel, not clean at all and a very simple and out dated bathroom. There is nothing positive about this hotel that worth mentioning. If I were a Bonvoy executive, I would not put my brand on this facility.

title: Surprisingly Fantastic!!!!
text: When I first walked in, I was caught off guard by the small lobby. But I greeted with such a warm smile that I quickly forgot about the lobby size. The hotel is almost hidden as surrounded by flowers and in the middle of the block. Rooms were very clean and the staff was a bunch of really friendly people. Small breakfast but there are many places to eat close by. We had a great time. The staff always said a hello as we walked by the desk and gave us great recommendations. I will be back when the weather gets warmer. I will be back!!! Very nice place to visit!

title: You have so many better choices than this.
text: Maybe I'm naive, but in a city that is struggling to recover from a flagging tourism industry, I'd expect a hotel to be on its game. This hotel doesn't seem to care. The room was not ready (despite the hotel being mostly empty). The bathroom was unclean -- there was pink and black mold in the shower -- so I doubt it was sanitized. The room had only one broken bedside lamp. There is no in-room safe and the ones at the front desk are tiny (they will not hold a laptop or tablet). The bedding was insufficient and put on the bed wrong. The blinds were broken -- the chain came off in my hand. I could go on. The hotel's response was to offer Marriott Bonvoy points equivalent to 1/6 of the daily rate.

title: Unsafe, dirty
text:
1. Their elevators are not cleared for use - the inside of both clearly say that passengers should not ride the elevators as they are for freight only. Crazy unsafe and even illegal.

2. The wifi does not work whatsoever

3. Rooms themselves are dirty - dusty, unwashed sheets, stained bathrooms

4. Make sure to deadbolt your door as staff love to just walk in and are completely unapologetic about it (one man even just walked in without a knock and then asked me to take out my own trash in the bins outside as it was trash day)

title: work
text:
Had a very pleasant stay for 3 days 2 nights at Fairfield  Inn Manhattan Chelsea.
GISSELL GARCIA WAS WONDERFUL. She honored my gold status to give later check out than normal time in order to accommodate my work and train schedule. I appreciate her professionalism and that she went above and beyond to deliver great service. The location is right by the flower district and close to lots of subway stations. Room is a good size. Only two down sides are the side lamp only on one side so my husband can't read at night. Second is the breakfast only have muffins and cereal.. wish there could be yogurt and hard-boiled eggs or fruit. Overall, a great stay.

title: Awesome stay
text: Just stayed here for one night. The room was a little bit small but cozy. The front desk lady, Melanie, was super nice!!! Great cleanliness in the room and public areas. Definitely would stay here again

title: Wonderful and highly recommended!!
text: The manager and staff were awesome!! Great customer service! My husband and I will definitely be staying there again on our next visit and highly recommending to all of my friends!! You will not be disappointed. During this uneasy time in life, the staff made a very pleasant stay for us!!

title: Jkilom
text:
Excellent customer service, Hotel follow CDC guidelines
, staff and guests all wearing masks, everyone practice social distance , room was excellent cleaned , you  feel comfortable staying at Fairfield Inn &Suites by Marriott.
Thank you Melanie !

title: Jstojanov
text:
Excellent customer service, clean room and they keeping up with CDC standards I will definitely return for next visit  , keep up the good work in this pandemic  times.
Tank you  and keep up the good work Melanie .

title: Best Stay Ever
text: I love this place! So nice and clean! Mabel in housekeeping is great! The GM Melanie will do anything to make you happy! You must stay here!!! The place is clean and the staff is friendly. Sometimes they are very busy but they make the time to help. They try hard and succeed. Thank you for all.

title: Internet Issues
text:
This is an addendum to the review 688Sherryl wrote for a stay in Sept 2020.  

This was actually for a stay from Oct 31-Nov 4 2020.  We had several issues with the hotel internet allowing VPN connections.  The hotel’s internet provider had issues unblocking the connection throughout the stay - which hindered the ability to work for the entire time (5 days of not being able to work effectively).  After some troubleshooting with the hotel’s IT on the 2nd day, we were able to connect to our VPN, but was intermittently cut off multiple times throughout the remainder of our stay.  We had to make do by hotspotting with our own phones instead.

Not sure if they’ve fixed the issue since, but definitely keep in mind if you’ll be working from the hotel.

title: My Stay
text: Melanie & the entire staff @ this hotel are awesome. A usually stay @ this location. The hotel is quiet, the beds are comfortable & the rooms are sparkling clean. I plan on returning next time I’m in New York!

title: Our Stay at the Fairfield
text: I usually like to leave reviews because it is very helpful. My stay at this hotel was amazing. The stuff were fantastic! Big shout out to the front desk supervisor Gissell, who was very helpful and answered all my questions. She made me feel very welcomed during these difficult times we are all going through. Room was small but that’s New York City.

title: Staycation
text: Thank you for Melanie for a quick and easy check-in and the manager on duty, Gissell Garcia, were just amazing. The hotel was super clean and I felt safe especiallu during these tough times. I definitely plan on coming back here again with my girlfriend!Thank you for making our stay memorable!

title: Clean and Safe
text: I was incredibly impressed with the way the Marriott kept every person safe considering COVID. They disinfected the room keys and enforced their mask requirements. I was so pleased with my stay. I’ll definitely be staying here for all of my future business in New York.

title: Best Stay Ever!!
text: My stay was absolutely amazing! We had the most relaxing and beautiful visit. The staff was so kind and helpful. I loved that the breakfast items were wrapped individually. I was concerned with the risks of COVID but the staff made me feel absolutely safe. From sanitizing my whole room down to disinfecting my room keys, everything was spotless! I definitely would stay again!

title: Great stay
text: Just wanted to say a big thank you to the really great team of Fairfield Chelsea. The room was very clean and staff was very friendly. You should know that rooms are small but comfortable. I like that they give you a wipe when checking in, but I wish they had mobile check in. Everything was great! Will be back. Thanks again!

title: Loved the Marriott!
text: We loved the hotel and the staff!!  Everyone was pleasant, professional, and courteous!  They helped us with directions and information about the city!  We will gladly be back and would recommend to friends!

title: Vacation
text: Awesome visit would highly recommend super friendly and clean. Will be coming here my next visit to New York. Location is in a great place everything is walking distance and they provide free breakfast.

title: Very Friendly and Accommodating Front Desk.
text:
With the small lobby and the COVID rules for social distancing, the front desk staff are very efficient, helpful and friendly (Melanie). They take the time to call to make certain you’re satisfied with your room. The answer is always “Yes, the room is perfect”! They really care about your stay and comfort...that’s why I will only stay here!
VERY CLEAN, COMFORTABLE ROOM WITH SPACE, GOOD LOCATION

title: The service I have received in Manhattan
text:
I stayed at the Fairfield Inn Suites Chelsea in Manhattan for approximately two weeks. The general manager, Melanie is unbelievable. Her entire team is incredible, because they are super friendly, always of service to their guests, with an incredible attitude. I travel over 90,000 miles a year, I’ve stayed in many hotels, and this was hands-down one of the best experiences I’ve ever had. 

The hotel was clean, all Covid protocols were followed and I felt safe, they also lock the main doors to ensure that only guests have access to the hotel, and provide a lovely breakfast for their guests as well.

The rooms are spacious, with all the basic amenities you would need.

I highly recommend this hotel, the staff will absolutely take care of you and it’s incredibly centrally located to almost anything you may need to reach for a business trip.

title: Why go anywhere else?! No really...
text: Let me tell you about the hospitality at this place. OUTSTANDING!! Wendy and Kellen/Kelleb(my apologies if its misspelled) The accommodations they made for my medical/health issues went above and beyond to make sure my stay was a very smooth, stress-free and pleasant one. Indeed it was. My room was spacious, clean and neat!! The breakfast of Muffins and Coffee was fresh. I was very pleased overall with my stay. I highly recommend and will definitely be returning!! Seriously if you need some alone time to just get away... THIS IS THE PLACE!! Thank you to the staff. I appreciate it.

title: Poor internet service.
text:
I stayed here for four nights and had VPN connectivity issues throughout my stay. The property used a lesser known internet provider called Windstream. I had to call them to ‘unblock’ VPN on day one, which I hadn’t experienced in other hotels, coffee shops, airports etc. 
I would not recommend others working from this hotel.

title: Will stay here again!!!!
text: Best night sleep bed are clean soft ,crisp linin ,nice breatfast, close to everything, secure establishment, excellent service, extremely helpful and knowledgeable loved it. I would and will stay here again when i come back to visit. Thank you Everyone

title: Our stay with Fairfield Inn on W 28th St
text: Our stay was great. While traveling for business, the staff makes your long journey stress free and provides pleasant conversations while checking you in. They make sure that you are comfortable and handles any inconvenience quickly. For being so close to Madison Square Garden, you're able to get a peaceful night with your stay. From the moment you're checked in to the day that you leave, you will be satisfied with your stay there.

title: Comfy Welcoming Home Feeling Stay
text:
EXCEPTIONAL Service with a SMILE
I recently stayed at Fairfield by Marriott in Chelsea.
While somethings are different now since COVID 19, Melanie(GM) and her team more than made up for it.
Gissell at the Front Desk was cheerful and charming and always welcoming. Staff was incredibly friendly. Not much of a breakfast but places nearby to grab a quick bite were recommended by the staff.
My first room did have some issues but I was moved right away no questioned asked.. Also, Great location and price! I will definitely be back at this location on my next NYC visit!

title: Awesome stay!
text: The staff was very nice warm and welcoming and checked in to make sure my stay was going well! I appreciated them the hotel was clean and nice! I will be staying here next time I come to the city on a business trip.

title: Excellent Hotel and Even Better Staff Make this a GREAT Place to Stay!
text:
As frequent business traveler, I expect nothing but the best from Marriott and the best I always get at this property. Due to Covid I have to stay in a hotel once or twice a week near my office in the Empire State Building. As you can probably see from my past hotel reviews, I stay at very large and extremely high end properties. However, due to Covid I wanted a change - small quiet hotel without large lobbies and open areas where Covid can spread out of control.  This hotel is perfect with a close knit staff that welcomes me with a smile and recognition of my Titanium Status.  Gissell and Melanie keep me wanting to come back and stay week after week!  Keep up the great work!! Im sure when you stay, both of them will welcome you with a smile and great service!

Typically I stay I have been consistently using this hotel as I find the common areas recently gave up Always a friendly and welcoming

title: Great value and customer service
text: I hold ambassador elite status and was treated to an upgrade and wonderful customer service at check-in.  I believe customer service is critical to a hotel's success, especially these days in NYC.  I stayed at two other Marriott hotels in NYC the past week and this had the best customer service. Rooms were clean  and average size of a NYC hotel.  For 96 usd a night (including taxes) this was a very good value.

title: Worst Stay at a Hotel in a Long Time August 20, 2020
text:
I suffer from a serious medical condition and booked this hotel for a family member who came to town to help me go to a medical appointment I could not go to on my own because I live alone. The hotel rooms are not as advertised. I have asked about changing rooms and I am told the double bed rooms are all the same. There is also no upgrade for this particular room because it is a double bed room. I was told by the customer service line of Fairfield Inn and Suites after explaining the below numbered points that there was absolutely nothing they could do for me because I booked through a 3rd party website. My only hope is to speak with a manager tomorrow morning and be able to get a refund, change to a suitable room in a partner hotel, or to go to another hotel not linked to Marriott without losing hundreds of dollars. The front desk attendant explained that we had been provided one of the “newly renovated rooms” but that is clearly not the case. I can’t even sleep.

1.) people can see into our hotel room and we can see people through are window. If we close the blinds the room is extremely dark and dreary. If we open them we have people who have access to what should be a private space. 
2.) the double beds advertised are smaller than pictured on the hotel website and on travel zoo.
3.) one double bed sits only itches away from the air conditioner leaving it impossible for the person sleeping close to that unit to have a comfortable nights sleep 
4.) despite the hotel attendent explaining we had been provided a renovated room that was not the case. The room is not clean. There is dust everywhere. There is lots of dust on the windows and table tops, the bathroom is also not clean, the toilet doesn’t flush properly and the plug in the center of the the room connected to the nightstand lamp does not function along with the lamp flickering when turned on.

I suffer from a medical condition in which symptoms are heightened by stressful situations such as these. I can provide proof of this condition. As the reason for my stay here was to relax. I would like a full refund or for this matter to be resolved ASAP.

title: Great Value
text: This is a perfect location, close to Penn Station, MSG, subway lines, and the Fashion Institute of Technology (my daughter is a student). It’s also in the flower district, so it’s like walking through a garden heading to or from the hotel. The front desk has been super friendly & helpful. The room is very clean and modern. I love that the floors in the rooms are all hard surface (no carpet). It’s a little small, but then again it’s NYC, so that’s a given. Given that the rate includes a full breakfast, this is a great value.

title: Amazing Stay!
text: I stayed here January into February for business. I had the most amazing stay. Rooms were very clean and well maintained. All staff were very accommodating and pleasant, always smiling.  Daily breakfast was lovely....I really enjoyed the 'do it yourself waffles' and fresh fruit...thank you Tina and the kitchen staff. Others who contributed to my wonderful stay were Wendy(at check in), Kellen (my go to guy), Brittany(during the reservation process), Chong(very helpful 'jack of all trades), Victor('my personal security guy') and Calvin who assisted me with my bags at check out.
