If there was any complaint, it's NOT with the Staff, it's with Marriott.......please get some regular size firmer pillows that DON'T envelope your head so that you feel like you just layed into a marshmallow!  Almost every hotel has gone to those kinds of pillows and it is one of the worst things they've done!  That being said, the Fairfield Inn and Suites is truly a wonderful Hotel to stay at!  Thank you for a very enjoyable nights stay.

title: Excellent Customer Service!
text:
The customer service is top notch!  My flight was canceled so I couldn't make it to my reservation and everyone was incredibly helpful and kind!  They made a bad situation a little less stressful.
I didn't end up staying here, but plan to book it for next time!

title: Delightful Stay
text: I have stayed at many Marriotts, and this one was definitely at the top!  The service was amazing from start to finish.  The staff was warm, welcoming, and remembered details about my husband and I.  As it was our first wedding anniversary, they went above and beyond to make us feel welcome and appreciated.  All requests were immediately fulfilled, and I never saw anybody on the staff without a smile.  Special thanks to Ashley for being so incredibly thoughtful.  Delightful stay!  We will definitely be back!

title: Accommodating Staff and Beautiful Rooms
text: The staff at Fairfield Inn and Suites were some of the most accommodating and helpful people I've dealt with. There was some confusion about our booking and they quickly resolved our issue and upgraded our room. They had a fantastic continental breakfast that allowed us to start our long sight seeing days off right. The hotel is a great central location. Subway stations very conveniently located near the hotel. And only a 10-15 walk to the Empire State Building or Time Square. The staff was so helpful with information about the Subway and sights to see. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

title: Lovely
text:
Nice area central for the subway, breakfast was nice,room was on the small side for 3 adult's overall enjoyed our stay and would use this hotel again, central for downtown,
close to times square and the theatre's.

title: Great value hotel in a good location
text: Great value for our stay, good location near Broadway and the Flatiron Building. New hotel, good free breakfast. Rooms are modern but small. Was not noisy at night and the street is great - full of foliage and flower shops that spill out onto the sidewalks.

title: Great value in Chelsea
text:
This Fairfield Inn is tucked away in Chelsea.
Rooms are quite small but still totally adequate in my opinion.
The staff was very helpful and accommodating with requests and local information.
If you are traveling by yourself, or don't plan on spending a lot of time in your room, this is a great option.

title: Suprised and pleased
text: I travel to NYC a few times a year for work.  To be honest I am have never been a fan of "the city", based on some of my past experiences.  This was my first time staying in the Chelsea area, and the first time at this hotel.  I was super pleased with my experience at the Fairfield Inn Chelsea, the staff was very nice and helpful.  The room was clean and comfortable.  I really enjoyed the neighborhood, very good places to eat, and very positive feel.  I will stay at this hotel again when I'm back in NYC!

title: Comfortable hotel in a great part of NYC
text: We loved this hotel. It's located on a part of 28th St that is full of flower and nursery shops. Every morning we awoke to the sidewalks coming alive like mini gardens. The area felt safe and friendly. The hotel staff were friendly and welcoming. I will definitely go back to this hotel.

title: Great Stay!
text: We spent two nights at the hotel and we were very happy with how nice and helpful the staff was. We arrived before check in and they happily kept our bags for us so we could go out and explore. We used the valet service also and it was very convenient. We pulled up right in front of the hotel and unloaded and at check out our car was waiting for us. Our room was very small but that is to be expected in NYC. The breakfast was very good also and the breakfast staff was very friendly and kept everything neat and fresh. We would stay again.

title: Great location
text: Hotel is completely renovated. Breakfast has something for everyone. The staff goes above and beyond especially front desk clerk Roxanne. Will stay there again. Easy walking distance to major attractions in Manhattan.

title: Fairfield New York
text:
Ficamos na unidade da 28th street entre a 6th e 7th 
Pontos fortes:
Café da manhã incluso - café variado e bom para economizar tempo logo cedo
Metrô no mesmo quarteirão 
Banheiro bom e bem limpo 

Pontos negativos 
Carpete sujo 
Travesseiros desconfortáveis

title: Nicely renovated, no more carpets
text: Hotel completed renovation, rooms are updated and clean.  No more dirty carpet and stinky smell. Room are pretty big for NYC.  Big TV and lots of outlets. Staffs are very professional, good communication between staffs.

title: Average
text: I would give this more a 3 1/2. I didn’t hate it, it was clean and the staff was incredibly courteous. The room was average sized by NY standards. The room itself was very dimly lit, which was very irritating.  The bathroom was the worst part. It had a shower with no edge, so the entire bathroom floor was wet. Also there was no type of shelf or countertop in the bathroom to set toiletries.

title: Best water pressure shower ever
text: I am a marriott gold member and have been to many marriott properties. This hotel was also good but the shower was phenomenal. I wish I have a water pressure like this at home. Only little issue I had was the toilet. Toilet doesnt flush strong. It flushes but requires a second try. I guess we cant have both.

title: Great Location - Superb Service - Awesome Staff
text: I was out with my daughter for her summer intern in NYC for a week and Ashley & Michelle made our stay truly "home away from home" - they are very efficient, welcoming and always willing to go extra miles to help everybody! You two are awesome! I recommend this hotel strongly - because of its location and great staff/hospitality.

title: World Class Wedding Venues - Say "I do" Worldwide
text: The WCWV team visited NYC and stayed at the Fairfield Inn - Manhattan / Chelsea. It was so close to every attraction. We walked down the Avenue of Americans to Broadway to Time Square to Central Park - a complete walking square! Amazing hotel and outstanding staff - the breakfast was wonderful! World Class Wedding Venues thanks you!

title: Use only in a pinch, or if given a very cheap rate ($100 or so)
text: Staff is friendly but not well-informed, so misinformation is passed along to consumers. Internet is Unreliable. Plumbing is at times Unreliable. One pillow had a streak of bright colored lipstick, which made me wonder if they re-use some linen. Unless you get a super cheap rate, AVOID or you'll be disappointed.

title: PERFECT CHOICE!!
text:
Un hotel fantástico y estupendo para alojarse. Limpieza absoluta, personal excepcional, pendientes de todos los huéspedes. Mención especial para las chicas de recepción: Samantha, Ashley, Michelle y Roxanne. Mil gracias a Janessa por la habitación!. Han hecho que nuestro viaje para celebrar nuestro aniversario haya sido todavía mejor gracias a su espectacular atención. El compañero que atiende en los desayunos fantástico. La sala de desayunos es pequeña pero acogedora y con variedad de alimentos. Todo el staff desprende amabilidad.  Te hablan en tu idioma si lo necesitas. 
Y no puedo dejar de mencionar la fantástica cama que te atrapa para que tu descanso sea inmejorable. 
Sin duda siempre recomendaré este hotel. Esta ha sido mi cuarta vez en NY y la ubicación me ha encantado. Muy cerca de todo, con muchísimas opciones para salir a comer o cenar cerca, tomar alguna copa, muy cerca del Empire (eso sí.. La vista del Empire State ya la ha tapado un nuevo edificio), de las tiendas, de varias líneas de metro. PERFECTO!!! UN MILLÓN DE GRACIAS CHICAS!!! SOIS UNAS GRANDES PROFESIONALES!!!

title: Excellent, friendly, accommodating staff, amazing location, new and clean!
text: Derrick and every member of the entire front staff absolutely made this trip a stress free adventure for me traveling with both my sons and my retired parents.  My mom was completely stressed to be in NYC but really wanted to go to the 9/11 memorial and museum. Derrick put them on a low floor (Dad's walking with a cane) and made accommodations for the rest of us so we could be on the same floor. This hotel is small, and feels very safe for non NewYorkers. The 9/11 site is literally 3 blocks away, even Dad was ok to walk there - though the staff did offer a wheelchair for our use (which Dad declined due to stubborn pride).  Our double deluxe room was quite large for the Manhattan location and very well appointed. We did not have any challenges waiting for the elevators.  We will absolutely choose this hotel over several others I have stayed at in this area for work at WFC. The staff ABSOLUTELY made the difference. We had an amazing time and have the staff to thank for it!

title: Better Than Solid "A" Property
text: Can't beat the location.  Short walk to Penn Station/MSG and to 5th Ave and Broadway St.  Staff is very attentive.  This is not a large hotel, but is clean, neat and convenient to many restaurants and places to visit. Very friendly and helpful staff from the folks tending to breakfast to the front desk staff and the manager.  I stay here monthly and often get an e-mail from them before my arrival welcoming me and one after I leave asking if everything was OK.  This is one of the more reasonably priced places to stay in mid-town Manhattan and the stay is more like a place hundreds more.

title: Ótima opção em NY! Preço justo pela localização, serviço e conforto.
text:
Hotel com ótima localização e opções variadas para comer, entretenimento e compras.
Dá pra fazer tudo a pé, desde que você tenha disposição. Caminhada na 9 e 10 Avenida, Brodway, Times Square, Central Park e há estações de metrô próximas. Seguro para andar de manhã até a madrugada. 
O hotel é novo, logo, isso reflete em conforto. 
O quarto tem um bom tamanho, cama king size confortável, frigobar, TV com acesso ao Youtube e Netflix, cofre, ferro de passar, secador de cabelo e várias tomadas próximas a cama, o que facilita carregamento dos eletrônicos.
O banheiro tem um bom chuveiro e cerâmica nova e moderna. Os produtos para banho são da Paul Mitchel, primeira qualidade.
O restaurante onde é servido o café da manhã é espaçoso e o buffet oferece ótimas opções de frutas, pães e opções quentes (ovos mexidos, omelete, hamburger). 
MUITO IMPORTANTE, escolhi este hotel porque não cobra Fee Resort (taxa de resort) e foi a melhor escolha, pois além de todos os benefícios, toda a equipe do hotel é muito educada e solícita.
Fiquei no quarto C-02 que fica no mesmo andar da recepção. Se tiver sono leve ou for ficar muito tempo no hotel durante a estadia, prefira os quartos dos andares acima, pois há uma porta que separa o elevador da recepção que, quando há um fluxo grande de pessoas, fica um bate porta toda hora.
Me incomodou pouco, pois usava o hotel mais para dormir.

title: Gran impresión
text: Llegamos ayer y nos recibieron con un detalle del hotel. En recepción hablan español. Está muy bien situado, a un paseito de Time Square. El responsable del desayuno, José Ospina ha sido muy amable y nos ha tratado con mucho cariño. La primera impresión está siendo genial

title: NYC for the night
text: My partner, Dominick and I stayed here for a night. The room was great as well as the breakfast. Roxanne B was so welcoming and helpful with anything we needed. The lower floors are a bit noisy especially those that face the street. Watch you account though; somehow it charged us twice for the same room- we straightened that out ourselves.

title: Avoid this hotel at any cost !!!
text:
I have checked in today for 4 nights and regretting my decision. The location of the hotel is far from the Penn station and it is very difficult to walk with any luggage. The sidewalk (footpath) on the entire lane outside the hotel is completely blocked by florist shops. There are so many loading vehicles on the narrow lane (street) that a cab (taxi) would struggle to reach the hotel.

The rooms are oversold though advance payment in full has been received !! Imagine your plight when you are an international visitor and likely to be told that your pre-booked room is unavailable.

The hotel requires a USD 20 deposit per night of stay but refuses to accept it in cash!!

If you are not carrying your credit card or feel unsafe using a card outside your home country, then you are required to surrender your passport to the hotel !! 

I do not know the US laws but in most countries insisting on being in possession of somebody's passport would be considered illegal.

I requested the front office staff to check with the hotel manager if security deposit in cash can be accepted but was told that "I am the Manager and this is the rule of the hotel". As this is a 'hole in the wall" sized property, maybe the senior most staff is indeed managing the front office as has been claimed.

If you are brave enough to surrender your passport (which incidentally contains your US Visa), please do note that the hotel does not give you any receipt against your original passport !!

Under duress, I have handed over my Aadhaar card (national ID card). Only on my insistence, I was given a photocopy of my card.

All should be aware that there is no restaurant in this hotel. The complementary breakfast shall be available in some area behind the elevator (lift) !! I have nil expectations tomorrow morning.

In the room there is no stand or table to keep your luggage. You have to sit on the floor to unpack !!

There is nothing king sized about the king bed. Two adults can just about manage.

The hotel does not have a bell desk or a doorman. The person doubling up for housekeeping does not speak English.
 
At an average room rate of USD 280 (INR 19000) per night, you can stay at a top end property in India (including Marriott).

I strongly recommend that everyone should stay away from this hotel.

title: Great location, even better staff.
text:
Was staying at the Fairfield for five nights for business. Got lucky with the hotel selection because we ended up just a few blocks from the office near Madison Square Garden.

What made the stay even better was the staff. They were all very friendly and helpful. All the way from the people taking care of the breakfast area, to the cleaning staff to the front desk, specifically Michelle and Ashley. For example I was not familiar with the NYC Metro system. They talked me through it and made it all so easy. Now I feel like a native.  

Speaking of staff a shout out to Roxanne Bracken-Luciano. She always seemed to be on duty and always had a smile on her face. Willing to take the time to help and make sure that my stay there was as good as it could possibly be. I celebrated my birthday in NYC and she got me a cupcake and a beverage and had it put it my room with a very nice note. She did not need to do that, but she did and it was a very nice gesture and greatly appreciated.

The location of the hotel is terrific. You are few few blocks from the Empire State Building and Times Square. You are within easy walking distance to Penn Station and numerous Metro lines. 

The breakfast buffet is very complete. Juice, cereals, fruits, yogurt, oatmeal, waffle maker, eggs, bacon, sausage, NY bagels, etc. I never left in the morning hungry.

The rooms were clean, comfortable and functional.

A note of warning. There is some construction going on across the street so it does narrow the street a bit and may cause some traffic backups. On the other hand you are in the "flower district" so you do have an opportunity to walk through a garden on the way to the office with all of the plants and flowers being delivered in the morning.

This will be my hotel of choice when I have the opportunity to come back to Manhattan.

title: The general manager was great
text:
I stayed there twice in April. I had some issues with my 1st stay, which is why I am rating this just below excellent. When she heard about those issues, Roxanne wrote me a lovely note and upgraded me during my second stay. She made the second stay great. I hope corporate recognizes her!

I will be back and would also recommend the place for that reason in addition to the great location. It is near Times Square without the craziness, near Koreantown which has great food, near herald square which offers shopping late a night and is close to one of the best pizza places in NYC: suprema.

title: Good Location, Comfy Place
text: My girlfriend and I ended up staying an extra night in NYC and your hotel was just what we needed: A comfy and quiet place to rest our head for a night before catching our flight. The price was good, the beds were comfy, and the rooms clean and orderly. The amount of space was also very reasonable for a big city like NYC. The staff was quite welcoming and made checking in/out very simple. We were busy showing family around the city, so we pretty much were only in the room to sleep. We therefore didn’t partake in all the hotel’s offerings like breakfast such. However, what we did use, we enjoyed thoroughly.

title: Ni
text: Posizione molto comoda, vicino alla metro e comunque vicino a Penn station, si arriva a piedi sia all'Empire che a Times Square! Le camere sono molto piccole e con la moquette che in Italia non si usa da 30 anni, colazione abbondante ma americana!

title: NIce little hotel with friendly staff
text:
My wife and I spent one night here prior to leaving on our cruise from NYC.  We wanted this area because it's near the Chelsea Flea Market, and it's in the middle of the flower district, which is a lovely, quiet, pretty place to stay.  We really liked browsing the flowers.

We arrived on a red eye Jet Blue flight so arrived at the hotel at 8am.  Naturally, they did not have a room for us, but gladly checked in our bags and invited us to enjoy the buffet.  The buffet was average, but the room in the back where it's located in a nice, cozy spot.  We were happy to rest there for a few minutes before heading on our way.  I had hoped our room might be ready earlier than 3pm...but that did not happen.  They promised to call when a room was available, but that didn't happen either.  That was really the only downside to our experience.

When we DID check in that afternoon, we found a small but clean room.  Decent sized bathroom, and an okay sized room (for NYC...as in, small for the rest of the country).  We enjoyed breakfast again the next day.  The staff was always super friendly when we interacted with them, and that really made a nice impression.  The place was clean (some construction was going on, but not a big deal at all).  Elevator was even a decent speed!

I'd happily stay there again.  It's a good location in a lovely part of the city.  Flatiron Building is nearby.  Macy's and Empire State not too far.  Even the HiLine Park is a reasonable walk.  Subway station nearby.  Cabs come by fairly frequently.  We recommend this place.

(Price is crazy  high...again, that's NYC.)

title: Great hotel
text: Stayed here the first week in April with my wife and 19 year old son . From the start the people on front desk are excellent could not do enough to help us. Especially Roxanne and Samantha from printing out our baseball tickets to extra blankets for our room. Breakfast is a buffet and the kitchen staff are great making sure there is enough for everyone . The location of hotel is perfect for first time visitors like us . As you have two subway stations at ether end of the street that will take to where ever you need to go from statue of liberty to Yankee stadium and great value if like us you buy the weekly pass. A McDonald's at corner of street and a couple of supermarkets nearby. The only trouble of giving this hotel a 5 star review it will be hard to get a room when we return and we will definitely return to this hotel .

title: Wonderful service on a block of flowers convenient location
text: Turned out to be a lovely experience to see all the flower shops put their plants and flowers on the street. The people at front deck were extremely courteous and attentive to our requests such as a refrigerator in the room. Away from crowds of Time Square but only a 20 block walk or short subway ride.

title: Friendly, Clean, & Good Location
text: This is one of the better "typical NYC" hotels. That is, you'll get a small room and not much of a view. But the staff was very friendly. The hotel is modern and clean. The location really can't be beat. We stayed just one night during a weekend in NYC, but were happy with the experience.

title: Very few (working) amenities, but it is quiet!
text: We were here during Easter week of Spring break.  The rooms are about 240-250 sq ft not including the bathroom, which tight, but not terrible, with two double beds.  There were no rooms with two queens available (not even sure they exist at this hotel).  Although this hotel is being remodeled (according to the sign in the elevator), not much worked in our rooms.  In our first room, neither the heat, the remote control nor the newly installed light above the sink worked.  In our second room (they had to move us so we had heat in 30 degree NYC), the same three things did not work, though the heat eventually kicked in, but not at the temperature we programmed.  Clearly, they are not checking these features when they remodel. Yes, there is free wifi, but there is no safe in the room, which surprised us.  Our second room had an adequate number of outlets for all of our devices, which our first room did not have.  In fact, we were unplugging clocks and lamps so our devices would not have to charge on the floor or near the sink.  I do agree that the service is excellent, which is helpful when the facilities are just average.

title: Excellent Service
text: I stay over 100 nights in hotels a year for work. Had a very pleasant stay at this property. Staff went above and beyond to make sure we were comfortable. Had a great time. Hotel is currently being remodeled and I am sure it will only get better with this team.

title: Uma diária
text: Tivemos nosso voo cancelado por conta da neve no dia 21/03 e o hotel em que estávamos hospedadas não tinha mais vaga. Então...naquele desespero de achar um lugar, consegui vaga nesse hotel. Não achei tão confortável comparado ao outro em que estávamos hospedadas, achei a cama pequena, não gostei do banheiro (molhava tudo por fora) e não ter um frigobar também faz toda diferença. Eles têm cafeteira no quarto. Minha mãe e minha tia que são viciadas adoraram. Mas o café da manhã deles é bem gostoso!! Gostei das variedades!!

title: Convenient stay in NYC
text: The hotel was under construction during our stay, but they tried to keep the inconvenience to a minimum. It is very close to the subway which made it easy to get around. Having a king size bed made the room feel very small, but the room and bathroom was very clean and it was also nicely quiet, which is not always the case in Manhattan. My only complaint is that the room was very cold and I was surprised to see that it was a thin blanket on the bed, not a big puffy comforter, as I would've expected. For some reason, the air conditioning was on (in MARCH) when we checked in that evening. After not being able to turn up the temperature or get the heat going, I turned the system off and went out for the evening. It was better when we returned, but still cold. As it was late when we returned, I didn't bother asking for another blanket, but I know better for next time and I will call the front desk.

title: Hôtel idéalement situé dans Manhattan
text: Chambre un peu petite pour quatre, nous voyagions avec nos deux enfants qui sont adultes...mais on ne fait qu'y dormir! Il faut tout de même s'organiser avec 2 grosses valises! Nous pensions également avoir des lits King size comme souvent aux USA, mais nous avions 2X140.   Bouilloire, café à disposition dans la chambre mais aussi en self-service près de la réception, ce qui est indéniablement un plus! La salle de bains n'est pas nettoyée tous les jours, c'est regrettable et si vous déposez vos serviettes à changer sur le sol, elles y restent souvent...c'est également dommage. Pour le reste rien à redire, le personnel est très sympa, au petit déjeuner comme à la réception... Le petit déjeuner est varié, copieux et très bon : oeufs brouillés, omelette au fromage, salade de fruits frais, porridge, gaufres, muffins, bagels, jus divers, yaourts etc...rien ne manque! La station de métro est au bout de la rue. L'hôtel est tout près de l'Empire State Building...Bref, à recommander!!

title: Ótima localização, ótimo custo-benefício
text: Vale a pena pela localização, entre a 6ª e 7ª Avenidas, próximo a estações de metrô. É possível ter acesso a vários pontos da ilha de Manhattan a pé também. O hotel não tem luxo, entretanto é muito confortável e, principalmente, com quarto silencioso. E as atendentes da recepção são muito simpáticas e eficientes.

title: Excelente opção!
text: Recomendo o Fairfield. Me hospedei por uma noite apenas, mas gostei bastante. A localização é muito boa e o custo x benefício é excelente. Café da manhã incluso na diária; internet free; atendimento cordial; quarto não é grande (padrão de NY), mas atende bem. Indo a NY, considere este hotel.

title: Pas mal!
text: Cet hôtel est très bien placé. À côté du metro, Herald square , Empire State Building ... en plein centre de Manhattan. Les chambres sont petites Ok mais la journée on y reste pas. Grande salle de bain. Le ménage a été fait tout les jours. Il y a la tele, une armoire , un bureau et même une table à repassée et un fer. Il manque un coffre fort. Le wifi Marche bien. Le petit dej est complet ( jus, bacon, œufs, céréales, gaufres ...). Je ne regrette pas le choix de cet hôtel je vous le recommande si vous voulez etre au centre de Manhattan

title: Valeu a pena , recomendo.
text:
Excelente localização, próximo a 3 linhas de metro, Empire State e 6ª Avenida.
O atendimento é muito bom, confortável e com bom café da manhã.
Os funcionários são atenciosos e simpáticos. Vale a pena conferir a vista no topo do prédio (pent house).

title: Un hotel para olvidarte de todo
text:
Excelente atención de los receptores del hotel. Cuidando todos los detalles para que sus huéspedes no tengan nada en que preocuparse y se sientan como en casa.
El desayuno es muy abundante y variado. El personal que se encuentra allí es muy agradable, atentos a los gustos y necesidades de los pasajeros.
Las habitaciones son muy cómodas. La wifi funciona perfectamente y cuenta con Tv con Internet que te permite mirar programacion en tu idioma.
Es nuestra segunda visita en el hotel y estamos más que conformes.
Super recomendable.

title: Excellent Midtown Hotel
text:
Great stay at the Fairfield Inn Manhattan/Chelsea over the weekend. The Front Office Supervisor Roxanne Bracken-Luciano was great with the accommodations right from the start. We were upgraded to a high floor with a nice view with our gold status. The breakfast was great in the morning with your usual varieties (Cheese omelet, fruit, bacon, toast, etc). In addition, the hotel is right in the middle of everything, about 10 minute walking distance to the Madison Square Garden along with multiple subway stations minutes away. 

We would stay again in this hotel next time without hesitation, it was perfect price vs. performance for a midtown property!!!

title: New York Stay
text: Stayed in this hotel in early January with a group of girls from work. Great hotel, and in a super location. Our stay was made comfortable and anything we needed or any directions and information that we asked for was provided by the extremely helpful staff. The rooms wereclean, bed linen and towels changed daily and our breakfast was excellent and plentiful. Would highly recommend. Value for money.

title: Very nice stay and exceptional staff
text:
We had a great week staying at this hotel, family of four. Room was small, to be expected, but even with lots of luggage and shopping ;) we managed quite well.
Special mention to Roxanne and Tori, who were extremely helpful and welcoming, with all our inquiries and packages!
Definitely staying there next time around.

title: Perfection
text: My husband and I went for an overnight date in the city. We live fairly close to Manhattan so I had this silly idea a few years ago to stay at all Marriott properties in the city. Well let me tell you this little gem is by far my favorite so far! My husband told them that this was our Valentine day since he would be out of the country on business this week for actual Valentines. We went out for a little while came back to the room to the most amazing gesture,,,a heart shaped Ferraro Rocher’s, a Valentine card, and a small plaque that said “Boss Lady” Can you say going above and beyond! Our room was an executive suite and it was clean and very nice. I also love the location. It’s perfect with perfect staff. If you are planning to go to NYC this is your place! Thank you again to the staff. My husband will also follow up with Marriott with how pleasant you made our stay.

title: Fantastic price and service wonderful!
text: I usually stay in mid town Manhattan but my usual place was very expensive this weekend for some reason so I found the Fairfield Inn and Suites in Chelsea. Great location. Wonderful service from Samantha at the front desk to the people at breakfast to the housekeeping done well and timely. The room was small yet very clean and very comfortable and the view not much but the price allowed us to go out to wonderful dinners. With breakfast decent and varied this hotel was quite a deal! Will return!

title: Great Place to Lay Your Head
text:
This hotel, reasonably priced, friendly staff, clean and a great breakfast can't be beat. It is in a great location on 28th street one-half block from the subway. The breakfast can't be beat, eggs, sausage, even non-Meat sausage, as well as the usual cereal, toast, bagels etc. 

Really, give this place a try.

title: 狭い部屋でした。
text: 私達は7階に宿泊。上階の部屋は わかりませんが7階は狭かったです。アーリーチェックイン出来ず。15時迄、ロビーでチェックイン待ちをしました。次回、ニューヨークに行くならばこちらには宿泊しない。良い点は、立地。地下鉄乗り場から近いこと。朝食は毎日、同じメニュー。期待していたから残念です。

title: What a find in Manhattan
text:
We were a group of 7 ladies from Ireland on a 5 night trip to NY. While I have been in NY on many occasions I have never stayed in this area.  So surprise surprise to find such a great hotel in a very convenient area- we were able to walk everywhere. Only took subway once to Ground Zero and that was even easy just at the end of the block. Several of our group were visiting NY for the first time so being so Central was great for sightseeing .
Reception staff were excellent, nothing too much trouble,  water always available , tea/coffee station all day, I was surprised how good the FREE breakfast was as I am a picky eater and enjoyed it every morning.
Room for 3/4 occupants is small but beds are comfortable, great pillows and so clean.   Bathroom was good and shower was perfect.  Hotel is also quiet so got great sleeps on the 17th floor. Anyway when in NY you only sleep in it as there is so much to do.
I have already given this hotel to several friends for their next trip to New York and I am looking forward to staying there again soon.  Finally we found a great deli on 6th ave , great lunches from there. 
Thank you Fairfield Inn for a very enjoyable stay. You should be very proud of all of your staff.   See you again soon.
Margaret

title: Amazing Staff and Great Location!
text:
I stayed at this hotel with a friend for a weekend in January. I actually kind of booked this hotel by mistake. My friend and I had been going back and forth with options of where to stay and I thought this was where we agreed on, so, I booked it. When we were being dropped off my friend said “this isn’t where we are staying” and I said “yes…it is?” Turned out to be an excellent “mistake”!
This isn’t a fancy hotel. You aren’t going to walk in and be wowed by the lobby. It is clean and in a nice location (flower district). It is walking distance to a lot of major attractions (we are big walkers but we really didn’t need to take transit or cabs anywhere and we saw a LOT). 
What WILL wow you is how truly nice the staff are. The front desk staff when we arrive were friendly and showed genuine interest in us as guests. We were early for check in and they found us a room so we could start our weekend right away. We told them we were in NYC to celebrate my birthday and when we came back after a day of walking we found a bottle of wine one ice with a lovely welcome note. Amazing! The staff in the breakfast area were also all very friendly and welcoming. 
The rooms are small but, it’s a major city so that is totally expected. It was surprisingly quiet (ask for a room at the back of the building…no view but definitely quieter), not a lot of storage space but for 2 people over a weekend, it was totally manageable. Only downside really would be not having an in room safe or fridge. The included breakfast had way more options than expected and is a VERY nice bonus in an expensive place like New York City. 
Awesome stay. Would definitely recommend to anyone headed to NYC. I hope to visit again soon!

title: Clean, modern hotel with nice amenities
text: Great location. Very clean hotel, it's obviously been kept up-to-date. The free breakfast is served in a nice area that includes a covered/climate controlled sun room. They offer free coffee/tea throughout the day, and free water in the lobby. Our bathroom was small; you couldn't stand in it with the door open, really, but our friends were staying in another room and didn't have as small a bathroom. Would recommend.

title: Satisfying budget hotel, but nothing special
text:
I came away with this hotel with nothing terrible to complain about, but nothing that would drive me here again.  The staff was friendly and accomodating, the room was clean, and the location was great.  

Otherwise, I was still left wanting for a few things.  The hotel room by Manhattan standards was still pretty small.  With a two double bed room, there was very little maneuvering room, and even less to park a suitcase.  I was disappointed to not see a mini fridge in the room, which would have mattered if my insulin dependent child was with me.  There was also a distinct lack of electrical outlets to plug in phones and tablets.  If you want ice, you need to head into the basement, where the exercise room was located.  When I needed to print something, the single computer station was occupied, and even then, the printer was not functioning.  In the middle of January, the room was either too hot with the heat on or too cold with the A/C on.  There was no middle ground.  

Conclusion: a decent if otherwise lacklustre hotel.  I won't ever not consider it, but can think of better alternatives in New York City.

title: Business hotel with excellent service
text:
I chose the hotel based on the location expecting the typical business hotel with impersonal service. However the staff were very friendly and provide an exceptional service. They helped with packages that arrived before and during my stay and kept luggage while I traveled out of NYC.
I would return here purely based on the service.

title: Great service and very friendly front desk
text: Stayed for two nights and was upgraded to a larger room. Great location and rooms were spacious for being in NYC. Also has bag check and free breakfast. Close to everything and less noisy street in Midtown. Will definitely stay again when back in NYC.

title: GREAT location, GREAT staff, good rooms
text: The staff at this property are the best asset. SO helpful and it didn't matter what time of the day or who it was they couldn't do enough to help us from helping with rooms, to airline check ins, navigation, restaurant selection, shopping tips, just great, always smiling, remember you, just great. We were 4 adults and realized when we reached the room we had booked it was too small for us and our luggage. We spoke to the team who immediately worked with us to move us into different accommodation in the hotel, it was so swift and helpful AND what makes this special was it was the week before Christmas so very busy. They have security in the lobby, not that I felt it was needed but it was there. Provide a refreshing bottle of water on arrival which was appreciated and have a water station in the lobby. The hotel has a subway at the end of the block, 1 minutes walk away and you can walk to Madison square gardens in under 5 minutes and same for Macys and Herald Square. Really good base for exploring. You can walk to Times Square in under 15 minutes. The rooms are well appointed and have everything you need and the beds are really comfortable. It is a little noisy early in the morning as the hotel is on a street full of florists which is beautiful to walk past each day. The hotel offer breakfast and it was included but there arent that many seats in the small breakfast room but I think this is a timing thing as if you go down earlier there is room but in the last 30 minutes its packed so plan or bring it back to your room. All the coffee is Starbucks and that includes in your room. we would definitely come back here as the team were just so helpful.  Wifi was good and fast and I believe included. They will hold your luggage on check out day for you which is helpful.

title: Great Location to Coordinate your Trip From
text:
This was my first trip to New York City, and I was a little nervous about locations and how I would navigate the city.  Any fears I had were dissipated after my arrival at the hotel.  As with any large city that you visit for the first time, you will have questions and it is a learning lesson.

The hotel was a very nice quick in and out hotel.  It was very clean, and the staff was super friendly.  I found the rooms to be very comparable to Fairfield standards in cities like Chicago.  The Fairfield brand seems to me to be a little higher in major metropolitan areas.  I do not mind booking them because they are a higher grade than their normal product.  You do have to remember that they have a breakfast that is more on the line of a simple in and out continental style.

The bed was very comfortable, there was not a noise factor from the outside traffic.  It was a pleasant stay.  The single bathroom was a little small, but in New York, real estate is a high price!  Everything was clean and up to standard.  It was very manageable for me.

My luggage was lost on this trip, but the staff jumped right in to help.  I was only staying two nights, but they helped to get it delivered, and then called me when it arrived.  The hotel was also very safe and secure.  There is a drug store right on the corner, so I was able to get the things I needed until my luggage arrived.   There are also a lot of eating places very close.  You are nestled right near 6th avenue, and within walking distance of the Empire State Building.

Cab rides were also reasonable, and I did not meet a bad cab driver.  I went to the 911 Memorial, and the ride was about $20.  You are within a short drive to Times Square as well.  New York City is pretty compact, and very well laid out for a large city.

title: 22nd Birthday
text: We initially booked a hotel in the same area & were so unhappy with the room that we decided to check out immediately. Not being in the best of moods, we checked into a second hotel-Fairfield Inn and Suites hoping for a better experience and we got it. Tori, the staff member at the front desk, was personable and knowledgeable about the area/things to do. She went out of her way to make our stay (and my 22nd birthday) amazing. She even sent a complimentary bucket of ice and bottle wine up to our room with a handwritten note. I was blown away by this hotel & Tori's contagious positivity and service made that happen! We'll definitely be back!

title: Excellent location, staff & service.
text:
Great location, attentive and detailed staff & service. Nice power shower which I adore and a comfortable bed  & clean room. NY rooms are small but this is practical and well used of the small space. 
Includes breakfast - which hours are too short - 9am?! and the crowd is massive confusion for your typical free breakfast. Grab a plate and head back to your room with your breakfast.

title: Wonderful stay
text:
My gf booked this place as we decided on a last minute 4 day trip to NYC. 

Because of her Marriott status she was able to get upgraded and for early and late check out. 

The location of the hotel is great close to the 1/2 and N/R subway lines. You are in midtown so many great food choices and stores around. 

 The staff at the hotel are very friendly, warm and will help to answer any questions you may have. 

The room itself was a good size in nyc, clean and what we needed. 

Would definitely stay here again!!!

title: Great value and location
text: Despite the small rooms (presumably standard for Manhattan) we found this hotel very good value, and excellently located for exploring New York.  The inclusive breakfast generally had something for everybody.  Sadly the views of the Empire State Building in the photos on TripAdvisor are now mostly obscured by a new building across the road, but a 30 second walk to the junction with 6th Avenue allows you to see both the ESB and One World Trade Centre from the same spot.

title: Great spot,
text: Nice quiet location in the flower district, close to subway stations.  Friendly staff, room size as expected for was clean.  Full breakfast each morning was fresh and hot! Six visits to NYC, six different hotels....I will go back to this one.  Thanks for the great hospitality!

title: The Perfect Stay Away
text:
I am a frequent traveler, especially with the Marriott brand, and this hotel’s staff went above and beyond my expectations!  

Upon arrival, they went out of their way to find us a room, even though we arrived hours before check in time.   

Later in the trip, we noticed the price of the hotel was lower than the rate we were paying, and the management matched the advertised rate.  They also offered water bottles whenever we came in/out of the lobby area.  

The management also put up with my mother’s frequent questions and requests, haha!  I thank them for their patience.

The free breakfast was excellent!  And, they did not shut it down immediately at the posted closing time, like most hotels.  They made sure everyone was able to that last helping they needed.

The hotel was centrally located, and within walking distance to Central Park, Time Square, Greenwich Village, etc.  

The WiFi was excellent!  Very easy and fast connection wherever I was in the hotel.

Would recommend the hotel to anyone visiting New York City, whether for business or pleasure.

title: Excellent value in central location
text:
Very friendly staff, always welcomed us and valet parking was easy.  Location is great, very near two subway stops and walking distance to good eats.  

Breakfast staff was amazing.  Very attentive, friendly and put out a great spread to get the family off on the right foot.  

Double rooms are tight and have small beds, but for the price we were not surprised and consider it on par with some of the big cities we have visited.  We don’t spend much time in the rooms, so not a big deal for us.

We were impressed by the staff and overall quality, would recommend in the future.

title: Nice Hotel Good Location
text: Good location just a short walk from Time Square and Central Park and right next to the underground. While the décor is a little dated it is in good condition and the room was always cleaned well. Staff were always friendly and helpful

title: Conveniently located in Midtown
text: The hotel is conveniently located in Midtown section of NYC. If you want to avoid the crowd/tourist of NYC, this location is the place for you. Nothing can beat a good location, free breakfast and wifi. It is also near Eataly a 10 min walk. Chelsea Market, Flat iron building, St Marks and many more. SOHO is prolly 10 min cab/uber. Definitely will stay here again!

title: Nice hotel, nice location
text: The location is good if you want to be close to things but not necessarily directly in the middle of them, which is probably the reason that the price of the room was less than other Marriott hotels around the city.  It’s close to Herald Square and Macy’s, Empire State Building, Madison Square Park, Union Square and more.  The hotel itself is pretty much what you’d expect in a city location:  small lobby, small rooms, narrow halls.  The bed comfort level was ok, but not exactly like sleeping on clouds.  The room was quiet, no street noise or sounds from other rooms.  Most importantly, it was clean and the staff were all super-friendly.  They greeted us with bottled waters and Christmas cookies upon our arrival!  And as with all Fairfield Inns, there was free breakfast which we took advantage of!

title: Perfect Stay
text: Came to NY for weekend arriving at Penn Station, and it is Very nice to be able to walk to hotel from there.  My interactions with every member of the hotel staff, including front desk, housekeeping, and breakfast personnel were all extremely pleasant.  My king room was small. but clean and quiet as it faced the rear.  The price, location, and staff could not be beat for the room quality and convenient neighborhood.

title: Nice place, I'd stay here again.
text:
Just stayed there 2 weekends in a row.
Roxanne at the front desk went above and beyond to make our stay totally comfortable!
If a company has people this good, it tells me a lot about the rest of the hotel.
She showed a lot of personal interest in our whole group and we were all impressed!
The breakfast was good, the rooms were small (but big for NYC), the beds were very comfortable.

title: Hotel parfaitement situé !
text:
1. L emplacement topissime !
À côté de 2 lignes de métro, des bus sur la 6th avenue (pour voyager du Nord au Sud de Manhattan c est l idéal !) et beaucoup de commerces sont accessibles à pied facilement
L Empire State dès la sortie de l hôtel et à 10 minutes à pied
Le flatiron, union square, Times Square à moins de 15 minutes

2. Le personnel très gentil et serviable avec un petit déjeuner très varié et toujours bien fourni parfait pour attaquer les visites

3. Chambre pour 4 de taille correcte pour NYC mais impossible de mettre une grosse valise au sol sans tourner autour quand la chaîne est occupée : un peu d organisation et de rangement s imposent

4. Un peu déçu par le fait qu hormis les serviettes changées et les lits faits le ménage de la chambre et de la salle de bains n aient pas été faits au quotidien

Je recommande cet hôtel dans le quartier des "fleuristes" et j'y retournerai qu l occasion se présente !

title: Great Stay Here - Very Comfortable Room
text:
I stayed here when I was relocating to New York for about 5 days.  Got a great rate from Marriott and then the fabulous woman at the front desk bumped me up to a corner room with a view.  The room was huge for a NY hotel room.  The bed and the linens were some of the most comfortable I have ever slept in.  Seriously.  I was so comfortable here.
Always nice to wake up and see fresh flowers all over the sidewalks, too.
Breakfast is decent, but quite hectic.  Dozens of starving tourists with their families, so it was a bit of a war zone sometimes.  If you can manage through it, you can get satisfied.  Everyone I dealt with was always friendly and attentive.  Would happily stay here again

title: Well-situated hotel in Chelsea
text: Nice hotel within walking distance of Penn Station and many of the key sights. We had an issue with our room and the staff changed it quickly and were friendly. Like every NYC hotel, the rooms were small but you wouldn’t spend much time there.

title: Quick trip
text: The staff assistance was excellent. We got to the hotel early and was offered the opportunity to check our bags while we explored the nearby areas. Checkin was average. The room itself was tiny, typical Manhattan size room. It was clean and quiet. Next morning, early, at breakfast there was a homeless person getting two large plates of food. Once the staff discovered him he was dealt with in a quiet non embarrassing humane manner. Being in the Flower District the sidewalks were full of beautiful flowers and plants of all sizes.

title: Outstanding visit
text: We brought a team with 32 HS Cross Country girls and a number of parents. Our team travels quite a bit and this hotel was one of the most accommodating hotels where we've ever stayed.  Staff was always friendly and extremely helpful, the breakfast was outstanding and our stay was wonderful. Whenever our girls needed water, they had it, and we're talking 30 girls having to fill their water bottles basically every day. Location was awesome, 1 block from the 1 line and within walking distance of Times Square.  I can't say enough positive things about this hotel.  We plan to return in the next few years and we will absolutely for sure return to this hotel.

title: Heerlijk verblijf.
text: Fijn verblijf gehad.  Prachtige buurt tussen de bloemen. Kamers met straatzicht waren ruim en schoon. Ontbijt was ruim voldoende qua hoeveelheid en keuze. Kortom een aanrader voor een heerlijk verblijf in NY.

title: Fantastic!
text: What an amazing place, for something that looks quite small outside, the service and facilities could not have been better! On arrival we were told we could wait a bit longer for a free upgrade as we were going for my girlfriends 21st. Kevin the manager was great! Nothing was too much for him, we recieved multiple complimentary muffins, a card and a bottle of sparkling wine. He helped us naviagate round the city and provided us with a late checkout after finding out we had a late flight. All staff were easily approachable and helpful. There was a good variation in food for breakfast. The hotel is in a good location and a subway station is just down the street. Overall rating of 10/10. Thank you for making our visit so special!

title: Well located, good-value hotel, but with tiny rooms
text:
My wife and I stayed here when we were in NYC to see the US Open. The hotel is extremely well located, walking distance to Penn Station, restaurants, and other subway lines. It was also very well priced, but the rooms are very small, even by Manhattan hotel standards. This was fine for us as we didn't spend much time in the room.

Travelers with children or looking to spread out should probably look elsewhere. But, if you are traveling light or don't plan to spend too much time in your hotel room, this hotel might be a steal.

title: Home Away from Home
text: Conveniently located close to subway and public transport ; loved leaving the hotel amidst all of the potted flowers and plants than lined the sidewalk each morning as this is in the flower district; enjoyed a varied and generous buffet for breakfast which really helped keep our costs down;but most of all appreciated and enjoyed the staff, especially the evening crew of Janessa, Samantha and Roxanne  who were so accommodating in finding us the right size room for 4 Canadian seniors; guiding us through technical adjustments [ Wi-Fi, room safe,thermostat] and still made us feel like we were coming home each evening as they greeted us warmly anxious to hear about our daily adventures and ready to answer our questions and make recommendations. We will be recommending this hotel to our friends and family.

title: Mooi basic hotel op ideale locatie om stad te verkennen
text:
Hotel ligt in de bloemenstraat wat een verademing is om door te wandelen. Drie metrolijnen (rood, geel en groen) op korte wandelafstand (tussen 3-5min van hotel).
Optioneel ontbijt is beperkt maar zeker ok. Receptie personeel zeer behulpzaam en vriendelijk. Kamer is voldoende ruim (zeker voor NY normen). Moderne badkamer, geen koelkast/minibar op de kamer.

title: ótimo custo / benefício
text: hotel muito bem localizado. quartos muito confortáveis e banheiros novos e limpos. Funcionários simpáticos, atenciosos e prestativos. Próximo ao metrô e a alguns metros da Times Square. Me hospedaria novamente neste hotel.

title: Handy for getting around
text:
The picture of the hotel's room on TA gives the impression of a brighter room than the one we had.  Our room, comprising of two double beds and a small bathroom (shower over bath) was fairly depressing with dark furniture and carpeting and drab walls.We overlooked a brick building where it's workers had a direct view into our room when we raised the blinds which meant that during working hours we left both blinds down.  Still, you don't stay in your room much during the day so we were fairly resigned about this.  We had breakfast (complimentary to guests) at the hotel.  I really enjoyed the variety but did note that although there are two rooms accommodating guests these were very cramped at weekends with many people waiting for people to vacate tables.  Also, I was disappointed that breakfast finished at 9am (10am weekdays). Why would you do this when the majority of your guests are on holiday? There are no other meals or even a bar at the hotel so what's the rush?
We found the hotel easily accessible from Penn Station. It is only one stop on the metro to W28th street but we had quite a bit of luggage and walked down 7th Avenue to 28th which took us only a few minutes - no big deal.  With the metro at the end of the street we went to The South Shore for the free Staten Island Ferry and in the other direction to Central Park. - no problems at all.  We went to a bar called the Compton Ale House in W27/W26 street which had good beers and food and there is also a cheap laundromat at W26th.  All in all, a useful location to be in.  I should add the young ladies on the front desk we're friendly and helpful. Thanks Ashley.

title: Gold star for providing veggie sausages!
text:
We chose this hotel for its convenient location.  Some places of interest are within easy walking distance and a nearby metro station allowed us access to others.
We received a friendly welcome on arrival and our king room was a good size, with a comfortable bed.  There was plenty of choice for breakfast, including cereals, yoghurts, fresh fruit, oatmeal, waffles, assorted breads and juice.  There was always scrambled egg and omelette on offer plus sausage or bacon and veggie sausages.  In all of our travels in the USA this was the first time we saw veggie sausages.
The one down side was the noisy location, though unsurprising as we were in NYC.
Would have given a 5 had the pillows not been so lumpy and the carpet badly stained.

title: August 27th Stay
text:
Read lots of nice reviews on this hotel so decided to give it a try.  After all, shouldn't have too many negatives for only an one night stay.  Unfortunately, I stayed at the Courtyard on W31st the night before, so this hotel's room and especially the bathroom became a major issue for me.  When I first try to check in early, I was told that no rooms are available for early in for that day, but I was hopeful that perhaps, someone would double check and see if a complimentary upgrade was available, but no such luck (I guess being a Marriott gold status member won't get any special treatments at this hotel).  Instead, they nicely asked me to come back closer to the check in time.  Thank goodness I was able to get a late check out from Courtyard.  When I return later for the proper check in, I was very disappointed that the room that was assigned to me was not on a higher floor, and was near the elevator.  Everything that I do not want on my profile.  The young woman at the front desk told me that I was supposedly assigned to a room with the view of the Empire State Bldg., I am sorry to say that the building view I had was not it.  So, the room was clean, but there was no floor space to lay my luggage on and the drawer spaces available were maybe 6 - 8 inches to the end of the bed.  This wasn't the issue that bothers me the most.  It was bathroom vanity space that I am not used to.  On top of it, you cannot leave the bathroom door open because the door opens inward and will block out half the vanity space.  This means you must close the bathroom door even if you only need to wash your hands.
The nice things I could say about this hotel is the location and complimentary breakfast.  For my personal preference, I'd rather stay at other Marriott properties in the future.

title: Here's to the Night Staff!
text:
Amtrak was late so it was 1am and I received a nice New York welcome and directions to a deli on 6th avenue that stays open all night. 

Rooms are small, housekeeping does a nice job, and the breakfast is passable. 28th street has numerous flower and plant shops.

They do need to work on the pc in the lobby area, lots of trouble printing attraction tickets.

Spend the money you save staying here on a great dinner!

title: Nice Hotel
text:
People at the front desk always smilling., fast answering questions.
Room was clean and bed were confortable. The hotel located near of Empire State building, Madison Square Garden, Fashion district.
Breakfast is include.

title: Hotel + staff + location = Great!!
text: The hotel is very clean with a bright & cheerful atmosphere. The room was small and "NYC Size" but my time was spent out and about exploring. The front desk staff was extremely courteous and gave a warm welcome. The location is convenient to so much and is right in the middle of the flower district. From early morning to late afternoon the sidewalks are loaded with everything from trees to plants to loads & loads of fresh cut flowers. A great NYC experience.

title: Excellent emplacement et rapport qualité prix.
text: Cet hôtel est très bien placé à proximité du métro et de l ESB. A proximité aussi d'un Whole food Market ,très pratique pour nos repas du soir ! Nous pouvons profiter du petit déjeuner copieux et à volonté chaque matin. De même, vous avez la possibilité de prendre en self service , à chaque heure de la journée, une boisson chaude ou froide , ce qui est très appréciable. Le rooftop avec vue sur l'ESB est très sympa. Le personnel est très souriant et disponible. Les chambres sont certes un peu petites pour quatre mais on y fait que dormir !! Le seul petit bémol, la salle du petit déjeuner trop petite pour le nombre de chambres et donc de l'attente pour s'installer à une table. Cela reste un hôtel idéalement placé , de bon confort et d'un très bon rapport qualité prix.

title: Great location + clean + quiet
text: The small rooms (as expected) were very clean and quiet. Great location -- we spent time at NYU and Central Park -- so we specifically chose Chelsea and would definitely come back.  Its in the floral district and there is a wonderful cafe on the same block, a few doors down, called Just a Taste if you want an awesome latte. I didn't like the hotel coffee but the breakfast had a nice variety of basics. Rooftop was ok.... is small, with seating, a view of the Empire State Building. Friendly staff and felt safe.

title: 1st trip to NYC
text: Everything was wonderful!!! The room was a little smaller than I'm used to but I'd never been to NYC before. I did know from friends that the rooms are comparatively smaller.  The beds were very comfortable. Breakfast was delicious. Hotel staff was very friendly & always willing to help. The location was beautiful. We will definitely go back!!

title: Normally
text: El hotel no esta mal. Habitaciones pequeñas. La cama muy cómoda y grande. Armario pequeño. La ducha no estaba mal, pero no era un lujo ni mucho menos. Es un hotel bastante normal. Lo mejor la maquina de agua fría con lima que hay en la recepción. Sienta muy bien después de un largo día de turismo

title: Great hotel for the price
text:
I stayed here the last weekend of July after returning from vacation in Europe. The front desk agents were all very efficient, attentive, and respectful. I was upgraded to a high floor room with a view of the Empire State Building upon checking in, as a courtesy for being a Gold Member.

The room was very clean and there were plenty of electrical outlets for charging. For an NYC hotel room, this one was pretty spacious.

As far as Fairfield Inn breakfasts go, this one was pretty good. If I'm being very picky, the one thing I would note is that the breakfast attendants were not as responsive (i.e. clearing plates, stocking the yogurt fridge, etc) as some other Fairfield Inns in NYC that I've stayed at.

All in all, I had a great stay. I'd stay here again for its central location and reasonable prices.

title: Definitely recommend this hotel
text: My husband & I booked a room here (unexpectedly)  at the very end of a 2 ½ week vacation.  Our  flight home out of New York (& several subsequent re-booked flights) were cancelled & we had to scramble to find a room for the night.  All properties near the airport were booked.  We were extremely pleased with our stay.  We checked in around 9:30 pm - & out the next morning at 6:15am, but wish we could have stayed longer.  Great location in Chelsea, especially if you were there for a longer stay in New York and wanted to be centrally located.  Very close to a variety of nice restaurants.  The lobby is small, but very welcoming, with a tank of ice water, cups, & very friendly staff.  The rooftop deck has an excellent view of the top of the Empire State Building, which was a nice treat for us on our unplanned “bonus” night in NYC!  The room is not large, as is typical in NY, but was comfortable in every other way.   The bed was the 6th one I slept in during this trip, & was absolutely the most comfortable out of all of them!   The towels were also nice & thick.   The room was very quiet.  Our night was too short, but we slept very well.  Grabbed a bit to go at the complimentary breakfast bar the next morning- which was well-supplied & everything looked really good.  Finally, I needed some assistance after our stay with obtaining some receipts to file a claim with our Travel Insurance.   Helen Guon, the General Manager, went above & beyond to assist us.  What we needed took a bit of time & she was very patient, responsive, and so very helpful through the entire process.    I highly recommend this property.

title: Great Stay!
text:
I arrived to the hotel around 7:30am and was greeted with a warm welcome! The staff was more than helpful to check our bags and offer us access to the complimentary breakfast service, which was one of the better complimentary breakfasts I've had! Everything was great! 

I came to New York City for a birthday weekend getaway. My husband had called the hotel and asked if there was anything special they could do for my birthday! Janessa and the hotel staff went above and beyond! I came back to my room to find wine, freshly baked cookies, a happy birthday sign, a treat bag, and beautiful flowers! It was such a nice surprise!! 

Every staff member was extremely friendly and helpful! I would definitely stay here again and would highly recommend it to anyone! 

Thank you Janessa for everything! We had a wonderful stay!!

title: Idéalement situé + vue imprenable
text:
En plein coeur de Chelsea sur la 6th av et la 28 st (la rue des fleuristes),  2 stations de métro et commerces à proximité, idéal pour un séjour à Manhattan.
Chambres de tailles correctes pour NYC, belle salle de bain contemporaine, boissons chaudes en chambre, mais surtout très belle vue sur l'Empire state Building, insonorisation un peu  défaillante mais nous avions des travaux en face dans la rue.
Bons petits déjeuners complets (salés et sucrés) . Personnel efficace et service de qualité ( bagages en conciergerie le jour de notre départ)
Je recommande !

title: Perfect in all ways
text: I went for a short weekend trip, and must say that this was an excellent location. Its about a 12-15 minute walk from Penn station. The staff is friendly. The rooms are a bit tiny but its clean and well maintained. The breakfast is great and you are very close to the empire state building. I would not think twice about staying here again.

title: Clean and good location, TINY room
text: Stayed for a night recently in a teeny-tiny room on the 10th floor looking right onto the building next door. The room was clean but the carpet was so old and dingy I didn't really want to walk on it. Nice neighborhood -- right in the flower district and down the street from FIT. Good restaurants and bars around. Decent price.

title: Made a challenging weekend a bit nicer
text:
We traveled to New York City for a weekend away. While the trip was fun, it turned into one of those adventures where a number of things went wrong. I left my credit card at an airport store and my mother-in-law left her license at home, We arranged to have them delivered to the hotel. Jenifer, who was working at the front desk, recognized we were having a tough day and delivered a bottle of champaign to our room with snacks to make the day a bit brighter. She was a great hostess and was very attentive to all the guests needs. 

The hotel itself is very nice and is located right in the flower wholesale district. The sights of the flowers and the wonderful fragrances emanating from them made for a great walk in the morning as the workers moved the flowers out to the street. There was also a yellow cat who seemed to be the greeter for the hotel on the front porch area. I don't think an earthquake would have encouraged him to interrupt his daily nap outside the hotel. :)

As always, the Fairfield Inn breakfast was good and provided a nice start to each day for our family. I would highly recommend this hotel as an affordable place to stay while visiting New York City.

title: Well that was fun!
text: If you are looking for a  hotel to stay while you venture NYC…this is the place.  From check-in to check-out it has everything you need including great customer service. Comfy bed and surprisingly decent breakfast.  Hidden gem during your stay….rooftop patio overlooking the Empire State building!

title: Excellent place to stay
text:
This is a wonderful place to stay if you are coming to New York. It is within walking distance to Times Square but far enough so as not to hear all the noises that you can expect to hear on a daily basis.

The manager, Janessa Williams, was truly accommodating and friendly. 

If you are wanting to stay at a place that is reasonable, clean and nice, stay at Fairfield Inn.

title: Wonderful hotel
text: We stayed 10 nights in this excellent hotel. The location, the wonderful view from our window ( empire state building), the spacious room, the good breakfast, and the helpfull hotel staff,  made our trip to manhattan more enjoyable.

title: Small cozy
text:
The room is a little small, not much space to put stuff and luggage, but then again it's Manhattan, typical. Breakfast is very ordinary and not much variety, better off having breakfast outside.

The beds are comfortable and the staff are exceptionally helpful and friendly. The hotel is very near the subway and very convenient. Note that the hotel is in the middle of the wholesale flower district and it can get quite noisy early in the morning. Be down early for breakfast as the food run out relatively fast (around 8am.)

title: Hidden Gem with GREAT PrIcing for NYC!
text:
Stayed here for two nights while on a business trip and couldn't have been more pleased! Great location and room was just what I needed!
No bathtub- but space is a premium in the city so no big deal.
Complimentary coffee, tea and water 24/7! Free printing on computers! Complimentary breakfast each morning!
Enjoyed the rooftop patio a few times with a great view of Empire State Building.
Try GiGi's Cafe (3 min walk) away on 7th for fabulous made-to-order salads. They'll even chop it all up and toss your dressing for you! Yum!

title: A No-Brainer
text: This is such a no-brainer for me. It's clean and quiet (with a room in the back). The rooms are not large but I'm looking only to get into bed and read  until I fall asleep. The  staff is great. It's two blocks from my favorite Starbucks. I can get up nearly two hours later than I do at home and still be at my office by 8:00 a.m. And as I leave for my morning run, the flower district is already alive and two workers are putting  a dozen magnificent Bougainvillea trees in front of the hotel's outdoor seating area. How I love Bougainvillea! What more do I need? This place is such a deal.

title: Great Hotel - Convenient Location
text:
This small hotel is tucked away right on W 28th Street. The street contains many flower shops that line the streets with their merchandise (i.e. Flower District). It makes for a real nice walk to and from the hotel!
The hotel is very convenient to many shops, restaurants, and sights in mid-town NYC. Also, it is a very easy walk to Penn Station.
The staff are very friendly and helpful. The check-in process was quick and easy. Breakfast in the morning is available and had plenty of good choices - hot and cold foods, and plenty of fresh fruit. The breakfast area has seating both inside the hotel and in a sunroom area - very nice area if you have a sunny day! The breakfast is both a great time and money saver if you are staying in the area for a few days. Our hotel room, while a bit small, is pretty much the norm for NYC. Everything was neat and clean - and in good working order. The hotel has a rooftop area - which we quickly visited. Some nice views from the rooftop area - both day and night.
The front desk staff were happy to help us on our last day... We asked them to hold our luggage while we explored the city. We were not leaving until much later in the day.
We liked this hotel and its location so much, that we will choose it on our next trip!

title: Average hotel in good location
text: Good location. Construction in progress across the street. Friendly staff.  I booked city view quest room and got a room on 4th floor facing the street - hardly to see the "city view". Overall it was clean but the carpets could be cleaner. Very small bathroom, it was hard to move about. Nice rooftop view.

title: Stayed at this hotel foe a reunion of 6 collegfe friend in their 60's
text: From the moment we checked in after walking from Penn Station, till the day we checked out, the staff was very accommodating and helpful in every way. The location is excellent for walking Highline Park, and the Subway Station for Line#1 was so conveniet for getting the the 9/11 Memorial and the Wall Street area. The rooms were quiet and comfortable, the breakfast varied and plentiful, and all of the staff were top notch.  We were not leaving till the evening of our check out day and the hotel stored our luggage, allowed us to come back to the lobby to get some refreshing water, use the bathroom, and cool off on a record breaking heat day in NYC, until it was time to catch our train to JFK that evening. Not one complaint from 6 ladies and we all agreed we would definitely stay here again and recommend this hotel to anyone staying in the Chelsea area of NYC!

title: Friendliest Faces in Town
text: Staff was terrific.  Helpful (needed scissors) and attentive.  Breakfast was good and convenient.  Housekeeping and timing of such was great for us.  I was stuck working in the room until 11:30 and no issues.  I will be back.

title: 3σ φίλοι
text:
Μείναμε 3σ φίλοι
Τα δωμάτια είναι μικρά αλλά καθαρά 
Βέβαια αν είσαι πάνω από 180 πραγματικά θα στριμωχθείς στο κρεβάτι.  
Το άσχημο ήταν Ότι το είπα στη ρεσεψιόν και η απάντηση ήταν πως προτιμούσαν να αλλάξουμε ξενοδοχείο παρά να μας αλλάξουν σε μεγαλύτερο δωμάτιο ( το οποίο Κ είχαν) 
Το πρωινο πλούσιο αλλά και τις 10 μέρες που μείναμε ίδιο 
Η περιοχή βολεύει τέλεια 
Το ρουφ Τοπ του όχι κάτι ιδιαίτερο 
Τιμή σε σχέση με όλα ακριβή.

title: Housekeeping or Nah???
text:
My daughter and I were guest for two days.  I was really not happy that housekeeping did NOT take care of the room.  We were up and out by 7am and returned at 6:30 pm to find that our room had not been serviced at all.  I witnessed them clean the rooms to the left and right of our room but they did bother to clean our room.  When I asked the housekeeper if she planed to service our room she told me she would come later.  I was thinking later, it's 6:30pm.  We called the front to report the issue and they apologized for the housekeeping.  Really?????

We also had a staff member knock on our door but didn't identify himself as a staff member.  He let himself in the room while we were inside.  Once he realized the room was occupied he quickly retreated.  I guess we should have used the safety lock inside the room to prevent unwanted entry by stranger or hotel staff memebers with keys.

Just a bit disappointed as we used valuable rewards points to book this room.  Feels like a complete waste of good hard earn points.

title: Horrible treatment of guests
text:
I stayed here for two days last week and was pleased with the level of hospitality. I'd initially only planned one night, and decided to extend my stay. I work as a singer in Germany, and really value my time in New York (home), so this trip, however brief, was quite important to me.

Upon checkout, and while waiting for a friend to pick me up, I went into the back room where there are computers for guest use, a sitting area, and a coffee and tea station, which the concierge invited us to use.

While sitting quietly and well-dressed, with my albeit cold cup of coffee, I was accosted by a security agent who asked me "what do you think you are doing here," and who then told me "they do not want you here; you need to leave." 

I spoke politely to a desk agent, who agreed that there was a misunderstanding (they were looking for somebody else?) but I did leave the hotel very upset. 

I appreciate the possibility of miscommunication, however cannot appreciate or understand how in a business whose sole product is the furnishing of hospitality, words such as that, (i.e. "You are not welcome here," "please leave," etc.) can be misfired. What an absolutely humiliating experience, and had not a minute before settling my 300 dollar guest check.

I would not recommend this hotel  or these people. Unbelievable. Huge thumbs down.

title: Second stay
text:
Went to NY for my second trip and stayed at Fairfield inn. Good hotel nice roof top bar. Breakfest was really good to. Our stay was for the whole week,saturday to saturday. My wife has been here before she liked it and recomended this hotel for our family. Had our room at 19 floor.
Clean nice rooms service are good. I have nothing to complain about.
Would love to come back,best regards Karl Ole

title: Clean. Comfortable. Secure. Friendly. Nice place to stay in NY.
text: We stayed here for 3 nights (24, 26, 26 Nov 2016). I was really happy here. The centrality of its location is great for the tourist - close to tube stations, Penn Station, Broadway, Times Square, restaurants etc etc and a great place from which to launch yourself each day.  The room was warm, comfortable & clean. There was plenty of good food for a full  breakfast each day - cereal, fruit, juice, eggs, sausage, hash browns, toast, jams, milk, yoghurt, waffles etc etc and lovely "bottomless" coffee and tea. The breakfast room was a bit crowded but you have to expect that if you choose the same time as everyone else.The staff we dealt with were friendly and helpful. (Maybe for my next visit they can invest in some bottle openers and keep them behind the desk.)

title: NOT Value for Money!!!!
text:
We stayed in the particular hotel for 6 nights, in April 2017 and we were extremely disappointed. The truth is that the location of the hotel is excellent, very close to metro station and the room was decent & clean. 
The major problem was that the breakfast room is extremely small and sometimes we couldn't find a place to sit down. The variety of the breakfast is poor & the quality of the products is very low. Some members of the staff weren't very friendly and in general the hotel doesn't provide you enough services comparing to other major hotel chains. In addition the hotel is extremely overpriced although in New York this is the rule.

title: Pleasantly Surprised - Great Staff!
text: The Fairfield in Chelsea was perfectly situated with walking distance to everything.  The room was clean and comfortable and had the most amazing shower!  The rooms were very quiet.  The breakfast was much better than similar hotels I have stayed at with a lot of variety...something for everyone...even waffles!  Most of all, the staff were friendly and helpful.  The hotel manager and all of the staff went out of their way to be helpful and accommodating.

title: Staff was very friendly and helpful
text: The toll free reservations messed up our reservation and the GM of the hotel stepped right in and made things right.  Rooms were quite comfortable and was a easy walk to MSG.  Look forward to coming back and staying here again.

title: Highly recommend
text: The staff during all shifts were very friendly and always greeted you when you arrived in the lobby and when leaving the hotel for the day they would tell you to have a good day.  The area the hotel was in is the flower district and it was very pretty to walk out of the hotel into that environment.  I would recommend this hotel to anyone.  The location was good as well.

title: Friendly hotel - good vibes
text: Front desk "Daniel" was just one friendly face out of many during our family weekend in NYC. The staff were great with our multiple room bookings, tourist questions and always tried to be helpful - including with a voucher for a free beer at a pub around the corner! The hotel is Marriott-standard. Clean, efficient with good coffee and a hot breakfast in a little patio (look up for the classic NYC view). Breakfast waitstaff were quick and thoughtful despite the busy buffet. We sat on the simple roof-top garden to unwind after the shows and watched the NYC night lights. Stored our luggage before and after our stay. Walking distance to Amtrak if carrying light luggage.  Blocks from "high line" and Fashion Institute. Whole Foods and a drug store nearby - seemed very safe-- located in the middle of the flower district. Friendly city cat named Tiger hangs out by the entrance.

title: Excellent and convenient
text: I took my girlfriend to NYC so she could do a spinning class at the Peloton "mothership" for her birthday. This was only a few blocks away. I booked it on points alone and was pleasantly surprised. The counter staff was very friendly and check in was less than a minute. The room was larger than I was expecting for the area. Everything was clean and had a fresh feeling. Breakfast was included and was decent, but nothing extraordinary. I met a very friendly NYC street cat outside the hotel. Overall good experience and I would definitely go back if in the area.

title: A Bit Worn, But Perfect Location
text:
Starting with the good: 

The front desk service was friendly and prompt. I checked in from the mobile app and didn't have to wait, though since I was earlier than the stated check-in time I got  a room with two beds rather than my reservation for one king.
