That was fine since I was early and needed to use the room before a meeting.

The location is great for proximity to Penn Station, a Whole Foods, Brown's Bagels, easy access to the Subway and other sites by foot. Plus it was a few blocks from where I needed to be for work. 28th Street also has a number of flower shops, the owners of which line the sidewalk with their wares. It makes for a very bright and fragrant walk to 6th Ave., if a bit of a squeeze.

My room, 803, was quiet and the shower had strong flow and got quite hot.

Breakfast and wifi included in the price. It's nice to be able to go down and get fresh coffee in the morning, as well as oatmeal or other breakfast items. Nothing fancy, but serves the purpose well.

The not so good: 

The room was otherwise pretty worn, with stains on the carpet and bed frames and sheets that seemed quite old and used. This made me a little apprehensive, but ultimately I slept fine and had a fine stay. My room had no real view to speak of as it looked at the back of other buildings that were quite drab. I had to remind myself I wasn't there for luxury, but for work and this hotel suited the purpose well.

title: Would stay again.
text: I stayed for a quick over-night stay.  The hotel was clean and comfortable and in a great location. The staff was very polite and the breakfast was very convenient.  I would definitely stay here again!!

title: Great Hotel
text: Excellent location within walking distance of so much and easy access to the subway. Bonus it is located in the flower district with beautiful plants and flowers lining the street. All staff were very friendly and attentive. We had a city view on the 18th floor and it was gorgeous, especially at night. The room was big enough but the bathroom was tight quarters. It rained while we were there and the threshold for the window/sliding door leaked and got the carpet wet. The room was quiet and bed super comfy. We never had to wait long for the elevators. Breakfast was always stocked up and a good variety of your basics. We would stay here again.

title: Great Service
text:
Jillian who is the front office agent was awesome.  Friendly, helpful and professional.  
Made my stay even better 
She kept my bags at the front desk prior to my check in and always had a smile and kind word. 
The hotel rooms were clean

title: Muy buena ubicación con una atención muy agradable
text:
Estuve una semana en abril 2017, la ubicación es perfecta cerca de todo y con dos líneas de metro a una cuadra.
Estuve con mi mujer y la habitación era de muy buen tamaño con una vista del Empire State inmejorable, lástima que srá por poco tiempo porque están construyendo un edificio que me imagino tapará esa vista.
Buena atención y el desayuno al ser complimentary me pareció aceptable

title: Perfekte Lage, sehr freundliches Personal
text: Das Hotel liegt sehr gut, zwischen 2 U-Bahn Linien. Zu Fuss sehr gut erreichbar sind z.B. Time Square, Empire State Building oder Flat Iron. Von der Dachterrasse ist das Empire State Building zu sehen, eine wunderbare Aussicht!! Das Zimmer war sauber hatte aber keinen Safe und keinen Kühlschrank. Hochwertige Pflegeprodukte im Bad, die General Manager hat mir sogar etwas besorgt und mich informiert wo ich es kaufen konnte, herzlichen Dank! Sehr freundliches Personal,  PC und Drucker sowie Internet kostenlos, Frühstück war gut, wir würden dieses Hotel wieder buchen.

title: Ferie
text: Sentral beliggenhet.  Gåavstand til det meste. Ca. 5 minutter til Madison s garden og Time square😊. (Gåavstand)  Hyggelig og serviceinnstilt betjening👍 Ligger i kort avstand til Broadway, Empire state building.  Typisk amerikansk frokost😊

title: Great location - 15 min walk to Times Square
text: To begin with i would say great location, its on 28th street and Times square begins from 33rd street. so its like hardly 7-8 minute walk and then 15 min walk to main Times square on 42nd street. The hotel rooms are small but as I have read about the hotels near Times square you would not get bigger rooms. After all who wants to stay in hotel once you are in NY and Times square. Its extremely clean. The staff at reception is very helpful, courteous and sweet. the room was cleaned everyday and they did it very well. The complementary breakfast is average. There is very less seating space hence ensure that you are on time for it. The food might even get over after 1 hr or so.  They happily allowed to keep bags before checkin and after checkout. Wi fi is very good.

title: Prenotazione cancellata il giorno stesso del nostro check in
text:
La nostra esperienza è stata pessima, dopo aver ricevuto conferma della nostra prenotazione il giorno stesso della nostra partenza, siamo stati contattati telefonicamente per informarci che la prenotazione era stata cancellata per overbooking. Da considerare che la nostra prenotazione risaliva a 5 mesi fa!!!
Attenzione!!!

title: Great location near Penn Station
text: This was a very good hotel, with excellent service.  I loved waking up each morning in the Flower District, the street lined with fresh plants and flowers.  The rooms are New York-small.  We were Two adults and two teens, traveling for spring break, and my only complaint is paying a $349 room rate and trying to sleep 2 in a full-size bed.

title: Great Visit
text:
Great hotel. Room was a little on the small side but spotless! Big bathroom (relative to room). Staff was great, friendly, helpful! Breakfast was good also. 
Would definitely recommend! Right off 7th Ave so close to everything.

title: Hotel discreto... Ottima posizione
text:
Abbiamo soggiornato in questo hotel per circa una settimana e lo abbiamo trovato ottimo per visitare Manhattan, in quanto si trova vicino alle fermate delle principali linee della metro ed a poche decine di minuti a piedi dalle principali attrazioni turistiche (times square, rockfeller center, empire state building).
L'albergo non è niente di eccezionale, le camere sono molto pulite anche se parecchio piccole. Nota positiva la colazione compresa nel prezzo, vera rarità per gli USA, che torna molto comoda. 
Un'unica pecca: abbiamo prenotato molti mesi in anticipo attraverso booking.com e al momento dell'arrivo la sorpresa: la camera non era disponibile per la prima notte. Quindi ci hanno trovato una sistemazione nell'hotel di fronte (che abbiamo dovuto pagare) e poi la mattina seguente ci siamo trasferiti al Fairfield. Il disguido è accaduto per causa loro (o di booking), ma nulla è stato fatto per riparare all'errore.

title: Disappointing
text:
My husband and I have stayed at this hotel several times.  
Positive: The location is convenient and the front desk personnel are professional and efficient.
Negative:  The rooms do not have a refrigerator or microwave which we find useful.
We went to the "free breakfast" on 4/14/17 at 8:45 (it was supposed to last until 9:00).  Every food station was empty except for the cereal and waffle station.  However, there was no milk so that made the cereal station useless as well.  (See pictures). 
No fruit, no milk, no bread, no yogurt, no eggs, etc.  pathetic!
Our room was nice but the desk chair literally was pealing.  The faux leather deteriorated and was flaking everywhere.  Seems way below Marriott standards.  
While we enjoy the location, I doubt we will ever stay at this location again.

title: Awesome
text: Easy checkin, elite upgrade, big city room for New York - bathroom also decent and modern!  Bed comfy, stocked my feather pillows and very clean!  Wifi upgrade to hi speed to rewards members.  Subway close but not much else around, no late night snacks close!  Breakfast in morning not bad, have healthy fruit oatmeal and yogurt and it's free!  Coffee always good.  Has a rooftop area.  Lots of construction around but if you get a decent price, you can't beat this hotel.  Clean and the people are very nice!      Elevator is fast, not sure why it has ever gotten a bad review.  Lots of tourists around that probably don't know any better!  Ha, I'm not a New Yorker but have come to the city a lot and am used to the tiny rooms and noise so this quiet little clean area and big room are a bonus for me!

title: A pleasant stay in NYC, by flower wholesale stores
text: With a view of Empire State Bldg.  Friendly staff. Good breakfast. Coffee all day. A block from several metro stops make this location so  convenient.  We stayed in 304 facing 28th street.  Ask for room facing 28th!!!

title: Good location, few complaints
text:
The hotel itself was nice. The rooms are nice and clean. The room had more than enough space for two people and a single suitcase. The bathroom was spacious and updated. It also had a ventilated fan, which it seems like few hotels have. There was no fridge in the room. The complementary breakfast was good. It had an assortment of baked goods, cereal, a waffle maker, fresh fruit, and yogurt. The front desk staff was friendly and helpful. The hotel is in a great spot.  We were able to walk to time square and Central Park no problem. We were also close to Madison square garden, which is the reason we came to New York. 

There were two reasons I didn't give this hotel five stars. First: we planned on doing the valet parking. But, because it had snowed within the week we were here, there was only a single small spot available to park in, and it wasn't cleared. Plus, the valet service is off site, so we would have had to wait about 10 minutes while blocking traffic to valet the car. In nice weather, this probably wouldn't be an issue as a full size spot would be available. We ended up doing the self park, which was cheaper anyway. Second: we left our do not disturb sign on the door when we went out for a couple hours during the day because we didn't want the room disturbed. When we got back, the sign was back inside the room, and it had been cleaned. Nothing was disturbed or taken, but I did find it surprising that the sign was ignored. 

The hotel can't be blamed for this, but the street noise is extremely loud. We were on the 11th floor, and the horns and sirens woke me up multiple times throughout the night. I recommend bringing ear plugs if you are a light sleeper.

title: Excellent, will stay again
text: Very very good hotel. Hotel is clean and in good shape. Rooms, beds, bathrooms excellent. Bright and cheery. Hotel staff provides excellent, attentive service. Gym is clean. Comp breakfast is good, includes plain and fancy food. Price is excellent. Location is great - flower district, walk to everything in midtown. Near #1 and N/R trains. Nail salon next door & upstairs is very good. Will stay here again if i'm paying my own way

title: L'emplacement avant tout...
text:
Idéalement placé entre Time Square, Madison Square Garden et Downtown Manhattan, vous pourrez sillonner dans Manhattan rapidement avec des lignes de metro toutes proches et u quartier très bien desservi par des restaurants.
Seul bémol, la taille des chambres, vraiment minuscules pour trois, tout juste bonnes pour deux.
Mention bien pour l'accueil et le front desk.

title: Camas muy chicas para 4 adultos
text:
No es para 4 adultos, la habitación es muy chica, y las camas no se adaptan a adultos
Cuando reclame me dijeron que solo tienen estas camas... Mal... me quedo 6 noches y la verdad no es lo que ofrecen. La habitación esta limpia. Espero realmente solucionen el problema.

title: Nikel
text:
L'hôtel est très bien situé, le personnel très agréable et serviable.Le petit déjeuner est correct et bon.Les chambres pour 4 sont un peu petite mais bon nous étions rarement dans la chambre, juste pour dormir.
Je le conseil sans problème.

title: Great Location
text: This is a wonderful hotel with clean rooms and a great location. You can walk from Penn Station and there are several subway lines with in walking distance. Do yourself a favor and don't stay in Times Square,  this hotel is about 4 stops away on the broadway line. The price was right for NYC, which was our determining factor in choosing this hotel.

title: Misinformation hurt our wallets!
text:
We stayed at the hotel on Sunday, February 12. After our stay we received an email from the operations manager, asking for a feedback. I submitted it, but have never heard back. So now I'm posting my email here:

"Thank you so much for writing to me! Staying at your hotel was very pleasant & great! You were able to give us a very early check-in! And from all our hearts we want to thank you! 
However, there were a couple of things that I wanted to point out:
1) The girl at the reception said that parking in your partnering garage facility was $35 flat fee. But she DIDN'T say that this was the price for only 24 hours. I asked if there was any stamp/ticket/validation for the parking garage to ensure they know we're staying at your hotel. The girl said that there was nothing special and we should tell the garage that we're staying at your hotel & if they doubt that, they will just call the hotel. We came to the garage to find out our that we needed a validation from the hotel. I walked back and the new girl placed a sticker on our parking receipt (different girl at the reception). I went back to the garage & were told that price for parking doubled, even though we were only 1.5 hours over the 24-hour mark & had to pay $70 because the girl didn't tell us anything about that. That was supper disappointing for our walet. 

2) The same girl at the reception told us that breakfast lasted till 10 am when we arrived. I asked if that was the end time all the time. She said 'Yes'. We woke up this morning & went downstairs at around 9.30 & discovered that breakfast is till 9 am on weekdays & 10 am on weekends. Again, the girl provided the wrong information & that was not what we paid for. Also, there were other people that went downstairs to ask why the breakfast was almost gone & I explained what happened (in from of the reception). They too, were told that breakfast lasted till 10.00 am & were shocked that it was over. 

So we missed the breakfast & paid double for the parking. The reason why I wanted to stay at your hotel is because the price was great, convenient location for us, good price for parking & free breakfast.
All above went downhill except for the location.

I never complain about microscopic things, but when something hits our wallet or we don't get what we paid for, then I bring such things up."

There.

title: Great place to stay
text: Great and quiet place with a spacious room. Excellent location with a great breakfast. Staff was very friendly and welcoming. Tube station very close nearby. Madison Square Garden just around the corner.

title: We found a gem
text:
Hotel is in a great location if you want to explore NYC -- two different subway stops within a block either way, and very walk-able to all midtown locations.

Room was New York small, but nice. Bed remarkably comfortable. And breakfast provided - which surprised us in midtown New York at this amazing price.

What stood out most was the staff --- very friendly and welcoming to a person. Housekeeping, breakfast attendees, front desk, everyone.  In particular, Trisha (front desk) was wonderful - greeting us by name and as though we had be acquainted for years, offering assistance, making transportation arrangements, and providing recommendations.  Will definitely return to this hotel.

title: Comfy, Clean, and Reasonable!
text: Great hotel in Chelsea that is pretty close to the Flatiron District with lots of great restaurants. During the daylight hours the streets outside this place were lined with beautiful plants of all kinds- even in the middle of January.  I was happily surprised at how neat and clean the rooms were and the bed was very comfortable. They have a roof deck that anyone can use and a good gym. Really enjoyed my time here.

title: Centrally located good value hotel
text:
Stayed her for 4 nights in the last week of January.  Booked directly via hotel.

Pros
-Close to two subway lines. Convenient location
-Safe neighbourhood 
-Breakfast included (yogurt, cereal, fruit, egg, sausage patties, muffin, juice, coffee and make your own waffle) it's not the highest standard but when it's included with your stay, it's very good) Staff seems to be working hard to replenish the items
-Coffee tea available 24/7 at lobby 
-Room and property well maintained and clean
-Fast elevator
-Sufficient wifi
-enough hot water for showers, no pressure issues
-Microwave available in the breakfast room
-Overall good value for the price. Will come again 

Cons
-Small room but it's standard for New York size. It's still comfortable for 2 adults 
-No in room safe but they have one at the lobby for guests
-No natural light in my room as I am facing other apartment buildings
-Small sink so if you are a woman and need to do make up, there is no counter space. No natural light also and light is dim in the bathroom. See picture for sink
-breakfast room not environmentally friendly as they use disposable utensils and plates
-I had an issue with my bathroom and it was not taken care of until I escalated it to management. They took care of it to my satisfaction after it was escalated.

Tips:
-Taxi ride to LGA airport was $37 including toll (2pm weekday) Tips extra
-From LGA to hotel was $45 plus tips (11 am Saturday)
-Hotel offers shuttle of $22.5 per person for airport transfer
-Pre-ordered towncar service for $60 one way to LGA
-I got a corner room and it was smaller than the two rooms in the middle (picture attached of the floor plan of my floor).

title: Decent, clean, affordable hotel in the Flower District
text: Recently stayed here for one night on business. Hotel is small, but clean. My room did have an odd, pungent chemical smell which I attributed to cleaning products (although it smelled uncomfortably close to very strong body odor). My room was otherwise clean with no issues. The hotel is reasonably quiet for New York - although I could hear people in the hallway and those above me. Breakfast was complimentary, and very basic. Scrambled eggs, some sort of weird sausage patty, English muffins, pastries. If you're trying to eat healthy, this is not where I would plan to eat, as I struggled to find the right mix. Many other Fairfield/Courtyards offer spinach, turkey and other healthy foods - not this one. They did offer soy milk, which I thought was a nice touch. The gym was small - two treadmills, one elliptical and one bike. Ther was one weight bench. At peak hours, it got packed - and a bit contentious about space and who had the weights first, etc. I appreciate the hotel for offering a fitness room, but given the amount of rooms in the hotel, they desperately need to expand the facilities. I liked the staff - all were kind and friendly - and the location was very good for walking around the city. I'd stay here again - just with certain expectations, and I'd probably go elsewhere for breakfast.

title: Good Location, Clean, Tiny Room...
text:
In October of 2016, a colleague and I had a business trip to NYC. Our first time there. We selected this hotel due to it's location in Manhattan. Yes, it was expensive, but not as expensive as some other hotels 'closer to the the action'. 

Our room had two double beds and full bath. The room itself was tiny that's for sure. But it was clean so we couldn't complain.

The hotel seems to be around the flower/florist district. Lots of these similar shops in the area. 

The front desk staff was friendly and helpful, and always with a smile. You are a short walk (100') from 6th Ave so it's relatively easy to catch a taxi. From this location, the taxi rides aren't too costly (depending of course on where you are going). Plus there are many areas that you can get to by simply walking from here too.

On my next trip to NYC, would I stay here again? Possibly. I have no complaints really. If the price is right and it suits my location needs, yes, I'd stay again.

title: Bom custo benefício
text: O hotel é mediano em tudo: conforto, limpeza, café da manhã. Os quartos são pequenos, mas não minúsculos. O café da manhã poderia ter mais variedade. Sempre as mesmas coisas: ovos, hamburgues, pães, cereais. Pouquissima variedade de frutas e bacon so teve em dois dias (fiquei 7 dias hospedada). A localização é muito boa. O chuveiro muito bom também, contudo as tolhas são pequenas e pouco macias. A arrumação do quarto era bem superficial. Li sobre falta de lugares para tomar café da manhã, mas em todos os dias achei lugares disponiveis e tomei meu café tranquilamente. No período em que fiquei hospedada, haviam obras nas ruas, fiquei receosa quanto ao barulho, mas felizmente, não tive problemas com isso. Acredito que as janelas sejam anti-ruído. As cortinas deixam o quarto bem escurinho, uma delicia para dormir. O ar condicionado é bastante barulhento, mas como chegava tão cansada da rua, não tive problemas para dormir. Uma desvantagem é não ter serviço de restaurante no hotel. Precisei ficar no hotel devido ao tempo ruim e por conta disso, também fiquei sem almoço e sem jantar, me obrigando a sair posteriormente para comprar comida.

title: Good clean hotel at reasonable price
text:
I spent Thurs-Sunday night there while visiting my daughter who is in NYC for work for about a month.   Room was very small  (it is NYC) but it was quiet, clean and comfortable, wifi worked well, and shower had lots of hot water.  Rooftop terrace is nice.  

Staff was friendly and helpful. Breakfast room is small but I could always sit down (I get up early) and they never ran out of coffee. 

Pretty convenient location.  It is a Fairfield Inn, not a Four Seasons.   You probably can't do any better for $110/night within walking distance of midtown Manhattan.

title: Very good location but very bad front desk communication between shifts
text:
We have booked this room in advance for New Year's Eve.
Arriving at the hotel the gentleman who welcomed us was very nice giving us the hours of breakfast and the WiFi password.
We have booked a room with a view,they gave us a room on the 7th floor,good location of the room,small for the criteria of the American size of rooms with a small bathroom.
We spend 12 nights and from the 3rd night we saw that the cleaning service was awful.They didn't vacuum the room(not even at the main hallway of the elevators),the cleaning lady only changed us towels and never took care of cleaning the bathroom properly.The room was never dusted and I myself had to do the job,which is unacceptable(I was there for vacation),OMG. From the moment we saw this fact I immediately went down to the front desk to clarify the issue,they told me they will notify the cleaning service,but nothing was done,until our departure.Next day I went back again,zero response to our  request.Shall I say more when you are paying an amount of money for a hotel???Every day we had the same problem and nobody took care of it.Ohh and sheets are change every three days.
Breakfast area was small for the amount of guests they have but the service during breakfast was very good.
The only plus is the location,where you can easily walk to Times Square  in 5 minutes and 3 minutes from Macy's. 
Oh a little hint for those who will probably book in the next 6 months from now...a building is under construction just in front of the hotel so the lower level rooms(like 7th floor)will not have a view to the Empire State Building.
Next time I will definitely book in another Marriott...

title: Construction?!!!!!!!!!! Don't stay here if you want to sleep in after 6 am!
text:
My sister's families from Delaware and my mom came in from Asia; happy to book the hotel under friends' recommendation.

They checked in Friday; were never informed that weekend construction will start (at 6AM!!!) until their arrival.

Never again.

title: Decent hotel, good location, still disappointing
text:
The Fairfield Inn is located in an up-and-coming area of NYC with lots of restaurants and is within a short walking distance from Penn Station. Rooms are nicely furnished and spacious, with decent bathrooms. I stayed at high floor rooms and there was little street noise. Still, spending $350/night at times at this location gives you pause and raises expectations.

I normally ignore reviewers who report one-time mishaps. Crap happens. But having spent more than a day every week in a hotel this year, I finally 'won' this dubious raffle at this Fairfield Inn: 
I woke up in the morning with no water, never mind hot water, in my room.
Luckily I did not have any customer meetings that day, but it is unimaginable to arrive unshaven and unwashed to a meeting? The disruption is dramatic.
Nonetheless, the hotel staff knew of the issue and offered no remedy whatsoever. No 'go to hotel X to shower'. Barely an apology. My call to Marriott's customer service led to a 10,000 point credit. Underwhelming. The fact that there was no response or thought was striking and really disappointing.

So yes, this is a single instance, just one time when this happened to me. Nonetheless, I am never coming back to this hotel. Lots of other Marriott hotels in NYC. I'd avoid this one.

title: Great stay
text:
Stayed here for 4 nights and really enjoyed it. Excellent location and a nice room which had a good bed and nice bathroom.
Not worth the price that we paid but thats new york at new years. 
Only negatives would be the breakfast area is too small and the wait for breakfast is too long. 
Overall i really enjoyed my stay though.

title: Extremely overpriced
text: Overall we had a good stay! One star was removed as it cost us $1800 Aus for just 5 nights! The room is equivalent to a 2 star Australian hotel room that you can get for $80 a night back home so it was very shocking to see that price, knowing it is New York and is very expensive to stay here we expected the price we just expected a more modern room for the price. Otherwise the room was the size we expected for NYC, just couldn't believe the price, however we did stay for new year, hence the price increase. Breakfast is included, all the hot food was always cold and coffee and tea are meant to be provided all day however they are always empty. Everyday we came and stocked up the tea, creamers, and sugars and cups from the cabinets below as they were ALWAYS empty, and had to constantly ask for coffee and hot water to be refilled which took them 20 minutes so we never bothered to wait. They provide coffee in the room however only provide ONE coffee pod of regular coffee a day (we have 2 people in our room) we asked twice for more coffee to be brought up to our room because the machines downstairs were always empty and we were on the 15th floor and the elevator takes 20 years to come, however the coffee pods never showed so we never had access to the complimentary coffee at all times that we were meant to have. That was disappointing, we thought the service would be better than that and that if you ask for coffee pods they should be brought up, but nope! Otherwise we greatly enjoyed our stay in NYC for new year, however we stayed in 2 different New York hotels (both by Marriott) and the other one was way cheaper and wayyyy newer so definitely wouldn't return to this Chelsea location during our next stay.

title: No Frills in New York City; (almost) everything works...except the heat.
text:
Aesthetically there is nothing wrong with this hotel.  It was clean, and (almost) everything functioned as it was supposed to.

We checked in on New Year's day, 2017.  The front desk clerk was not overly helpful and we did arrive about an hour before regular check in time of 4:00 (which seems like an excessively late check-in time).  They held our bags, but, I would suggest watching them because our bags almost got carried out with other bags that they had just pulled out of storage.  That there-in seems to be the biggest problem with this hotel.  The staff does not have any way of doing anything in an organized manner.

Supposedly there was 24 hour complementary coffee available, but, every time I went to get a regular coffee it was completely empty.  Likewise, the breakfast buffet had no one to ask or assist and they were out of everything an hour before it was supposed to shut down (and again out of coffee #@%#^$).  Luckily there was a Gregory's coffee close by that satisfied my morning caffeine craving :)

When we finally got to our room it was freezing.  I turned on the heat and the heater only blew cold air; I checked and made sure that the thermostat was set to heat and it was, but, it still just kept blowing cold air unless I turned it all the way up to 78 degrees and then it got so hot you couldn't stand it, but, anything less than 78 and there was no warm air.  

In general I can't say that I wasn't pleased with the stay.  It offered the amenities that we wanted with no frills that we needed while in NYC.  I just think the staff needs to organize, focus on giving guests a superb experience, and also respond with solutions and not just road-blocks to why something can't happen (like:  I'm sorry our handyman has already left for the evening and leaving it at that -- ummm...how about offering a room change when the heat doesn't work in January?).

title: christmas and new year in New York Citu
text:
we stayed here after a through hotel search and fiund out for best price for most appropriate location for shopping time square Broadway shows relatively more quite and several other factors.

we were very pleased with our choice here where entire hotel people were extremely friendly and rooms were always very clean without an error. we stayed at elit level but found rooms to be on the a bit smaller but we knew that extra room would have cone at a significant extra cost

we were happy with our stay so i recommend everyone

title: Outstanding
text: First trip to New York, great place to stay, super courteous and nice. Only a short stay but would recommend to anyone. Great staff and close to the subway. Only a 20 minute walk to times square and just a block from pharmacy.

title: Excellent Service
text:
The staff was exceptional! The staff went beyond our expectations to make our stay in NYC enjoyable. Will gladly use this hotel again!
Having a quality breakfast each morning was easy on the finances in the city!

title: Great location
text: I had a great stay recently.  The hotel is just outside of mid-town in Chelsea.  There are several decent restaurants close by.  The room is pretty modern, small, and clean.  I was a little worried by construction site across the street but sleep quality was very good during my stay.  Room charge was very reasonable for Manhattan and included complementary wi-fi.  Staff were friendly upon check in and check out.

title: Excellent Chelsea/Mid-town location!
text: We were in the city for a long weekend following a professional conference. The location on 28th street was perfect. It's tucked just far enough away from the more congested areas of mid-town that it was quiet, but close enough that we walked almost everywhere. A pretty easy walk up to 34th street to/from Penn Station. The staff was very friendly and efficient. The breakfast can get a little crowded if the hotel if full - especially between 8 and 9 a.m. There is a wonderful rooftop deck o the 27th floor that looks directly onto the Empire State Building.

title: Далековато
text: Станция метро близко. Она вам и в помощь, так добираться до всего на свете придется на этом виде транспорта. Имеется интернет. В целом, чисто, но тесновато. На последних этажах, конечно, открывается шикарный вид

title: Horrible Customer Service
text: We arrived to the hotel and upon check-in we were told the room/floor we were promised over the phone that morning was no longer available. When my husband asked what happened, we were told that since we were using points and not cash for our entire stay - they put cash paying customers ahead of everyone else, regardless of how long you are staying. We asked to speak with a manager, and she finally came out 15-20 minutes later. My husband asked why a phone call hadn't been made when they realized they weren't putting us in our promised room, he was told it wasn't top priority for them to follow up with customers.  It literally ruined our entire time here. When you check into a Marriott hotel (especially when you are an Elite customer) you expect to be treated with respect and courtesy - we received neither. The manager said "she would take of us", but we have yet to here from her. We have been here for 6 days and leave tomorrow. I would not recommend this hotel and we will be following up with corporate about this after we return home.

title: Confortável,muito bem localizado
text: Esse hotel possui uma excelente localização ,perto de metrô e da Times Square.Hotel novo e confortável,bom café da manhã e staff atencioso.Tem café ,chá e chocolate na recepção o dia todo!Além de cafeteira no quarto o que faz meu nível de satisfação aumentar imensamente.Recomendo!Pricipalmente se tiver programação no Madison Square Garden,fica na esquina!!!

title: What an Extraordinary Find!
text: What a great accommodations find in the heart of Chelsea that is rather reasonably priced, has an awesome welcoming and attentive front desk staff, and serves a bountiful breakfast with a rich assortment (I realize it is standard variety of food at places like Fairfield) in an inviting bright space.  Look forward to returning and venturing upstairs to what looks to be a phenomenal rooftop.

title: Girls weekend
text:
I really enjoyed our stay at this centrally located hotel. We didn't spend much time in our room but the hotel was very clean. Small room but standard for NYC. The breakfast was very good for inclusive breakfast standards. (Scrambled eggs and bacon, oatmeal , yogurt and fresh fruit).

The location is in the floral district. So refreshing to walk out of the hotel and be surrounded by fresh flowers.
The subway station is very close. The value is very good especially if you don't plan to stay in the room much. Will be staying here the next NYC visit!!

title: Great location, clean rooms, friendly staff
text:
Fantastic location - Close to Chelsea Markets, Flat Iron District, subway stops etc.  
The staff were very helpful, from the moment we checked in to the moment we left, they were quick to answer any questions and did so in a professional and friendly manner.

The rooms are small - but you're not in NYC to stay your room!  They are clean, beds are comfortable, and ours was fairly quiet.  There was no real view from the room, however the rooftop offers an excellent view of the Empire State building, and a couple of blocks away is "230 fifth" - a rooftop bar with an amazing skyline view. It's heated and has 'igloos' on the top so it's accessible even in the winter months.

We tried to do breakfast during our 4 day stay, but it was too busy, and not stocked well enough to account for the influx of people.  We arrived most days between 730 and 8 - so perhaps this is a busier time period?  you aren't short of choice in the area anyways, and most mornings we ended up at Tobys Estate near the flat iron building.

I would definitely recommend staying here.

title: Thanksgiving
text: Excellent location for getting around.  Double room was small, but very nice and clean.  Breakfast was a nice start to the day, but get down early.  Area is very quiet and close to subway, which is a big plus.

title: Great Business Location
text:
A nice Fairfield Inn, conveniently located on 28th between Sixth & Seventh Aves.  No restaurant/Bar but a good breakfast area that is included.  Several local restaurants are within walking distance.  Mustang Harry's is at the end of the block on 7th.  Clean, consistent housekeeping.  Free Wi-Fi throughout the building.  Nice breakfast offerings or hot & cold items.
The staff is typical Marriott in addressing any concerns or problems.  I needed a new TV installed and it was done before I returned for the day.  Good cable selections.

title: Great Value and Location
text: I really like this hotel. With a complimentary breakfast and comfortable bed, it was a great place to stay for a couple of getaway nights in NYC. Since it was within walking distance of Penn Station I didn't have to pay for a taxi.  Front desk staff is very friendly and welcoming.  Some caution:  I walked right past this place on the other side of the street because it is next to a garden center and its shrubs obscured its sign and I didn't realize I had passed it until a block later.  Most buildings on the street don't have street numbers on their front.  Also, the earlier you can get to breakfast the better.  It gets really, really crowded and the staff has some difficulty keeping up with the demand.  Also, I was surprised when the housekeeping staff removed my personal water bottle from the desk in my room, something I was using during my travels.  And the hvac in my room blows air right over the bed, which was uncomfortable until I fell asleep. But the view of the Empire State Building from my room at night was awesome. Overall, the place was very clean and updated and if you don't mind these inconveniences, it is going to be a great place to stay.

title: Loistava sijainti ja erinomainen aamupala
text: Siistit huoneet ja aamupala ylitti odotukset, hyvä kahvi. Välittömässä läheisyydessä penn Station metroasema, macy's sekä madison square Garden. Helposti kävelee times squarelle. Hyvää vastinetta rahalle.

title: Location
text:
Great location , friendly staff , decent breakfast .  Rooms are small and bathroom is even tinier .    The cleaning staff was mediocre .
Must see - rooftop deck .  Beautiful view of the Empire State Building and the old Met bldg

title: Perfect getaway!
text:
The beds were perfect to get a much needed rest, the staff was amazingly helpful, this was close to everything we needed. 
The view was amazing, everything was just perfect, I couldn't find one thing wrong with this hotel except I had to wait an entire minute or two for the elevator, but that is the only "bad" thing I could come up with so that makes this an excellent hotel to stay!

title: Great value in the Chelsea distrcit
text: I enjoyed every minute of my stay at this hotel. We asked for early check in and when we arrived, I was very happy that in fact the roon was ready, The room was clean and perfect for a NYC hotel.Our room (4th Floor) had a perfect view of the Empire State Building. Close to Penn Station and Madison Square Garden, which was the reason we were in NYC. The staff was great and always willing to help,

title: Excellent Pick for Chelsea
text: I really enjoyed my (quick) stay at the Fairfield Inn & Suites. It was a short walk from Penn Station and conveniently located in Chelsea. The staff was friendly and my room was immaculate upon check-in. I was able to get a good night's sleep and look forward to staying here again.

title: BON HOTEL
text: Hyper bien situé près de l 'empire STATE BUILDING, chambre petite mais propreté TOP ainsi que petit déjeuner, situé à la 6éme avenue nous avons tout fait à pied. On recommande vraiment cet hotel vu son emplacement et la sympathie de l 'accueil.

title: Great place to stay
text: I have stayed here 14 times in last 3 years when we visit our son who lives in Chelsea.   Rooms are always clean and they do a great job trying to accommodate early arrivals.  Breakfast is good.  It is within walking distance to many of the popular tourist sites and restaurants.   We do not even consider staying anywhere else. City view rooms have an awesome view of the Empire State Building.

title: Great value in Chelsea
text: I've had all types of hotel stays in Manhattan from very good to very bad and you typically get what you pay for.  This Fairfield location was outside the norm.  The rooms were a good size for NY, and I was impressed that they were well appointed and looked like they were new.  Breakfast was great and it was a bonus that my meetings were only a couple of blocks away.  This hotel may become my go-to when in Chelsea.  Clean, quiet, easy to get around, all winners in my book!

title: Wonderful experience all around
text:
We stayed at the Fairfield Inn & Suites for a night while in the city and it was a wonderful experience! The staff was very friendly, especially the guard and woman at the front desk. They have complimentary breakfast where you can make your own waffles and it had the basics (eggs, bacon, bananas, yogurt, cereal, waffles) plus 24/7 Starbucks coffee and tea available. We had to print out tickets for a Knicks game and they have a free computer and printer as well! Plus, the location is just half a mile from Madison Square Garden, about 25 minute walk from Times Square and there are tons of great restaurants near by. 

When you go, make sure you grab some coffee and head up to the rooftop. They have a great patio with chairs and couches out there where you get a beautiful view of the skyline at night! We'll definitely stay there again.

title: Posizionato bene
text:
Vicino alla metro, in dieci minuti si e' Times Square.
Reception praticamente sulle scale, con personale gentile e disponibile.
Stanze minuscole, non si sa dove mettere le valigie.
Colazione sufficiente, ma occhio a non arrivare dopo le nove e trenta, rischiate di non trovare piu' cibo, e se lo chiedete vi sentirete rispondere semplicemente che e' finito!

title: Perfect Location (with fresh flowers daily!)
text: This was our second time to stay at the Fairfield on 28th. Since last year they have upgraded all the décor in the hotel and the rooms. The Pent House Roof was a welcomed surprise. Great view. The hotel is located in the flower district. Wholesale and retail florists everywhere. Great fragrances and what a wonderful site. Close to many nice restaurants on 6th Ave...and lots of good shopping within 2 blocks.The hotel rates are good and the staff is excellent as well a bilingual. We will continue to stay here on all our future visits.

title: A peaceful locale but centrally located
text: This first visit was amazing. The room was comfortable and very clean. Hotel management went out of the way to make us feel cared for, especially the manager, Kevin, who gave his personal phone number and encouraged us to call if anything came up while we were out and about. He also gave great suggestions about the special features of the hotel (roof top lounge area with fantastic view of Empire State Building) and eagerly answered any questions we had even if they were out of the ordinary. This was a great location and an interesting close-to-everything spot. Outstanding service was its hallmark.

title: Excelente opcion
text:
La situación del hotel es excelente para moverse por NY andando y con el metro muy cerca.
Muy buena relación calidad-precio. Habitaciones de tamaño suficiente al igual que el baño. Estaban limpias y con una cama grande. Nosotros las teníamos con vistas al Empire State y merece la pena, aunque hay algo de ruido por una obra cercana.
El desayuno es aceptable aunque con poca variedad.
El trato del personal muy bueno. La mayoría habla español y siempre dispuestos a ayudar.
Tiene una terraza en el último piso que es un gustazo para tomar algo y disfrutar del Empire.

title: New, Clean, and good location
text: This hotel is located near the Empire State Bldg. and you can see it from the front of the hotel, especially at night when it is lit up.  The hotel is new inside and very clean with a free breakfast that is quite good and has very good staff.  The rooms are small as usual for NYC but it has all you need.  Hotel has fitness center also.  Subway on corner of 28th.  It is in the flower district so flowers line the sidewalk in front of the hotel every day.

title: A Room With a View
text: This hotel is in a very convenient location. It is walking distance from Penn Station ,Madison Square Garden, and Koreatown for great restaurants. It is on a lovely street in the Flower District,seasonal flowers and trees lining the sidewalks in front of shops. The rooms are fine,a  standard free breakfast, and very friendly and helpful front desk staff and room cleaners. Perhaps the best feature is the Awsome rooftop patio with a view of the Empire State Building. We will definitely stay here again!

title: Great service and location
text: The staff was pro-active in providing help for car service, other transportation, directions, restaurants among other items and also followed up to see if you were satisfied. The front office manager, Kerwin Francis, and staff checked to make sure the other services provided were satisfactory, such as breakfast, clean rooms, 24/7 coffee.

title: Great staff, Great location, Great value
text:
Whenever we need a hotel in New York, I call the Fairfield Inn & Suites Chelsea.  I have sent many colleagues and groups here in the past few years.  They never let us down.  All the staff go above and beyond to make their customers comfortable.  On our most recent visit, Keisara and Kevin, Front Desk, were fantastic - so kind and helpful.
Thank you to all at Fairfield Inn & Suites.

title: Great location
text:
We stayed here for three nights during a visit with our daughter.  The location is close to Penn Station, an easy walk even pulling a suitcase.  Also close to subway stations.  It is in the Chelsea neighborhood, flower district.  When you come out of the hotel gorgeous flowers lined the streets!  
We were in room #1701.  Small but typical for NYC.  The lighting wasn't great, especially in the bathroom.  Difficult to put makeup on in that light.  And very little space around the sink area to set anything down. The bed was very comfortable.
Every staff member that we encountered was extremely friendly!  Nice to see in a city that can be very unfriendly.  I do wish they had told us that "PH" was not the penthouse floor.  It was a rooftop patio!  We would have enjoyed it during our visit if we had know before our last night there (found out from a young guy in the elevator).
typical continental breakfast, just ok, but lots of choices.  
The only issue we had was being given a bath towel full of holes.  I was surprised housekeeping even hung it because the holes were noticeable.  I took it to the front desk upon checkout and they said they would give us some extra rewards points.  I'm sure they will show up on our account soon.

title: one star at first but becomes better
text: when we got there the outside looked very good. when we got inside i started to fell less exited about the inside. when we got to our room the room was very cramped. there where two of the smallest beds i ever seen. there where a small tv and that was about it. also the smell of the room gave me a terrible cough. after that though, it got better. the smell cleared off and the bed felt better. after the night was over it was up from a 2 star to a 3.

title: Great Location, Great Staff, Great Hotel
text:
I have been traveling to NYC for work/leisure for the past 9 months. Initially I hopped around from a few different hotels before coming across this one. Since then I stayed exclusively at this hotel for roughly 6months straight. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful. NYC can be an expensive city so having breakfast included is a great way to keep expenses down and something that should not be overlooked. Additionally the location is great. You can walk to MSG, Penn Station, Times square, Empire State building, etc. While all these locations and more are walkable you don't have to deal with the massive crowds/congestion of times square at this location. There are plenty of great restaurants within walking distance. Additionally the proximity to Penn Station makes taking the LIRR to JFK extremely easy and makes planning trips to the airport without the worry of traffic.

The rooms themselves are not massive but they are clean and accommodating and I had no problems with my oversized luggage bags fitting. Additionally if you plan to visit NYC and desire to spend the majority of your time in any hotel room then you need to reevaluate why you are visiting NYC.

I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone planning to visit NYC for a brief or extended stay.

title: AWFULLY CRAMPED
text: Positives first. Great bed and shower. Important but that's it. We had room 201. Very cramped with lots of faulty equipment. We booked 4 nights but moved on after one. Breakfast room is nice but poor quality items. I can't stand plastic cutlery and cardboard plates. It's got to be cheaper washing proper plates. There is construction going on outside and the building noise is constant. Were happy to leave. The picture is the view from our window.

title: Super beliggenhed.
text:
Vi var 4 veninder der boede på samme værelse. Lille værelse med 2 ikke særlig brede senge. Aircondition var placeret under vinduet lige ved den ene seng, så vi var ved at blæse ned af sengen. Det var også det eneste negative ved dette hotel.
Lækker morgenmad, skøn tagterasse med udsigt til Empire state building. Hjælpsomt og venligt personale. Blomsterforretninger på begge sider af indgangen, skøn duft.
Gåafstand til de fleste seværdigheder. 10 min. Gang til Penn station, hvor man ankommer til fra Newark airport. Kan anbefale dette hotel.

title: Disappointing
text:
I like Marriott hotels and generally I write good reviews but I was disappointed in this one BUT it's not down to the staff who were polite, it was down to what is happening around the hotel,.
Firstly , arriving at the hotel the pavement is blocked by what is becoming a giant garden centre, the shops spilling out onto the street and constant blocking of pedestrians and for me arriving with a suitcase it was ridiculous, not sure why it is allowed, the plants were really nice but not when they are blocking your path, the vendors are constantly sweeping up and carting great big bushes around. Now, if you have allergies or the bugs like you that's a second problem, so use insect repellant and have your allergy tables on hand, mainly pine , conifer if it bothers you. 
I had a great view of the Empire State Building, unfortunately between us was a building site, well a few in fact, opposite side of the road, and at the moment they are putting in the piles for the foundation. What that means is an excavator ramming in rods into the ground with a huge hammer, pretty much every 2 seconds and seemed to last all day (including Saturday) so dont ask for the view if you want to relax. 
The hotel is constantly getting cleaned which is good, if you don't want to climb over bags of rubbish ask for a room away from the lift, ( the lift also makes a noise like trainers on a squash court when it goes past you floor)
Finally, papers plates and plastic spoons and forks,paper cups for coffee for breakfast, bizarre 
Not for me, sorry not a Marriott

title: Good for a short stay
text: We were attending an event at MSG & needed a place to stay just for the night. The price was decent & it was close enough to walk to & from. There were 4 of us that stayed in a room. 2 adults & 2 children. This had to be one of the smallest rooms I've ever stayed in while visiting NYC. There was barely enough room to set our bags on the floor without getting in the way. It was clean which is PRIORITY. The bathroom was tiny & the shower curtain wasn't long enough causing water to get all over the floor. There is a breakfast included & I was pleasantly surprised in the variety of food provided. Scarmbled eggs, potatoes, sausage, muffins, bread for toasting, yogurt, fruit, hard boiled eggs, oatmeal and make your own waffles along with Starbucks coffe, tea, milk & juices. Not too many tables in the dining area but we arrived early enough to get seating. All in all, it was ok. We were in the hotel less than 24 hours. Probably wouldn't stay again only due to general location as we had to take the subway everywhere the next day. We would rather walk.

title: Estadía corta
text: El hotel está localizado en una zona muy céntrica y privilegiada. El personal está muy bien preparado, en especial la recepcionista Teresa quien con un trato personalizado estuvo atenta a cada segundo para asegurar que todos estuviésemos a gusto. Ella realmente fue la que nos hizo sentir bienvenidos a Nueva York.

title: Location Location & Incredible Award Winning Staff at Fairfield Inn & Suites Manhatten/ Chelsea
text:
I stayed at the hotel last week, commencing Sept 1st, from the moment we arrived the staff were just incredibly friendly, I mean each & every staff member. They are a credit to the Marriott Group. The rooms are small, the breakfast choice is excellent. Free Starbucks tea & coffee all day with delicious cookies in the afternoon.
From the moment we arrived Ashlei and all of the staff were just incredible, they could not do enough for us, they are undoubtedly the most pleasant & friendly people that I have ever met in any hotel worldwide.
They never let us pass by the reception without wishing us a good day etc, the staff that looked after the dining room & the staff that do the house keeping are the best ever. We felt at home, the penthouse lounge / seating area offers great views of the city. The location is great & within walking distance to all areas also served by subway & train at either end of the street. Restaurants & bar choice are excellent in the area. A gym is also available free of charge. 
Maceys two blocks down the street. P Harte.

title: Weekend Getaway
text: After Spending hours trying to find a reasonably priced hotel in NY during fashion week I found this little Gem!! No resort fees, good location. Close to transportation.  Check out was not until Noon.  Breakfast was included.  Nice bed Linens and comfortable bed. Rooms are clean and spacious.  This will be my 'go to' hotel in NY city.

title: I love Fairfield & Chelsea...
text:
L'hôtel est très bien situé au coeur de Manhattan, dans la pittoresque rue des fleuristes.
Nous avions une très grande chambre au 11ème étage avec une vue magique sur l'Empire State Building. 
Le personnel est convivial et efficace, y compris les femmes de chambre. 
Petit dej extra avec oeufs brouillés, porridge, gaufres maison, etc... 
A noter: 2 PC avec imprimantes en libre-service pour imprimer si besoin billets d'avion ou cartes d'embarquement.
Le prix est élevé quoique normal pour New-York. 
Il y avait des travaux dans la rue, donc pas mal de bruit malgré le double-vitrage mais l'hôtel n'y est pour rien...

title: Excelente situación y personal amable
text: No te das cuenta de lo bien situado que está el hotel hasta que llegas allí, con paradas de metro muy cerca y muchos negocios de todo tipo, además la calle se pone muy bonita por las mañanas ya que está llena de tiendas de plantas y flores. Comer una habitación con vistas merece la pena si es la primera vez que vas. El desayuno variado y buena calidad , excelente el bacon. Puedes encontrar a personal hablando español y eso facilita mucho. La única pega que puedo poner es el frío que hace en la zona de desayuno, pero eso es una tónica normal en los locales de Nueva York, ponen muy alto el aire acondicionado. Bonita terraza para comprarte algo de beber y disfrutar del empire state. Un detalle las botellas de agua de cortesía por parte del hotel

title: Inmejorable situación!
text: Hotel muy céntrico, Times Square a 5 minutos. Habitación de 2 king size beds, un poco justa para 3-4 personas y si tu estancia es para 6 noches. La verdad que mucho tiempo no pasas en el hotel.. Ruido la verdad que estabamos en la planta 12 y poco ruido. Limpieza diaria justa, y con moqueta. Desayuno incluido, pocos hoteles lo hacen por el mismo precio, la verdad que no varía y el comedor es un poco justo para tantas habitaciones, días con cola para acceder (max 10min) y te ofrecen poder subirte la bandeja a la habitación así reducir volumen para el comedor. Eso si, desayunos para madrugadores con el horario tan mañanero.

title: Expectacular!!
text:
Exelente ubicacion, super limpio y bonito. Elegante. Vista al Empire State desde la azotea.Tienen variedad para escoger que desayunar.
Servicio muy amable.
Siempre estaban sonrientes.
Puedes ir a a varios lugares de interes caminando.

title: Best service in a while
text:
Ashelel,
The receptionist check us in with a snap. She was very friendly and helpful. She was just what I  need.This was a escape from my children for just a day.The room was very nice.New York Style!  I'm in love with this place. You guys rock!

title: Excellent hotel and location
text: My family visited the hotel on our recent stay to New York and could not be happier! The housekeeper manager Amrita Bangari and her fantastic staff did a outstanding job in making sure our family was taken of from the clean hotel to the courteous and helpful staff along with the fantastic breakfast in the morning. Whenever we travel to New York we will always stay at this beautiful hotel. God bless you all

title: Great Stay in Chelsea
text: My family and I have stayed in the hotel for 3 nights.  Location is great, Walking distance to time square, Subway is few minutes away from the hotel.  I have a nice view of empire status building from my room.

title: Definitely will return
text:
Sometimes the staff makes up for any shortcomings of a hotel. We stayed on Saturday night.  Check in was fast and easy and greeted with a smile. Valet parking was $55 for the night but literally had 2 days of parking (that's important in NYC) the front desk even held our bags after checkout so we could eat lunch then return to pick up the car. Location of the hotel is great we were able to get to meatpacking district and midtown within minutes and being in the middle of the flower district was nice scenery as well. There is free starbucks coffee in the lobby ,free breakfast from 7am-10am (I love that this was a late breakfast I always wake up to late at other places that offered), and free bottled water if you ask the front desk. The rooms are clean and air condition is quiet and works well. Bathrooms are nice, good water pressure in the shower, hair dryer available and Paul Mitchell amenities. The staff at the front desk, housekeeping and maintenance are all so nice. We asked for late check out and they said yes without hesitation. 

Ok, now the shortcomings...but nothing that was not handled appropriately and with a smile. The toilet would not flush on 3 occasions and maintenance had to be called (not our fault...just flushing mechanism did not work). The second time called was in the morning and took over an hour to get someone to fix it. We did have a bit of a wait (30min+) when we called valet for the car but the front desk did notify us of the wait time prior. The room smelled musty when we first went in for about 15 minutes until the AC cleared itself (front desk offered to give us a new room without question but we declined as the smell went away). Breakfast does get crowded even though there is a good amount of seating- we ate in the lobby on the couches...perhaps they need more outdoor seating. The hair dryer might have been overheated as it got very very hot without a lot of air probably would have burned my hair so it was not used. 
In the end the front desk (each person from night shift to morning) was extremely kind and accomodating. They acknowledged the problems with the toilet and took care of us appropriately. 

I would definitely book this hotel again due to hospitality, location and the extremely comfortable bed.

title: Bello ma......
text:
La posizione dell'albergo è abbastanza comoda, vicina alla metropolitana e abbastanza centrale, le stanze sono silenziose e la colazione ok (è l'unico albergo con colazione a Manhattan!)..... Però le stanze sono davvero PICCOLISSIME e anche i letti queen size erano davvero minuscoli.... In una settimana abbiamo dormito in due in uno spazio al limite della decenza!!! La stanza era piena di valigie (ci fermiamo un mese negli USA..... Possiamo portare solo il bagaglio a mano???) e onestamente non so come facessero a pulire 🤔 .... 
Parliamo del bagno: in se' non era piccolissimo, ma la disposizione dei sanitari (con vasca da bagno!) era assurda e non consentiva di muoversi in modo funzionale; io sono piccola di statura, ma mio marito è alto e neanche lui riusciva a usare comodamente il lavabo, e addirittura la porta ne intralciava l'uso!!! La luce sullo specchio era buona... Peccato che lo specchio fosse a 1 metro di distanza da me..... Mi sono truccata a memoria!!!!
Ancora: noi avevamo una stanza senza vista, che affacciava su uno splendido cortile interno, distante 5-6 metri dal balcone di fronte. La luce che entrava dalla finestra era praticamente nulla...... E allora perché l'illuminazione nella stanza consisteva di un faretto sulla porta e una lampada da comodino???? Sembrava di stare in una tomba!!!!! LUCEEEEEE Please!!!!!
Ultima annotazione: appena fuori dell'albergo ci sono una quantità di negozi di fiori..... Bellissimo????? Mah..... A me personalmente dava fastidio dover cedere il passo agli altri, visto che i fiori occupavano TUTTO il marciapiede ad eccezione di una stretta striscia, appena sufficiente a camminare, ma con attenzione per non calpestarli...... Non credo che tornerò 😕

title: I look forward to returning.
text:
From the moment I was welcomed to check out, service at the front desk was excellent.  My room was clean, cool and comfortable. 

The only thing that was less than ideal was the breakfast. It was crowded, chaotic and not particularly clean and not enough places to sit. But the food -- once you got to it -- made for an easy start to the day.

I look forward to returning.

title: Located in the heart of the city
text:
Good option with affordable price in the heart of NYC, just few blocks away from Empire State Building. 

The hotel seems to be a little bit olde and the room is not so good but it's perfect if you will not spend so much time in the hotel.

There was some construction close to the hotel so the noise started everyday at 7am.

title: Little gem in the city
text:
I was deciding between staying at this hotel or another one at the Times Square.
Many reviewers say that it is noisy at the Times Square, so I chose the Fairfield Inn, a few streets away.  That turned out to be a wise decision.  It is within walking distance to many attractions, and yet far from the noise and lights at the TS.

This is a hotel in a small building.  I almost drove past it without realising it as the sign was small.

Counter staff was always friendly and smiling.  I am especially appreciative that they kept my GPS unit when I left it at the couch in the morning without realising it. I would have been very lost without it on checking out.

Breakfast was adequate, the eating area was interesting.  The ceiling was glass and that allowed plenty of sunlight through.

Room was small, the 2 double beds in the room were almost touching the opposite wall.  I suppose real estate space is expensive in NYC.

Bathroom was adequate and updated.  Most importantly, it was clean and well stocked. Water pressure was good, WC pressure was awesome!

Guests can access the highest floor to have a glimpse of the night lights around the hotel.

Check out was a breeze.

Only grouse with this place?  They limit free WIFI to only 3 devices.  That's really cruel in this day and age.

Oh, one other thing.  There is no onsite parking.  Parking is a short distance away.  Remember to get the ticket validated by the counter staff for a discount.

title: Average hotel in New York Midtown area
text:
I stayed here for 2 nights during a business trip. 

Pros:
Hotel is conveniently located, especially for tourists. 
Rooms are decent enough. 

Cons:
I find it expensive for the value of services. Base prices are expensive and on top of that those essential tax components. 
Hotel service staff are pretty average and indifferent. 
My room was extremely dark with only one light in the room near the main door. 
Breakfast is quite minimal (standard items in US hotels) and boring. 

Overall I'm not very impressed, but I believe this is what you get in NYC and US in general.

title: Lovely Hotel in Flower District, BUT Construction is 6 days starting at 7 AM THEY DON'T TELL YOU at Checkin
text:
Chose this hotel to try staying in the flower district.  Great prices so I splurged for a City View (should be a great view of the Empire State Bldg) on a high floor.  I am a Marriott Silver Rewards member which normally means something, but not to this hotel.  Was placed on 8th floor (of something like 20 floors, so not so high).  We arrived midafternoon, so we went up to our room to rest before going to an evening broadway show.  After resting 10 minutes, the construction noise started, and simply did not stop.  Looking outside, I could see the building that was being replaced, as they were scraping out the remaining foundation.  We left for our dinner and show, and contemplated our choices.  When we returned, it was pleasantly quiet.  The next morning, the noise started at 7 AM.  We couldn't sleep, so we went down for the free breakfast.  The place was packed - the 2 empty tables were desperately in need of cleaning, and half the food items were out.  The 1 lady working the area could hardly keep up with the demand.  I had 2 hard boiled eggs with a yogurt, a far cry from the promised scrambled eggs, made to order waffles, fresh fruit, etc.  So Not like the other Fairfields we've stayed at.
It was Friday, so we were hoping no construction on Sat morning.  We were wrong... I went down to talk to the manager, who hadn't shown up for his shift yet.  The lady at the desk promised to move us to a much higher floor, facing the back (so no construction noise), and refund us the upgrade price.  She said a room would be ready in a few hours, and they would move us.  We arrived back at the appointed time to find a) she was gone b) there was a new room, 4 floors up but still facing construction c) they would not refund anything.  No other options... so we took the higher floor and asked for earplugs.
When booking Marriotts, I've ofter seen hotels note there is construction going on, so customers can make an informed choice.  This was not the case.... would like to stay here again, but will call the hotel directly and ask!
Not great customer service, and given the missing manager who only pays to have 1 overworked staffperson in the breakfast area, I am hoping someone else is in that role next time I plan my stay.

title: flop house at best
text:
room not ready until after 7PM, kept stringing me along for 3 hours...entered room at 7:30 bed not made, towels on floor !!!! Complained to management upon return home. Voice mails, emails all unanswered. Had to elevate to corporate. Hotels response to corporate was (politely) inaccurate, VERY inaccurate.
Corporate needs to review this franchisee with greater scrutiny.
Poorly managed, little integrity.
Park bench possibly better

title: Sarebbe meglio non vendere certe camere per 4 persone!
text: Siamo stati in questo hotel 3 notti 2 adulti e 2 bimbi. La nostra camera era piccolissima, senza armadi, senza posto per mettere la valigia . Bagno mini dove a mala pena ci stava una persona , solo con vasca da bagno e tendina (bagno allagato dopo ogni doccia). Odore in camera di sporco , probabilmente la moquette . La colazione accettabile in un ambiente con aria condizionata fortissima ma ahimè questo è normale a New York . La nostra camera era senza vista quindi si vedeva il vecchio palazzo attaccato sul retro. Meno male che vai giusto la notte per dormire.

title: Horrible service, unprofessional staff
text:
We arrived to this hotel exhausted and hungry after a 6 1/2 hour drive from pittsburgh. Upon checkin we were rudely informed that there were no doubles and gave us a tiny King bed room. (All rooms, hallways, entrance and elevators are very small in this hotel) This was unacceptable for our family of 4 especially since our reservation was for 4 people. The front desk manager was rude, very dismissive and completely unhelpful. He refused to provide a refund, was very publicly nasty and inappropriate to both myself and my husband (Who is a Platinum Elite Marriott member!) However, he was more than gracious to a large wedding party who checked in after we did which we noticed while waiting over an hour for our car in the lobby. Maybe they needed our double room?
 In the past, staff has offered to open up other rooms or find something at another property or even help get our bags. None of this was offered and we had to make our own arrangements to the very accommodating Residence Inn Times Square. We had to transfer our bags and pay $56 for 1 1/2 hour of parking that was supposed to be validated by staff. There are many wonderful hotels in New York, this is DEFINITELY NOT one of them!

title: Decent Hotel
text: Price is right hotel team was friendly in the lobby and the free breakfast buffet was decent.  The hours for the rooftop bar are not very good and the bartender was incredibly rude.  Rooms are small but clean and quiet and the hotel is convenient to everything.  Not a bad stay for the price.  Just need to fix the hours of the best feature the hotel has so you can come back to the hotel and unwind on the roof with a cocktail and a friendly bartender.   Oh and restocking the cups in the room would have been nice too.  Hard to make coffee or drink water without them.

title: Felt unsafe
text: Facilities were decent. However we had a bizarre unsafe experience. Had repeated many Knocks at 1 am which kept intensifying. Finally asked and was told it was housekeeping with towels. Front desk was too quick to say it was some mixup. No apology from manager or call though I registered a complaint with Marriott customer service. Felt very fishy to have supposed housekeeping bang non stop in the middle of the night.

title: One heck of a team!
text: My friend and i decided to do a day visit into the city and couldnt have asked for a better place to stay. Everyone at the hotel was very nice and treated us like family. They helped us with everything from direction, places to eat, where the best deals where right down to fixing our poor feet after a long day of walking. I am so glad they were there to help us along our way especially Daniel. We hope to return very soon!

title: First time I've felt compelled to review a hotel!
text: Can't say enough great things about this little gem in ChelseaNYC-- it was so great, I'm compelled to offer my first TripAdvisor review, despite being a pretty frequent traveler. The hotel is ideally located near Penn Station, tons of restaurants, great NYC florists, subway stops, etc. I was thrilled to arrive and be the designated "guest of the day", with a complimentary upgrade to to the 18th floor (rm 1806). (...Proof that Marriott Rewards is worth signing up for.) The skyline view from this room, including a perfect angle on the Empire State Bldg, just can't be beat-- classic, charming NYC. I was taking pics from my window nonstop. If you need daytime sleep, there's some construction noise across the street, but it's not excessive & they were done by 5 pm during my stay. The front desk staff were always attentive, cordial, and quite helpful. My room (again, an upgrade) was a perfect size, the AC worked great (during a NYC heatwave), everything was impeccably clean and comfortable. The complimentary breakfast in the lobby is worth noting, as well-- nothing over the top, but perfect for my needs-- simple, but very tasty and fresh with various hot and cold items. This is simply a great, convenient hotel, such a terrific value -- incredibly clean & well-kept -- I will undoubtedly stay there again soon!

title: Excelente trato del personal. Destaco la gran atención del manager Kevin Cifuentes.
text:
Celebrabamos las bodas de plata y recibimos una felicitación de todo el personal y un detalle en la habitación (fue una gran sorpresa).
La habitación normal es pequeña para una familia de dos hijas mayores pero uno piensa que solo va al hotel al final del día a descansar.
Preciosa la terraza y un desayuno aceptable

title: Quick trip to the city
text:
We were able to check in early (at 2pm) which was great! The room was small but is not a surprise for a New York hotel. 

Free breakfast was included.

The bed is very comfortable and I love the huge windows.

The bathroom was a little too tight though.

They also can store your luggages after check out if you want to explore the city.

title: Hotel correct au calme.
text:
Proche de deux stations de métro qui malheureusement  ne sont pas des lignes principales, changements à prévoir. Dans un quartier calme (flowers district) avec commerces à proximité).
Personnel agréable et serviable.
Petit déjeuner compris et varié (salé et sucré). Boissons chaudes à disposition en chambre et dans la salle de petit déjeuner toute la journée.
Ordinateurs disponibles.
Terrasse sur le toit avec vue sur l'empire state building.
Chambre bien insonorisée mais petite pour notre cas (nous avons eu du mal à caser nos 3 valises (chambre pour 4 théoriquement!). Lits trop étroits pour deux personnes (2 lits doubles en théorie pour nous). Sinon la chambre est bien équipée (cafetière), cosy, salle de bain également: petite mais fonctionnelle.
Légère odeur d'humidité.

title: Great hotel in a very convenient location
text: Nice clean rooms. Staff very helpful. Ashley at the front desk was very helpful. Lina the Assistant Manager was very caring. Great options for breakfast. We walked practically everywhere -Times Square and everywhere in between! We'll be back!

title: Disappointing for us!
text:
My husband and I booked in for four nights to start off our US tour.  We arrived late after a long journey and the receptionist was pleasant, with check in being quite painless.  When we got to our room it was very small with dark furniture but the bed was comfortable although AC quite loud.
We had a search around for the safe and to our surprise couldn't find one.  On enquiring at reception we were informed that they had all gone and the best they could offer us was to leave our passports (but not cash and valuables) in the office!  
My husband was not comfortable (as have been burgled before) with this and decided after the first night we couldn't stay any longer. 
Reception staff had changed and two women were now in place but we found it very hard to attract their attention as they were engrossed in their conversations!  So after a few attempts we managed to inform them of our reasons that we would have to find alternative accommodation elsewhere.  We then were landed with a cancellation fee on top of the room rate of $280 for the one night!  Lesson learned that if these things are important to us, we will now double check before booking!  A plus though, breakfast was included and there was a nice selection of different foods in an area that was quite bright and airy.  There is a roof top area with seating.

title: Ottima posizione e buon rapporto qualità/prezzo
text: Posizione ottima per chi vuole visitare New York. A breve distanza fermate metro della linea arancione (BDFV) sulla 6aAv. e la linea gialla (NQRW) su Broadway. Buono il rapporto qualità prezzo, specie se si prenota con un certo anticipo. Colazione compresa con la stanza (non comune a NY), di qualità soddisfacente. Forse lo spazio della sala colazione può sembrare insufficiente in determinati orari, ma il flusso è abbastanza rapido. Le camere sono silenziose, anche ai piani bassi. Fruibile e piacevole il terrazzo all'ultimo piano, con vista sull'Empire State Building.

title: Hotel is fine, there are some challenges
text:
My colleague and I traveled on business for two nights. We chose the Fairfield because it was cheaper than other options and it's proximity to our clients. 

The rooms were standard New York size, so they were on the smaller side but I was pleased with the amount of vanity space in the bathroom and it had the desk and coffee that I needed. My colleague said the A/C in her room sounded like a jet taking off but mine wasn't that loud. 

On the hotel itself, the front desk staff were very friendly. However, the lobby bathroom has a leak under the toilet and was dirty and smelled when I visited. Also, I went down to the lobby to get hot water and water and neither were available. There were two empty water pitchers sitting there. 

The most challenging bit about the hotel was getting a car in front of it. The street is so congested with construction that it is down to one lane. Be prepared to move down to Avenue of the Americas if you need a car. 

It was a fine stay but I think I will look at a different property for my next trip to NYC.

title: Highly Recommend
text: Stayed for one week at this fantastic hotel in a great location.  Located in the flower district.  Short walking distance to Penn Station, Empire State Building, Macy's, Madison Square Garden and so much more!  Located a very short walking distance to subway lines that take you all over the city.  The hotel lobby and breakfast area were very clean, as was the room.  Staff was attentive, extremely friendly and always eager to please.  We had a few minor issues with the room:  a slow draining bathroom sink and a phone that did not work.  Both issues were taken care of promptly.  The morning breakfast was great with a variety of hot and cold foods.  Items that ran out were replaced quickly.  I highly recommend a stay at this hotel.  I chose it based on location and positive Trip Advisor reviews.  You will not be disappointed.

title: Awesome customer service!
text: The room was nice and it is always great to have a complimentary breakfast and a rooftop patio. The staff at the Fairfield at 116 28th St. was outstanding. From making a copy, providing directions to making adjustments, this staff was the best and they were extremely busy. A special shoutout to Lily, Kevin and Ashlei for  their help and graciousness! Thank you!!!

title: New York City Hotel
text: A clean hotel.  We very much enjoyed our stay in the New York City.  Staff members were helpful and accomodative.  Conveniently located.  Close to the subway station.  We felt safe coming back to our room at 11 p.m.

title: Great location!
text: I stayed four night while working a show at Jacob Javits in May, I didn't know that 28th Street turns into an urban  garden every day. Short walk to Chelsea/Penn Station/Time Square/Village and Javits. Will definitely stay there again.

title: Top-shelf staff at a well-run hotel
text: Ashlei, the Front Desk clerk, greeted us with genuine enthusiasm and that was the start of a magical stay in NYC.  She worked hard every minute to insure that we had a good time.  That's why I give the Fairfield Inn on 28th St in NYC a top-shelf rating.

title: Aniversario en N.Y
text:
Nos hospedamos en este hotel con mis padres en su aniversario de bodas de plata. Todos los empleados son maravillosos desde la mucama hasta el sr. De servicio de mantenimiento. Saludan todos los días y siempre ayudan en todo lo que necesitamos.
El hotel queda cerca de las estaciones 28st por donde pasan rutas muy convenientes como la 1, 2, 3 N, R. 
El desayuno es muy americano: huevos revueltos, cocidos, salchicha, yogurt, café Starbucks, waffles, frutas enteras, cereales, pan, jugo minute maid de naranja y cranberry. 

El día de aniversario el hotel tuvo un hermoso detalle con mis padres, todos los empleados firmaron una tarjeta de felicitaciones y les regalaron un ramo de rosas y una botella de vino.

La terraza es muy comoda y tiene vistas al empire state, la torre MetLife y a la torre de reloj de Madison square.

Estamos muy felices y esperamos poder regresar proximamente.
