title: Nice hotel, not really sure about staff.
text: I came to visit the Fairfield a couple days with my husband. He checked in a couple days before me on business. The hotel was lovely. Even though Keisara said she was still learning how to get around the city. She was very helpful and gave great directions and even asked her manager just to verify the info she gave us. We loved them. However, you do have two agents at the desk, both Spanish speakers, wears glasses, you guys should know who I'm talking about since I don't want to leave a bad review with names. But they are the most unprofessional people I've ever witnessed in my life. While my husband and we're waiting for our Uber we heard some very personal things that we shouldn't have. It's very unprofessional to talk about lying about your kid being sick because you want to go out or talk about how the hotels owner is so cheap and you hate your boss. It's disgusting. They were talking about other platinum elite guest that were staying in the hotel and my husband is platinum premiere and will be calling Marriott customer care to let them know what goes on at your desk. Also you might want to tell your AGM to make sure no one is around getting breakfast while she's talking about guest in the kitchen. I loved the property and some of its staff but the others really put a bad taste in my mouth. Won't be staying here again, sorry.

title: Great location, average hotel
text: Chelsea is a great place to be and the hotel is conveniently located. It was average for a NYC hotel. Typical tiny rooms. Air conditioner unit over powered the room...it was either cold when on or hit when off. Nice roof deck and helpful staff.

title: Nice NYC hotel
text: We were in town for a concert at Madison Square Garden and this hotel was a short walk.  This is a very nice hotel, that's not too expensive and close to a lot of things.    The rooms were nice, clean and the shower wonderful.  They also have an included hot breakfast which was rather nice and had a lot of options.  The staff were very friendly and helpful.

title: Clean, quiet, and friendly
text: We were met by Kevin at the front desk and thought his service was exceptional, but all the staff was friendly and helpful. A minor complaint is the lack of attention to make sure the coffee and cold water are serviced, although when I pointed it out it was immediately fixed. It also in the heart of midtown with easy access to penn station, Empire State building, Macys, and a short walk to Times Square but out of the congestion of people and cars.

title: Nicest Fairfield Inn ever!
text: This Marriott was exceptional.  The rooms were clean and quiet, the front desk and housekeeping were very attentive.  The breakfast was great.  The business center was located in a convenient spot.  And last but not least they had starbucks coffee available all day!

title: The Manager!!
text: Adam the manager is the BEST! Very understanding and great at his job in terms of customer service. I have stayed at the Fairfield Inn before and the service is alway exceptional!! I will recommend anyone to travel and stay here. Very close/walking distance to Times Square. My friends and I did not need a car!

title: Excellent hôtel
text:
En visite à New York en mai 2016, nous avons séjourné dans ce magnifique hôtel où la chambre était parfaite (la salle de bains était immense et moderne)
Personnel à l'écoute et très agréable.
Quartier paisible et entouré de fleuristes. Nous avons pu voir chaque soir l'Empire State Building changer de couleur (magnifique !!)
Petit déjeuner copieux et excellent (varié).
A recommander fortement si vous visitez Big Apple. Nous en tout cas nous reviendrons à coup sûr !!

title: Buon rapporto prezzo/qualità
text: Un hotel al giusto prezzo (per stare a Manhattan), con una buona posizione (le due metro portano dappertutto) e con la colazione inclusa. Stanze piccole, con letti confortevoli ma piccoli (noi abbiamo preso la doppia con due queen e avendo una bambina piccola ci è andata bene). Bagno micro. La colazione è ricca e non abbiamo mai trovato problemi per trovare posto (pur essendo molto piccolo lo spazio per la colazione). Uova e bacon da dimenticare, ma per il resto una ampia scelta tra waffles, muffin, yogurt, cereali. Caffè starbuck e frutta fresca. Bellissimo uscire la mattina dell'hotel e trovarsi nei fiori del Flower district. Bella la vista dalla terrazza, diretta sull'empire. La sera poca scelta di locali per la cena nei dintorni, ma comunque a pochi passi sei ad Herald square.

title: Outstanding Front Desk
text: The high point of this hotel was the front desk (Ashlei specifically) and the other friendly staff including the very professional and friendly housekeeping staff. The rooms are somewhat small, but not too bad. Overall great location. We walked to Times Square, Flat Iron District, Korea Town, Central Park, and many other places in between. The subway is also very close and cheap for a one-way ticket anywhere on the line with transfers included ($3.00). The top of this hotel has great views and places to sit and have a drink if you choose. Breakfast is standard Marriott fare - reconstituted eggs that can be covered in salsa to improve the taste, yogurt, waffles, etc.

title: Friendliest Hotel in New York
text: It was my first time to stay at this hotel though I have stayed at many other hotels -- including Marriott properties -- in the Chelsea/Penn Station area.  The impression was formed at check-in when the receptionist introduced herself along with the other lady working reception, thoroughly went through all of the basics for the hotel and made me feel at home.  The rooms and amenities were adequate, the breakfasts were fine -- but made special by the sunlit porch behind the hotel -- and the location is great. Every staff I had interaction with was friendly and interested in my well-being.  Within an hour of check-out while at the airport I received a message from the hotel manager asking about my stay and what else they could do for me.  I don't think you could expect friendlier care from any other hotel in New York.

title: Friendly service, great location, nice rooms and amenities for an affordable Chelsea hotel
text:
I have spent over 250 nights in Marriott Hotels all over the world, all their brands including several Ritz Carltons. I give this property 5 stars, because for the money you get so many amenities, values and one of the best, friendly, accommodating staffs of any Marriott owned property. 

Special call outs to Ashlei and Kerwin at the front desk who bent over backwards to make my stay special. It started out with an early check in at 10am because my upgraded room was available. From there, they made sure I had what I needed for Memorial Day Weekend stay. They provided me with a refrigerator and special, personal welcome gifts. Great local recommendations for spas, stores and restaurants in the area. ONE NOTE: They treated me well because I was nice and patient with them. Don't expect the front desk to treat you well if you don't treat them well. Be patient, quiet and understanding and SMILE. Treat them the way you would want to be treated if you were working their long hours.

The rest of the staff was equally friendly and helpful. They all deserve special recognition from Marriott corporate. Top notch hospitality.

Highlights of the property:
- Good free breakfast buffet. In NYC, this saves quite a bit of money.
- Rooftop penthouse deck with views of the Empire State Building. No bar, by BYOB, which saves one even more money.
- Decent sized, comfortable rooms with GREAT Marriott beds 
- Powerful air conditioning

title: First time in New York
text: Hotel location is excellent and near many restaurants, shopping and attractions. The room and hotel are very clean and tidy. (Room size was average and not small as some people have commented on.) The complimentary breakfast included a good selection and was above average. My husband and I were most impressed with the hotel staff -- all staff demonstrated a genuine friendliness and all were very helpful and professional. In particular, Ashlei went above and beyond to make our stay extra special as we celebrated a milestone birthday for my husband. We look forward to visiting NY again and will most definitely stay at this hotel again, and also recommend it to others.

title: Uma grande decepção
text:
Escolhi o hotel baseada nas recomendações do Booking e do Tripadvisor. A recepção foi gentil e a área térrea é agradável com confortos como café e dois computadores. 
A decepção veio com o quarto. Minúsculo e escuro, não acomodando satisfatoriamente nem mesmo duas pessoas. Eu e minha filha tropeçávamos uma na outra, a qualquer tentativa de movimentação.
Fui pedir um outro quarto e a moça da recepção nos avisou de que o hotel estava cheio e enfatizou que era para aquele tipo de quarto que eu tinha pago ( mas não pago barato, nem de longe!) e que tentaria conseguir outro quarto para o dia seguinte, mas sem garantia. 
Houve um pequeno incêndio  causado por uns hóspedes durante uma comemoração de aniversário e que foi prestamente resolvido.
Depois da comoção do incêndio, conseguimos dormir? Não.
Num quarto ao lado, o alarme do telefone tocou até me acordar. Tentei sem sucesso falar com a recepção, o que me obrigou me vestir e pedir ajuda à recepção. Um funcionário entrou no quarto e desligou o alarme, que dez minutos depois disparou outra vez, repetindo todo o aborrecimento.
A diária do hotel não justifica em absoluto a hospedagem em um quarto minúsculo, no terceiro andar, dando para um paredão de tijolos num beco. Mesmo nos parametros diminutos de NY, este hotel conquistou o troféu de pior quarto que me hospedei na última década. E olhem que viajo duas a tres vezes ao ano, ou mais, se possível.
O café da manhã é bom, embora cheio.
Não possui cofre no quarto nem geladeira.
Não volto, não recomendo e acho uma má relação custo benefício.
Mudei-me no dia seguinte para o hotel Índigo quase em frete e de diária equivalente. Com mais espaço,  mais luminosidade, cofre e geladeira.

title: Great Stay in NYC
text: We've been Marriott Reward members for years and we were looking for a nice, reasonably priced hotel with a great location.  Our son lives in Brooklyn, and this hotel was very convenient to Penn Station and subway lines.  My wife was the "guest of the day" which made her weekend with a gift bag and other accolades.  It's located in the Flower District with stores, shops and restaurants surrounding it.  We had a great view of the Empire State Building from our room and it also has a very nice roof top deck.  After trying several places to stay in NYC, we have finally found the right combination.  The breakfast was way more than we expected with many hot and cold foods and Starbucks coffee.  We will be staying there from this point on, no need to search for other places.

title: Amazing!!
text: I loved this hidden gem and would absolutely stay again! The room was a bit tight, but the customer service was amazing! The complimentary breakfast was delicious and the ambiance of 28th was fantastic (the hotel is nestled between several flower shops). I highly enjoyed walking down the street and smelling the sweet smell of flowers! I

title: Loved this hotel!
text:
We had made a last minute booking for 2 rooms and checked in for 5 nights with another couple earlier this month. After an initial glitch with a running toilet and some concerns about the size of the rooms with very little storage, we were upgraded to larger rooms. 
The staff could not do enough to ensure we were happy with our accommodations.
This place has such a warm vibe. It's all the little things, like the 24 hour tea & coffee station (a great feature after being out on a cold night), the welcome you receive upon return, helping us to book baseball tickets, booking our airport transfer for us and a hearty breakfast every morning. The rooftop terrace was an awesome place to have a nightcap and the view of the Empire State Bldg was amazing. Even though there are only 2 lifts, we never had a problem and thought they were quite quick. Our rooms were on the 7th floor right outside the lifts, and we never had an issue with noise.
The subway location and close proximity to Macy's was a bonus and we loved the pavements covered in flowers everyday...the fragrance was beautiful.
We would most definitely stay here again and would not hesitate recommending it to others. 
Thanks again for making our week so special.
Glen & Donna

title: Great visit
text: Good location in the middle of all the flower wholesalers. Great staff. Easy to find reasonable food in the area and subway stops are handy. Rooms looking at the Empire State Building offer that special NYC view. Wish they had at least one more elevator.

title: Pleasant Surprise
text:
This Fairfield is in a terrific location, right between stations serving the 1 and the N/R lines. It's on a street known for its flower and plant shops and as such the sidewalk is a bit crazy, but it makes for pretty scenery.

I checked in online (use the Marriott app - it's great!) and was given a room on the 17th floor. No view for me but that's alright. I wish the room had a refrigerator but there was a coffee machine and the iron was clean (here for work - need a good iron). 

The room itself was absolutely fantastic. Truly. The fixtures were far above what I'm used to in a Fairfield property. The shower was enormous - beautiful glass enclosure, strong water pressure - just ideal. I always wish that NYC hotels would consider going with just one nightstand and squeezing a soft couch chair in there somehow but the desk chair was adequate enough (people need to stop complaining about NYC room sizes). 

The people were terrific as well. They couldn't find a package I had sent prior to my arrival for a bit but we eventually tracked it down. Breakfast is complimentary and served in a clean, bright room - kudos to the folks working that shift (very friendly). I had some struggles with a printer one afternoon and they dealt with that issue quickly as well. Just a really responsive staff.

I'm definitely going to stay here again if/when the price is right (the rooms even here can creep over $400 per - don't like that!). A really nice spot.

title: Flowers all the way
text: This lovely little hotel is THE place to stay if your are visiting New York. Plum in the middle of the flower district it has excellent facilities and a warm welcoming, helpful staff. There is a great breakfast. Coffee, teas available at all times  - and usually a cookie to complement. It is close to the subway, buses and if you want to walk, the great city of New York is wrapped all around. Just step out! Thank you to all for a memorable stay. We will be back.

title: Ottimo rapporto qualità/prezzo
text:
Ho soggiornato con il mio ragazzo in quest'hotel a capodanno per sette notti e ci siamo trovati molto bene. Abbiamo scelto il trattamento con colazione inclusa che abbiamo apprezzato per il giusto mix tra dolce e salto.
Posizione ottima a due isolati dall'empire, ed a 100m dalla metro.
Sotto l'albergo c'è un vasta scelta di fast food, sturbucks nelle vicinanze.
Quando prenotate ricordatevi che le tasse sono escluse ( anche quella di soggiorno).

title: Two night stop over
text: Perfectly adequate accommodation in a good location only 6 blocks from Penn Station. Room fairly small but everything is there and clean. We required a fridge for medication and a small one was brought to our room within 5 minutes and plugged in at no extra charge. Staff were very friendly and helpful and the complimentary breakfast was enough to get you on your way. Roof top balcony was an added bonus with city views. Air conditioning unit was a bit noisy so we slept without it but wouldn't want to try that in summer. Thanks for a good stay.

title: Birthday Trip!
text:
I know this is long past Due but our stay here was fantastic. The friendly staff went above and beyond to make our birthday trip very memorable. The location was great, and we were able to do so much in a short time. We walked to Times Square our first night and found the location was not as far as we thought. The front desk staff gave us information on how to get where we were going, places to eat and little tips for navigating. 

The rooms were clean, comfortable and modern. The breakfast was always warm and even if you were close to the end of serving time, someone made sure there was more. 

Check in and out was easy. We arrived early and were allowed to leave our bags until our rooms were being prepared until check in time. They also stored our bags after check out until our driver arrived. They also made our reservation for transport to the airport which allowed us to enjoy more time exploring the City.

title: Ottimo
text:
L'albergo si trova vicino alla fermata della metropolitana in una stradina che la sera risulta piuttosto buia ma di giorno si riempie di colore essendo piena di fioristi che espongono fuori la loro merce.
La camera era molto pulita e moderna, sinceramente veramente un pò stretta per essere per quattro persone, non sapevamo manco dove metterci le valigie, anche se alla fine quando si rientra dopo aver camminato tutto il giorno ci si mette solo a dormire.
La sala della colazione molto carina con una bella veranda coi tavoli ed all'interno un ricco buffet per tutti i gusti (latte, yogurt, caffè, the, cereali, frutta, waffles, uova, bacon, patate..)
Molto bella la terrazza in cima al grattacielo dell'albergo con divanetti e dalla quale si può apprezzare una meravigliosa vista sull'Empire.

title: Second home in New York
text:
The room was renovated and modern, the size was good because New York hotels usually are so small. 
Bathroom had all the utilities needed for a woman and shower really large. 
and no need to say that Marriott always got the most confortable beds. 
More than I was expecting with flowers surrounding the sidewalk during the day, a real surprise. 
The staff is here for you and really helpful, some customers were late for breakfast but still got what they needed. They make sure you leave with everything! Lina the GM makes sure you start your day the best way possible.
The location is great, especially if you here for shopping, you are next to Herald square and the famous Macy's, Time square and Madison square garden. 
On 6th avenue you got a lot of nice restaurants and bars, this area is really safe and quiet at night. 
And if you dont want to go out, the rooftop has the best view of the Empire State building!
I travel a lot by myself and guests were a nice mix in between business and tourist people, the breakfast area has a huge table and allow guest to interact, it was all fun!
Family or business trip, this an amazing place to stay, really convenient!
Lets not forget wifi everywhere from the 24/7 gym in the lower level to the rooftop, we all know how much this is important weither you have kids or work to do!

title: Great little hotel
text:
It was our first trip to New York and we stayed at the Farefield inn and suites at 116 west 28th St. We were in a small room at the rear of the hotel and had a few problems with WiFi and lack of storage space .  As we were there for the whole week we were upgraded to a city view when one became  available which was great. All the hotel staff went out of their way to help us particularly Jillian and also Kevin on the front desk.
We were made to feel at home from the word go.
The complimentary breakfasts were brilliant, serving bacon sausage patties breakfast potatoes every day as well as fresh Waffle's, porrage and a host of other things. The ladies looking after the food were lovely, as were all of the staff.
West 28th isn't the prettiest Street but every day the pavements are filled with thousands of flowers and plants on sale as most of the shops were garden shops.
The location turned out to be perfect for us, being only a 6 minute walk from Penn station where we arrived from JFK.
There were metro stations at each end of the street and we were a short walk from The High Line, the garden in the sky. We could see the Empire State Building from our window.

title: T.E.R.R.I.B.L.E. |  DO NOT STAY HERE!
text: My experience with this hotel and staff has been nothing but a NIGHTMARE! I have literally been scammed out of money and rudely insulted by general and front desk management, Adam Gollub and Kerwin Francis. Please, do yourself a favor and find another hotel to stay at. I have never in my life experienced such incompetence from a business!

title: Πολυ καλη σχεση ποιοτητας τιμης
text: Το ξενοδοχείο ήταν πολύ καλό. Το δωμάτιο ήταν λίγο μικρό σχετικά όμως για την τιμή του ήταν πολύ καλό. Στα συν το δωρεάν πρωινό για τα δεδομένα της νέας υορκης... Καθαρό δωμάτιο. Νομίζω ότι πρέπει για κάποιον που δε ζητά πολυτέλεια.

title: schlechtes muss nicht bilig sein
text:
die Gegend ist ein Entschädigung für den Aufenthalt, das Hotel befindet sich mitten im Floristen Distrikt, Stadtteil Chelsea,  Das Preis-Leistungs-Verhältnis 170 und 220 $ stimmt nicht überein mit der Qualität, am Sonntag gab es keine housekeaping, und das Zimmer wurde einfach nicht gemacht, das Frühstück ist sehr mangelhaft und die Fenster auch sehr schlecht Schall geschützt,  es ist ein Hotel für kleine Budget, das Personal ist trotz alledem sehr freundlich und sehr hilfsbereit eine Entschädigung ist die Gegend, die Straßen werden geschmückt ab 5:00 Uhr morgens mit einem Teppich aus Blumen und das habe ich zwei Tage sehr genossen,  trotzdem bleibt der Aufenthalt für mich mangelhaft wenn ich überlege das man für den Preis in Städten wie München Hamburg oder Frankfurt schon bereits am Wochenende fünf Sterne Hotels bekommen kann.
Jamais au revoir 😏

title: What a disaster
text: The room was close to the elevator which was loud and the walls were very thin which meant no sleep. The toilet ran constantly and was never repaired. Then I left a personal item behind and called just hours after I checked out to retrieve it. I was directed to Housekeeping who NEVER returned my calls, and this is despite sending an email directly to the hotel manager - who also did not return any calls or emails. And I stay at Marriott hotels every 2 weeks! Save yourself a lot of trouble and do not stay here. And forget any brand loyalty.

title: Well Located Hotel
text: A very comfortable hotel near several Metro stations makes it an easy to explore option in central Manhattan. Rooms are rather small but the free breakfast helps make up for this. I asked for a quiet room on an upper floor and was given one on the 7th floor. It was quiet as it overlooked the back of the hotel but did have a side view of the Chrysler Building. Staff were very friendly and nothing was too much trouble.Plenty of choices for breakfast.

title: Overall Negative Experience
text:
I was staying in New York for one night.  We booked a suite to fit 5 people.  When we arrived, I was told that there was something wrong with the room so we could not stay in it.  This was already frustrating since everyone besides myself was from NY.  The point was to stay together since we were their for our friend's party.  The more frustrating part is that no one contacted me in advance to notify me.  

We then got two rooms next to each other at a reduced rate.  The hotel called around which was nice, but they also recommended we all sleep in one room with one person on the floor which was an outrageous option.  And the carpet was wet in the room from it being cleaned right before we got there.

At 8:00am someone knocked on both of our doors to ask us if we were leaving today.  We said yes, but it bothered us to be woken up for something that they could have checked on in the lobby.  We then put our do not disturb sign up since we were still sleeping.  45 minutes later someone came and knocked on our door waking us up again to ask if we needed a towel, which we did not.  

All in all for a one day stay I thought it was more of a headache than a help and would not stay there again.

title: Rien à redire
text: Chambre propre, beau design en plein centre de manathan avec  vu sur l'empire state building,accueil bien sympa , seul ic : le petit déjeuner...je vous le conseil si vous recherchez quelque chose de simple et efficace.

title: Cool !
text:
Apres fais plusieurs hotels a NYC, constat simple : mieux vaut privilegier ce genre d'hotel de taille moyenne plutot qu'un mastodant sur time square !
Le personnel est plutot sympa, ils st la pr la moindre question & font en sorte de vs aider !
De plus, il est superbement bien placé & le petit-dej est agreable

title: Buen Hotel
text: Servicio,atención y bien situado.Muy recomendable, para viajes de trabajo y viajes de ocio.Dispone de desayuno bufet y WiFi gratis para los huéspedes.Buena relación calidad-precio.Impresionantes vistas desde la terraza en la última planta del hotel al Empire State.

title: Bra läge
text: Perfekt läge och mycket trevlig personal. Ganska litet rum men ok. Rent och snyggt. Fin takterrass med utsikt mot Empire State Building. Frukost ingår. Kaffe och te finns hela dagen. Prisvärt alternativ.

title: Weekend Stay
text: This was a comfortable hotel in a great location. They provide a full, complementary breakfast each morning. My only issue is that there was no dinner room service from the hotel - you are able to order out though.

title: Très correct
text:
Tres Bonne situation au calme.
Accueil et service top, petit déjeuner honnête et raisonnable. Rooftop sympathique avec une jolie vue sur le sommet de l'empire state building. 
En gros le seul point négatif est la taille des chambres ainsi que leur éclairage. 
Je recommande.

title: Countryside feel with a New Yorkish touch!
text:
I stayed here for 12 nights during a business trip (including through the famous January 2016 snowstorm!). The best parts I liked were that the rooms were reasonably spacious for a Manhattan hotel, the reception staff was quite warm (there was a relatively senior lady one of the mornings who was so quick to understand I was a tea drinker and quickly arranged for everything in the middle of the morning rush), the breakfast restaurant was well-equipped (even during the snowstorm), the bathrooms were perfectly clean and I got a fantastic view of The Empire State Building from my room (1402)! Also, there was possibly a Hispanic member of staff, a young lady, who had this very special attitude of coming into the breakfast area in the morning and greeting whoever made eye contact with a very vibrant, "Good Morning" - she was very helpful with many of the senior guests too. The range of teas was also impressive and I was also impressed by all the healthy items that were available for breakfast as walnuts, etc. Overall, things were clean, of good quality and reasonably warm (just that Countryside, boutique feel with the New Yorkish touch of speed and efficiency).

Another big plus, given I am Indian, was that there were a whole bunch of Indian restaurants on Lexington Avenue, just a short walk from the hotel. Also, if you did not want to take a taxi, there were multiple train stations nearby. And Macy's and J C Penney and a whole host of branded shops were just a walk away.

There were a few misses, of course, (you expect some over a 12 day period), like the TV remote was just missing (though I got to noticing that only after a few days) and though they knew early on that I was not a coffee person, they did not arrange a tea kettle as a replacement and only on one day of the 3-4 days I asked, the receptionist just did not get me tea in my room in the morning since I did not want to use the coffee machine to make tea since it could smell of coffee!. 

Another miss was that though I told the possibly Hispanic young lady about preparing all guests about the snowstorm since many of us were from outside New York or like me, not an American and though she said it was a good idea, she possibly could not convince the management to act on it and they did not send any information and we were left to figuring out ourselves. Luckily, I had a lot of friends whom I could call and figure out what to do. Like, since I am a vegetarian, I decided to stock up on a few essentials during the snowstorm and they promptly arranged a refrigerator (which honestly I expected in the room in a top hotel as this, and I am used to amazing hospitality in good hotels in India and I should have understood that this was the US and Manhattan at that and special things do not come without request or payment here - they did not charge me for that).

Also, one of the days I needed a taxi quickly and the staff just asked me to walk to the corner and hail a Yellow Cab which actually took a full 15 minutes to get and I will have expected them to call for an Uber or figure out a faster mechanism to get me a cab - again, this one was not an easy one to fulfill and I wound not consider this one as a big miss.

The internet was also patchy at times.

Overall, if it were not for those misses, I will have given a 5-star rating here (I rarely give!) and nevertheless, if you are on a bleisure trip (business + leisure) trip or just a business trip, I will certainly recommend staying at this hotel - I have good memories of New York from here!

title: Great place to stay in NYC
text: I stayed Monday-Friday for a work trip and decided to stay in the city and take the train to NJ for work every day.  The hotel is very clean in a great location.  The staff was very nice, accommodating and did everything right from checking in to checking out.  The daily breakfast was very good.  I got lucky and got a room on the 9th floor overlooking the city with the Empire State Building in my view and really enjoyed that.  Short walk to the Penn station at Madison Square Garden and in the middle of everything if you want to do some sight seeing.  Would definitely stay here again next time I'm in the city!

title: awesome Boutiques Hotel
text: We booked a stacation in NYC. chose this place because of price... soon as we walked inside., the entire staff and (Bethany) were terrific! they Welcomed us and gave us a great send off.... The rooms were a bit close quarters but, it is Manhattan and they didnt spare any amenities...room was extremely-clean-modern-fresh. maid service was on point. the breakfast in the morning was way more then we expected. we figured it would only be coffee and muffins.. well they had everthing to offer and also for the health conscious. would definitely stay again and we recommend. nice place...!

title: Friendly staff / clean hotel
text: Thanks Beth and Sebastian for making us feel welcomed and for the sweet note and cookies. Clean hotel. We are used to bigger rooms from Marriott since we live in Fl, but its not bad for a couple. What matters is that they are clean. The Penthouse/ rooftop was okay. I wish they have something cute there. Maybe a fire pit or something similar so that you can sit and have a drink while looking at the Empire Building. It is near the Madison Square Garden and many places to eat. While there we visited Brother Jimmys bbq, and Friedmans restaurant which both were great. Again, I really would love to see something be done to the penthouse. 😀

title: Great Experience at the Inn
text:
When we checked in, Kevin helped us with that...and all went well. He was great and very friendly. When we got to our room...it was a little small for 2, awesome for one! We unpacked and thought no more about it, it's New York! Went to the roof top to see the spectacular view, (think Empire State Building) and on the way down we met Dennis. We were joking with him in the elevator about not having a bar on the rooftop, and the we JOKINGLY mentioned that our room was a smidge small. Readers, let me tell ya, I have never witnessed a manager go into overdrive to accommodate guests like this! Before we knew it, Dennis had us pack up all our things and moved us to another room on the front side of the hotel, that was larger!!! This guy even brought up a bottle of wine for us for the trouble...C"MON!!!
In closing...this hotel is filled with a smiling FRIENDLY staff, CLEAN rooms, comfy bed, excellent location, and a great rate for being in Manhattan. 
Can't wait to come back!!

title: Volveria al mismo hotel
text: Hemos estado hospedado 7 dias el personal del hotel excelente te ayudan en todo lo que les pides el desayuno bastante bien y las habitacion aunque para 4 personas es un poco pequeña las camas son bastante comodas y tiene una buena limpieza. Todo genial

title: Very Nice
text:
My experience was awesome.  First thing when I approached the building and saw the entrance swinging glass doors.... it had no finger prints on it , it was spotless, I found out that Chris who I got to meet makes sure the lobby area is spotless, that means a lot to me.  The other two hotels down the street glass windows and doors were so nasty.  

The other thing,,,,Theresa the lady at the front desk is wonderful,she made my stay so welcoming from the beginning, she is so caring,  When I arrived it was 10pm, I had a long day and she made everything easy for me.  Thanks again Theresa.  The room was very clean. The bed was so comfortable that it was the best night sleep I had in a long time.  Breakfast was great, we had a wide variety of teas, it was a full/international breakfast.  I'll have to stay there again soon.

title: Recomendable 100 %, amabilidad, profesionalidad,... Perfecto!!!
text: Muy buen ubicado en midtown, trato muy cordial y amable de todo su personal, sobre todo Kevin, con quien coincidimos más. Muy limpio, muy buen desayuno y variado, wifi, gimnasio, que no disfrutamos por falta de tiempo,... En general muy profesionales y dan un trato personal que te hacen estar como en casa. Gracias!!!

title: ótimo custo benefício e ótima localização
text:
Esse hotel é um dos melhores que fiquei, na mesma rua fica 2 estações de metrô, a mais próxima fica em torno de 4 min andando, tem um Mc donalds de esquina, fica próximo da times square, do empire state  e etc. a localização é excelente. perto de tudo, e quem tem disponibilidade de andar, muitas atrações não serão necessárias pegar metrô, mas se quer ganhar tempo, só comprar a passagem ilimitada do metro por 37 dólares por 7 dias e usar o metrô quantas vezes quiser. 
Café da manha: muito bom, serve leite (integral e desnatado) e achocolatado gelado, iogurte da activa, 3 tipos de cereais, café do starbucks e chá, sendo esses disponíveis o dia tudo, pão, muffin de  blueberry, banana, chocolate, waffle. ovo mexido, batata, linguiça ou salsicha ou bacon dependendo do dia e sucos.
Vista: No último andar tem uma excelente vista para o empire state, vale subir de noite
Ponto negativo: Quarto pequeno
Ponto Positivo: Quarto limpo, café da manhã e localidade.

title: NYC Blizzard 2016
text:
We arrived just as the epic blizzard was starting. Very friendly check in at 11:30 PM. Got upgraded to suite on 17th  floor. Still a small room but decent for NYC. Located on quieter side street but 2 blocks from subway and some eateries. Room was very clean. Comfy bed, TV with fair amount of channels. Decent sized bathroom. Good breakfast in morning.
The staff was just great. Due to the blizzard, the staff was stranded just like us. They kept smiling and keeping things clean.
Depending on time of year, this hotel is a fantastic bargain for Manhattan.

title: Clean, Great service
text:
We had a snafu parking our car. Jessica at the front desk and Adam, the manager were extremely helpful in solving the problem. They went above and beyond and I appreciated that when we arrived. As a matter of fact, all the staff we encountered were friendly and helpful.

Hotel is in a great location, we walked the streets and felt safe day and night. The room was immaculate and the breakfast was varied and excellent. I will definitely try to stay here again.

title: Great location and value for money
text: I've stayed here several times for its convenience from Newark Airport, especially since United no longer services JFK. Taking the easy NJ Transit Train from EWR to Penn Station, it's a few short blocks' walk to the hotel -- which also has easy access to major subway stops to all points. The hotel itself has few frills--after all, it's a Fairfield Inn, the lowest in the Marriott foodchain. So no real lobby, tasteful and clean but basic rooms. But hey, even high priced hotels in the Apple have tiny rooms.The rate includes a decent breakfast spread of hot and cold items. In NYC, a coffee and bagel alone will set you back a few bucks, a hot bfst at least $10 pp if you go to a sit-down place. Free wifi, good sheets and towels and amenities. Staff is friendly and helpful -- what more is there? A real winner in my book.

title: Good location, no frills
text: I always stay at Marriotts when traveling for business, so I have stayed in many.  This location is a no frills spot.  The rooms are bare bones (no fridge or Minibar).  Also, no restaurant (food) or bar attached to the hotel, so make plans to get what you need before you retire for the night.  The location is great.  Waking distance to great shopping, restaurants and all mid town attractions such as Empire State Building.  I do like to have more amenities, so the Courtyard Marriott on 30th is a better choice for that...it at least have a fridge in the rooms and a restaurant/Bar attached.  "Dewey's Pub".

title: Convenient location, friendly staff
text: This was a 10 minute walk from the GO bus from Boston drop-off/pick-up location. Half hour walk to everywhere and a 5-10 minute walk to a few subway stations when it's cold. The breakfast was better than typical fare, and the rooms were decent sized. The first night they were filled and we ended up in an ADA compliant room. This room was very narrow, so even though the bathroom would work for someone in a wheelchair, the room seemed tight to me. Since we stayed for 3 nights the staff offered to switch rooms the 2nd night, and that room was more spacious and very nice. The staff was very friendly throughout.

title: Great one night stay!
text:
We thoroughly enjoyed our one night stay here. The staff was super friendly and helpful. The room was clean and nicely decorated. The breakfast was hot and satisfying. On the COLDEST weekend in New York City, it was a great place to come back to after a busy day of walking.

A few of our favorite perks:
1. Close to Penn Station
2. Amazing view of the Empire State Building if you go up to the roof
3. Awesome staff (they deserve a second mention)

title: The best location and the best staff
text: After having stayed at many properties in the city, this is the best for service and location!  The staff are professional, personable and always make my family feel at home.  The location makes it easy to get anywhere in the city using mass transit or cab.

title: Great location, great service, great room
text:
Ok- nothing fancy here. But- room is big, new, clean and satisfies all you need. Bed us great. Shower is awesome. Breakfast is not fancy- but nice and basically has all you need.

Its not romantic or sth- but- if you come to the city for business purposes - and seek mon fancy comforts- its ideal!

title: Très bon hôtel bien situé
text:
L'hôtel est idéalement situé (28th Street). Deux stations de métro se trouvent en bout de rue (la ligne rouge et la jaune). Le lobby est agréable et le personnel très pro et sympathique. 
Notre chambre (deux double beds) était située à l'arrière au 4è étage. Comme dit dans d'autres commentaires, la chambre est assez petite mais fonctionnelle. 
Les plus: calme du fait d'être à l'arrière. Le confort de la literie. Propreté impeccable.
Les moins: l'airco trop proche du lit et donc soufflerie assez désagréable.Chambre assez sombre car vue sur un autre bâtiment (pas trop gênant car finalement on n'y est que pour dormir). Lit double très étroit... je déconseillerais pour 4.
La salle de bain se compose d'un WC, d'un évier et d'une baignoire avec douche intégrée. 
Le petit-déjeuner (compris) est correct et assez varié (oeufs brouillés, bagels, pain, fruits, gaufres, etc.).
Des boissons (thé, café et chocolat chaud) sont à disposition toute la journée. Très chouette quand il fait très froid dehors (ce qui fut notre cas).
Proche de Herald Square (Macy's), de Times Square, Union Square,Flat Iron Building et highline.
Très bon rapport qualité/prix. Je recommande.

title: Ótimo
text: Hotel limpo, agradável, bem localizado, funcionários alegres e prestativos. Todos os nossos pedidos foram atendidos imediatamente, seja um aspirador de pó no meio da masrugada, seja para guardar nossa mala por três dias, seja para deixar fazer o check in mais cedo (10h quando o previsto era 15h).

title: Great location to both theaters and High Line area - A gem in the neighborhood
text: I stayed at the hotel for two nights with three girlfriends.  We were upgraded to a suite due to Marriott rewards status and we loved the extra space and second bathroom in the suite.  The breakfast was ample and standard Marriott fare.  The breakfast room was a lovely greenhouse behind the alley which was a delightful area to dine in the morning.  If you don't mind a walk, the hotel is walkable to Times Square and Chelsea Market (about 20-30 min walk in opposite directions.  We didn't mind so the location suited us.  For the price, it was a great option since we were travelling on a budget.  I would recommend this hotel.  Staff was also very friendly and accommodating to our needs.

title: Great Location, Great Price,
text: Stayed for a week. Had to change hotel reservation last minute due to the snow storm and the hotel was very accommodating. Close to the metro station and several great restaurants. The breakfast was a bonus as it was included in my price. Would recommend this hotel to anyone travelling on a budget and wanting to be near the metro and a lot of New Yorks main attractions.

title: Perfect Location
text:
Is located in the "Flowers District", walking distance to Times square and Empire building. Metro just around the corner. Breakfast is delicious and the staff outstanding.
A special thank to Daniel.
We will be back.
Valeria & Federica

title: The Best Hotel stay
text:
I was lucky to book my stay with Theresa, who is the night receptionist. 
 She was amazing as well as all the staff there who couldn't do enough for me.  I stayed 9 days in the hotel which is in Chelsea and therefore close to all the art galleries and museums and away from the tourist trap of Times Square area.  Great room with plenty of space and free breakfast.
Again the best part was Theresa who took care of me, and I understood that she does that for all guests at the hotel, in the most personal and efficient way.  
The Marriott is lucky to have her!

title: Diária debitada do cartão de crédito indevidamente!!!!
text: Fiz reserva de 18/01 ate 22/01, no dia 16/01 o hotel me debitou USD 175. Staff atrapalhada, não encontraram minha reserva, fizeram outra as pressas. Sem respeito aos hospedes. 4 dias tentando consertar uma porta ao lado do nosso quarto, seja durante o dia, tarde ou noite batendo a porta, cobraram 175 USD a mais no meu cartão e não querem devolver. No dia da saida antes das 8 da manhã simplesmente colocaram a conta embaixo da porta, tipo assim saiam daqui agora. Quando vou conferir a contar esta com valor errado, demoraram 2 horas para arrumar. E o valor debitado no meu cartão 2 dias antes de entrar no hotel não me devolveram. Acionei o BOOKING.COM, estou no aguardo. Estou analisando entrar na justica.

title: No necesitas mas
text: Un hotel centrico, con wifi buena, y habitacion mejor de lo esperable por su categoria. Le falta mejor limpieza, y que los platos no sean de papel. Desayuno bien sin ser muy variado. Personal muy amable

title: A good place, not too expensive in NY
text: A clean, well located place, close to train, subway. Nothing special, but ok for a short stay in NY.The hotel is close to many attractions, TV in the room, mattress so so, bathroom clean. Nothing more to say. A good budget option.

title: Very accommodating and great location
text: We were supposed to spend two nights at this hotel.  Due to a blizzard, we had to leave early, so as not to miss a surprise 90th birthday in Long Island.  They let us out of our reservation at 4pm on a Friday.  The staff is very friendly, the rooms are small but very efficient.  They offer a nice breakfast.  The location, just off 6th Ave is quiet at night and offered plenty to do, see and buy during the day.

title: Blizzard 2016
text: I had tickets to see Les Mis on Broadway the weekend that the blizzard hit NYC in 2016.  I found this hotel online and the price was right.  The hotel room was great, the location was great and the staff was fantastic.  I couldn't have asked for more.  And after walking out in the cold wind and snow for dinner, we came back to freshly baked cookies.  I would definitely stay here again and would recommend this hotel to anyone planning a visit to the city.

title: "SIMPLY WONDERFUL"
text: My twin daughters came and stayed 4 nights at this lovely hotel!   I would suggest booking directly with Marriott because Booking.com is less than par.   I have nothing but great things to say about the lodging conditions, the breakfast options and the well equipped, professional staff that was so very friendly!  They went over and above to make sure our stay was simply wonderful!  A shout out for Lina the assistant general manager of this Marriott.  She was beyond nice and SO incredibly personable!!!!  I highly recommend this hotel for any traveler who wants a "home away from home" experience!

title: IT was great
text: very good location close to metro stations. Our room was at the top floor with amasing city view)and very clean) Thanks to Mena our stay at the hotel became interesting and he was great in advising places to visit and answering all of our questions. We really enjoyed our stay and the hotel. Good luck to the personel and especially Mena!!!

title: Great Rate, Location and Breakfast for NYC Hotel
text: Stayed on a Friday night in January for under $120, including breakfast and all taxes. Nice, clean room with king bed, and free wifi (not real fast, about 1 mb up/down, but adequate for email and info). Front lobby staff very friendly and helpful, and they kept our carry-on bags for free before check-in time and after check-out the next day while we toured the town. Good breakfast, and clean breakfast room. Good location only 3 block walk from Penn Station and easy walk one block to the 1 subway line. Overall, great bang for the buck in NYC.

title: Un buon albergo a NYC
text:
Abbiamo trascorso otto giorni a NY e, contrariamente alle altre due volte, finalmente in in Hotel di buon livello. Intanto, all'arrivo, non essendo ancora pronta la stanza, causa ritardo dei precedenti occupanti, visto l'attesa protrattasi per oltre 1 ora, ci e' stata offerta una stanza migliore rispetto a quella prenotata, senza costi aggiuntivi. Stanza accogliente, comoda e spaziosa e non rumorosa (strada).Tre ascensori grandi, personale cortese e didponibile. Wi-fi perfetta e senza interruzioni. Unica pecca la colazione, piuttosto "normale" e non particolarmente invitante, anche se compresa nel prezzo. Non c'e ristorante ma la zona offre qualunque cosa nel giro di pochi metri.
Posizione perfetta, di fronte al Medison Square Garden, con la Metro a 50 mt dall'albergo. Prezzo elevato, ma essendo a cavallo tra la fine e l'inizio Del Nuovo anno, corretto. Considerate Che siete a New York, a due passi dalla Fifth Ave. e Times Square.

title: Perfect Point and Great Great Staff !
text:
Perfecct Point to visit NY, and High Level floor rooms have spectacular view if you are Marriott Elite Member you can enjoy view of Empire State Building as on the fantastic Roof-Top. Hotel is Clean and Breakfast is full and relaxing in a little courtyard. Most of all Staff is Great and helpful...Lina the Manager, the 2 "J" Jessica and Jillian, and the 2 boys at reception (one was Kevin?...sorry but i miss the names :) were nice and very polite.
Location was perfect in nice Flower District, close to Metro and few blocks from NYC Heart of Times Square and MSG.
We (me and my wife) we had a beautiful christmas time and our first year wedding celebration...Thank you all.
Unforgettable NEW YORK....

title: Visit to New York
text: As to location I think it could not be better. Very central, close to Penn station and walking distance to the Empire State building and other main attractions. Hotel room and bathroom were very clean and so was the linen and towels provided. Breakfast was good with hot and cold food available, coffee and tea facilities were available 24 hours. On the downside we had a very small room which for a family of 4 was extremely close to claustrophobic No space to put clothes or suitcases. TV against the wall was in the way since space between beds and wall was only a couple of feet.

title: Great location, great service!
text:
I stay her regularly.
Great staff...great location.
I have never had an issue with the rooms or with any level of lack of customer service at this hotel.  Two reasons for 4 stars and not 5?....rooms are a bit small (although expected in NYC)...and breakfast should be offered to 10 and not 9.

title: Turismo
text:
Un hotel fabuloso , te encuentras muy cómodo ya que las personas que trabajan en el hotel , intentan ayudarte siempre , tratamos con el Sr wilson que nos ayudó en todo lo que le preguntamos , amable y atento .
Hotel muy limpio nuevo cómodo ,almuerzo muy completo perfecto ,a todas horas puedes tomar un café , infusiones agua o un chocolate caliente , siempre gratis .
Hotel bien situado para ir a pié a muchísimos sitios , también tienes el metro con las líneas rojas verdes y azules , 
También tienes la estación PENN la  más importante a solo 450 mtrs con las que puedes conectarte con el aeropuerto línea azul en 1H y 20 minutos llegas .

title: Excelente localização
text: O hotel é ótimo, não cobram por caixa recebida, o cafe da manhã é completo com ovos, panquecas e tudo mais. Bem localizado em uma esquina tem o metro e na outra tem um mc donalds. Recomendo. Com certeza volterei.

title: Posizione strategica.
text:
La posizione è strategica, linea rossa e gialla della MTA a 2 minuti a piedi, poi sulla 6^ per uptown o sulla 7^ per downtown si trovano svariate linee bus. L'ambiente è accogliente, la colazione non è molto varia, ma "generosa". Il personale gentile e disponibile.
La moquette dei corridoi non è stata aspirata per giorni (qualche pezzetto di carta trovato all'inizio del soggiorno ha migrato in vari punti del corridoio, ma lo abbiamo salutato alla partenza dopo 7 gg), quella delle camere era sporca e nauseabonda. Ad ogni ritorno in camera era ben avvertibile odore di muffa. Poi, in una delle camere dove abbiamo soggiornato (con due letti queen size), il condizionatore a 10 cm dal letto ti spara aria addosso durante il sonno ed è fastidiosissimo, salvo spegnerlo e magari patire il freddo o il caldo a secondo della stagione. Lo spazio a disposizione è poco, difficile sistemare il contenuto di più di due valigie nell'armadio. Il wifi non permette di avere più di 3 device collegati e bisogna scollegarne uno per collegare l'altro. Niente frigo in camera, in compenso trovate asse e ferro da stiro. In bagno non c'è una mensola o un piano d'appoggio, il piano del lavabo è piccolo e non ci sta niente. Al nostro arrivo non cera l'asciugacapelli che abbiamo dovuto recuperare in reception. Controllate la sveglia, a noi è suonata alle 6 di mattina facendoci svegliare di soprassalto, sicuramente puntata da chi ci aveva preceduto. Di solito rassettando la camera dovrebbero disattivarla.

title: Good Location
text: Great location for a couple of family of 4 (you can not fit more than 4 in a standard or double room...it's very tight) to be at a center location with walking distance to most attractions and right by the subway.  Breakfast was great!  However we had two rooms and neither had fitted sheets on the bed, I found that odd.

title: Best of the best
text: I have had to stay in nyc for the past 4 weeks. Three weeks in November and 1 week of December.  I can stay in any hotel I wish to.  I love this hotel as they go above and beyond to make sure that you are comfortable and have everything you can need.  I love the fact that they are each very friendly and helpful.  I love the breakfast too and there was many times I was needing to get breakfast on the go, they would saran wrap the muffins and give me a bag . I love each of the staff they are amazing and professional.  It is great to come in from a hard day at the office and grab a cookie in the lobby. The hotel is always impeccably clean.  I love the fact that I don't feel alone when I am up there at the hotel.

title: Great service!
text: We ended up here after the Fairfield in Midtown had overbooked. Teresa at the front desk was awesome -- was able to answer all of our questions and was so accommodating. The beds were super comfortable and we had a view of the Empire State Building from our window.  We liked being off the main street and in a little neighbourhood with a flower shop next door and apartments across the street.  Spent the next night at the Fairfield up by Penn Station, and while that was also nice, we liked the cosi neighbourhood feel of the Fairfield in Chelsea better. Would definitely stay again!

title: Fabulosa elección
text: Hotel de lujo en la zona de Chelsey a sólo 3 paradas de metro de Times Square. Hemos dividido nuestra estancia en 3 noches en la zona de Times Square y otras 3 en este hotel. Sí eres español es la mejor opción para elegir un hotel en Manhattan. El personal del hotel es de habla hispana, un grupo de personas jóvenes entre 25 y 35 años deRepublica Dominicana,Colombia....con muchas ganas de trabajar siempre con una sonrisa en la cara y gran profesionalidad que te harán sentirte muy cómodos. Nos instalaron personalmente la wifi la cual funciona en todo momento.Felicite personalmente al gerente de dicho hotel por la estupenda selección del personal.nos dieron una habitación de categoría superior a la que habíamos reservado con vistas al Empire Estate. Todo un lujo dormir entre rascacielos. Habitación diseño moderno y cálida con cama extra king super cómoda y muy limpia toda ella con edredones ,sábanas y toallas de la cadena Marriott. El desayuno muy bien cuidado de marcas y ofreciendo la posibilidad de un desayuno normal o uno cuidando tu colesterol. Yogurt Oikos de Danone, sveltesse desnatados, chocolate Starbucks , paces individuales de leche entera o desnatada,bricks individuales de cereales Kellogg's normales o especiales para el colesterol, huevos,bacon, patatas, frutas, zumo minuete Maids .se puede desayunar en el salón interior o en una terraza acristalada entre los rascacielos.Sin duda recomendable 100%. A 5m de la estación de metro Penn Station que te lleva al aeropuerto y a 2 minutos del metro que en 5m te lleva a Times Square. Maravillosa elección para repetir y muy barato para la calidad ofrecida por este hotel de la cadena Marriot

title: Great place to stay
text:
Awesome service. We needed to take a call the next day at 2 pm, and they extended the checkout to 230 for us. That was very nice of them. Leo, Jessica, Kevin, and Lina facilitated. Thank you for the help. 

The place is located near all the usual stuff you would want to visit in NY.

title: Terrific Hospitality
text:
I've stayed in NYC many, many times in hotels ranging from small boutique to large upscale, and my experience at the Fairfield Inn and Suites on 116 West 28th Street in Chelsea ranks as one of the best-ever experiences. The room was comfortable, clean and exceptionally quiet, and the hotel, itself, was spotless, secure, and inviting. I arrived before check-in time, and while they prepared my room, I was made comfortable in a relaxing room provided with a TV, long table, computers and beverages for guests. Check-in was a breeze, and the receptionist was very welcoming. 

Indeed EVERYONE from the front desk, to the custodian in the elevator to breakfast room attendant was polite and personable. But I should mention two people, in particular, who made the stay exceptional. The first is sales manager, Kathy Mendez, who personally welcomed me and arranged for me to use the "Green Room" part of the breakfast room for a film interview. The stress that normally attends such a project was enormously reduced by Ms Mendez whose lovely, gracious presence was professional, warm and reassuring. I felt quite at home and supremely at ease.

The other notable is Jessica Jimenez whose genuine smile and natural charm at the front desk provide a wonderfully inviting beacon of assistance. She went out of her way to find me a choice of restaurants and was concerned as to my dining experience afterwards which precipitated a conversation that left me smiling and refreshed after a hectic day in the city. 

The included breakfast was the an unexpected treat and was one of the best I have encountered in the city. Moist scrambled eggs, fresh orange juice, oatmeal, quality brand yogurts, and many other choices were available for guests to partake of in the accommodating glassed-in breakfast room with its pleasing natural light. 

The location, a mere seven-minute walk from Penn Station, could not be more convenient, and an added bonus is that this section of West 28tn Street is the wholesale flower district of the city. So one's walk to the hotel is a pleasant mix of aromas and colors.

But it all finally comes down to people, and what truly makes this Fairfield an oasis in the city is the staff who seem to function like a happy family. I seem to have found a new home in NYC. I'd like to keep the secret to myself, but that wouldn't be fair.

(Side note: at the same time of my visit a friend of mine stayed at a Fairfield in Times Square and had a miserable time with an overworked and under-attentive staff in a hotel that needed cleaning and was noisy. It's all about the management, and I hope the Fairfield on 28th St. in Chelsea keeps its present staff for a long time.)

title: Our Lovely Teresa
text:
We decided to take a spontaneous weekend away, our first time leaving our kids so I (mom) was extremely anxious the entire way and I couldn't wait to just check in and relax. Upon checking in, there was a small hiccup with the rooms that were available but Teresa fixed it and we never saw the issue. Shortly after checking in we went to park our car and the lot attendant gave my husband a huge issue and almost got physical, we called Teresa not knowing what to do and she called the police and stayed on the line with us the entire time to make sure we were okay. The issue was resolved and as soon as we got back to the hotel all Teresa cared about is if we were okay, you could see in her face she was genuinely concerned. So that was our first night lol. The following night we saw her again and she wanted to hear about our day and was so sweet. We were sad to not see her the next morning for checkout but she really made our stay great! My husband is normally a tough critic when it comes to hotels mainly because he hates staying at them but this time I didn't hear one negative comment from him. 

Only reason I didn't give the 5 stars is because the room isn't exactly what was pictured, I'm mainly referring to the bathroom. But I will say it was clean, and spacious. We payed half the price of our friends that were staying closer to Times Square and we had a bigger room than them! Everything was within walking distance and I loved that it wasn't so loud at night. Walking out of the hotel to see beautiful flowers lined up on the sidewalk was awesome. 

We love Teresa!! And we will make sure uses there next time we go... With the kids! :)

title: Pleasant surprise
text: The service here was first rate.  From the greeting to the food service to the room attendant, everyone was extraordinary.  I liked the location, set amongst the wholesale florists.  Very cool to see their operations.  This was convenient to Penn Station and most everywhere in Manhatten.  The free breakfast and free wifi were a plus.

title: Excellent location, excellent stay
text: We enjoy staying in this hotel, very well attended by Kathy, Jill, Angie and Leo, confortable room, and nice breakfast, depite the location, that was very good! Thank for making our stay very nice, we'll come back

title: Great location with beautiful views of the Empire State building
text:
We had a room on the 14th floor facing the Empire State building and every night it was shining a different color. Rooms are a tad small, but I've come to find out that, that is a NYC thing. 
Staff was very friendly and always accommodating to whatever I could have wanted. I was also told in passing by an employee that I should go up to the Penthouse floor and it's a rooftop sitting area with Great views of the Empire State building.
Complimentary hot breakfast in the morning and they have Starbucks coffee vs. the normal Marriott brand coffee.
28th Street Subway is half a block away.

title: In the Heart of the Flower District
text: This was a surprisingly convenient location and a really nice hotel. We usually stay closer to Time Square but because of the super expensive rates at the holiday season, we decided to give this location a try. The rooms were a little small, but they were clean and comfortable, and the staff was helpful and friendly. Also, nothing beats walking out the front door and smelling all the fresh flowers from surrounding florists.

title: Gemma's Hen/Pauline & Ann's birthdays/Trip of a Lifetime for us all
text:
From the moment we checked in the staff greeting us were very friendly and helpful.  Our rooms were very clean and facilities in the hotel were fantastic for the price i.e. complimentary breakfast with a huge choice from cooked breakfast to cereal, bagels, toast, muffins, fresh waffles, fruit & yoghurt too plus fresh juice and hot drinks on tap.  

As our stay progressed the staff continued to be helpful and were really interested in meeting our every need, from booking car service to taking group photos and not to mention helping us start Gemma's hen night off on a hilarious journey!  Wilson and Lina deserve the credit for that.  

The maid service was fab, our rooms were immaculate and if we needed more towels the front desk staff were happy to oblige and the towels appeared in moments.  The views from the top floor roof terrace of the Empire State Building were amazing.  The seating area was clean and comfortable meaning that weather permitting we could enjoy the view day or night in nice surroundings.

The location of the hotel is great, situated among flower shops and a short walk to the top of the street was a McDonalds.  The opposite way was a short walk to the other end of the street where both direction subway stations were available.  The Triple Crown Irish Bar became our 'local' and it was a 10 minute walk when turning onto 7th Ave to go uptown to Macy's, Madison Square Garden and Times Square.  I would definitely stay there again due to the central location, friendly staff and value for money.  I was able to keep in touch with back home with the free wifi which was fab!  

I'd just like to thank all of the staff at the hotel and hope you all liked the Scottish Cook Book we left for you a a small token of our appreciation for making our stay in NYC so carefree!  Hope to return x

title: The best experience in Manhattan
text: The word that best defines our stay is: wonderful! The hotel is situated on a very nice spot, there's two subway stations on each corner on the same street, and there's a lot of necessary places around, like two Duane Reade, Whole Foods, Fairway Market, Two Bros Pizza and so on. Besides, I loved the rooftop with the Empire State Building view! The staff was amazing! Theresa was so kind and helpful at our checkin, and Lina was so enjoyable everytime we met on the lobby and brunch area. Jess, Leo, Wilson, Bethany and Kevin: they were so loving and nice with us! We loved all of them!

title: Fantastic
text:
How can this hotel be even better? There is no way!
This hotel is perfect! People that work there makes everything! I arrived earlier and we were very tired, 9 hours flight, they found a room for us, and they didn't charge more for that. Theresa checked us in ans she was AMAZING! She was nice, 
The room is not huge, but is good and really comfortable! The bathroom is good too!
The breakfast is delicious, waffle, fruits, muffins, baggle, yogurt, eggs, bacon, juice, and they have Starbucks Coffee. 
The stay was incredible because of: Lina, the Assistant General Manager, she was perfect, she talked to us, helped us to find a table in the mornings, she gave us some tips. Wilson was amazing too, he helped us during breakfast, during our stay.
Leo the Supervisor helped us with a wrong thing in our bill and the bags, Kevin, Jessica, Bethany they were amazing too. They helped with bags, palces to go, places to eat, they were nice.
I loved the hotel specially because of people!

title: Gemmas hen week
text: From the moment we arrived the reception staff were fab nothing  was a problem for them and they arranged all our transport for all the things we had booked.  Lina was great gave us lots of information and recommended great places and nothing was a problem.  Wilson was also fab he certainly entertained us and was so helpfully and pleasant we all loved Wilson and Lina we would have liked to have left you all tips as you were fab and you defo deserve a pay rise for making our stay perfect.  I would defo recommend this hotel and area to all my friends and will stay again if I get the opportunity to visit in the future.  The rooftop was lovely in the evening and the hotel is central to subways pubs etc.  Well done to the staff in this hotel x.

title: Definitely recommend this hotel
text:
I searched for quite a while to find a place with access to many of the things I wanted to see in the city.  I had only visited NYC one other time and it was overwhelming.  On my daughter's recommendation of the Chelsea area of the city I booked this hotel and found it to be perfect.  There are two subway entrances close to the hotel- one right on the corner - the other a short walk that took me everywhere I wanted to go.  The hotel sits on a street in the flower district so everyday you leave the hotel and get to see all the beautiful plants and flowers being set out, it was great.  

The hotel itself was clean and the room was really comfortable if not exactly spacious.  The bathroom was fairly large considering the room itself had a king bed, desk with chair which doubled as your night stand on that side, a small night stand on the other side, and an armoire of sorts all of which took up just about all the available space.  You also don't have to worry about walking far to your room since you exit the elevator, turn left or right and your room is pretty much right there.  It was very quiet.  I was on the 5th floor facing the building next to us (not pretty but blinds closed) and could not hear the city sounds, which is actually amazing and a welcome relief after being out all day.

Probably shouldn't have left the staff until last but they certainly are the best.  They remember you and welcome you back when you return from being out.  They work hard to be accommodating.  I asked one morning at breakfast if they had soy milk, the person attending the breakfast said no but they could have it in 2 minutes.  I said no don't bother, it was no big deal I would eat something else.  Next thing I know, here she comes with soy milk they had ran around the corner to buy just for me.  Pretty sweet. It did turn out that she was the assistant manager so it might have been over and above what another staff person might have done but she did make me feel like she was glad I was staying there and she wanted my experience to be a good one. I felt like all the staff I encountered had that same attitude.

title: Loved our 4 day stay.
text:
This was our first visit to New York. I read trip advisor reviews for over a week before choosing Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea.

I contacted the hotel the day before we left to confirm our 2 rooms would have 2 double beds. They were very helpful and reasurring. We arrived very late due to flight delays I called again on my way in because we got stuck intraffice and would not be arriving till after midnight. Again very friendly and reassuring that our room was waiting. We arrived at 2am to a very friendly staff memeber sorry I forgot her name. She checked us in quickly and got us to our rooms.

First sight of the hotel and night does not look like much but the hotel was clean and well managed. In the morning it loooked totally different from the outside because we were right in the wholesale  flower district. It was beautiful. Our room was clean beds were very comfortable. Everyday we came back from a long day our room and bathroom were very clean. The staff was amazing a very good continental breakfast was provided the staff offered us bottled waters to take on our long walks and adventures throught the city. The rooftop area had great views and if it not too cold its beautiful in the evening. 

I will definatley be visiting New York again and would stay here again. All the staff we encountered our entire trip were all very friendly and helpful. Thank you For everything we had a great trip.

title: No es para 4 personas
text: Contraté una habitación para mi familia y resulto ser por demás de chica, no ingresaban las valijas, estuvimos muy apretados realmente. Las habitaciones son realmente para dos personas, no posees habitaciones para grupo familiar en el hotel.El resto de los servicios bien, posee una muy buena terraza al empire state y excelente desayuno.

title: very friendly and accommodating
text: The entire staff was extremely friendly, helpful, and very efficient. They went out of their way to be sure that we were happy. A gentleman named Kevin stood out. The room was very nice and it was clean and comfortable.

title: IL SOGNO DELLA MIA VITA
text: Ottima posizione strategica, hotel pulitissimo,con una  buonissima colazione internazionale  e il personale e' sempre sorridente e carino  e' stata un ottima scelta !!!!!!  lo consiglio a tutti, e' difficile trovare un hotel molto professionale

title: Qualità-Pulizia-Posizione-Colazione tutto perfetto!
text: Siamo stati in questo hotel 8 giorni. E' stato tutto perfetto, la pulizia,la cortesia, la fantastica posizione(subway a due passie e Times Square a 10 min di cammino!!),la palestra e  la colazione abbondante compresa Macedonia fresca! Per finire la giornata consiglio di salire sulla terrazza e ammirare l'HEMPIRE che si trova nelle vicinanze. FANTASTICO!!!!!!

title: THIS IS IT, LOOK NO FURTHER
text: I read about this place on trip advisor, which drew me to it. Now that I've been there its all I expected and more, the staff were great and made you feel as part of the family. It was almost like a B & B, special mention must go to Jessica, Kevin, Lina, Leo, Jillian, they didn't miss a beat. Always there to assist with any question or advise. The hotel is well positioned, whether you are travelling uptown or downtown, you are a short distance away. 28th street Metro was on the corner of our street about 100 m away. Breakfast was included, fresh fruit, coffee, tea, yogurt, milk, juice, bagels, muffins, eggs, bacon. More than enough to start the day. The room was great, its a bit small but that doesn't worry me, I'm only there to sleep, it was clean, fresh, linen was great, bed was comfortable, shower and bathroom were excellent. We were given room 403 which was at the back of the property, it was quiet, I did not wake up once from any sort of noise. The place has a rooftop terrace, with stunning views of uptown. The hotel is also in the middle of the flower district, as soon as you walked out you though you were walking through a forest. We stayed 8 nights, I will be back. Trust me, do not go past this place.

title: Comfortable & well located hotel in New York
text:
Stayed here for a week in late September, 2015.  When we arrived at night did not have a good impression due to all of the garbage that is outside on the sidewalk on the entire block.  But next morning a refreshing sight was seeing all of the beautiful flowers and plants aligned on the sidewalk (Flower District).  
The bed was the best, shower was good as well.  The room is pretty small and had no closet or in room safe.  Breakfast was good, but I would have liked a little more variety after three days.  Staff was very courteous and nice.
The hotel is very well located.  Close to most places we were interested in going.  Walked to Madison Square Garden for the Billy Joel concert, walked to Times Square and close to several Metro stations.

title: Super friendly hotel and a good base to visit NY
text:
Without exception the staff at this hotel is the friendliest and most helpful staff we have ever had the pleasure of; Marriott hotels are lucky to have such a great bunch working for them.                  
After a long journey from the UK we were greeted by Bethany and a chap whose name I’ve forgotten they offered us fresh bottled water and cookies. Check in was fast and we were provided with maps and if we needed any recommendations we only had to ask. I travelled with my wife and 2 older children; we flew in and out from Newark. We used NJ Transit train which are every 20 minutes and took 30 minutes to NY Penn station. Come out of Penn station (Macys is across the road) turn right you’re on 7th Avenue keep walking until W28Street and turn left. We walked it with a suitcase and hand luggage easily in 15 minutes. We could have taken the subway (Line 1; one stop) which is at the corner of W28 Street/7th Ave.
The bedroom was very clean and had 2 doubles it was a little tight for room only but we managed; for younger children it’s perfect. Storage space was at a premium. The beds were very comfortable and we all enjoyed a good sleep after a hard day sightseeing and shopping. The bathroom was very clean and had a very powerful shower which was great; we were only given 2 towels on one occasion, not an issue as Wilson sorted us with additional towels. We were on 17 floor at the back of the hotel with a view of the 1 World Trade Centre. There are 2 lifts and they move quickly so there was never an issue getting to and from the room to the ground floor. There was free Wi-Fi for 3 devices in your room and the quality was excellent, probably the best Wi-Fi I have used in a hotel no buffering at all. The hotel as a rooftop area where you can sit, relax and enjoy the view of the Empire State Building.
Breakfast was good, porridge, yoghurts, fresh waffles, bagels, bread, scrambled egg, bacon, sausage etc. The Starbucks was great and Tea Coffee and iced water was available in the breakfast area all day. If you ran out just ask and they bring f4resh. The ladies at breakfast were great always polite and they couldn’t do enough for you.
My daughter was 21 while we were there. I emailed ahead and asked if we could dress up a table as a surprise for when she arrived at breakfast; they were delighted to be asked and they could help. One of the ‘breakfast’ ladies (I’m hopeless with names sorry but she had 2 young boys) helped set it up and Lina arranged a bottle of champagne for her. It was just perfect.
We used the subway to get around. Turn left out of the hotel walk 200 metres and you reach line 1; 2 stops to Times Square and downtown to Battery Park, 9/11 Memorial. Turn right cross 8th Avenue walk 200 metres and you have Line N & R down to Brooklyn and Lexington Ave area.
We hope we will visit New York again and if I did I would not hesitate to use this hotel again. Many thanks to Lina and her team for making our stay thoroughly enjoyable .

title: Excellent value & location
text: This hotel is a great value for the price. Our room is flawlessly clean! Also, extremely comfortable mattress and the room is actually a bit spacious for NYC, even has a full closet and roomy bath! Location is great, right in the heart of Chelsea and subway is literally steps away. Breakfast is nothing special but is included in the price. Fabulous rooftop deck to enjoy the gorgeous views of the Empire State Bldg! I highly recommend and will return!

title: Flawless
text: This is my new go-to hotel when I am staying in midtown for work as everything about it was excellent. Every single interaction with the employees was pleasant and courteous like I was a regular guest instead of someone staying there for the first time. The bed was the best one I've had in a hotel in a very long time - so good that I'm ordering one for my home. The internet was fast, the water was hot, and the rooftop patio offers a nice view of the city & the ESB. My colleagues who stayed elsewhere at a higher rate were complaining about very small rooms and uncomfortable beds while I had a very pleasant stay. I can't wait to return!

title: wonderful find
text:
I was in NYC for one night, to visit a dying friend.  The Fairfield gave me a warm welcome at the desk, a very clean good room. Everything in the room functioned well.  All this was very appreciated.  Having the hot shower since I hail from drought ridden California was terrific.
Breakfast was very good and friendly.  The surprise: a worker offered to get me a plain yogurt and actually went out to the store for that.  Doesn't get much better.

title: Really nice hotel
text:
The room and whole hotel are in great shape, less than 5 years old.  The staff and manager were very accommodating and great at addressing our questions.

The location is near the subway in the flower district which added to the ambiance.  

The breakfast was top notch with a great selection of hot breakfast items, fruit and yogurt, and bagels.

title: Staff was wonderful, location, location, location and a nice breakfast included!
text: This was a 2 block walk from Penn Station.  Staff was wonderfully accomodating when we asked to be on the same floor (traveling with my two sisters and my niece)... we had a king room and a two doubles room.  Also... staff, everyone from reception to housekeeping, from the breakfast room attendants to the maintenance workers were cheerful, friendly, asked about our stay, and they were all very kind.  My first time in NYC and it was just great!  I highly recommend the people, the hotel, the convenience, and the location.

title: Great hotel in a perfect location with very friendly staff !!! Very much recommended !!!
text:
It was my second stay at this hotel and like the first time my experience was great !!!
The hotel is in a perfect location, very nice rooms, excellent breakfast but the most important thing is that the hotel staff is very friendly and willing to help and make your stay the best as it can be.
Special thanks for Wilson for all his help and also for all the front desk staff leaded by Lina.
Looking forward for my next visit in a few months.
Keep on the good work!!!

title: Très bon hôtel, personnel charmant et disponible
text: Je recommande chaudement cet hôtel, aux tarifs abordables. Idéalement situé, dans une rue plutôt calme et pleine de fleuristes. Le petit déjeuner est pantagruélique et s'est révélé particulièrement bienvenu avant de longues journées de marche.
