Le personnel mérite toutes les louanges : charmant, souriant, patient avec les touristes à l'anglais hésitant, disponible, plein d'initiative sans être envahissant - un régal. Un grand merci en particulier à Jillian, mais aussi Jessica et Kevin, qui nous ont bien facilité l'existence.

title: A Perfect Stay
text: It was the second time that we stayed in this hotel in Chelsea and again everything was perfect (Location, Rooms, Breakfast, 24/7 free starbucks coffee) It feels like home. Extremely kind staff. Kevin & Wilson were supporting us all the time. Thank you very much guys. Definitely we go back there.

title: Great for business travel.
text: Loved how helpful the staff was.  When I had a question, when I needede assistance, they were quick to respond and do so as friendly and quickness.  The room was clean, the bed was super comfortable, the view of the Empire St Building at night was stunning.  I've been in  a lot of hotels and in NYC, this is one of mpy favorites for a reasonable price for the area.  Fairly quiet rooms from other rooms and street noises.

title: Good place...great staff
text: Very good location with an outstanding staff! Here's the however... Could use a facelift...and new towels. Marriott has modernized most of their Fairfield Inns...this is not one of them. The place was clean, and met my needs for 2 nights. The free breakfast is ...free

title: Estupendo hotel, estupenda ubicación
text: Nos encantó: habitación en la planta 9 con vistas al Empire State, personal amabilísimo (algunos hablaban español). Cama muy grande y cómoda, desayuno muy completo incluido en el precio, y una terraza en la última planta con unas vistas impresionantes de NY... Ubicación perfecta junto a un par de estaciones de metro. El precio es alto, pero es Nueva York, y los hoteles son caros. Volvería sin dudarlo. Lo recomiendo.

title: Top hotel in great location
text: This is my fourth time on holiday to Manhattan and this is without doubt the best place I have stayed. Staff without exception were always friendly and helpful. Leo and Bethany, and everyone else, were welcoming and warm. Room was a good size (we had upgraded for the view), bed properly comfortable, TV large. We had the promised view of the Empire State Building too (I always have my doubts about view promises!). Breakfast was great. Good range from cooked to oatmeal to fruit and fibre cereal and Activia yogurt. Which is great in NYC when there is a good possibility you will spend the rest if the time eating rubbish. Location brill for us as less than ten minutes walk from Madison Square Garden and the subway was at the end of the block. Would absolutely stay here again. No problem with noisy guests either. Would not even look elsewhere now if I was to return to Manhattan. Thank you for a fab stay.

title: Ótimo
text:
Ficamos 7 dias no Hotel, quarto não é grande mas atende a necessidade, limpo diariamente, café da manha perfeito, equipe do hotel muito atenciosa, recebe pacotes sem cobrar taxas.
Ao lado do Hotel há um Mc Donald e a estação do metrô. Voltaria a ficar no mesmo muitas vezes.

title: agréable séjour dans cet hôtel que je conseille vivement
text: Nous avons passé une semaine dans cet hôtel ; il est très bien situé dans une rue très fleurie (fleuristes) d'où se dégage une bonne odeur. Le personnel est très sympathique, souriant et fait tout ce qu'il peut pour vous être agréable. Nous avions réservé un schuttle en ligne,  pour l'aller et le retour et au retour personne n'est venu nous chercher. La réceptionniste s'est occupée de tout,  a appelé pour nous et nous a bien dépanné car autrement nous aurions raté notre avion. Je tiens à remercier le personnel de cet hôtel. Si vous avez une petite faim, vous avez des cookies trop bons à disposition sur le comptoir. Si vous désirez une petite infusion ou un café une boisson chaude le soir quand vous rentrez de Times Square à 10 mn à pied  rendez vous dans la salle du petit déjeuner, tout y est. J'ai bien aimé l'appareil à gaufres à faire soi-même au petit déjeuner.  Notre chambre avait une vue sur l'empire state building, lit très confortable, douche italienne comme j'aime (manque un frigo). Dans cet hôtel on parle l'anglais et l'espagnol. L'emplacement est idéal pour les visites. Si vous aimez le homard je vous conseille d'aller à Chelsea market pour en déguster un à la taille que vous choisirez vous-même, cuit devant vous, mais trouvez d'abord une place pour vous asseoir.

title: legal
text: O hotel é muito bonito mais achei o quarto um pouco pequeno, dividi o quarto com uma amiga e nao gostei muito do quarto, mas os funcionarios foram muito atenciosos e queridos,  adorei a recepçao  as refeiçoes e o ambiente que era muito aconchegante. adorei

title: Pessoal muito simpático, sobretudo a Theresa (overnight gal)
text: Ficamos uma noite neste hotel, marcado em cima da hora, depois de chegarmos a um quarto via airbnb que não correspondia nada ao que vimos online! Quando chegamos ao hotel, às 23h, a Theresa da recepção foi absolutamente maravilhosa. Muito simpatica, compreensiva e ponta a ajudar, aconselhou-nos bem e deixou-nos fazer check out no dia seguinte uma hora mais tarde do que o habitual. O quarto era muito confortavel. Só a casa de banho é que era pequenina.

title: Great location for exploring
text: We arrived late and had a great check in experience. The lady at the desk was friendly and helpful. The rooms are small but comfortable. The breakfast was a wonderful way to start each day.  Great location, only a block from the bus/subway station for exploring. Many places to eat are located very close.

title: Great location,Great staff !
text:
We arrived late into Chelsea and were greeted by the lovely Theresa and Leo.
Due to length of our stay we were kindly upgraded to a suite by Theresa which was much appreciated and made a big difference. The room was bigger than the standard room, it had a great view of the Empire State building, a large extremely comfortable bed, large shower and quality bathroom products.

Over the course of the stay Theresa and Leo became our go to people, always making things easy for us and greeting us with a smile. A special thank you to you both :)
A big thank you to all the staff at this hotel as you are all great, friendly and helpful, and this makes a huge difference to the quality of the stay.

The hotel roof top is a great space for guests and friends to use and if you are lucky enough to be staying on the right night, the hotel provided drinks and food on the rooftop for guests is great !

The hotel location was ideal for us, with 2 stations nearby in short walking distance, Macey's and Time Square both in walking distance. Great coffee (Melbourne Australia style) close by at "7 grams", and easy access to taxis .

We will definitely come back and stay at Fairfield Inn & suites in Chelsea.

title: Inmejorable elección
text:
Nos costó mucho decidir en qué hotel hospedarnos en Manhattan pero el consejo de unos familiares terminó de convencernos. Elegimos este y quedamos encantados. La ubicación es excelente, íbamos y veníamos a pie de las zonas más céntricas como Times Square o Unión Square. Además, tiene varias líneas de metro con estaciones muy cercanas al hotel, que te dejan en los puntos de más interés en pocos minutos. La calle donde está situado está muy animada durante el día y llena de flores, y por la noche es tranquila. El hotel tiene una terraza super agradable con unas vistas del Empire State impresionantes. El desayuno que sirven está muy bien, y teniendo en cuenta que es uno de los pocos hoteles que incluyen el desayuno, es una maravilla poder salir ya con el estómago lleno. 
Las habitaciones está bien equipadas, limpias y el baño renovado y las camas son muy cómodas. Si tuviese que encontrar algún pero es que las habitaciones son un poco justas. Nosotros éramos tres y nos alojamos en una cuádruple (ya que no tienen camas individuales y hay dos camas dobles) y la verdad es que nos faltaba un poco de espacio, pero de todos modos, quedó compensado por todo el resto. Lo mejor del hotel son sus trabajadores, el servicio es de una calidad impecable. Con quién más tratamos nosotros del equipo de recepción fue con Kevin y Leo. Los dos hablan español y son super atentos, te ayudan en todo lo que les pidas y rebosan amabilidad. Elegir este hotel fue un acierto total, sin duda alguna repetiríamos.

title: Great hotel in the heart of Midtown Manhattan
text:
This was our second stay in this hotel (we were here in Oct '14 too), and it was as good as we remember.  Perfect location - subway is a 2 minute walk to the end of the block, and either a couple of stops on the 1 train or a 20 minute walk to the likes of Times Square, Grand Central, Madison Square Garden and so forth.
Lovely, friendly staff - Jillian, Kevin, Leo, Angie and Bethany to name but a few of the front of house team, but the ladies and gents who serve up breakfast are great too.
Free, unlimited breakfast (cereals, cooked breakfast, juice, yoghurt, waffles etc) really sets you up for the day and can save you buying food later in the day.

Good sized room (well worth spending the extra to get a city view - who wouldn't want to see the Empire State Building out of your window), which was clean, tidy and well appointed.  Decent, fast (and free) wifi for the duration of the stay was welcome too.  

Be aware - it's in the heart of the flower district, which means that the flower wholesalers on the street below start work at about 5am.  The rooms are well soundproofed, so unlikely to disturb all but the lightest sleepers.  For us, it was a bonus - we loved getting up early and watching all the goings-on below us.

Bed was huge and comfortable.  Bathroom was snug but had a good sized shower.
There's a small gym in the basement (which we didn't use, but looked fine), plus a vending machine and ice machine.

There's no opportunity for evening meals, but you can bring back food and use the dining room.  However, we'd recommend taking a (literally) 2 minute walk round the corner to 6th street and visiting Waldy's Pizza and Penne.  Doesn't look much from the street, but it's the best pizza we've ever tasted!

title: A great Hotel in the Heart of the City
text:
Me & My family had a great stay at the hotel. Where should I start : Check In was quick was helped by Ms. Bethany , she was very welcoming and made sure we felt comfortable.
Breakfast was very good and the people who attended breakfast and took care of guest were hospitable, sorry I dnt remember their names.
Room was a bit small but function able, good room amenities.
Location was perfect very near to Penn Station where one can get connections to LIRR for JFk.
The street every morning was full with beautiful flower and plants was awesome to walk.
Over all the best part was the staff from Ms Bethany to all the staff who helped us guide our stay in New York to the last person who helped us check out the lovely lady who was working late shift was wonderful , she helped us arrange a Taxi at 4 am , she was wonderful , I wish I remember her name, please thank her It was a great stay overall.

title: Great Location, Even better Staff
text: We arrived at the hotel at 9 AM. The front desk staff Welcomed us (very friendly) and checked our bags, as the room was not ready that early in the morning.We found this site gave easy access to many NY sites we wanted to visit.  On our second day there, my daughter wasn't feeling well, and the entire staff showed genuine concern for her, and kept asking us if we needed anything and offering help. The room was clean and well organized for the small space. The bed was comfortable and easy to fall asleep in. The hotel was very quiet until our last night when the alarm system went off. (Some crazy guest decided to smoke in his room) The staff was very professional and kept giving updates while the alarm service worked on silencing the alarm. Shout out to Lina the General Manager. She is amazing at her job and very accommodating.Actually all of the staff were.  Thank you for a great visit Fairfield Inn Staff

title: Hôtel très bien situé, propreté des chambres et gentillesse des employés
text:
Nous avons passé une excellente semaine au Fairfield Inn situé à Chelsea, la rue est entourée de fleurs (coin des fleuristes à NYC).

Chambre spacieuse au 15e étage, chambre exécutive avec une grande baie vitrée avec vue sur l'Empire State Building. Grande douche. Rien à redire sur la propreté des lieux. NYC est bruyant mais la vue vaut le coup.

Station de métro à quelques mètres. proche Penn Station, MSG...

Petit déjeuner correct.

Le personnel est agréable même s'il ne parle pas français.

Possibilité de laisser les bagages sur place le dernier jour, dans une pièce fermée.

WIFI dans les chambres.

Très chouette terrasse avec canapés, au dernier étage avec vue sur l'ESB.

Hôtel à recommander.

title: Good location, central yet quiet.
text:
This hotel, located in the plant district, was away from the mayhem of Times Square but central enough to walk to many of the main attractions - Times Square, Empire State, High Line, Central Park.
The room was large enough with a very comfortable king size bed. There was a lovely view from the roof top where free drinks and nibbles are served every second Tuesday evening. Bethany at the front desk went out of her way to help us try to get a taxi on the morning of our departure. A quiet haven in a frenetic city. We would certainly stay here again.

title: Well located, well priced, comfortable and friendly hotel in Chelsea.
text:
We booked early and it was well priced in comparison to other properties in the area.
The location suited us perfectly with good access to subway lines and other attractions. Walking distance to Madison Square Gardens, Macys, Times Square and Empire State Building. The area is very safe.

Standard rooms are small for a longer stay. We were fortunately upgraded to a suite due to the length of our stay, which made a big difference. Bed (King Size) was extremely comfortable. Good bathroom products provided. 
It has a good roof top area available for guest use, with a great view of the Empire State Building. The hotel provided food and drinks on alternate Tuesdays during our stay which was a nice bonus.

Staff are very friendly and helpful. Housekeeping were attentive and prompt.

Breakfast is basic, but sufficient for a short stay. Hotel provides drip coffee and hot water all day. However, if you prefer Melbourne style coffee like ourselves, a short walk down to Seventh Avenue will take you to Seven Grams Cafe which serves awesome coffee. Highly recommended.

CONS: For light sleepers, the in room air conditioning unit is fairly noisy. Ear plugs advised .

title: Large-ish room by Manhattan standards, friendly service
text: We got to the hotel at 10:30 AM, well before check in and well before rooms were ready.  The woman working the front desk was so efficient in getting our bags checked, directing us to some water and restrooms to freshen up, and then sending us out to explore the city.  Staff was always friendly and helpful.  Free breakfast was typical, neither horrible nor outstanding.  Acceptable for filling up in the morning.  Rooms were big for Manhattan and well-kept and clean.  Exactly what you need when visiting:  central location (blocks from Penn Station), right in the flower district, relatively quiet area at night.  Recommended.

title: Very Central
text: Where the hotel is situation it is in the middle of uptown and downtown Manhattan. A 15-20 min walk to Times Square and great shops.  The hotel room is small but very clean, the beds are very comfortable. Great staff, very helpful with directions to places in New York.   I would definitely  recommend this hotel.

title: Nice hotel in Convenient location.
text:
My wife and I stayed 4 nights and had a very nice stay.  The staff was friendly and the room was clean and comfortable.  The hotel is in a very convenient location away from the main tourist areas.  We wanted to get a feel for some of the neighborhoods & this location is a good starting point.  It's a block from the red line to go to WTC site and the yellow metro is 2 blocks to go up and down Broadway.  The continental breakfast was nice and a 
good way to start the day.

title: Great Hotel for the US Open Tennis Tournament
text:
My wife and I go to the US Open tennis tournament most every year.  This year we stayed for four nights at the Fairfield Inn and Suites/Chelsea.  It was a very good choice for the Open and for sightseeing in NYC. 

Check- in was personable and efficient with Kevin. As requested, he assigned us a room on a high floor with a very nice view of the Empire State Building.  The room, albeit it small, was well appointed and well-equipped.  The room included the following:  a very comfortable king bed, nice bed linens, a large flat screen TV, a desk/chair, iron/board, clock radio, adequate storage drawers/closet, nice toiletries and an adequate number of towels.

The breakfast was very good and had a nice variety of foods, including continental type foods and cooked breakfast foods.  The staff in the breakfast area were always helpful and accommodating.

The hotel had a roof-top balcony with tables and seating which was open 24 hours and had very nice views of the surrounding city area.  The hotel also had a small exercise room in the basement and somewhat unusual for NYC, the hotel had an ice machine and soft drink machine in the basement.

The location of the hotel is great for travelling to the US Open.  Penn Station is only a few short blocks away and the Long Island Railroad runs regularly to the National Tennis Center. The LIRR costs a few dollars more than the 7 train to the National Tennis Center but the additional cost is well worth it.  The train in very clean, very cool and the seats are very comfortable.  It is also usually less crowded and runs 24/7.

The hotel is also well positioned for touring and sightseeing. A subway stop is about a block away which allows you to get most anywhere in NYC.  The hotel is in the flower district so it’s very nice to walk through the fragrant flowers and plants when entering and exiting the hotel.  Hell’s Kitchen is also close by with a number of good inexpensive restaurants in the area.  Times Square is about a 15/20 minute “easy” walk from the hotel (highly recommend Matilda, if you want to see a very unique Broadway musical).  

The staff at the Fairfield are all very personable, helpful and accommodating.  The cookies at night are a nice touch.  We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and highly recommend this hotel for other travelers.

title: Wonderful and caring staff. THANK YOU!
text:
I want to thank the staff of the Fairfield Inn Manhattan/Chelsea for the care and empathy shown to my family.

Last week, my nephew Caleb Wilford, 22, was diagnosed with  cancer and had to undergo emergency surgery at Mt. Sinai Beth Israel  hospital, down the street from your property. His parents, my brother Daryl and sister-in-law Sabina, hastily traveled from their home in  Hawaii to be with Caleb in New York. I started calling the Fairfield Inn Manhattan/Chelsea for to book a room for the family, the hospital is right down the street.

From the time I began contacting your hotel , at 4:00 am for reservations,  Leo, Darren, Kevin and Bethany went above and beyond to accommodate our family. I had to call the hotel several times for arrival changes. I know I drove them crazy, I was scared and delirious. 

Fairfield Inn Manhattan/Chelsea,  is lucky to have  a very attentive and outstanding team working for them.  The kindness they have shown to my family will never be forgotten. My sister Andrea Valentin is staying at your hotel too and passed on the hugs from me to Leo, Kevin, Darren and Bethany. I hope to see you all soon as we do not know how long our Caleb will be in the hospital.  

Thank you all and bless you.

title: Great location! Friendly staff!
text: This hotel is in a great location and walkable to public transit and many tourist spots. The staff is friendly and knowledgeable especially Theresa. She is quintessential New York and helped us relive our adventures every evening and plan for our next day. She made our trip! 😆

title: Estupendo!
text:
Me hospede con 3 Amigas por 3 Noches en Agosto en este Hotel, buscábamos un hotel céntrico y bueno y la verdad este fue excelente elección. esta ubicado en medio de dos estaciones de tren que te llevan a donde sea céntricamente hablando en 5 minutos, time square, la 34 o simplemente caminar en meatpacking district.

Los desayunos estupendos, varias opciones saladas y dulces, buen cafe y jugos y todo muy fresco. su personal muyyy eficiente y amable, habitaciones limpias y la cama MUY cómoda.

Desde nuestra habitación se podía ver el Empire State desde un 7 piso.

Lo recomiendo y definitivamente volvería.

title: Fab NYC stay!
text: Stayed at the Fairfield from 1st-7th September! This hotel doesn't disappoint. It's In a fab location, with easy access to the rest of Manhatten. The street is full of beautiful flowers, there just everywhere. Wonderfully maintained hotel, very clean and the staff are very friendly. The rooms are a little small but more than adequate. The thing I loved most about this hotel, was its amazing roof terrace, with the back drop of the Empire State Building, we mainly sat up there of an evening with drinks or a deli meal, the city just looks magical all lit up.. It's only a short walk from Penn Station, and even with suitcases was ok, there's a subway station at the end of the street too, so getting about was very easy. The complimentary breakfast always helps when deciding what hotel to choose, and there was more than enough to choose, from;sausage, eggs, potato, to cereal, waffles, yogurt, fresh fruit,bagels and muffins! Overall, I would give this hotel a huge thumbs up, it was a great base for our amazing holiday! Ladies, my only advice, is to take along your own hairdryer, there was one in the room, but it wasn't very powerful and didn't have much heat, it took ages to dry our hair. 10 out of 10, would definitely come back.

title: Ottimo hotel e ottima la posizione
text: Dopo varie ricerche per scegliere l'hotel a NY alla fine ho scelto questo hotel. Sono rimasta molto soddisfatta soprattutto per la posizione perché sono raggiungibili a piedi le attrazioni principali. Stanze grandi, pulite, ben insonorizzate. La colazione tipica americana direi con grande scelta tra dolce e salato convenzionata con starbucks coffe. A disposizione  anche in camera le miscele di starbucks  che vengono fornite ogni giorno. Personale molto gentile. Rapporto qualità prezzo ottimo

title: Great place to stay
text: Stayed at the Fairfield while in NYC for the U.S. Open. The staff couldn't have been nicer! One of the best I have experienced at any hotel. The hotel is clean and while the rooms were small, (not usually for NY) they were very comfortable. Loved the pent house roof top. Picked up a pizza and wine and took up to roof top to enjoyed. Great view of the Empire State Building. Be sure to check out Eataly, which is close by while you are there.

title: Nice hotel shame about the housekeeping
text: This is a small hotel with little facilities but the roof terrace overlooking the Empire State Building is lovely only spoiled by the amount of smokers using it. We had a problem with housekeeping one day I felt ill so put the do not service notice on the door which was fine , however the next day we did not put out the sign but the room was not serviced so we mentioned this at reception and the housekeeping guyapologised. However I think they might have been annoyed as when we returned the beds had been straightened but not toiletries replaced no spare toilet roll and when my daughter opened the towels they were only re folded not replaced which meant we had those for 3 days yuk. Eventually after complaining again we were given loo rolls and towels but a big blemish on an otherwise perfect stay. No housekeeping tip left this trip.

title: Walk to Penn Station, convenient to subway lines, modern, quiet, great breakfast
text: This hotel is about 5 blocks from Penn Station, a block from the 1-2-3 subway, two blocks from the N-Q-R subway and about 4 blocks from the 6 subway -- great location for everything.  The staff are all very friendly.  Rooms are small but recently updated with high quality bedding. Internet is free and fast. Breakfast includes eggs, sausage, fresh fruit, yogurt, cereals, all kinds of bread and breakfast pastries. Fast elevators. Reasonable prices considering what hotels charge in New York City. We will stay here on future trips.

title: Hidden Gem in the City
text: We checked in in the early morning but our room was ready as promised and the front desk clerk was top notch, I wish I had gotten her name. The rooms are smaller than average BUT you are in NY. It was me, Hubby and a 14 year old and there was plenty of room for us although the bathroom is a little awkward because of the size but still very nice. A nice surprise was the breakfast with a decent selection of food and the upstairs sitting area to relax and have drinks or conversation. We enjoyed our stay and because the location was so close to a subway we will make this our go to hotel when in NY. We were lucky to find street parking, good thing the car stayed parked all weekend because you couldn't find it when all the flowers were out. You are definitely in the flower district.

title: Hotel stupendo!!
text: Voglio segnalare la professionalità di tutto il personale ubicato a pochissima distanza da tutti i luoghi più interessanti. In particolar modo una mensione di merito va a Kevin Leo e Angie per la loro gentilezza cortesia e professionalità . Consigliato vivamente !!

title: Great Staff, Small Rooms
text: Stayed for a couple of weeks at the Fairfield Inn & Suites Chelsea.  The front desk staff was really warm and welcoming, especially Kevin!  Kevin was always friendly and sometimes even saved the evening cookies for us when we came in late! Bethany and Keshia were also nice.  The rooms are very small - not much space to store luggage, but the location is great. The bathroom was very small, but well appointed. It was nice to walk out into the floral district and smell the flowers. The breakfast is really good and there is a lot of it. Easy access to the subway. We had a great stay!  Good value for Manhattan.

title: Adorable Hotel
text: My stay at Fairfield Inn & Suites--Chelsea was terrific! The rooms are kept very clean and have anything you need. The front desk staff was AWESOME and helped me in any way they could. Breakfast was delicious too. I would recommend this to anyone :)

title: Buena relación precio/calidad
text:
Nos quedamos casi 1 semana. Lo escogimos por la cercanía con times square y aledaños. La habitacion es pequeña pero cuenta con todo lo necesario para tener un buen descanso. El personal es super amable y están atentos ante cualquier necesidad que uno tenga.
El desayuno se basa en masas dulces, al menos 3 tipos de pan, huevos revueltos, salchichas, cafe, te, leche, jugo, yogurt, cereales, etc...bastante completo (y viene incluido en el precio que pagamos por la habitacion).
En sintesis, es un buen hotel dado el precio que uno paga.

title: Fabulous staff
text:
Great location. Less than 200m metres from two subway stations, almost in the shadow of the Empire State and Penn Station and Times Square are walkable.

This is New York so space is a premium and unless you have lots of money, hotels are small and tend to be a bit grubby. Accepting this, this hotel is OK. Our room was nominally for 4, but was basically two double beds in a single room. It was pretty cramped as our teenage kids are tall and so are we parents

A well worked little roof terrace around the 19th floor with an incredible view of the Empire State building was a nice surprise. There is no bar in the hotel but we took a bottle of wine up on a warm evening admiring the view and listening to the sounds of the city

But where this hotel really scored was the staff. We had arrived from the rural south where the level of friendliness and courtesy are off the scale and so had braced ourselves more abrasive New Yorkers. All the staff could not be more helpful and friendly, getting us anything we needed and answering our dumb tourist questions without any hint of exasperation. We also witnessed the same treatment for other guests .A special mention for receptionist Britney who could not have been more helpful when we had to check out at lunch but were not flying until the evening. She tried to get us an even later checkout (tough as they were full) and then helped us store a huge amount of luggage and got us towels to freshen up on a sweltering day. Also got us a car which could cope with our excessive luggage. All this despite being on the late shift the night before and being heavily pregnant. All the staff (bell hops, cleaners, other receptionists and breakfast staff) was helpful, but Britany cheered up some sad brits who were on there way home after a great holiday . If the big Marriot corporate bosses read this, these foot soldiers are what makes the difference to us visitors

title: Honeymoon, Anniversary, 30th Birthday perfection!
text:
I have a lot of great things to say about our stay; Here is the brief, read on if you want to know more!

Location: Good. Close to subway and pleasant walking distance to many attractions. In the flower district. Fast response from Uber drivers and cabs. 
Accommodation: Very comfortable. Small bathroom but the bed was great! We also had a great view of the Empire State Building
Customer service: Far exceeded expectations! Leo is fantastic!
Breakfast: Satisfactory! 
Good to know: Wifi is good, there is a gym (we did not use it), comfortable rooftop access with view of the Empire State Building, Comfortable beds, blackout curtains, cold AC, hot shower, fast elevator.

My husband and I just returned from a one week stay at the Fairfield Inn in Chelsea. We booked our trip to New York as a belated honeymoon, celebrated our 1 year wedding anniversary as well as my 30th birthday. As we are in our first year of marriage we wanted something that was not going to break the bank, but something that would do justice to the multiple celebrations. The Fairfield Inn met and exceeded our expectations. 

About a week before the trip my husband called and spoke with Leo letting him know the purpose of our trip. Leo went above and beyond making our stay special. He was able to offer us an upgraded room and greeted us with a warm welcoming smile when we checked in. As we arrived several hours early, the staff offered to hold our luggage for us (for free) so we could go explore the city while we waited. Once we came back and checked into our room we were incredibly pleased by everything. The room was very comfortable and the view of the Empire State Building was unexpected and very nice! 

A factor for our decision to book with Fairfield Inn was the included breakfast. We were not expecting anything spectacular and would have been perfectly fine with cereal and bagels. The breakfast did include cereal and bagels, but also muffins, toast, hot eggs, fruit, a breakfast meat (sausage or bacon), waffles, yogurt, coffee, tea and much more. We ate breakfast downstairs almost every morning and enjoyed the variety. 

The staff were always very friendly and accommodating to us. We were meet with a smile and polite greeting every morning when we headed out, and friendly conversation upon return regarding our day. Everyone that we interacted with seemed to meet us where we were at. If we wanted to chat a bit, they kindly obliged and engaged in pleasant conversation. If we were worn out and just looking to get to our room, they did not intrude.

The day we were to check out was very rainy. Since check out was at noon, but our flight did not leave until 7pm, Leo was able to allow us to check out late so we did not have to arrive at the airport 7 hours early. 

The absolute cherry on top of this fantastic stay was the little surprise we got one even upon returning to our room. The staff had decorated our room with rose petals, fruit, cupcakes, a bottle of wine and a card wishing us a happy anniversary. We were so blown away by the attention to detail and the customer service we experienced during our stay. 

My husband and I plan on returning to NYC regularly (Yankee fans!) and I know where we will be booking again.

title: "Tremendous service " as usual
text:
I checked into the Fairfield early and they did not have my room ready .Keshia worked with me to find me a room as I have some work to do . Keshia is always so atttentive to my needs and cheerful "even when its raining " 
I primarily stay at the Fairfield Chelsea when I am in NYC because it is consistently the best experience and the people genuinely enjoy their jobs and it shows!

title: You can't go wrong here.
text:
We were extremely happy with this hotel. It's very well-located and on the weekends the street has free parking. The #1 train is down the block.  Also, the block is full of flower vendors so in the summer it's very festive.

We were able to get a "city view" room with a perfect view of the Empire State Building. The bed was excellent. The bathroom was a bit tight, but fine. Breakfast was average and a bit cramped, but acceptable. 

The best part of this hotel is the staff. The front desk people, esp. Brittany, are terrific. Every staff member I encountered was friendly. I rode the elevator with one of the maintenance workers and he seemed sincere in asking how my stay was.  Truly great customer service.

title: Comfortable, well located hotel in Manhattan
text:
We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in May 2015, the rooms were well equipped and very comfortable and the hotel was very well located in the 'garden district' of Manhattan. It's 6 blocks from Macy's and Madison Square Garden and a short walk to several subway stations.
The staff were very helpful and very friendly, this was our 5th visit to NYC and this was the best hotel that we'd stayed in. The best 'extra' was the free breakfast in the conservatory. There was a very good selection of bagels, pastries, cereal and cold food. We'd definitely stay here again. It's not super deluxe but its good for the price for NYC.
One tip for NYC - if you fly into JFK, get the subway into town during the day and get either the subway or a taxi at night. Do not bother with the shuttle buses unless you fancy a magical mystery tour of Manhattan / The Bronx / Washington Heights and a transfer time of a good few hours.

title: Great hotel with good rates and free HOT breakfast
text:
This hotel is located within a few blocks of Times Square, Bryant Park, the worlds largest Macy's and much more. You can also see the Empire State Building from the rooftop of the hotel. There was a subway a block away as well.
The customer service was good. Anytime we needed extra towels or blankets the concierge came promptly. Although the rooms were very small they were clean. You don't spend much time in the room with all of the nearby attractions so that wasn't a big deal. Breakfast stayed fully stocked daily and there was plenty of seating and room to move around. I would recommend this hotel and I will be staying here the next time I'm in NYC.

title: Outstanding Experience
text: I found that every employee I had contact with was very professional and polite.  Several went out of there way to ask if I needed anything.  Housekeeping staff was excellent.  Excellent service delivered by Brittany, Theresa, Keshia, Bethany, Leo, Kevin and Dennis.  I will definitely come back to this hotel.

title: Advisable.
text: Hotel conveniently located near Madison Square Garden, Penn Station, Empire State Building, Highline. Receive parcels. Regular room service. Spacious rooms with no microwave, refrigerator and safety box. Breakfast very good. With an open penthouse for sunbathing or something. Front desk crew awesome. 1 block from the subway. 10 blocks from times square. 4 blocks to Empire State Building. My appreciation to Supervisor Kevin Cfuentes.

title: Gute ruhige Lage, Perfekt um Manhattan zu erkunden
text:
Positiv:
Mitarbeiter sind freundlich. Man wurde auf dem Zimmer nicht gestört, wenn das DND Schild draussen hing. Zwei Subway Stationen in näherer Umgebung. Madison Square Garden, Empire State Buildung, Timesquare usw. sind zu Fuß zu erreichen. 
Frühstück war stets frisch. Rechnung kam am Tag der Abreise unter der Tür durch.

Negativ:
Frühstück wurde nach ein paar Tagen eintönig, da es nur einen Wechsel beim Obst (Apfel, Banane, Orange) gab. 
Die Zimmerkarte hat in 10 Tagen zweimal nicht funktioniert. Die Putzfrau kommt teilweise schon um kurz nach 10 und schiebt einen Zettel unter der Tür durch (Für einen anderen Termin zu machen oder das benötigte an der Rezeption zu holen). Zimmer war ein bisschen klein für 4 Koffer. Es gab nur einen Schrank, kein Safe.

Fazit: 
Wir würden das Hotel beim nächsten Aufenthalt wieder buchen.

title: Wonderful Stay!
text: My husband and I visited NYC the weekend of July 10-12 and chose this hotel based on good reviews and close proximity to MSG. We were attending a concert there Friday and arrived early.  We were told that early check in was to be determined upon availability on arrival. We were pleasantly surprised to find an available room on the 12th floor with a perfect view of the Empire State Building! The front desk clerk, Bethany, was a HUGE help and a doll to work with.  Another surprise was the rooftop terrace! We enjoyed many cocktails up there while enjoying the unobstructed view of the Empire State Building!  BYOB :) The rooms were clean and the bed was VERY comfortable, especially after a day of walking around the city. However, the bathroom was a tad small.  You're in NYC though, so it's to be expected.  I woke up the next morning early and came downstairs to find a nice continental breakfast spread.  They had eggs, sausage, hash browns, baked goods, juice, and STARBUCKS COFFEE!! We enjoyed a great day walking around the city on Saturday and found a great Sushi place for dinner, located within the Bryant Park Hotel, Koi.  It was delicious and Ya Ya the hostess went out of her way to seat us at the perfect table! On the morning of our departure, we called down to front desk to ask for the valet to bring our car and were told there was a two hour wait. We were not in any rush to get home. So, this didn't upset us, but if you need to get out at a specific time.  PLAN ACCORDINGLY!!! It seemed as though there was only one man working the valet service, and on a Sunday morning at check out time, it's VERY BUSY! So, we went to plan B.  Bethany, at the front desk couldn't have been more helpful and understanding.  There is a $1500 charge for checkout time past 11:00 and she waved that for us, as well as gave us some good ideas on what to do with our "free time." We ended up taking a left out of the hotel doors and ran into the Highline walking trail.  I highly recommend it! We had an amazing view of the Hudson River and lots of surprises along the way!  Eventually we ended up at the Chelsea Market and were again pleasantly surprised!!!  We made it back by 11:30 to find our car waiting outside the hotel for us.  We had a great weekend and will definitely be back to the Fairfield Inn!  :)

title: ...la struttura che volevamo....
text: Ottimo albergo per NYC, situato nella 28th strada, praticamente nel cuore di Manhattan. Aderente alle esigenze di un turista o di una coppia come nel nostro caso che ha visitato la città dal 28 al 02 luglio 2015. Camera ottima, noi avevamo una CAMERA KING, veramente perfetta. COLAZIONE molto buona, ricordiamoci che siamo in America, e ovviamente i sapori cambiano...ma in generale abbastanza varia e abbondante. Carino la terrazza all'attico (PH)dal quale si poteva ammirare il panorama locale e la sommità dell'EMPIRE vicinissimo la struttura.

title: Pleasantly suprised
text:
Good location, close to Penn Station (we walked down to catch the train to DC with all our luggage with no hassle), and breakfast included. 

The room was what we were expecting size wise. Big enough for two people but not a large suite. The bathroom was quite small and lacked bench space to put anything. The water from the cold tap in the bathroom in warm/hot so not very nice to drink from.

The breakfast was basic; cereal, toast, bagels, yoghurt, fruit salad if you were lucky, and two hot options; either sausage patties, dry overcooked bacon, fried potatoes or scrambled egg patties which weren't appealing. There was also free starbucks coffee you could help yourself to anytime of the day.

The let down was that there was hardly ever water available to drink at breakfast, I think I counted twice there was a glass water dispenser by the coffee you could help yourself to, otherwise you only had juice, coffee or tea to drink. A hot chocolate option would be a nice addition too. Also, the cereals weren't refilled during the breakfast sittings and most if not all options were high in sugar children style options.

The fruit salad was also not refilled so if you weren't down there early you were tough out of luck.

Our last morning there was a Sunday and the hotel clearly had a lot of guests. We had to go away then come back for breakfast as the first time there was no where to sit. Upon our return we noticed that even though there was clearly people still coming down close to 10:30 am (which is the finishing time for breakfast), possibly due to having to go away and come back again like us, the staff packed up breakfast bang on time. The breakfast maid was literally taking the bread away while people were still queuing for the toaster machine and locking up all the plates and cutlery etc. It actually felt quite mean and snarky and I witnessed a lot of disgruntled guests who missed out. We understand things have to run on schedule, but the dining area is too small for a large number of guests to use at one time and so maybe the hotel should either extend the weekend dining times or be a little bit lenient so nobody misses out.

The best part of the hotel was their front of house employee Daniel, who always greeted us when we entered, was extremely welcoming and helpful with any questions or issues and farewelled us like we were friends.

Overall a good stay and we would recommend this hotel to others and would probably stay at it again if we ever returned to New York.

title: Súper recomendable
text:
Todo 10 puntos. La limpieza, la comodidad de las camas y almohadas. Excelentes sábanas y toallas. Súper variado y rico el desayuno. La atención de los empleados todos muy amables y serviciales. Especialmente Leo el
Conserje de la mañana que habla español, siempre predispuesto a ayudar, muy educado y proactivo, éramos 8 amigas nos tuvo taaaanta paciencia!!!!!! Gracias por todo Leo.
 Relación precio calidad más que bien! Sin dudas vuelvo al fairfield en mi próximo viaje a NYC

title: Such a great hotel....
text: We wanted to stay somewhere nice near Penn Station.  We found the place.  Just about a 10 min walk from the trian station and not too far from anywhere.  Room was of course the usual NYC size, but we did score an ADA bathroom so we had plenty of room.  Very clean and staff were so nice.  Breakfast was the usual; eggs, sausage, and potatoes.  The difference here was it was hot.  It was right in the middle of the flower market block so the place smelled wonderful.  Our room was at the back of the building and we did not year one bit of traffic there.  Would mostly definitely book here again.

title: excelencia en la atención
text: Es un muy buen hotel: limpio, buen desayuno, excelentemente ubicado y la gente que allí trabaja es muy amable y siempre dispuesta a ayudar. Para destacar la buena onda de: Leo, Kevin, Angie en el comedor.... todo impecable

title: Great Staff, perfect location, super breakfast!
text: All the people at the hotel are amazing!!! Leo and Kevin were so helpful at all times! They definitely made our stay in NYC great!!! Rooms were always clean and tidy and breakfast was superb!!!!!! The location of the hotel is perfect, so that you can go walking almost everywhere!! I would come back to the Fairfield Chelsea, no doubt!!!!

title: Great Staff, Location and Breakfast
text: We were going to attend an event at Madison Square Garden so booked a room at this hotel which is close by.  Upon our arrival there was an issue with their computer system but we were still able to check in early.  What could have been an inconvenience for incoming guests was    handled with by a wonderful staff who went above and beyond to take care of their guests.  Thank you so much Keshia at the front desk and the man who appeared to be the head of housekeeping who escorted us to our room.  Also, the breakfast there was very nice with a large selection of fully stocked hot and cold items.

title: Great staff and hotel
text: This is a late review for a stay in May visiting NYU with my son.  I stay at Marriott hotels and this has been the best by far.  It is located in a charming street lined with floral and ramen shops. It is quiet and close to the subway.  The staff was outstanding, every single one of them including the personable mgr. Darren P,  but Kawanna, was especially accommodating, and made every effort to make our stay special.  She is a seasoned front-desk agent and does her job well.  The rooms are modern, quiet, and spotless, and the beds are very comfortable.  The setup is ideal, equipped with functioning fridges, great views, good lighting, clean carpet, sensible lighting, and exceptionally clean bathrooms.  The breakfast area is a little tight and can get congested, but the offerings are fresh and varied.  Would be great if they offered their famous yogurt parfait and fresh pastries. This will be my NYC hotel for the long run.  Thx for a wonderful stay.

title: Nice hotel on an interesting street!
text:
This Fairfield Inn on 28th St. in Chelsea/Manhattan was an "interesting" stay.  The staff was very nice, friendly and helpful.  The street is also interesting in that apparently this very block of Manhattan is some kind of "floral district" so regardless of the warm weather "aroma" NYC tends to give you this time of year... each early morning, the vendors start to set out their flowers, trees, shrubs and plants for distribution/sale.  The bonus that this street smells wonderful!  Then each evening, they move them back indoors and it's like it never happened.  But all and all, to an out of towner, it seemed like a pretty average big city street with a couple of indirect added bonuses.  There are a couple of average-good restaurants nearby and a Duane Reade market on nearly every corner.

Again, upon arrival the front desk staff was very kind and immediately offered a dinner destination (which was just ok).  Be forewarned, most things about this hotel are quite small, including the lobby.  By far the smallest lobby I've experienced.  They they did somehow manage a nice little patio area out front to safely watch NY life go by.

The rooms are also fairly, if not quite, small.  I did have a King bed with 2 nightstands, a desk, a TV stand/dresser, small closet and small bathroom.  All of which were very clean, including the shower (usual giveaway on cleanliness).  The room was semi-modern and had a reasonable amount of outlets for charging all of todays devices, but I would have preferred a couple more on the night stands (1 per nightstand) and possibly some USB chargers around the room as most new hotels do.  

The bathroom was tiny (door has to be opened and closed to get around it to use the vanity), but usable.  Again, shower/tub with cloth curtain was clean and water pressure was decent.  Vanity was small but perfectly functional.  Vanity mirror had an ambient light that is a nice feature.  Bathroom did have a overhead light out that made it a bit dark though.  All and all, better than average all around the restroom though.

Upon arrival for some reason the TV was unplugged and the remote seemed to not want to respond to it very well.  But ultimately it satisfied.  Street view was interesting (from 9th floor) and I was able to see the Empire State Building from the room/bed - that was kind of cool.  Otherwise, interesting views of other building rooftops and city life.

I opted to take the hotel up on their black car back to the airport on my final morning at their recommendation - they said it would ultimately be cheaper than a cab or Uber - but with tip (20%) it ended up just under $80.  I think I could have gotten a cab or Uber cheaper, but it was morning rush hour so who knows.

I think I'll try a couple of the other newer hotels on 28th street on my upcoming trips back to this area, but if I had to stay at this hotel again, it would not concern me.

Oh, one last thing... as usual with most hotels today... the wifi was atrociously slow.  photo attached of the internet speed test.  Thi

title: Muy bien atendido!
text:
Me aloje en el fairfield Marriott Chelsea y al no hablar inglés tuve  la suerte de encontrarme con Leo Veras,Guest Service agent del hotel,quien me asesoro y soluciono, excelentemente bien, todos mis requerimientos para mi estadía .
Muchas gracias Leo.
Además quiero destacar que el hotel tiene una muy buena ubicación,y un servicio de desayuno muy bueno.

title: Great staff!
text:
Bethany, Leo, and Kevin were all great, they were so friendly and made our stay fantastic!  They were helpful and accommodating. We'll be back!!
Wine service would be a wonderful addition to the roof top patio!
☆Tracy and Kym

title: Weekend in NYC
text:
I stayed at this hotel over the Memorial weekend.  Family members from Buffalo & Rochester came down on Amtrak to join me.  They chose this hotel because it was within walking distance from Penn Station.  I came in on local Metro North Railroad and took the subway down.  Easy-Peasy!  The hotel was small (11 floors / 10 or less rooms per floor.) but the rooms were very spacious for NYC.  The price was excellent.  The hotel is on 28th....which is where they sell wholesale flowers & plants.  So the walk from the subway, restaurants, and other local businesses was down a sidewalk filled with beautiful flowers.  How enchanting is that?
Hotel staff was friendly.  The breakfast was included....the dining room was a bit crowded during the "breakfast rush"...which was between 8 and 9 am.  Many times the coffee urn was empty, however, there was always coffee and tea in the breakfast room at all hours.  Afternoon tea ?  Yes you can!
If you are on a budget and don't mind a quite neighborhood hotel - this is the one for you.  It's close to 2 subway lines and there were lots of taxis available.  Two local markets within a block of the hotel....for a quick beer run after a busy sightseeing day.  Perfect.  Marriott never disappoints.

title: Short stay in Fairfield Inn
text:
We (young couple) stayed three nights in Fairfield Inn hotel in Chelsea. Good thing about this hotel were breakfast as you rarely can find hotel in New York with breakfast included for this price. Wi Fi was poor and room was not spacious too.. 
Location is very good, close to Pen station, Empire state building other attractions..
If you staying in this hotel, go to  230 fifth avenue roof top bar. Amazing!!

title: Great space in the city!
text: A perfect spot in Chelsea/ Manhattan with a beautiful view of the Empire State Building.  We enjoyed being in the midst of the Flower District and just blocks from the Flatiron area's great restaurants and shopping.  Excellent location within blocks of two subway stops. The staff is most helpful, and the hot breakfast in the "atrium" was a bonus.  Will definitely keep this on our list of places to say when visiting friends and family in NYC.

title: Leo
text: Estuvimos alojados en este hotel y todo estuvo muy bien,la ubicación es fantástica,el desayuno muy bueno y el personal excelente,quiero destacar la atención de Leo Veras,que habla perfecto español y nos resolvió todas nuestras dudas.Gracias Leo por tu amabilidad y predisposición para atendernos.

title: ロケーションの割には割安感、ただし、部屋次第。
text: 地下鉄のウォール街駅から歩いて数分、文字通りウォール街は、すぐ横。観光も、ワールドトレードセンター、バッテリーパーク（自由の女神）、ブルクリン橋など、マンハッタン南部は、全て徒歩圏と、非常に良い立地。あと、フリーのコーヒーはスターバックスで、アメリカのホテルには無い美味しさ。ただし、部屋は狭く、しかも、2階だったため、早朝から非常にうるさく、さらに、2階にはトレーニングジムもあり、さらにうるさく、完全に睡眠不足。高層階ならOKかも、ですが、2階は絶対にお勧めしません。参考までに宿泊は、203号室でした。

title: Buen hotel con excelente ubicación
text: Buen hotel en Manhattan. Excelente ubicación entre dos líneas diferentes del metro en la calle 28. Limpio y comodo con excelente atención del personal. Los desayunos no son buenos pero son los mismos que te ofrecen todos los hoteles de los Estados Unidos, ya sabes produces infinidad de basura para consumirlos.

title: AGRADABLE CONFIRMACION DE LA CALIFICACION
text:
Hace dos semanas pasamos 6 noches en dicho hotel. Realmente sentimos en todo momento que no nos equivocamos para nada en la eleccion.Buenas instalaciones, muy buen desayuno y la coordialidad de quienes nos atendieron nos sorprendio agratamente. Siempre y en todas las circunstancias fuimos atendidos con amabilidad resolviendo todo lo que preguntabamos.-

Excelente ubicacion y relacion precio servicio (no hay lujo) pero tiene de todo
Muy recomendable... espero volver muy pronto

title: Perfect hotel for my NYC stay
text: This hotel was perfect for my weekend in NYC. I had a great view of the Empire State Building. The room was small (but I expect that in NYC), but totally comfortable and clean. The staff was helpful. I did not eat the breakfast. I will stay here again!

title: Helpful hotel for a hectic business trip
text: Me and four colleagues stayed in the Fairfield for a full on five days at NYCxDesign. From the beginning the hotel did everything they could to make things easy for us, when there was confusion on the number of rooms we'd booked when we arrived, Leo at the front desk (who was utterly charming throughout our entire stay) upgraded us instantly to 'rooms with a view' – and it was a fantastic view, with the Empire State Building towering nearby. Printing facilities were really helpful, especially as we were there in a work capacity, and everything was clean and the showers were satisfyingly powerful. The location is great – Chelsea, Meatpacking, the High Line, Midtown and the Village are all within easy roaming distance, and there's a subway at the end of the street for trips further afield. The street the hotel is on is lined with wholesale flower sellers, making the street a verdant urban jungle during the day. Top tip: there's a great coffee shop around the corner called 7 grams!

title: Pleasant stay
text: The room was very neat, nice, and clean. The housekeeping staff was extremely helpful and the front desk was very welcoming. They also provided high-quality shampoo and conditioner (Paul Mitchell) and have a little fitness center in the basement. There are several very good Korean restaurants just a few footsteps away from the hotel. Also check out the nail salon right next door!

title: Short trip to NY in april
text:
friendly reception on both days
clean room
lovely place with all the plant-shops around
excellent breakfast with big choice of food and drinks (unfortunately plates, fork and knifes made of plastic)
quick transport at the end of the journey

title: Très bon séjour
text:
Nous avons passé 2 nuits dans cet hôtel et nous sommes satisfaits. L'accueil a été très efficace et sympathique. Nous avons eu notre chambre à notre arrivée (12h ) alors qu'on aurait pu l'avoir comme prévu à 16h. Les formalités de check out ont été rapides et on nous a imprimé nos boarding pass sur ma demande. La chambre avec vue n'est pas très grande mais correctement équipée avec un lit king size et une très bonne literie.  Il manque juste un petit réfrigérateur . Nous étions au 31è étage et la vue était superbe sur la ville. La salle du petit déjeuner est petite, il faut y aller de bonne heure pour ne pas attendre une table,  mais avec le décalage horaire cela ne pose pas de problème. Le breakfast est correct en qualité et en quantité,  il est servi sous forme de buffet.  Le seul bémol ce sont les couverts en plastique , on se croirait au pique nique !
Le bar sky room est très agréable pour terminer les journées bien remplies,  la vue y est splendide. 
Il y a une salle de fitness mais bien sur le sport, vous le ferez dans les rues à arpenter cette ville mythique. 
Derniers points, times square est à quelques minutes à pied avec une animation délirante et une station de métro à 2 pas. Des restos,  il y en a partout....
Pour terminer, vous pouvez venir au Fairfield Inn Manhattan sans aucun problème,  de plus le personnel est très professionnel,  souriant et à l'écoute.  Par contre, aucun ne parle le Français ce qui est regrettable pour un hôtel international.  Mais avec quelques mots d'anglais on peut se débrouiller.

title: Hotel so-so
text: My husband and I stayed here 4 nights while visiting New York.   The room was small and clean.  Housekeeping was dissapointing.  One day we didn't get our room cleaned and one day had to settle for having them hand us fresh towels because they didn't get to our room until late and we needed to get ready for our dinner plans.   Elevators slooooooow.  Breakfast was very good and the front desk was always friendly and helpful.  Love Tiger, the cat that sits out front and greets all!

title: Great hotel in NYC
text: My husband and I stayed at the Fairfield for 4 nights in late May. We arrived a few hours early and we're checked in straight away (super convenient!) Our room had a king bed and was larger than expected. We were on the 11th floor and had a good view of the Empire State Building. Staff were all very helpful and friendly, breakfast was fine (Starbucks coffee available 24 hrs) and the wifi was fast and reliable. The hotel is in a good location, close to the subway and plenty of places to eat nearby.

title: Perfect Stay! Helpful staff, great location.
text:
I stopped in NYC for a night en route to a conference in Upstate NY....so close to Penn Station, Subway, Chelsea Studios, SoHo and everything else you might want to do in NYC.

Staff was so kind and patient, I called numerous times for assistance with directions and recommendations on places to dine, etc.

Accommodations were actually better than I expected - I could see the Empire State Building from my room.

Will ABSOLUTELY return if I find myself in this part of NYC again.

title: Client Service
text: My son and daughter-in-law recently moved to New York so my wife and I decided to extend a business trip and stay the weekend prior to the business meeting at the Fairfield Inn & Suites for a total of 5 days. When the business meeting got cancelled we decided to go to NY anyway but only to stay for the weekend. I changed my flight schedule but forgot to change the hotel reservation (which needed to be paid fully in advance - no refunds once the stay commenced). When we checked out on Monday morning the front desk agent informed us that the reservation was till Wednesday and that there was no refund in principle. I told her we had to leave anyway and she said she would speak to management to get me a refund. And indeed 2 days later I was informed that the hotel would give me a refund. This is one of the many reasons why I am a Marriott Reward member for more than twenty years! The service oriented approach of the front desk agent (Kawanna Phoenix) in my experience is typical of what the Marriott group of hotels are known for!

title: Wonderful experience! Helpful staff, great location, full breakfast included!
text: This hotel is wonderful. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Our room was well designed and as clean as could be, with a view that could only be described as stunning. The location is very convenient - right in the middle of the wholesale flower market - and the FULL breakfast was an unexpected delight. You're not going to find a better deal in NYC!

title: Excellent Property, Excellent Location!
text:
Stayed here with a group for work, they had the best rates in the area. We were all really happy when we found the hotel & rooms clean & modern. We've all stayed in so many NYC hotels that were less than desirable (run down, dirty, bad service) and paid a crazy high rate for. The area is great too, lots of good restaurants in walking distance. Also, it's in the middle of the flower district, so every day you exit the hotel to a jungle of beautiful plants & amazing smelling flowers. It was a real treat every morning!

The staff was really nice, very warm greeting at the front desk and always very helpful and informative. I must make a special note for Leo & Kevin, they were both superb and sincerely friendly. Great guys! Overall, I definitely would recommend this hotel to travelers coming for both work or pleasure!

title: Good Value, Great location
text:
Very good location- right beside a row of flower shops, Japanese restaurant (Ajisen Ramen) and walking distance to Times Square, Chelsea Market, even the High Line (well, it was not that near, but my family loves to walk and explore together). There were a lot of places to discover around West 34 street- with the street food fair, etc...At night, you can see the beautiful Empire State Building all lit up!

If you want a simple place to stay in the city - this is for you.  The bed was very comfy.  The room was small but it was very clean and modern.  The bathroom was also clean and updated in terms of fixtures and decors. I also liked that they have free wifi.

The staff were very friendly and accommodating.  We enjoyed our stay!

title: Buena ubicación
text: aunque el precio era algo caro, también por la temporada, la ubicación es excelente, puedes ver el Empire State desde el hotel. La habitación justa de tamaño pero suficiente, con un armario, cama bastante grande  y cómoda. Baño limpio con cambio diario de toallas. Desayuno incluido con café del Starbucks. Volveria!

title: Good value
text:
The top reason for us to book it was the price, which was the best we found in the areas we wished to stay in Manhattan.
The room was pretty small, but clean and the shower was great. The window is about 10 meters from the next building, so the view was just a wall with some windows. In the second night, our air conditioner roared like a blender, so we had to turn it off in the following 4 nights.
There are no facilities in the hotel, except for the breakfast lounge (which didn't have enough tables in the peak hours) and the rooftop area (which has nothing but 2 tables, but the view to the Empire State is awesome). Sometimes we just took our breakfast up the rooftop and made a picnic with a great view).

title: Great stay for work and fun!
text:
This hotel was in a great location for where I needed to be for work!  It was reasonably priced, and had a lot of great amenities, like free breakfast, free wifi, and a 24 hour gym.  The staff was very friendly and the rooms and whole hotel was very clean. Great stay and would highly recommend!  

There aren't a bunch of rooms on each floor, its like a tall skinny hotel.  There's only about 8 rooms on each floor.  And I'd say about half of them touch the elevator bank. When it was functioning properly, you didn't hear a thing.  It was a bit noisy when I arrived, but the staff was on it and it was fixed the next day.  The rooms that touch the elevator bank, I'm pretty sure they don't have a city view either.  If you get a room with a city view, you have a clear view of the empire state building.  It's kinda worth the extra money.

title: Lua de Mel
text: Nota 19 em tudo! Desde a recepção, atendimento, limpeza e principalmente o café da manhã. A localização é um ponto forte principalmente por se situar perto de dos principais pontos turísticos de Manhattan. Sem contar que a saída do hotel é cercada de floriculturas, que deixam a rua muito charmosa na primavera.

title: Très bon établissement idéalement situé
text: A deux pas de Times square et de l'empire state building. Chambre et salle de bain très spacieuses, et très bonne literie. Petit déjeuner très copieux. Toit terrasse avec superbe vue sur empire state building. Accueil correct mais sans plus.

title: Clean and Convenient!
text:
This hotel is a hidden gem, literally situated right in the flower district. I stayed loved walking out of the hotel each morning and into the flower vendors' wares. The hotel is a quiet section of W 28th Street far enough from 6th and 7th for plenty of peace and quiet at night. The staff is both efficient and helpful, and held our luggage even after we checked out until it was time to catch our bus in the afternoon.

The rooms are small but stylish and clean, and worked just fine for two.

If you're a walker like my friend and I, then I highly recommend the hotel. It is located about an equal distance right between Times Square and Greenwich Village, and served as a great base for our exploration of the City. We look forward to staying here again!

title: Mycket bra hotel+läge
text:
vi bokade via booking.com och allt fungerade mycket bra.
hjälps sam personal och trevligt läge med närhet till väldigt mycket och fräscha rum med väldigt bra wifi som dessutom är gratis.
Personalen bistod även med hjälp att boka och skriva ut hockey biljetter mellan 
rangers-Washington kanon upplevelse.

title: Recommended and a very good hotel
text:
My wife and I were staying Fairfield Chelsea at the end of April.
 The hotel has a very pleasant atmosphere.
 The room and shower were very clean, comfortable and very spacious.
 The hotel is close to two subway stations.
 Breakfast was tasty and filling. 
 I want to praise the hotel reception staff and especially the hospitality and professionality of Ms. Britney.
Thank you very much!  We will sure come again!

title: 3 day weekend trip
text:
the hotel is in a convenient location and we appreciated the very small but  clean rooms.

What really took away from the trip was the noise the elevator makes when in use - a constant very loud and very annoying noise that feels as if it's right next to you......

They said one of the elevators has a problem ( not unsafe to use it ) - and they switch it off at night but it's really really very loud when switched back on in the morning.....

And why would it not be fixed ...???

title: perfect tourist stop
text:
This is one of the best marriotts ihave stayed in. The staff was fantastic,everything worked, andit was clean. Ask for even number room, they face the street and have space for suitcases, odd number rooms are small__ xx1, xx7 are very small, xx3 and xx5 are a little bigger.

1block from 1 subway, 3 blocks from 4/5/6 subway. Three blocksfrom penn station,walk to hotel. Plan on subway, $31 for  a 7 day bus/subway unlimited pass. Stay away fromcabs, everyone sems to ride the subways

title: Hidden Gem in the heart of New York City!
text: This hotel has just about everything you would ever need for a trip to NYC.  Amazing service, immaculate rooms and an amazing free breakfast.  Every time we passed by the desk we were greeted with BIG smiles and always a friendly hello.  As you exit the hotel you are awakened by beautiful bright flowers everywhere as the hotel is located in the heart of the Flower District.   The hotel is close to Penn Station, Hearld Square, Times Square and several Subway lines.   Our only regret was that we couldn't stay longer.  We will be back.

title: Muy lindo hotel
text: El hotel es muy bueno, de la cadena Marriot, no decepciona. Esta cerca de la 6th avenida, y es una zona muy comoda para desplazarse por NYC. Se llega en un par de minutos a Macys, al Manhattan mall, y caminando un poco mas, a Times square. También tiene cerca el subte, por si tienen que ir mas lejos. La habitación es muy comoda, no es enorme, pero un buen tamaño para esta ciudad. Lo único malo es que no tiene caja de seguridad en la habitacion, aunque a mi no me parece imprescindible. La cama, comodísima también. El baño comodo, y muy limpio. Con secador de pelo "real", no esos amurados que no tienen nada de potencia. El desayuno incluido en el precio, bastante completo. Tiene para elegir bebidas calientes (café, variedad de tes, chocolate) y jugos. También cereales, panes, bagels, yogures y algunas frutas. Si bien, no necesite asistencia del personal, todos eran muy amables. En cuanto al precio, consegui una buena oferta, por lo que la relación precio-calidad fue muy buena.

title: Management Needs to Up Its Game
text: Sunday morning and lots of people checking out, asking tourist questions, calling down for their cars, etc. How many people does management have on the front desk to handle all this in one of the biggest cities in the world? One. She is doing the best anyone could under the circumstances but there can be no excuse for such short staffing. As a result, I called down repeatedly to have my car brought around but no one answered at the front desk. And when I went in person, and made it to the front of the line, it took so long I finally walked to the garage and got it myself. In addition, the drain in the shower backed up and the light over the sink in the bathroom didn't work properly. The AC system lurched from too cold to too hot and couldn't find much room in between. I can say the breakfast was decent. And the staff they did have worked hard and were pleasant. But those are about the only positives I can come up with. I'm surprised Marriott lets their name be used when it is so poorly staffed.

title: Very good Midtown hotel
text: We have stayed here many times and have always been pleased with the staff, the cleanliness, the breakfast etc.  This was our first stay as Platinum members and we were a little disappointed that our request for more pillows went unheeded---since we received no other special gift.  Depending on the dates of your stay these are sometimes not the lowest rates on Marriott....so always compare....even with the Hilton next door.

title: Would be 5 stars except for a/c, hard to regulate temperature
text: Many things are wonderful about this hotel. First the staff is outstanding, very helpful, friendly, room was spotlessly clean, etc. But the a/c heat system either blasted you with freezing cold air, or with heat. It was ok just to turn it off for awhile, but then it got too hot and we were forced to endure the cold blast again. Good things were a fabulous view of the Empire State Building from the 15th floor, the interesting location on 28th St between 6th and 7th with all the wholesale flower markets. In the daytime the sidewalk was lined with flowers, gorgeous. It is walking distance from Penn station, has good subway connections, bathroom was fine, the free breakfast was unusually good, with hot scrambled eggs, bacon or sausage, toast, cereal, yogurt, juice, hard boiled eggs, bagels, good coffee and tea.

title: Hotel muy recomendable
text: Excelente atención, el personal muy amable y acogedor, barrio con poco ruido y cerca de todo, incluyendo varias lineas de metro, el desayuno complementario fue mucho mas de lo que esperamos, las habitaciones un poco pequeñas pero muy completas. De todas maneras regresaría!

title: Aconchegante
text:
Localizado na rua das flores, este hotel é bem aconchegante! O quarto não é muito grande, mas são moveis novos tudo muito limpo. O café da manhã é simples mas não deixa nada a desejar, principalmente onde não se tem o costume de oferecer como cortesia, o local para o café é pequeno e isto pode gerar desconforto.
Estação de metro fica bem perto e voce pode ir a pé a vários pontos turísticos como a high line por exemplo.

title: IMPECABLE
text: premier séjour a N.Y et pas déçu de cet hôtel qui se trouve près du  métro dans quartier calme.Une vue sur Empire State Building . Personnel sympathique . petit bémol le petit déjeuner peu varié mais cela reste un détail.

title: The Service is unbeatable
text:
I often stay at this hotel . I never get over how accomodating the staff is .Multiple times I have had special requests and they are always happy to help me out . Last time I stayed , I forgot some of my clothing in my closet ( I know, I know ) and had to call Lina . Lina made it so easy for me to recieve my clothing via Fedex . I would love to say they went above and beyond ( which they did ) , but this is not the exception , it is the rule with them . 
I stay exclusively in Marriott properties for business because I can rely on excellent service , clean on trend rooms and good locations . 
I will continue to stay at the Fairfield - Chelsea and look forward to my next trip  back to NYC .
Thansk Lina !

title: I often stay here
text: The location is great, rooms clean and comfortable, and good view. The rates are not terrible for Manhattan and sometimes there are excellent deals. Marriott treats its guests well. Leo and the others took good care of me and my colleagues who I also booked for this hotel. We'll be back soon.

title: My go-to hotel in NYC
text: The location could not be better. One block from the 1 train and walking distance from the BDFMNQR in Chelsea. The hotel is incredibly clean and the city views are to die for. The staff are incredibly friendly and professional.  I always feel so welcome every time I come back. Prices are super reasonable for NY, so you never feel ripped off. I wouldn't stay anywhere else in the city.

title: wonderful!
text: The staff at this hotel is superior!  From the kitchen staff in the morning who cook the all you can eat breakfast, to the housekeeping, (they are constantly mopping the floors) to the front desk, everyone seems happy to be there and to help make your stay nice.

title: Excellent choice to visit New York
text:
Excellente situation in the heart of Manhattan, Excellent service (Thank you Lina - assistant general manager- for your kindness and your effectiveness).
Excellent ratio price/services, but we had booked very long time ago.
Rooms a bit too small, but we got a room for 4 persons. A very good point for families.
Excellent breakfast, but plastic cutlery. I'm not sure that it is at the level of this hotel...
We had a room situated on the yard, and it was really very quiet.
Overall appreciation: An excellent choice if you intend to visit New York in Family.

title: Séjour au Fairfield Inn & Suites Chelsea New York
text: Hotel bien situé à Manhattan, proche de Times Square, de l'Empire State Building, du métro. Chambre confortable, prestations très satisfaisantes. Personnel agréable et disponible mais ne parle pas Français. Wi-Fi gratuit. Petit déjeuner complet et bon. Vue sur l'Empire State Building.

title: Good value in Chelsea's Flower District
text: This member of the Marriott family of hotels boasts a convenient location in Chelsea on the same street as the Flower District, lined with numerous vendors of plants, flowers, etc. A subway station and Sixth Avenue are within a block's radius. Service is adequate. Rooms are clean and decently sized, but sounds from other rooms and the hallway sometimes do travel. The free wifi worked fine.  Having room safes would definitely be a plus. A basic hot breakfast starts the day.

title: A Welcoming "Oasis"hidden inside a "Concrete Jungle"
text: When we booked our hotel we were torn between finding a hotel in Brooklyn to be near family or in Manhattan, to be in the center of the universe.  We made a decision that Chelsea would be great central point and we knew that it was a neighborhood with a lot of culture and charm.  At first we hide a little trouble finding the Fairfield Inn as it was tucked away between two flower shops in what we soon discovered as the Flower District.    We were pleasantly surprised to what we find inside this small but somewhat tall hotel.  Our room was small but it was expected, after all, it is NYC and who goes to NYC to stay in their hotel room.  The room was modern and clean, wireless was super fast and free, the hot breakfast buffet was amazing and offered something for everyone, hot or cold and the staff was unbelievable.  I don't think we have ever seen so many smiles in NYC, it appears they enjoy their jobs and really care about their guests.  We will be back in August and we know exactly where we will be staying.  Thank you Fairfield Inn for a great experience.

title: Best Kept Secret. Great Staff - Thx Leo. Thx Kawanna
text:
Location is great.
 Awesome, HOT breakfast - Starbucks coffee, eggs, sausages!! 
Room is spotless, super comfortable. Free wifi!!!
Upgrade to a room with a view of The Empire State Building - stunning.
Staff really step up - Leo worked with Expedia to get a refund when my delayed flight meant I missed my first night stay. Kawanna organized a car for the airport for me. They even gave me a late checkout when my flight back was delayed. So friendly, felt like I was coming home to friends every evening.

title: Great Location, helpful staff
text:
I stayed here for three nights. I arrived by car. It was convenient to get to off of the West Side Hwy and the hotel validated a nearby garage at $35 a night total (including the 18% parking tax!), which makes driving an attractive option. it's also a ten minute walk from Penn Station.

The room was clean and small (it is NYC). 28th St has a lot of wholesale flower markets and things get loud early with deliveries etc, so if you want quiet, ask for the back of the bldg. The front has the benefit of a great Empire State Building view!

The 1 train (Down Town to Greenwich Village all the way down to Battery Park or Uptown along the Upper West Side) is at the end of the block, making it a very convenient place to stay if you are looking to see the statue of liberty or 911 Memorial & Museum. A ten minute walk to the highline and chelsea market. 15 minutes to Times Square through Herald Square.

Serviceable breakfast included for those on a budget. Not a lot of nightlife in the immediate vicinity, but Greenwich Village is 3 stops away (Christopher Street stop) or walk up to Empire State Bldg or Times Square.

The staff was top notch - extremely courteous and helpful. Will definitely repeat.

title: Excellent value - Friendly Personnel - Perfect for NY visit
text: This hotel is nearly perfect for a visit to New York city. All the personnel were very polite, friendly, and professional. The rooms are very cleand and up to date. The breakfast (included) is very good (egg, sausage, pastries, bread, fresh fruit, yogurts, juices, starbucks coffe, and variety of teas). The location is excellent, right in the middle of manhattan, with everything minutes away by subway (or walking distance if all you want is to visit midtown landmarks). The hotel has a deal with a parking garage (half a block away) were you can either self park ($35 for car, $45 for SUV - 24 hr rate) or valet park (extra $10).   The rooms are not very big, but they are not "european small" either.In my opinion, for a base from which to explore the city this hotel is an excellent choice at a more reasonable price than many other hotels  in the area. Definitely a great choice for the practical traveller. In my case there were 7 of us (4 kids, 2 adults) and two double bed rooms were perfect !!!

title: Great Hotel. Wonderful Staff
text: I have stayed here prob 25 times the last 2 years and have never had a bad experience. The staff is very friendly and professional.  It is far enough away from the tourist area, yet close enough to get everywhere.  Wish it had a market place to purchase snacks.  The free breakfast and nearby parking are very important.
