text: brilliant location for this hotell. clean and tidy, ok breakfast, very friendly staff. The street the hotel is located is very central, but still very quiet. Little if any noise. The price of the hotel was also very reasonable. Often in NY, will use this hotel again

title: Very nice hotel
text: We don't stay in Fairfield's a lot, but the location was right this time.  Overall, our stay was excellent.  The location is fantastic.  We did upgrade for a larger King room with a view, and it was soooooo worth it.  Floor to ceiling windows, amazing views of the Empire State Building, more room than expected in Manhattan.  The lighting was good in the bathroom (important to the wife).  The bed was VERY comfortable.  And it was surprisingly quiet.  The staff were all very friendly and helpful.  Breakfast was surprisingly good - sausage, eggs, lots of fruit, cereals.  If I want to be nitpicky, the towels were thin for my taste, and I didn't like going to the lower level for ice, but again, super minor issues.  Starbucks, McDonalds, and several liquor stores were all really close (convenience items), as well as a drug store.  Cabs were a breeze to pickup on 6th Avenue, which was only steps away.  We'll be back!

title: Great stay and location!!!
text:
Stayed over memorial day weekend and had a great stay! I can't comment much on the price because I paid with my points but seems pretty avg for nyc. 

The room was great! We had a city view and it sure was a view! Loved waking up to the sight of all the bldgs. The room was a nice size- nothing huge, but not small either. The bathroom just had a shower- no tub, but it was updated and nice. 

This location also serves breakfast every morning which I thought was a real winner. You can easily spend $20 on breakfast for two people in Nyc, so having a free meal was excellent. (we would fill up on sausage, boiled eggs, and yogurt then we would stop into a local bagel shop to buy one bagel for us to split. Best of both worlds!)  coffee was hit or miss. Sometimes the coffee (starbucks btw) was good and other times it tasted burnt or old. Not sure why. But, what was really cute about the whole breakfast thing was that they have a sunroom kinda place that is indoors but all windows for you to enjoy your breakfast. What a nice touch! It was kinda like you were eating outside! 

OK and now about the location..... This hotel is perfectly situated! It is close to the flatiron district, Chelsea, curry hill, Korean town, subway stops, etc. Loved it! 

Ps: they also have a little courtyard in front with a few tables and chairs. This is a great place to sit and unwind.

title: Great for the Price
text: We stayed at the Fairfield for our second time only two weeks ago.  Is the accommodations unrivaled? No.  But, when you consider the location and amenities, it's pretty hard to beat.  Free internet and free breakfast are a great start.  Walk out the front door and you're in the middle of the Flower District!!  It's like they had people put waves of flowers on the street to make you feel important!  Walking home from our daughter's apartment four blocks south, we always enjoy the spectacular view of the Empire State Building.

title: Below Average
text:
Except location this hotel does not have anything which you can call as good.
Staff is highly arrogant n misbehaves. Being a Marriott platinum elite member n having seen multpli properties across I was expecting some bare minimal level of behavior from front desk. Staff there behaved as if they are the most important n busy people on the earth.
Avoid this place even if you lose some Marriott points.. Instead stay at something else

title: I found this property to be sub-par and awful...it is in an okay location but everything else is awful
text: Room had an awful smell and BUGS; I was literally kicked out of the property (at 1 am on a Saturday) because I had the audacity to complain. As a Hyatt Diamond member I stay at lots of hotels but this was one of the worst hotel stays that I have had!

title: Ótimo custo benefício em Manhattan
text: Hotel novinho, com café da manhã honesto, boas instalações, quarto pequeno mas perfeito para uma bela noite de sono depois de um dia todo batendo perna em Manhattan. Ótima cama, tv tela plana e ducha excelente!

title: Surprisingly Excellent
text:
I didn't expect much coming here. I had an extra day in NYC before my business meetings and booked this hotel due its economical pricing and good locale. Ended up being a wonderful stay. Highlights:

1. The room had a very comfortable bed and modern design. Didn't feel old or stuffy. Felt renovated and well kept.

2. The hotel staff was SUPER friendly and accommodating. Always handled everything with a smile and warmth.

3. The location is excellent. You're close enough to everything, including major subway stops, without being too close to them that you feel you're in chaos.

4. The neighborhood can be a little noisy, but you wouldn't know it from being inside your room. They do a really good job of keeping the noise out.

I would stay here again in a second. Two very enthusiastic thumbs up.

title: Awesome stay
text: Beautiful room, not much of a view stayed on the 3rd floor.  However very good accommodations and amenities nearby.  Central in chelsea and everything you want from the area and the city.  Friendly front desk staff and very clean hotel.

title: Excellent service and location
text: My wife and I recently spent a week at the Fairfield on 28th street. The desk staff were very helpful with all our requests, from recommendations for dinner to helping with subway advice. Located in the busy flower district the immediate area around the hotel entry was kept extremely clean, considering the amount of action that happens on the side walk. The location is great, close to all your needs. The west side subway is a 2 minute walk away. The room we had was quite small but perfectly adequate. The breakfast options were good, but can get quite busy, so earlier the better. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone staying in NYC.

title: Хороший отель с невысоким ценником
text: Сам по себе отель вполне неплох - современный, чистый. Номера, правда, маленькие, но зато бесплатный интернет (скорость хорошая) и бесплатный завтрак - однотипный, зато с коме из Старбакс. Расположен в Челси - не очень удачно, пешком до достопримечательностей идти далековато, зато рядом метро.

title: Love the hotel! Great staff (well most)
text:
Hotel is in a perfect location for walking to time square and other popular destinations. Upon our arrival we were met with the very friendly staff- Mya checked us in and she and another gentleman (sorry, forgot his name) were most helpful. There is a ton of traffic on the street, but hey it's New York City, Mya explained that we needed to take our vehicle up the street to park and the cost was $25. Remember to take your ticket back to the hotel for them to validate it. They explained that there was 24 hour Starbucks coffee and Hot chocolate for our kiddies.  As others mentioned the flowers are absolutely gorgeous and its nice to have such a beautiful walkway leaving and coming back to the hotel.  I don't normally sleep well in hotels; however, I found their beds most comfortable, as did my husband. The rooms were clean and well maintained, and when we called for additional towels, housekeeping responded very promptly.  We stayed on the twelfth floor, but my parents stayed on the tenth, and they had issues with their heating system. They called the next morning to have someone look at it- which was fixed, but they froze through the night.  We did not have those issues, that is why I am still rating this hotel as excellent, as my personal experience. 

Breakfast was the norm, oatmeal, hard-boiled eggs, scrambled eggs, and sausage along with mixed fruit and bagels. They also had orange and cranberry juice- and the hostess was very very pleasant and helpful also. She kept everything stocked and made sure everyone was well taken care of. 

Overall, this was a very nice hotel, the price was perfect very reasonable and the staff extremely friendly.

title: Above and Beyond
text: After reading the outstanding reviews of this hotel I had high expectations. I can honestly say that the FFI-Chelsea exceeded all expectations on every level (quality, value and especially customer service). We have stayed in many NYC hotels with varying star levels and tripadvisor ratings but none better than the FFI-Chelsea. As noted in previous reviews the customer servce is excellent. Every employee (too many to mention each by name), from those we spoke with by phone prior to our visit to those with whom we interracted during our stay, were both professional and personable. They made us feel right at home. Special recognition should go to Katie C who upon learning that we were there to celebrate our daughter's birthday went above and beyond with an upgraded room (great view of ESB) and a bday surprise. The rooms are large by NYC standards, well appointed and very clean. The free wifi and beakfast add to the already outstanding value. The location is convenient - near subway, restaurants and out of the craziness of Time Square. The FFI-Chelsea will definitely be at the top of our list for future visits to NYC. The only word of warning has nothing to do with the hotel itself but is worth mentioning. They were working on the street in front of the hotel. It did not take away from our positive experience but we did awaken to the sound of a jackhammer each morning. I'm not sure how long this will be an issue but you might want to ask if it matters to you.

title: Great experience in NYC at this hotel
text: My wife and I stayed here last week and had exceptional service from the staff. They were very helpful with directions and a cab to the airport. This hotel is clean and well run and very convenient to the West Village, Midtown, Soho etc. I do receommend it.

title: Nice stay in NYC
text:
Very good location. Close to subway, can walk to Penn station. In addition, there are flower shops all along the road in front of hotel which make you feel fresh whenever you out of hotel.
Staffs are good. Room is good. Anyway, breakfast is never change, that make us a bit bored.

title: A Really Well-Run Hotel
text: This is a well run hotel with great staff; top to bottom. Thomas and Mia - you are a credit to Marriott. Thanks for all your "foody" advice and other tips as well. Really great service; positive, fun and super helpful. Clearly good management. Great rooms (2 rooms; 2 Kings; great beds; we viewed the Empire State Building from our windows); really decent breakfast (fast and hard working breakfast crew). Everything is new, modern and clean. Its in the "Flower District" of Chelsea. What else can I say?  We would definitely stay again.

title: Excellent stay, excellent location and staff!
text:
I cannot fault anything with this hotel.
We arrived in Manhattan at 10am, and I knew that we would not be able to check in yet.
The staff at the front desk was really welcoming and right away offered to hold our luggage while we went out shopping in the city.
We were given luggage tags and I felt really secure leaving our bags with them.
We returned to check in at around 3pm, and were delighted to find out we had been upgraded to a suite.
The suite on the 18th floor was great! I would recommend the splurge if you can.
The bedding and the room as a whole felt really new and clean.
Breakfast at this location is great. Starbucks coffee is available 24/7 as well as tea and hot chocolate.
The location of this hotel is on west 28th, in the middle of the flower wholesale shops.
This hotel was walkable to all NYC attractions and shopping.
My biggest compliment is given to the staff. Always with a bright smile and I felt as if they cared that I have a good stay.
Keep up the good work!!!

title: Bon emplacement et rapport qualité prix
text:
Nous y sommes restés 8 jours, d'abord chambre très petite à l'arrière, puis grande devant.
Très propre, personnel très disponible et petit dej complet bien que rudimentaire pour la partie chaude.
Très bien placé au point de vue métro et si on veut aller prendre le train, directement à pied.
Parking abordable à 25 usd / jour

title: Excelente localização
text: O hotel é muito bem localizado, fica a poucas quadras da Times Square. O quarto é pequeno mas extremamente limpo e novo. O café da manhã é muito simples, mas é tranquilo, não tem muita gente e há reposição o tempo todo. Os funcionário são muito educados. Ficaria nesse hotel novamente, sem dúvidas

title: Perfetto!
text:
Siamo stati in questo hotel per 6 notti, devo dire che riconfermo tutto quello che avevo letto sulle precedenti recensioni (positive)!
Personale molto disponibile (il mio bagaglio era stato smarrito e si sono messi in contatto loro con la compagnia aerea ecc) - avevamo prenotato due camere, di cui una standard e senza vista: mi hanno offerto due camere con vista allo stesso prezzo.
La colazione, seppur uguale per tutti i sei giorni, era essenziale e ben gradita dal momento che è gratuita ed a new york è raro trovare hotel che offrano questa opzione !
La camera, pulita e spaziosa, doccia un po vecchiotta ma ben funzionante. 
Ottima insonorizzazione delle camere.
Posizione ottima, il "distretto dei fiori" piacevole ed a due passi dal centro, girato l'angolo si trovano subito negozi e supermercati.

Consiglio vivamente questo hotel, ottimo rapporto qualità prezzo e si è stati bene quasi come a casa!

title: Nice, affordable option in NYC
text: Stayed at the Fairfield Inn & Suites for 2 nights for a quick getaway. The hotel's rates are very reasonable for the quality of the hotel and by NYC standards. I liked the location-close to Madison Square Garden, shopping and it is in the flower district, so I loved walking by all the beautiful flowers and plants getting to and from the hotel. Yes, the rooms are small but I have stayed in much smaller rooms in the city. It was clean and comfortable although the towels in the bathroom were a disappointment. The complimentary breakfast was okay and nice to have as an option but I prefer to try one of the many fabulous brunch restaurants the city offers. If you are looking for something fancy, then this isn't your place. But for the price, cleanliness and convenience -this is a great option!

title: Boa localização, quartos pequenos, serviços razoáveis
text:
A localização do hotel, a menos de uma quadra do metrô e muito próxima (5 min de caminhada) a estação Penn Station é a característica mais positiva do hotel.
Os quartos são pequenos, dentro do padrão NYC, e o serviço de limpeza é precário. Em uma das noites, o lixo do banheiro sequer foi trocado.
O pessoal da recepção é simpático e atencioso.
O café da manhã, incluso na diária, é outra vantagem. É razoável, padrão americano.

title: Not your best option in Manhattan
text:
I recently stayed here for three nights during a trade show, and it was a disappointment.  There are better options at this price point.

Service was mixed.  On the plus side, I arrived at 8am on my day of check-in, in order to drop off my bags.  Although I hadn't stayed there the night before, the friendly desk attendant offered me breakfast.  That was unexpected and I was impressed.

The next morning, though, I was disappointed when I went to iron my shirt and suit.  The iron was dirty from another guest's misuse, and the ironing board cover had holes in the foam and wouldn't stay in place.  I requested another board and iron from two -- yes, two -- people at the front desk, but never got it.

Another problem with the room was something that's all too common.  Style and function are a balancing act, and when it comes to bathroom renovations, far too many hotels come down way too far on the side of style.  Hip tile and fixtures are great, and I do appreciate them, but not at the expense of functionality.

It get it -- NY bathrooms are notoriously small, and there's not much room for counter space.  But that's all the more reason to have a shelf or two.  It's a hotel.  Guests have toiletries.  They have to go somewhere.

The bathroom lighting, while not the worst I've ever experienced, was also lacking.  But if you don't need to shave, you might be fine.

The hotel has a good location, but I've stayed at others that are much better at a similar price.  I wouldn't stay here again.

title: Awesome Hotel
text: I've got to agree with all of the other great reviews.  Entire staff was great, very friendly and helpful.  Loved the coffee available 24x7 (Starbucks!); breakfast was great.  They do a 5-star job at a 3-star hotel.  Everything was kept really clean as well, which is really the most important thing.  Bed was very comfy.  The only negatives, was I would have liked the availability of a room safe (though they have a deposit box at the desk I believe), and like someone else said, the towels were a bit thin. Other than that, great price, good mid-town location, and great overall hotel.

title: Great value, location, & Friendly staff
text: This hotel has a lower star rating than I usually pick. The hotel was surprisingly good. The towels are not as fluffy as four star hotels, but the price is not as fluffy either. The breakfast was simple but very good. I liked the fresh fruit. The subway is a very short walk in either direction. so it is very easy to get anywhere in NYC in a short amount of time. It is a short walk to Madison Square Garden and Macy's. Lots of shopping and good restaurants are just a short walk. 28th street is lined with flower wholesalers so if you like flowers it is very nice.

title: Excellent, superior customer service.
text: I have never experiences friendlier customer service, from checking in to checking out. I  booked the room for the great price on Travelocity, and was happily surprised that this reasonably priced room had superior customer service. It was a fairly typical mid-range room, and the towels were not thick, plush towels you get at the finest hotels. But the room was quiet, the bed was very comfortable, the included breakfast just right, and the view of the Empire State building quite nice. This was a terrific location for me, and I cannot overstate how nice the members of the staff were.

title: Localização excelente
text: Estivemos no hotel em dezembro de 2012 e chegamos as 6 horas da manhã do dia 25 de dezembro e infelizmente todos os quartos estavam ocupados. Tivemos que esperar no saguão até que algum quarto ficasse vago, o que ocorreu as 10:30 da manhã.  Tal situação não foi culpa do hotel, poiso check inn só iniciaa tarde, e eles ofereceram para que tomássemos café da manhã enquanto esperávamos, o que foi bem positivo. A cama é grande e macia, o quarto é um pouco apertado com as malas e o banheiro também. Não gostei do carpete no quarto e o ar condicionado/aquecedor foi um item que nos incomodou durante todo o tempo. Estávamos no inverno e o aquecedor é automático e ao colocar uma determinada temperatura, ele aquecce até chegar nela e depois desliga até ficar bem fri. As vezes o aquecedor passava a esfriar o ar como ar condicionado e essas constantes mudanças intensas de temperatura eram muito desconfortáveis. Chamamos por diversas vezes a manutenção mas eles não resolviam.  Na noite de natal, que para eles ocorre no dia 25, o hotel só ficou com 2 pessoas para atender o hotel inteiro. Tudo fecha em Nova York no dia 25/12 a noite, nem Mac donalds funciona. O hotel não tinha restaurante nem serviço de quarto o que fez muita falta nessa noite.  Meu marido estava ardendo em febre e não encontravamos onde comer ou comida para entrega.  Ao caminhar pela rua, achamos um restaurante oriental esquisito e comemos qualquer coisa lá, isso após ligar para todo tipo de lugar e após o pessoal da recepção nos informar que realmente tudo fechava e que não encontraríamos comida. O café é no estilo americano, self-service de comida pronta e tinha sachês da starbucks, não é meu estilo de café da manhã,  achei bem mais ou menos, mas pelo memos tem, o que é raro em Nova York. A localização é excelente, dá pra fazer tudo a pé em Midtown.

title: GREAT STAY IN NYC!!
text: I recently took my daughter on a mother/daughter trip to NYC, neither of us had ever stayed there before so we were a little nervous and not sure of where to stay and what to do since there are so many options!!  I have to say that upon our arrival to the hotel we were pleasantly greeted by Thomas at the front desk and I have never felt so welcome or been treated so nice.  He made us feel right at ease and gave us great tips on where to go and good places to eat.  One suggestion was Waldy's pizza right around the corner, if you like thin crust pizza and at a very reasonable price, then this is the place to try. We also had the best Chinese food ever at a little place in Chinatown called Wo-Hop. It is at 17 Mott St., it's in the basement of the bldg, its not fancy but excellent food and also at a reasonable price.  Our room at the hotel was very clean and it was located on the 17th floor of which we never had to wait long for the elevator.  Another great plus about this hotel is that it is located only two blocks from the Empire State Bldg, Macy's, Madison Square Garden & the Manhattan Mall.  Thanks again Thomas for making our stay so pleasant!!

title: Favorite hotel in NYC
text: Stayed here for only night beginning of March 2014. Great staff. The location is amazing, you got the one train only a block away, 34th street is only 7 minutes away by walk. Despite the location, the hotel is somehow not on a busy street. The room is bright, really clean and in good size for a NYC hotel room. The only problem I had was the fact that my room was next to the elevator and its "bell" sound was really loud. I called the reception to change the room, but they told me that it was too late of time, which I thought was odd. However they did send me earplugs, which was a nice gesture. I would defintely stay here again, but will make sure that I wont get the same situated room.

title: Great room & ideal location!
text:
Hotel room with King bed was perfect for mother/daughter trip.  The room was on the back side of the hotel on 10th floor, so it was quiet.  The individual thermostat for the room worked great and was not noisy at all.  The bed was comfortable and the bathroom much larger than we expected for a midtown Manhattan hotel.  Coffee maker, hair dryer, and iron/ironing board were all in the room as well as hi-def flat screen tv (which we only watched a bit at night before crashing from exhaustion after exploring the city all day). 

Right in the middle of the flower district, it was a joy to walk out and see flowers & plants on the sidewalks in all directions.  The hotel is perfectly situated between 6th & 7th aves, with Herald Square being a short walk north to 34th.  Times Square wasn't much farther at 42nd.  The High Line is about a 15 minute walk to the west.  Empire State Bldg was close also.  We flew into Newark and took train to Penn Station, also only a 5 minute walk to the hotel.  Cannot say enough about the ideal location! 

Breakfast was good and the service was great.  Fresh baked cookies most afternoons - yum!  Will definitely stay here again.

title: 50th Birthday Celebration
text: Lovely hotel.  Considering how busy NY is we managed to get a quiet room as requested.  All of the staff were so helpful and friendly and efficient. Outside the hotel was beautiful as all the shops were florist/gardening shops and the pavements were covered in flowers. The hotel was ideal for walking to many of the top attractions.  We don't usually bother with breakfast but we were set up for the day after indulging in breakkie.The room was very clean and spacious for the small amount of time we spent I it. Would definitely stay again.

title: Good location, great room
text: Recently stayed here for a long weekend. Enjoyed the property. Service was wonderful, everyone I encountered was friendly and professional. Property seems new and is in good shape. Provided breakfast is OK, nothing to get too excited about but does the job. Room is comfortable and well thought out. Biggest drawback-no in room safe. Really? Is this the only place without these now? Yes, they have safety deposit boxes at the front desk, but that is not all that convenient, nor coudl hold laptops. Convenient to midtown, Penn Station, Theaters and Grand Central. Provided an excellent stay. Even with a front room on the 2nd floor, had no issues with noise and slept with no issues.

title: Great hotel, great location!
text:
We stayed here for an extended weekend recently and found the hotel to be modern, very clean, with a standard but tasty breakfast included in what we found to be a great rate for the heart of NYC/Manhattan. 

Thomas checked us in and was very friendly and warm. We had a room facing nowhere (didn't matter, we only used the room for sleeping) and we had two double beds that was very comfortable. Room was small, clean and bathroom was spotless. Hotel was super quiet, I slept 10 hours straight on Sat. night - one great benefit of a room facing the back! The hotel is tall and skinny so only 5-6 rooms per floor, keeping it really quiet. We never heard a sound. 

We only had one issue - the interior shower curtain had mold all over the bottom. We left to wander around for a couple of hours and asked for the problem to be fixed and by the time we got back two hours later, we had a brand new shower curtain - very prompt customer service!

The front desk staff in general are very friendly - Brandi stood out for being so fun and friendly, giving us directions and loaning me a brand new hair dryer to dry off my jeans in the lobby that were soaking wet from a huge water bottle spill!  She was very helpful/great sense of humor. 

The location is excellent - walkable to great restaurants, Broadway and lots of "neighborhoody" places that aren't filled with tourists. We had a lovely weekend weather-wise and since this hotel is smack in the middle of the Flower District, the streets smelled wonderful! 

This was my first trip to NYC and will stay here again on my next trip. Highly recommend.

title: très bon hôtel en tout point, très belle surprise
text:
nous avons séjourner dans cette hôtel 3 nuits, nous avions une chambre pour 4 adultes.

l’hôtel est très propres, idéalement placé,
le personnel est très accueillant et serviable

le petit déjeuner gratuit est très complet, ne vous attendait pas a avoir des croissants et pain au chocolat ni d'expresso, vous êtes au USA donc vous aurez bagle, muffins, pain, salade de fruits, oeuf brouillé.....  

de plus nous avons été surclasser a l'arriver sans rien demander ce qui nous a permis d'avoir deux salle de bain et une chambre plus grande.

nous y retournerions volontiers, nous travaillons en hôtellerie en France, nous nous attendions a un hôtel moins qualitatif vu le tarif que nous avons eu.

title: Great value in the middle of Manhattan
text: Newly remodeled hotel with breakfast and very close to Penn station so very accessible for travelers. Stayed three nights - very clean rooms and friendly staff.  Too bad the rooftop bar was closed for the season, would've been a nice icing to this review.

title: Comodissimo
text: E' un albergo in posizione strategica sia per muoversi a piedi che in metro. Molto pulito,arredamento gradevole. Le camere confortevoli con vista sull'Empire, il bagno con doccia mega. La colazione varia e buona ed il personale gentile. Prezzo ragionevolissimo per quanto offerto dalla struttura.

title: Muito Bom
text: Estivemos em dezembro 2013 e adoramos o hotel. Muito bem localizado, perto do Empire States, Macy's, comércio variado e metrô. O quarto muito bom e o café da manhã razoável, padrão americano e preço justo.

title: Totally average
text: We had booked a king bed room but was told only the double room was ready when we checked in after 2pm. After a long journey, we decided to go with it. Bad move. The room was small and with two double beds, there was hardly any room left for our luggage. We ended up using one of the beds for our luggage and slept on the other. There was no view as well, we faced another building so we had to keep our blinds closed the whole time. Location was convenient enough, two subway stations (separate lines) within walking distance. The street the hotel is on is full of florists and not much else. It's not on the pretty end of Chelsea for sure. If not for the good price we got via Priceline - $143/night (considering how expensive hotels are in NYC) it would have been a total let down.

title: excellent value lovely staff
text:
I booked this hotel last minute when I was already in NYC and had to quickly leave a flat that got invaded by cockroaches!!! it was Fashion Week so Manhattan was packed and hotels super expensive . but I found a great tariff on the hotel website.
conscious that the rooms were not big , I anyway found this small hotel perfect : the amenities and cleanlyness of  the room make you forget about the size. 
complimentary breakfast in the lovely veranda was a plus and last but not least , I want to mention the amazing staff , especially at the front desk : extremely efficient , welcoming and always cheerful without being intrusive!  they really made my days!
funny how some reviewers complained about the street being the flower market !! I found the location amazing : stepping outside the hotel , smelling the amazing scent of flowers and seeing all the bright colours could make me immediately in a good mood !
it's not a super luxury hotel but if you are not looking for that and don't want to spend a fortune, this is your choice, I would definetely go back again!

title: Great deal in a nice location
text: My wife and i stayed here on a recent business trip.  This hotel is in a great location.  Right around the corner from Madison Square Garden and less than a 10 minute walk from Union Station.  It is also very close to both Times Square and Rockefeller Center.  The rooms are very small, but that is fine with us.  We spent more time out in the city than in the room.  The staff is very friendly.  There is a decent fitness center in the basement.  They have a nice complimentary breakfast each morning.  The hotel is very quiet.

title: Room with a view
text: So when checking in I asked for a room with a view I was told they didn't have any left so I asked again just seeing and was told I reserved a king room which are in the back.  I booked on Priceline with an option of either a king or double no option for a room with a view. So then I checked on there website and I could book a king room with a view so I guess I just felt lied too. I just enjoy a view when I'm in nyc. The room was nice enough, small, no room for stuff in the bathroom on the counter and no place to put your clothes. Was a good price but I like a view so I wouldn't stay here again.

title: Not a businessman's hotel - tiny rooms no facilities
text:
This is not a hotel for a business traveler ... which for some is good but for a business traveler I would say go someplace else.

I had a quick business trip to New York so I booked an overnight here.  The room was clean and the staff friendly.  The room was also quiet, all points I value but it ended there.

The room is however tiny small (much smaller than competing hotels across the street or one or two blocks away where I have stayed in the past).  The heat control in the room is poor and the desk is a tiny table wedged in a corner.  Every time I tried to get out of the desk chair (it is the only chair in the room) it was banging into the heater or the bed because the room is so SMALL and the desk is stuck in the corner.  

The heat seemed to have one setting on or off.  I would get cold so I pushed the thermostat up one degree and then the room would get boiling hot so then I pushed it down a degree and it would go off and never come back on (or worse yet one time the a/c kicked on) till the point the room was so cold you had to go push it back up a degree.

Also the room has no draws or anyplace to put clothes or anything down. To work I had to spread out things on the bed.  There are tiny (useless) shelves in a corner and a small cupboard with hangers.  I ended up using the stone windowsill which meant everything got freezing cold.  Only other place would be to pile things on the floor and climb over them because there is no chair or bureau or .... Same in the bathroom no counter top or shelf or place to put anything other on the very small edge of the sink.

They say they have a "full service business center" but that turns out to be two computers in the corner of the breakfast room.  I had a word processing file to print out but there are no programs on the computers.  I asked at the front desk and the staff said they would look into it.  I asked later in the day and they attitude was "oh well" and the staff suggested you can go down the street to Staples. (As I pointed out later to the manager if I go down the street I can go the Indigo Hotel or the Hilton or the Holiday Inn or the Doubletree or .... all within a stone throws and better equipped for travelers.)  I said that is not a business center and the response from the front desk: complain to management.  I said you are management as far as a guest is concerned and they laughed.  I did later complain to management that the computers had no programs like Word and the response was we can not do that because of licenses.  I have stayed in a LOT of hotels (business oriented and otherwise) and this is the only one which does not have its computers set up with a basic programs.  The manager says you can down load a viewer program if you want.... really if you say you have a "full service business center" and want to have business travelers you need to be better set up and not expect us to be searching out and downloading programs or going down the street for a BASIC service.  

Personally as I said I would suggest one of the other hotels all within a block or two (some across the same street) any of which I have had better experiences with than this one when I stayed at those other hotels.

For a hotel in the Marriott band I expected better service and better facilities.  This hotel comes across as discount no service hotel.  Is that what Marriott wants?

title: Fairfield Inn - Chelsea near F.I.T.
text:
Only a few blocks from Penn Station, one block from F.I.T. and if you must shop big box - there's a Macy's right near Penn Station. The hotel was clean - very clean, the room was quiet, the staff polite, the bed was spotless and it had a comfortable topper. In fact, it was so comfortable I didn't want to leave the room.
Breakfast was included and full - everything a normal person would want. No sour fruit, everything was fresh. The breakfast area was really inviting as it was off the back of the hotel and had glass windows for bright and positive atmosphere.
Oh - FREE WI FI - a note to all the hotels that charge for this feature: I consider this when selecting a hotel. There's nothing more annoying then paying $10.00 to connect with a laptop.

title: Great Hotel
text: I recently stayed at this Hotel and I have nothing but good things to say.  The Hotel is in a great location, breakfast was good, room was clean and comfortable.  From the moment I arrived through my stay, the staff were exceptional.  They were professional, kind, friendly, accommodating, and knowledgeable.  I would definitely recommend this Hotel.

title: Fairfield Inn, Chelsea
text: We stayed at here for 2 nights on our way to Paris, and it fit our needs perfectly.  The room was tiny, but not a big concern for us because we were doing a lot of sightseeing and knew in advance that we wouldn't be spending much time in the room.  The location was convenient, close to the multiple subway lines.  The hotel was clean, well decorated and the staff was accommodating.  They were able to provide early check-in and also hold our luggage after checkout.  The free breakfast was better than most for this type of hotel.

title: Perefect location and great place to stay
text:
Our second visit and every bit as good as the first. Hotel was a bit quieter than on our last visit in June 2013.
We had a room on the eight floor overlooking West 28th. Elevator was outside our door but very little noise. Shower pressure was excellent. Room was nice and clean and no noise from adjoining ones.
Breakfast was decent and they kept everything replenished. Parking (validated) was perhaps a three minute walk across Sixth Ave and cost only $25 for 24 hours. Staff very friendly, particularly the Dominican gentleman at reception.
Area is great and just far enough away from the Empire State tourist madness to feel you are in the real NYC. Chelsea Market an easy walk and lots of good restaurants further south on Sixth and on Eighth Aves.

title: Perfektes Stadt Hotel
text: Wir waren 5 Tage in New York. Die Lage ist Perfekt! Es sind zwei U Bahn Linien in der Nähe. 10 min zu Fuß zum Time Square. Saubere Zimmer, kostenloses WIFI funktioniert im Zimmer sehr gut. Frühstück war OK aber immer gleich. Den ganzen Tag gibt es Kaffee und Tee kostenlos im Frühstücksraum, PC und Drucker sind auch kostenlos verfügbar. Personal sehr freundlich!

title: Excelente relacion calidad-precio
text: Hotel muy confortable, personal muy amable, aunque no hablaban español, se hacian entender. Internet: wifi buena en la habitación. Ubicación del hotel: muy buena. Desayuno: Americano muy completo. Si bien la habitación era pequeña para 4 personas, nos arreglamos bien. Limpieza: excelente. Muy recomendable.

title: Custo/benefício, muito bom!
text: Hotel muito bom, bem localizado, perto da Macy's e do Empire State, e da Penn Station, hotel limpo e agradável. Os apartamentos, não são grandes, mas, são confortáveis, tem um ótimo café da manhã, eu recomendo!!!

title: Non male per gli standard USA
text:
Il voto considera gli standard USA (secondo il mio parere molto inferiori a quelli europei).

Posizione: L'Hotel è vicino alla stazione della Metropolitana (Linea Rossa), molto vicino all'Empire State Building e al Madison Square Garden.

Camera: La camera ha il necessario, ampio letto, bagno con ampia doccia ma piccolo lavandino, phon per i capelli, tv con canali prevalentemente americani. Dalla nostra finestra si vedeva l'Empire come richiesto al momento della prenotazione. Negli armadi il numero di appendi-abiti un pò limitato. La temperatura della camera facilmente regolabile.

Pulizia: Ottima

Colazione: buffet abbastanza scarso. La scelta di basa su yogurt e cereali, tutto in scatola. Poca frutta (che finisce molto velocemente) e poca scelta di pane. Avendo soggiornato nei giorni di capodanno era molto pieno, quindi abbiamo trovato difficoltà un paio di mattine a trovare tavoli liberi per la colazione.

Personale: disponibile a rispondere alle domande e sempre al servizio del cliente.

title: good in almost all ways
text:
Stayed here with my son while visiting my daughter in NYC.
Pros: location was great. I love Chelsea. The metro was a couple of blocks away although you could easily walk to midtown. The shower was really good - son made mention of it. Staff here is very pleasant. Cost is not too bad - actually quite good for double beds (which are hard to find in NYC). room was clean. Breakfast was good - eggs were unusually good for a chain buffet. Hotel was quiet - the way the hallway is set up you don't have many neighbors.
Cons: heating unit was not reliable. We had to turn the heat up to 77 to get it to start. Room was very cold when we got there. The fan would switch to cold air once the heat got to the appointed degrees, so you were continually either hot or cold. Also, the unit was very quiet, which was actually a minus in the city - couldn't drown out the street noise (although we were up high, so the noise at night was not an issue). Parking is about a half block away, very convenient and very cheap for NY.
Beds were not the most comfortable. Room was small, but hey, its NY. Bathroom was very small and it would be nice if there were some extra hooks for clothes/towels. 
Overall, a good value for NY but not if you want to hang around your room/hotel.

title: Best Value Hotel!
text: Everything about this hotel was comfortable and it all started with the welcoming and helpful staff.  Hold our bags (many!) - no problem!  extra blankets - no problem! Thomas is the most helpful and cheerful of fellows and even suggested that we push PH to get to the top floor to make snow angels when we arrived weary and cold from the frigid snow storm.  We did it!  and even had a beautiful view of the Empire State Building lit up for the holidays as a background.  Nice breakfast, convenient location, comfy bedding, fair pricing....can't beat this small boutique hotel!

title: Best Marriott staff in the entire chain!
text: The front desk staff did it all:  check-in, check-out, storing luggage, giving directions that would otherwise occupy a huge staff.  Everything was done graciously,  expeditiously, and with great expertise.  Our room was quiet and immaculately clean.  The only very minor shortcoming was thin warn bath towels.  Note that the rooms without a view are the quietest. Would stay again at this great location slightly removed from the throngs of Times Square.

title: Great little hotel, does everything well!
text:
Lots of these types of properties all over NYC now. Three to four windows across and up 15-20 stories, obviously meant to build up due to smaller lots. All major chains have similar designs here. This FF Inn is a real nice find in the flower district...actually half way to Times Square and to Flatiron/ Greenwich Village by foot. Staff is welcoming, diligent and give the level of respect to guests respect Marriott is known for. Nice, modern, albeit small rooms that are quite comfortable in bedding and furnishings. Nice breakfast with eggs, sausage and a a complete array of carbohydrate delights from juices, to raisin bagels to muffins and toast, yogurt, etc. If you ever go to breakfast one hour or less anywhere before it ends, it gets competitive. Good Starbucks joe too!

Parking $25 per night with validated ticket on next block, very short walk back to hotel. Hotel located right off of 6th Ave and W28th behind  a McDonads right on the corner about 150 feet from the hotel and a lineup of flowers and shops as you are among a ton of flower shops in this area. Safe, short walk to Macy's 6 blocks and all the 34th St/MSG area doings.

Highly recommend this property if the cost is right for you. Cozy place to stay and really close to everything, except if you want to see a lot of Broadway shows and want to stay closer to the venues of mid-town Manhattan. And...go to Eataly, Mario Batalli's way over the top trip to Italian food heaven on 23rd and Fifth Ave. WoW !! (short walk)

title: Convenient for every where
text:
If you're spoiled by opulent New York City hotels with concierge desks and opulent decor and bellmen dressed up like the Swiss Guard, this place isn't for you. 

If you want convenience and cleanliness and economics, I highly recommend it. 

First, the cost was considerably less than similar properties farther uptown, in the more touristy area around Times Square. And there was a good breakfast bar that stayed open until 10 on the weekends. You could fill up on a big breakfast, then snack somewhere for lunch to hold you over until dinner, where you then felt comfortable with something nice and expensive.

The staff was always helpful. I'm Lifetime Marriott Platinum and not only did they upgrade me, but also gave an upgrade for others in our traveling party. We had a stunning view of the Empire State Building, all lit up for Christmas, from the 18th floor. (We were a party of six, two adult couples, two boys, 21 & 18.)

The convenience aspect was even better than I imagined. Maybe 100 yards to the 1 train, less than a block and a half to another subway stop, two blocks to still another line. Cabs were plentiful. It's an easy walk to Madison Square Garden and all the Penn Station transportation options, and an easy walk to Herald Square/Macy's/Empire State Building.  The High Line is close by and some in our party made a couple of walks to Times Square/Bryant Park/Rockefeller Center.

There's also even a little more feel of "the real New York," being in more a neighborhood environment, yet it is very safe.

I've stayed at the Waldorf Astoria four times, the Courtyard at Times Square easily that many times and some other mid-town spots on business, but this was terrific for our party of six that was there to play tourist and enjoy the Christmas holidays.

title: Excellent Value and Great Location
text: This was our second stay at this property within 2 months!  That's how much we liked it, with all the choices that the city offers. The rooms are clean, and not that small, but the bathroom is tight. Other guests love the extensive, free breakfast. Very close to Penn Station and multiple subway lines.  A great value choice in an expensive city.

title: Friendly welcome and service
text: The check-in and welcome were easy and warm. Throughout my stay, the staff were friendly and always ready to lend a hand. No complaints at all- recommended for a Manhattan stay. Good location and close by public transport means that if you don't want to walk, the subway is minutes away. Good variety of places to eat in the neighborhood.

title: A great experience in NYC
text:
Had a great stay at the Fairfield Inn.  Spent Thu/Fri/Sat there the week before Christmas.  The value was excellent for the amenities.  I would highly recommend this for anyone spending a weekend in the city.

Room - The room was new, clean and inviting.  It was a little small, but right in line with what I would expect in NYC.  After all, we have stayed at the Waldorf Astoria and for much more money had no more room.

Bath - Small.  A very nice bathroom, but very small.  Two people cannot get ready at the same time.  Once again, we experienced the same size issues at the Waldorf.

Breakfast - Perfectly Adequate.  I stay in hotels quite a bit on business.  Some offer cook to order breakfasts, others have prepackaged pastries.  Like all Fairfields, this is in the middle.  Eggs and sausage taste fine, but are obviously mass produced.  Cereal, bread, yogurt, and other options are also available.  While not fancy, the breakfast is sufficient and right in line with what others offer at this price point.

Location - Convenient.  By subway we found it was (including walking to/from stations):
- 20 minutes from the 9/11 Memorial
- 10 minutes from Times Square
- 12 minutes from Rockefeller Center
- 30 minutes from Central Park

Complaint - Internet.  It continues to baffle me that hotels offer such S--L--O--W internet service and think it is sufficient.  If going back to NYC for business, I would have to rule out the Fairfield.  However, for a leisure weekend it was sufficient to  check my emails.  They really do themselves a disservice by offering such a poor quality connection in such a nice, new hotel.

title: Good for price
text: The front desk staff was very welcoming, we arrived midmorning , hoping to store our luggage, so we could start exploring the city. They took our luggage and offered coffee and snacks and we hadnt even checked inn, all with a smile! The room was quiet, no street noise, we were on the fourth floor. My husband said the heater was noisey, but no worse than most hotel rooms. Good location subway at corner, the hotel is in the flower district. Only complaint, hard to spot hotel, we literally were practically in front of building, per GPS and had to cross street , to ask at the Hilton where the Fairfield was located. The room was adequate, but bath towels very thin and need replacement.

title: I'll try a hotel with heat next time, thanks.
text:
I had a horrible experience at this Fairfield Inn and will try my luck elsewhere. They're too cheap to provide proper heat!  Room was freezing, I turned on the heat and it never adequately kicked in. I raised it to 77 just to get some heat pumping, but it never rose above 65, and I'm being generous on that. I asked for help, the maintenance guy came in and told me that it was 77 in there because the thermostat said so. I complained an hr later, and the front desk told me that they cap the heat to save energy costs. Nice in the fall, bad when it's 20 degrees outside with snow on the ground. The "tip" was to set it to 74, so that the room would at least heat up to that temp. But it never even got there.

Worse, my room didn't even have an extra blanket. As is, the comforter on the bed was way too thin for a winter day, even with heat. There's no way I could have spent the night there without the extra blanket. So for $250, I had the privilege to sleep in thermals. 

Beyond that, the free WiFi was horribly slow and unusable. Even the wired Internet connection cut in and out constantly. Horrible for a business traveler. Second, someone on my floor was smoking weed at 4pm on a Monday. When I asked to change rooms to a non-smoking floor, they informed me that the whole building was non-smoking. I don't think they ever caught the guy because my room smelled again when I returned to the room later that night. So that's unlucky on my part, but still made a bad experience even worse.

So no, never staying here again. I'll only give it a 2 star because it was relatively clean and surprisingly quiet.

title: Who likes dial-up internet??
text:
For those who yearn for those days of the 90s & early 00s - this place will please you.  There is Wi-Fi in the rooms, but at least in my room it's ponderously slow, so it's just like dial-up.

Otherwise, it's an OK place.  The room has a decent-sized flat screen TV & a decent selection of channels.  Some channels are in HD, but not all.  The room is on the smallish side, but it is NYC so space is at a premium.  My room has only a shower, which is fine for me, but may not be for everyone.  The towels are on the thin side, but passable.  There seems to be plenty of hot water.
The iron & board was handy to give my wrinkled shirts a fresher look from out of the suitcase.

The hotel does offer a nice free breakfast.  I was told there's a small gym on-site, but I didn't look for it. The location is conveniently located to get to many NYC attractions.

title: The best!
text: We stayed here before our flight to Rome and loved the place and all the staff.  We booked it again for our return from Italy four weeks later.  Again it was just the best.  I wouldn't stay anywhere else in NYC.  Price wise it cannot be beat, it's spotless, great location, quiet, good breakfast, super comfy beds, everything works perfectly, and I cannot say enough about the staff - they're wonderful. Not one single negative for this place.  Ask for a room with a view of the Empire State Building.  Our room on our return had one and we got such a kick out of seeing the lights on it change each night.  We had no idea it did that.  Thank you Fairfield for giving us a perfect place to rest our weary heads.  We'll be back!

title: Very dissapointed !!
text:
The rooms here are very nice (updated, clean and not a bad size for NYC) and the location is great. The lack of customer service my entire trip was very disappointing though,especially the last day when I've discovered that I've been overcharged and it seemed like they wouldn't want to take responsibility for any mistake. I've booked,like every time before that,through booking.com,and I have been given a total price,including the 14.75% tax!excluding city tax. It may have been a mistake they've made when it was advertised on the website,but that's got nothing to do with me. I am actually dealing with this matter as we speak,because they wouldn't even consider looking into this,they've still charged me extra.
The receptionists,they were two that day,ganged up together and the lack of professionalism and the way there approached the whole situation made me feel as if I am a 5 year old who doesn't understand a thing,even though I was the one reading to them their "terms and conditions".
It was my 40th birthday trip to New York,something I've dreamed a very long time,but it's been spoiled by two very aggressive and loud ladies,who I personally think they should take a different customer service approach.
The room was small(nothing bad,just a little too small then I expected),but extremely clean. Breakfast staff was very polite and professional. 
Not a good experience!
19th of November,just in case you need to find the names of the two ladies in duty.

title: Ottimo Hotel
text:
Abbiamo soggiornato presso questo Hotel nella settimana del Thanksgiving Day, e lo abbiamo scelto seguendo il giudizio dei precedenti ospiti ma soprattutto tenendo conto del rapporto qualità/prezzo.
Confermo quanto detto dagli altri utenti, ossia la presenza di personale disponibile a soddisfare qualsiasi tua esigenza, la valida e abbondante colazione inclusa e soprattutto la pulizia della struttura.
Noi abbiamo soggiornato al 4° piano con vista sull'Empire state Building. La camera è silenziosa e ben riscaldata, grazie alla presenza del riscaldamento autonomo.
Nonostante vi sia un bel via vai di persone, tutto rimane molto insonorizzato; forse ogni tanto si sente suonare il clacson delle macchine ma è normale per una grande metropoli come NY.

Consiglio vivamente di soggiornare presso questa struttura.

title: Buon compromesso
text: Sto soggiornando al fairfield con la mia famiglia nel periodo della festa del ringraziamento. Albergo estremamente FUNZIONALE, camere ben arredate, piccole ma calde e pulite, letti comodi, bagni adeguati, colazione compresa anche se un pò povera, posizione centrale e ben collegata. Esiste certamente di meglio a New York, ma specie in questo periodo in cui i prezzi degli alberghi a Manhattan sono a dir poco imbarazzanti, l'hotel rappresenta una scelta estremamente vantaggiosa che mi sento di consigliare a chiunque. Tornerei.

title: Buon albergo, ottimo rapporto qualità/ prezzo
text: Abbiamo soggiornato 4 notti con amici in due doppie al 15• piano. Staff cordiale e disponibile. Vicino alla metro. Pulito. Arredamento buono e rinnovato da poco. Colazione buona inclusa nel prezzo. Wifi veloce . Consiglio un soggiorno a tutti

title: Excellent location ...good value !!!!
text:
The best thing about this hotel is the location. It is walking distance from Penn station. We landed at Newark airport and there is a direct train from Newark to Penn so it was very convenient. It is also very close to times square which is the centre of all activities in New York.

Hotel checkin process was very smooth, rooms were excellent, very neat and clean, had everything one can ask for. Bathrooms were neat and clean. Has complimentary internet with good connectivity throughout the hotel.

Other great thing about the hotel is that it also serves good basic breakfast. So you dont have to go outside in the morning in search of food. Hotel is also close to quite a few Indian restaurants so if you are like me who misses Indian food after two days then this is again a great place to stay.

Staff is very helpful and does all things possible to make your stay comfortable. 

Great hotel, excellent location.

title: Incredibly friendly staff
text:
Everyone from the front desk to the housekeeper was gracious and welcoming.
I'd stay here again just because of the excellent staff.
Good location (very easy walk from the Mega Bus stop.)

The free breakfast was a nice addition in NY (one reason I chose this particular Marriott.)
And free wifi is always great.  (Every hotel should do this.)

title: Great location, good value, g
text: When I arrived at the hotel very late at night, I was pleased to discover that all the positive reviews of this hotel were warranted.  First, the hotel is a newly constructed building, rather than a remodel or retrofit of an existing building, and it is contemporary in design.  The rooms are small, as one might expect in the heart of New York City, but they are cleverly laid out, clean, and comfortable.  A short walk to Penn Station and various midtown subway lines.  Parking in this block is free on the weekends, if you are lucky enough to find a space (I was), and since it's in the middle of the flower district, it seems to be a safe place to leave your car on the street.  Breakfast is included in the price of the room, offering plenty of variety and a spacious dining area including a glassed-in courtyard.  Front desk staff were very friendly, both at check-in and check-out.  I needed an affordable (at least for New York City) place to stay with easy access to Penn Station -- and this hotel fit the bill very nicely.  I'd recommend it without any hesitation.

title: Excellent stay!
text: This was a perfect hotel in an excellent location.  It was a girl's weekend away and we planned our outing well with the great access to subway lines.  Walking distance as well to great areas - Union Square (south) and 34th area (north).  Room was very clean and beds were so comfy.  The breakfast was fantastic with great coffee, eggs, toast, yogurt etc.  Staff were very kind and arranged an excellent airport service to Newark on our departing day.  Thanks for being part of another fabulous trip to NYC!

title: Second visit, same excellent value stay
text: I stayed here previously and this place it still going strong. Very clean, well maintained. Close to several subway stops and many main attractions. This is a simple hotel with no lounge or restaurant but they do provide a nice continental breakfast daily. With an amazing selection of dining options within a 5 minute walk, it is not a problem to find a good place to dine!  Rooms are small but so a most in NYC. No frills, exceptionally clean hotel with well-trained staff...

title: Comfy and convenient
text: I was very pleasantly surprised - excellent hotel at a very reasonable price.  Walking distance from Penn Station; easy access to subway.  Lovely during the day when the flower district vendors have their wares out on the sidewalk.  Very nice breakfast with excellent coffee.  Cool roof-top garden. The staff was very accommodating as I had several requests such as late check-out.  My room was very nicely appointed and the bed and linens were very comfortable.  I would stay here again!

title: Excellent with a few caveats
text:
Much better than I expected either from Fairfield Inn or a Chelsea location.  Anyone who knocks the location doesn't know NYC.  Half block from either the 7th Ave. line (West Side) or the N Train (East Side).  Half a block from FIT and amidst the flower district.  Couldn't figure how to get some home.

Staff was uniformly great.  All smiles and all helpful.  Room was as good as any four-star hotel, minus all the freebies (water bottles, etc.) but small as you'd expect in Manhattan.  Bed was excellent.  Breakfast was complete, but not exactly gourmet (the eggs, sausage and whatnot could have been cooked better, but this was a $200. room, not a $800. room).  

My biggest issue was the noise on the City Side.  The windows are double panes, but high above 6th and 7th avenues you can hear the sirens during the night.  Might be next time I'd surrender the view and choose the back side of the building.  Would stay again!

title: bom antendimento
text:
Estivemos hospedados em março de 2013 e achamos o hotel bastante razoável, com um bom custo x benefício. As instalações e equipamentos  estão de acordo com o esperado para a categoria e o café da manhã também dentro dos padrões da tarifa cobrada e anunciada. 
O ponto negativo fica para a vizinhança que não e´ das melhores mas que não chega a comprometer.
O ponto positivo fica por conta das atendentes da recepção que nos ajudaram em nossas reivindicações. 
Resumindo o hotel esta dentro de todas as expectativas informadas e anunciadas antes da estada.

title: Excellent hotel!
text: Excellent hotel!  Bright, new, clean and quiet. Extremely friendly staff and terrific location allows easy access to all points of Manhattan; walking, subway, or taxi. Every hotel should be this clean, efficient, and easy!  Thank you Fairfield staff!

title: Nice hotel-lousy location
text: Very nice hotel. Room,staff, free breakfast and the price were all great. Not much going on around hotel though. Next time I would stay a little closer to "the action". I prefer more bars, restaurants around my hotel and I like to walk back and forth to the hotel. Would not like to walk back to this hotel at night by myself as there's nothing but a McDonalds open at night.

title: Limpo e confortável
text: A localização é muito boa. No distrito das flores, próximo ao metrô e bem perto da Penn Station. Café da manhã correto, quarto confortável e silencionso e atendimento atencioso. Preço comptetitivo, considerando estar em uma cidade muito cara.

title: Good value, location, service
text:
Had a weekend getaway with my wife. We wanted to stay closer to Chelsea and The Village rather than uptown as we have done in the past. Also didn't want any surprises so as a Marriott Rewards members I was familiar with the hotel standards and amenities.

Pros:
- Very easy access to subways to go just about anywhere.
- Location close to Chelsea and Greenwich Village sights.
- Located on flower district street. A beautiful, aromatic walk on the sidewalk.
- Clean, quiet, modern room.
- Free breakfast. Free coffee. Free WiFi.
- Really great front desk service. Fast, friendly check in. Evening front desk (Robert) gave us good advice on local bars and restaurants. (Try "230 Fifth" rooftop bar and "The Library" at the NoMad hotel.) Plus EVERY employee we bumped into was friendly, smiled and said hello. That doesn't always happen.
- For NYC the price was a good, competitive price.

Cons
- Breakfast not exactly Five Star but we were very pleased with it. We just wanted basic eats so we could get on the move for the day. If you want fancy or full service, go somewhere else. Marriott brands serve Starbucks. Coffee drinkers either love or hate Starbucks. We aren't all that fond of it.
- The hotel footprint is a rather small square. This makes the reception area and breakfast area kind if tight and congested. Also, saw prior comments about one guest being close to the elevators. The elevators are in the center of the building so ALL the rooms are near the elevator towers. Our room was just across from the elevator doors. NOT ONCE did we hear any elevator noise. Bottom line this is a non-issue.

We would highly recommend our new go-to hotel. Thanks to the management and staff at this hotel. We had a very nice stay.

title: otimo!
text: otimos atendentes, otima localizacao, bom cafe da manha e excelente custo beneficio. Fica na rua de comercio de flores e durante o dia a calcadas ficam coloridas com todos tipos de flores. Cobertura com excelente vista para o empire state

title: Well located for Silicon Valley East
text: While the room was small compared to most hotels I've stayed in, that's normal for NYC.  But this is a very clean hotel in a bustling neighborhood  just off 6th Ave (Avenue of the Americas).  It is in the floral district so there are beautiful plant out on the sidewalk every day.  Very convenient to Penn Station.  Breakfast is ok.

title: No merece la pena
text:
Sabemos todos que los hoteles de Nueva York tienen las habitaciones pequeñas, hasta ahi todo normal, pero cuando otros factores te amargan la estancia es hora de cambiar de hotel.
Ropa de cama vieja, manchada y sucia, toallas de bano desgastadas hasta el punto de traslucir,personal sin agrado ni modales, todo esto son señales de la mala gestion de direccion.
Casi te sientes como un huesped rehen, teniamos reservado una semana y estuvimos solo 3 noches, no merece la pena que un hotel mal dirigido te arruine las vacaciones.
Me he alojado en otros hoteles Fairfield donde el personal sonreia y si habia algun problema hacia lo posible por solucionar, pero en este es que todo era pesimo.
El precio es caro, como todo en Mahanttan, pero por un poco mas tienes un hotel decente,limpio y que al menos te hace sentir apreciado como cliente.
No merece la pena jugarte las vacaciones por ahorrar un poco.

title: Proximo do metro
text: Hotel simples, mas sempre limpo e arrumado. O atendimento da recepcao bem solicita e auxiliadora quando necessitamos de ajuda. Perto de duas linhas de metro o que facilitou bastante a nossa locomocao. O cafe da manha, basico,  ajudou a sairmos para os passeios sem precisar procurar por alimentacao imediata.

title: bonne pioche
text: Notre expérience sur 8 jours est positive. Elle confirme les derniers avis transmis. Bonne localisation centrale dans la rue du marché aux fleurs, et accès faciles à de multiples lignes de transport. Chambre au 3ème sur cour, certes avec moins de vue, mais silencieuse, ce qui est pain béni dans cette ville. Seul bémol peut-être : les portes des chambres peuvent claquer en se fermant, gênant quand le voisin rentre à point d'heure. Sinon, bonne isolation entre chambres. Belle télé.  Lit excellent et large ! Salle de bains pratique. Le tout est propre. Personnel très aimable. Petit déjeuner inclus et correct.

title: Un gran hotel muy bien situado.
text: Estuve alojada en este hotel junto con mis padres y novio y esta genial en cuanto relación calidad-precio. Naturalmente todos los hoteles en Manhattan son caros y de habitaciones pequeñas, pero este por suerte no es de esos que ademas de ser caros tienen habitaciones minusculas. Este hotel tiene unas habitaciones no muy grandes pero en las cuales te puedes mover perfectamente por la habitación, el baño esta muy bien, muy nuevo. Y la situación es excelente, muy cerca del Madison Square Garden y a un paseo de diez minutos de Times Square. Tiene un desayuno buffet fabuloso y unas camas comodísimas. Sin duda si vuelvo a Manhattan iré a este hotel.

title: ÓTIMO HOTEL EM NY
text: Ficamos por 3 noites neste hotel e adoramos. É um hotel sem luxos, mas com tudo que se precisa para uma boa estadia em Manhattan. Nosso quarto ficava no 14º andar e tinha uma vista maravilhosa do Empire State! O Chuveiro era ótimo e o quarto tinha um tamanho bom para os padrões de NY. Tudo novinho e funcionando perfeitamente. Os funcionários da recepção sempre sorridentes e gentis. O café da manhã (com uma boa variedade) e wifi estão incluídos na diária. Vários restaurantes,cafés e lojas nas redondezas, inclusive um McDonalds e uma farmácia Duane Reade 24 horas na esquina. Uma quadra da linha 1 e duas quadras das linhas N e R do metrô te levam rapidamente a qualquer ponto de Manhattan. As únicas coisas que poderiam melhorar é ter um cofre no quarto e um frigobar. De resto, tudo perfeito!

title: Excellent staff!
text: Tucked a little out of the way, this is a great option for travelers ready to get out of the hustle and bustle of Times Square, but still needing to stay close by to everything.  Located on 28th Street between busy 6th and 7th Avenues (lots of convenient bars/restaurants, fast food, coffee shops, etc.), with a 1 subway line on the same block and an N and R subway line a few blocks away (not to mention a 6 stop within 10 minutes' walk), the location is ideal for easy access to transportation.  The minor complaint is that this hotel is located in the midst of the wholesale flower business in NYC, meaning the sidewalks are narrowed daily by (a gorgeous array of) flowers and plants, making it a little tough to get down 28th Street.  My room faced out onto 28th Street, so the noise at 4:30am was a little much--maybe try to get a room that faces another direction. The staff at this hotel was terrific; super friendly, helpful with booking a car and storing luggage and ready with a "hello" every time I walked in.  The place is clean, room was very nicely sized, elevators were in good and quick working conditions.  Breakfast room was also modern looking and clean.

title: Excellent séjour
text: Que des points positifs : l'emplacement excellent dans Chelsea, rue agréable (c'est la rue des fleuristes!), proche du métro, nous avions réservé une chambre avec vue (et c'était magique, vue dégagée sur l'Empire State Building!), petit déjeuner copieux, café et thé à disposition toute la journée, wifi gratuit (2 ordinateurs sont à disposition), personnel agréable, chambre très propre, climatisée et bien insonorisée.

title: Bom hotel
text:
Um bom lugar para se hospedar em New York, os atendentes todos muito simpáticos e solícitos. O quarto tinha um tamanho razoável, tudo limpo e organizado.
É bem localizado, numa rua até que tranquila em se tratando de New York.
Tem café da manhã e  wi fi incluídos na diária.

title: Great customer service!
text: The hotel was in a great location and very clean and quiet for NYC. We were in town for a wedding and my husband realized he forgot his tie as we were heading out, we asked if there was a lost and found at the hotel and Thomas at the front desk took off his own tie to give to my husband to borrow! He had an old tie in the back for himself, but wanted to give us one that would match. This was the best customer service we have ever had at a hotel!

title: Fair price for a fair hotel.
text: Nothing but fair! The hotel was quite clean, nice staff, the room was comfortable although very small (Keep in mind if you intend to shop a ton you'll probably see yourself in the middle of bags), breakfast was ok even though it was the same everyday. Guess I got a great deal considering the high season (December holidays), it definitely worths the price. The only ''negative'' thing is the parking availability but it is a NY issue - If you intend to drive you should consider staying in another area.

title: Loved the Location, Nice Staff
text:
We stayed 6 nights here and we welcomed by super friendly staff. They put us on the 2nd floor, it was pretty dark and there was a bad odour coming from the AC unit. We let them know and they had someone come right away to install a new AC unit. We were also moved to a higher floor on the 16th and it was much brighter. 

Hotel is in such a great location, close to subways and so many stores, restaurants and everything you would need in walking distance. 

Loved the free breakfast and coffee each day. That was a major perk. Also free Wi-Fi! That was a big selling feature for us when choosing a hotel. 

Would definitely return to this property in the future.

title: Clean, Friendly, Super Location
text:
We spend a Friday night here and were not disappointed.  Modern décor and amenities, a better-than-average selection of continental breakfast items, and a friendly staff made this a winner.  The location is an easy 5-minute walk from Penn Station, which connects conveniently to MTA subway, area regional transit (LIRR, NJT etc.) and Amtrak.

Added bonus was the nice view of the Empire State building from the room as well as from the rooftop terrace.  There are plenty of restaurants nearby, as well as convenience and drug stores.

title: Helpful and professional staff; good location
text:
This hotel is close to Broadway (about 11 blocks walking. 2 subway stops, 7.50 cab fare). Subway stop on the next block that will take you almost anywhere. Buy a metra card ($1.00) and put money on it. Cheaper and easier than paying for individual rides.
Staff was so helpful and pleasant. Great recommendations for restaurants. Breakfast was included and was just enough to start the day - nothing fancy, but very adequate. Nice atrium for coffee.
Rooms were small, but beds were very comfortable and clean.

title: ottimo rapporto qualità prezzo
text: personale cordiale, ambiente pulito e accogliente, ottima ed abbondante colazione inclusa, caffè a tutte le ore, posizione comoda per visitare a piedi o con mezzi pubblici NYC, metro a un isolato, camere silenziose

title: Solid Choice
text:
We were happy with our room selection for our first stay in New York.  Trying to match price and quality is often a challenge and we believe this hotel is a solid choice.  The staff were friendly and accommodating.  The room is totally functional though a little tight on space, especially the bathroom.  We thought with the KIng City View room we booked and that we had booked the room for a week we would have been a bit higher in the building; as it turned out we had an okay view of the Empire State building from the 8th flr and a much better view of the condo's across the street.  Breakfast each morning was the same but provided everything you needed.  The serving area is quite cramped and a few things could be moved around to make access a little easier but that is a minor complaint.  We felt sorry for the lone staff member who tried to keep all the stations full and clean up at the same time.

The hotel is located near 2 different subway stations and near bus stops heading both downtown and uptown.  Times Square is walk-able (we enjoy walking) at about 20 minutes and even easier with the subway.  Being in the Flower District was interesting watching all the stores move all those plants in and out each day.

The building had a little more noise from the street than we would have liked. The air conditioner was a little loud when it was turning on but really no worse than many other hotels/motels we have stayed at that have individual units in the rooms.  WIth that said increasing the white noise in the room and my wife (who is a light sleeper) wearing earplugs we got the sleep we needed.

There is a Penthouse level that allows you a commanding view of the New York skyline, the only thing that was disappointing was the fans(?) or what ever they were that were roaring on the roof.  Didn't make for a very enjoyable atmosphere on the roof top.

As an aside and nothing to do with the hotel, New York can be very expensive or it can be reasonable.  Do your due diligence if money is a concern it can be the difference between between a $5-$8 glass of wine verses places that there are no selections under $15 a glass.  We were able to find many great restaurants and bars that were fun, had great food and atmosphere.   Though we also went to a few "nice" spots as well, I mean we were in New York after all.  :)

Based on what we were told about New York hotels and prices this hotel was a good choice for us.

title: Good staff but a terrible night's sleep
text:
My husband and I paid extra for a city view room expecting a room on one of the top 8 floors. Instead we were on the bottom 8 with a view directly into the building across the street. 

We could live without a city view - it was the noise that was unbearable. The air con unit's compresser kicks in and out several times an hour and the unit also rattles - it sounds like a plane taking off next to the bed. This, combined with the traffic noise and noise from next door, made for a truly terrible sleep even with earplugs. We've stayed in several Manhattan hotels and dozens of hotels in busy cities like Tokyo and London, and Fairfield is the noisiest. 

The staff were all friendly and helpful but the quality of the building is not in their control. 

I was surprised that the room was dusty, there were small hairs in the shower and on the toilet and the bed sheets were not big enough to cover the unwashed comforter (duvet) - not something you want to wake up covered by. 

The location is good if you want to be close to Penn Station but it is a 20min walk to the nice Chelsea restaurants/shops.

title: TOLLES HOTEL!
text: Sehr schönes Hotel mit überaus freundlichem Personal, speziell zu Kindern! Die Zimmer sind zweckmäßig eingerichtet, für ein Stadthotel groß genug und sehr sauber. Frühstück im Innenhof absolut ok. Die Lage ist nahezu perfekt. Vieles ist zu Fuß zu erreichen und die U-Bahn ist nur ein paar Minuten entfernt.

title: Chealsea Great for the price
text:
Late in my review . However we stayed ther almost when it was refurbished or a new construction. 
THE location was very good in Chelsea. A funky type neighborhood. The room was a classic room, basic  but the beds were comfortable, linens crisp and clean. The room was not huge but good enough for a quick stay and the type of hotel. 
Lots of areas restaurants and the subway was right there. 
The typical breakfast but good enough and varied  enough to get going in the am. The coffee hot and freshly brewed. Good enough for me. 
The Hilton across the street I heard was pretty good as well from family that stayed there as well. 
Good luck. NY has gotten too expensive.!!!

title: Surprised at how good it was
text: This hotel is now on top of my list when visiting NYC.  They are extremely fair in price, located in a good area - convenient to most Manhattan locations, and the staff are top notch.  This was probably the cleanest hotel I have stayed at in NYC.  It feels new or at lease recently renovated.  The elevators were all very quick, never waited longer than 2 or 3 minutes for the elevator.  When you take the rate they charge compared to other hotels in the area, or even of a higher "star" level (many of which I have stayed at) there is no comparison.  You really do get your moneys worth here.  Plus the staff were all very friendly and helpful with any requests or questions that I had.  Walking distance to many cool eateries and drinking establishments.  When you stay here you will get a very clean room, friendly staff, good location not too far away from the noisy Times Square area, and a great bargain for NYC.

title: Great 2nd stay
text: I stayed at the Fairfield inn in Chelsea for a second time and as with the first time it was a great stay. The staff was outstanding as usual. I want to give a big thank you to Brandy at the front desk; she was so helpful to us. We stayed here again because it is close to Penn Station and we just walked from the station to the hotel. The rooms were clean and everything worked as it should have. We found a nice little café around the corner on 7th ave named GiGi café. It was just right for breakfast in the morning. All in all I would say this is a great hotel to stay at and will stay again in December when I return to New York.

title: A Nice Surprise
text: My husband and I stayed here for one night in July. We asked for a city view and got a terrific room that looked out on the Empire State Building. It was terribly hot in New York when we were there, but the hotel was extremely comfortable. It was also very clean. We were particularly impressed by the friendliness of the staff (everyone was great, but Thomas Nuñez and Bethany were especially accommodating the afternoon we were leaving). We enjoyed the free breakfast, and the central location made it easy for us to get around the city.

title: Great find convenient to the subway
text:
My husband had to make a spur-of-the-moment business-related trip to Manhattan and our daughter and I tagged along for the fun of it. We booked a room here based on price, located and a little for the discounted overnight parking rate! The hotel was really nice, neat/clean, modern and on the smallish side. Desk staff was helpful with the parking setup and with holding our bag after check-out to allow us to continue our visit without lugging it around with us. The room was a little tight, but updated. It was good for us with our two days in the city, but I can't imagine where a group of, say, four people there for a week would put their luggage. We were in the back of the building, so our window was literally looking into another building, which was a little strange (caused us to keep the blinds closed). The rooftop deck was awesome!
