Not much up there other than seating, but the view was amazing and so worth the trip up. I think we were up there close to a half hour just staring.

I didn't get to take advantage of the breakfast area, but my husband and daughter did and said that some of the stuff was gone by the time they went down. 

I will definitely stay there again. Maybe with a better view next time ;)

title: Very nice clean hotel and conveniently located
text:
We chose this Fairfield Inn for our first trip to NYC without really reading any reviews beforehand and were really satisfied with our stay. 

Like the other reviewers say, the rooms are very small but it was not a problem since we basically were only there to sleep and were busy all day exploring everything NYC has to offer. We found the room to be very clean which was one of our main worries. Free Wi-Fi service is available throughout the hotel however the speed of the connection is very slow and which makes it only suitable for very light web browsing. The flat screen TV had a nice choice of channels including some premium ones such as HBO.

One of the main problems we had with the room is the lack of available power outlets near the beds. Nowadays we all travel with numerous electronic devices (iPhones, iPads, cameras, computers) that requires charging at night and with three persons in the room it was a little puzzle to get everyone's devices plugged in at night. 

The hotel provides free breakfast every day which includes scrambled eggs, sausage patties, toast, bagels, cereal and fruit cocktail but to my surprise no waffles. I think I have never been to a US hotel that offers free continental breakfast and didn't have a self-serve waffle maker available in the breakfast area. That was a little disappointment for me because I really like hotel waffles but even without those the breakfast was really good.

Located on W 28th Street the hotel is within walking distance from Penn Station which is very useful for those arriving from JFK airport via Long Island Rail Road train. Macy's flagship store and Herald Square are also located close to the hotel as well as a good number of great restaurants. There is also a McDonald's, a Starbucks and a Duane Reade drugstore located within less than 5 minutes walking distance. Times Square is within 20-25 minutes walking distance from the hotel, even tough it is a feasable walk we prefered taking a cab most of the time to go there which is about a 6-7$ ride plus tip.

Overall, we are very satisfied with our stay at this Fairfield Inn location. Being one of the least expensive accomodations we found on Manhattan island we were very impressed with the quality of the service we received from the front desk and housekeeping staff and would not hesitate to stay at this property again on a next visit to NYC.

title: Great hotel - location, rooms, and especially service
text:
Location is a short walking distance from Macy's 5th avenue store. 
Rooms are a bit small but quiet, clean. and provide everything you need for your vacation. Air conditioning, a good shower (not a bath), HD TV, desk, and so on. Wireless internet was very good during my stay.
Breakfast buffe is OK, not too rich in variety but in good quality - Coffee/egg/muffin/bagels/cornflakes/etc. 
Everything is very clean. 
So all of these things were actually pretty good.
What wasn't good, though, was the service.. it was excellent!
The reception desk people were helpful, showing great hospitality to myself and to everyone else I noticed around the reception desk. They provided me with recommendations and help, and generally were very willing to assist.
Would love to stay in this hotel on my next visit.

title: Nice for short stay
text: This is my first Fairfield-in-NY stay.  It is located well, though I usually like to stay closer to Times Square or the Park.  There are a number of nice eateries located within walking distance. Hotel room was quiet (toward rear of building), clean, and the staff was very helpful and courteous.  Breakfast provided was fine.  Room was small, but adequate.  Bathroom was very clean and well-appointed.

title: Great Stay & Staff
text: Stayed here for a weekend, the rooms with the city view are great, very nice unobstructed view of the Empire State Building.  They also have a rooftop deck available for everyone's use. The bathrooms are small, but they are very modern and the shower is great. Thomas at the front desk was very nice and attentive; All the staff that you encounter was very pleasant, and had a smile.  The free breakfast and internet is an added bonus, not to mention you're in downtown NY, walking distance to Times Square and other attractions.  Sahara East Hookah Lounge has become one of my favorite spots as well during my trips to NY.  The Sangria and fries are great!

title: Clean Quiet and Reasonably Priced
text: Perfect hotel for my short 3 day stay. Declined larger front facing room for smaller rear room which was absolutely quiet. Flat screen tv on wall made the small room seem larger than it was. Enough room to work at desk and wifi worked well. Free breakfast was fresh and amply supplied with no waiting.  Staff friendly and helpful. Saved $100/night vs other nearby Marriott properties. If you are looking for a place to sleep and breakfast this is ideal for mid-town. Highly recommended.

title: Helpful staff and Nice Hotel
text:
We stayed in this hotel for 2 nights. Actually it suppose to be 3 nights but when I tried to cancel the booking for the other night they are very helpful and cooperate. 
When we arrive in the hotel we don't know what to expect but the front lady (I forgot her name but she is exceptional) make us feel right at home. She showed us where to park the car -in which we stayed right accross the street for 1 night-, the attraction around hotels and ways to get around the Manhattan. 
The room is sufficient to us and even though nothing fancy come atop, we get a feeling that the room is very comfortable. We were right, the bed is exceptionally comfortable.
The hotel had small gym room and ice machine in the basement. Breakfast is part of the room rates and it is good American / Continental breakfast. We really like the place where we had brealfast, the glassroom is so comfy. Staff is also helpful when I asked to heat some leftover we had the other night. 
Overall we are very satisfied and definitely considering to stay there again if we visit New York. Keep us the good job guys!

title: Safe and comfortable
text: I stayed one night here in October 2012 (and have been meaning to write a review since then). As a woman travelling alone, I was very concerned for my safety in NYC but I felt very safe at the hotel, even when I walked back to it after dark. My room was VERY small but it was ok for me; if more than one person is staying in it, you better know each other well. The block is nice during the day - 28th Street is the Flower District with stores lining the street with all kinds of flowers and plants. The front desk kept my bag after I checked out so I could do some more sightseeing. I didn't have the free breakfast (it's NYC - go to the corner store and get yourself a fresh bagel) but I'm sure it was standard for the hotel.

title: Nice Hotel
text: Stayed at this hotel for 2 nights for business and it was very nice.  As with lots of hotels in New York City the room was small but it was very very clean.  The lobby was nice and the free breakfast was outstanding with Starbucks coffee.  I would definitely stay here again, it is in a good location and the price is right.

title: Comfort and convenience
text: After a 30  hour flight we received the warmest welcome from one of the male staff members. The staff did not disappoint from that moment on and were always helpful. Rooms were tastefully decorated and beds were heavenly. The location of this hotel was great because we could get around Manhattan quite easily  being close to two subways stops.  I would recommend this hotel.

title: Great Hotel and Location
text: I spent three nights there while conducting some photography business over on 26th st. The property is between 6th and 7th ave. The  rooms are super clean and modern looking. It is NY so they are smallish, but larger than some other chains offer. The property has a roof top view you can enjoy and on site security personnel.  It sits in the middle of the flower district. Subway access is conveinent, but if you want to catch a cab 6th or 7th ave would be the place. A few restaurants are nearby. A McDonald is on the corner of 6th ave, while the Pot Belly Deli is just around the corner on 7th ave, and a Panera Bread is on 7th ave directly accross from the PotBelly Deli. There is also a restaurant/bar with sidewalk seating beside Panera Bread. The property has a small patio in the front wth a couple of tables and chairs. Good for sitting outside on a pleasant evening while people watching. You can even catch a quick view of the top portion of the Empire State building from the patio. I can't say enough about the staff I came in contact with during my short stay - Thomas, Eunika, Brandi, Leo and Teresa - so courteous,eager to help, and pleasant to talk to. Y'all rock !!

title: Very Clean Hotel in a Great Location
text:
My wife and I stayed at this hotel on the evening of July 13, 2013.  This is the first time we've stayed at a Fairfield Inn, and we were not disappointed.  The hotel is located between 6th and 7th Avenues, which is the Flower District.  There are numerous nice flower shops located within a few feet of the hotel.  The location of the hotel is  ideal for 2 reasons.  First, it is within easy walking distance of several key New York attractions, including High Line Park and Chelsea Market.  Second, the hotel is removed from the more congested areas of New York.  

My wife and I arrived shortly before 1 PM, and there was a room ready on the third floor.  Our checkin went very smoothly.  Our room was very clean and comfortable, although small in size. The bed and pillows were also very comfortable.  Furthermore, our hotel was very quiet, and we could not hear any outside noise.  A free breakfast buffet was included, and there was an outside patio for eating.

Our checkout also went smoothly, and we were allowed to check our luggage while we conducted our sightseeing for the day.  In summary, my wife and I were very satisfied with our stay, and we strongly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting New York City.

title: Great place for NYC visitors on a budget
text: I stayed here one night while visiting New York for a hair convention in Harlem. The hotel is located in a great area, near the subway (1 train) and walking distance from the transportation hub located in Herald Square, including Penn Station and a number of subway trains. The hotel room was small but that is expected for a Manhattan hotel. The room was clean. The front desk staff were friendly and helpful. I arrived several hours earlier than check-in time and the staff allowed me to store my bags there so that I could explore the city while I waited for my room to be ready. The hotel also offers free wifi (a plus) and a complimentary breakfast (e.g., toast, cereal, eggs, coffee, tea, juice, and yogurt). There are also several restaurants and fastfood places nearby. The staff recommended a pizza place a block away that served some of the best flatbread pizza I have had in the city. I would definitely stay there again.

title: Very nice little hotel in a good location
text:
I've spent 10 nights at the Fairfield Inn in June-July 2013. 
The hotel is quite small: 18 floors with around 5-6 rooms per floor.
Rooms were very clean, and my room was quite specious (for a NYC room).
The hotel location is great, with subway stops less than a block a way (red lines and yellow lines).
I've slept on the 17th floor which was quiet 99% of the time (you can easily hear people waiting for the elevator, and the elevator ping, but not across rooms). 
The complimentary breakfast is a great start in the morning. It has everything you need, including fresh cut fruits and pastries.
The stuff was friendly and helpful throughout my stay (though I didn't have any real issue).

Few general comments:
-My room was equipped with a 37'' TV with around 30 channels. 
-I've spent 10 days at the hotel, and my sheets were only replaced after I specifically asked for it (they basically don't replace sheets throughout your stay unless you ask). When asked, they were replaced that day.
-There is no refrigerator in the room. There is a single ice machine in the lower Lobby floor
- The AC system is EXTREMELY loud and weird. When clicking on off, it takes around 10 minutes for the system to actually stop working. Any change of temperature, also requires a long wait before it actually happens. However, the room was always cool enough for my needs.
- The mattress is very soft
- Free Wifi across the hotel and rooms 

Bottom line - a very positive stay and a hotel I will surely get back to.

title: Our best NYC stay so far
text:
Every year we make one to two trips to the NYC area, often staying in New Jersey and taking buses or trains to Manhattan, but this time we opted to stay in the city itself.

As others have written the street itself is awash with color, as vendors sell plants, trees and flowers of every size and description and perhaps for this reason the traffic on 28th was bad. The parking is very close, just after crossing Sixth Ave and was just $25 with hotel validation.

Check in was easy and Bethany who hails from Texas and later Brandi were super friendly and helpful. They allowed us to check in about an hour early at 2pm. Our room on the 8th floor was clean and certainly large enough for the two of us. However it's possibly a little too small to practice the hammer throw or discus!

Air conditioning worked a treat and I must single out the bed as perhaps one of the most comfortable we've experienced so far. I hope Fairfield management can point us toward purchasing a similar mattress! We also loved the bathroom and large walk in shower.

Public areas were spotless, the rooftop "penthouse" (observatory) was a nice distraction and the breakfast area was spotless, cheerful and well stocked - not bad for a free breakfast. I also loved the small number of rooms per floor, resulting in lots of peace and quiet and the elevator responded quickly on all but one occasion. I could say that a small fridge would have been nice, but it's really difficult and probably a little bit unfair to even consider leveling criticism at this superbly run hotel. 

We loved the area too and short walks south on Sixth, Seventh and eight Avenues led to a wide array of excellent eateries with the West Village within walkable distance too. I'm glad too that the hotel is south of the touristy mayhem that seems to start at around 33rd Street and move north. It's a reflection of the location of this hotel that we never used the subway or a taxi during our two day stay. We walked everywhere. I really hope we can stay here again!

title: Great place to stay in NYC!
text: We enjoyed our stay here. The front desk staff were amazing, and our room was well-appointed, albeit small. The bed was SO comfortable! Our room didn't have a view, but that's ok. We were only there to sleep anyway. We liked the free breakfast, and the afternoon cookies were tasty.

title: Great location and price
text:
Stayed at the hotel for 3 days and would definitely recommend it. It had everything you needed for a NYC stay. Good clean room (nothing fancy or not a great view - but this is NYC, so I hadn't expected anything else) and a very friendly staff.
Most of all I have to give thumbs up to the location. You are right by 28th and 6th ave and I found it a great location as my base for seeing everything from Brooklyn, Roosevelt Island, Pier 86 (USS Intrepid), Meatpacking District, High Line, West Village, 9/11 Memorial, Alphabet City and Central Park. I wasn't aware of nor expecting the complimentary breakfast, but ate it one morning and it served as a good starter for any long day of sightseeing, without being a huge buffet, but had everything I needed.
On top of everything - it had by far the best price I could find through any search-tool on the internet.

title: Friendliest & Most Professional Staff Ever.
text: My parents and I recently had the pleasure of staying at this Fairfield Inn over Memorial Day weekend.  As previous reviewers have noted, the location is great, but what really makes this hotel a standout is the staff.  We encountered staff members while checking in, when we came in in the middle of night from sightseeing, and then again at checkout and each time, every person that we encountered was not just courteous in a detached professional way - each person was genuinely friendly, funny, and interested in making our stay pleasant.  The front desk staff were helpful in safely storing our baggage after checkout so we could continue sightseeing and responsive to needs like calling cabs, setting wake-up calls, getting the internet password, etc.  In one instance, a front desk clerk who helped check us in was still at the desk when we returned from sightseeing around midnight and she revealed that another staff member had called in sick so that she would have to stay until about 7 the next morning.  Even though she had every right to be tired and surly under those conditions she was funny and charming.  In speaking with the staff, they not only seemed to care about the guests of the hotel, they seemed to care about each other, which evidently makes it a pleasant working environment that they freely share with the guests.  Coming from the south, I had braced myself for the unfriendliness that is rumored to exist in New York, but we felt as welcome in the City as we have anywhere else in the world - everyone we met, including the staff of this hotel, was fun and friendly.  We had an amazing time.  I don't know who does the hiring for this hotel, but whatever they are doing - they are doing it right.  As an aside, there is a not-very-good movie called "Premium Rush" about bicycle messengers that I recently saw and some of the action in this movie takes place right at the doorstep of this hotel.  So that's kind of cool.  The rooms are pretty small, but the bathrooms are spacious.  Everything was very clean.  Great job!

title: Excellent hotel in prime location
text: Booked the hotel after reading the reviews here and we were not disappointed. We stayed only for one night but will definitely be coming back! The rooms are good size, extremely clean and well maintained. The location cannot be beat! it's in the heart of the city close to absolutly everything. FREE WiFi!!! FREE breakast! And the added bonus is to relax on the rooftop patio with the view of the empire state building after a long day. The people at the front desk were the nicest and so accommodating our request.  Best value for money in NYC!

title: Otimo custo beneficio em Nova Iorque
text:
Hotel novo, limpo, conservado, com cafe da manha de boa qualidade incluido na diaria, com Wi-Fi gratis de qualidade razoavel. A desvantagem e o tamanho do quarto, bem pequeno, mas pelo preco em NY-Manhattan e dificil achar um quarto grande num bom preco.
Recomendo fortemente. Vi na propaganda num voo da American Airlines que os hoteis Marriott que sao da rede Fairfield tem cafe da manha e wi-fi incluidos na diaria.
Eu recomendo este hotel!!!

title: Gute Lage inmitten Manhattans
text:
Wir waren 6 Nächte in diesem Mittelklasse Hotel der Kette "Faifield Inn & Suites" an der 28th Strasse. Wir haben ein Zimmer mit Stadtblick gebucht, es hatte atemberaubende Aussicht auf das Empire State Building (10. Stock). Das Zimmer war gut gedämpft, allerdings wurde nicht sehr gründlich Staub geputzt. Das Frühstück ist für amerikanische Verhältnisse sehr gut, mit reichhaltiger Auswahl an Broten, frischen Früchten, Cornflakes und Joghurts. Auch hatte es Burgerfleisch und Rühreier.

Das Hotel liegt an der 28th Strasse und ist nur 2 Stationen von Times Square entfernt (1,2,3 Linie). Es liegt im Blumendistrikt der Stadt. Gleich um die Ecke gibt es zahlreiche Läden, Delis, McDonalds und Pharmazien. Top Preis-Leistungsverhältnis für ein Hotel an dieser guten Lage.

title: Perfect Location Lovely Hotel
text:
One of the best hotels I have stayed in. The staff were very accommodating considering we were travelling with a one year old.
The hotel is very clean, lovely comfortable beds, great breakfast and excellent staff. We couldn't have asked for more than that.
The hotel is great for walking to most shops. Central to pretty much everything. Having a baby meant it was a hassle getting the metro but the cabs were very accommodating.
The hotel wasn't overly cheap, but the cheapest we could find for this quality

title: Disappointed in management's lack of response
text: I'm writing this review on behalf of my daughter and I who stayed at this hotel for 3 nights...May 31st to June 3rd 2013. This was a mother-daughter get-a-way planned since Jan. We took a shuttle from Newark Airport, and on arrival were greeted by friendly staff. We stayed in room 207 which does not have a good view, but was nice and quiet, so we didn't mind, and like other people have mentioned, we didn't spend much time in our room anyway.  We did go up to the terrace which was fun.  The beds were super comfortable.  Room was clean.  It was great having the breakfast included.  We always found lots to eat. Starbucks coffee was great. We did find our air conditioning very cold.  It seemed like the temperature couldn't be adjusted, so that in a matter of a few minutes, it went from being warm in the room to freezing! Especially with the room being small. We tried leaving just the fan on, but it didn't make a big difference. It was so nice to see all the flowers on the sidewalk as we stepped out in the morning. Overall, we had a great experience there, and I would have returned except for one thing that happened.  My daughter left behind a shopping bag in the wardrobe in our room (never mentioned to me that she had put it in there out of the way). She had gone to one of her favourite stores and bought 2 blouses and had also picked up a souvenir t-shirt and put it in the bag.  We did not put anything else in the wardrobe.  On arriving home, approx. 12 hrs. later, she realized that she had forgot it.  She phoned the hotel the next morning and explained to the staff, described the bag, where she had left it, what was in it, etc.  She indicated that she has a friend who lives nearby and could go and pick up the articles left behind. This friend is actually coming  to our city next month. After a couple of phone calls, she was told that the bag wasn't found. That's it. No other explanation.  She phoned back and left a message with the manager of the hotel, but he did not return her call, and it's been well over a week. There is no doubt in her mind where she left the bag. There must be a policy in place at the hotel for articles left behind, but since my daughter did not hear back, we don't know what that policy is.  So unfortunately this has left a bad taste, and we would not stay there again.

title: Great Stay in NYC!
text:
I really struggled finding a place to stay in the city that wasn't a crackerbox and had standard hotel fare at an affordable price. Prices ranged from $109.00 for a room with a bed and common bathroom to $1000.00 for rooms that looked like standard hotel rooms.  I decided to go with The Fairfield Inn because it seemed like what I had in mind and offered some things that all hotels should include free of charge, those being a continental breakfast and Wifi. Sorry but free wifi is more important than having a phone or Bible.

Nowhere did I see that Wifi was available in all rooms so I took that chance. Wifi is available in all rooms. I told them upon checking out that they need to make sure everyone knows that they offer this and it's a pretty big deal.

What was a bigger deal was how nice everyone was at the hotel. I had perhaps the best experience I've ever had in the city and a lot of it was due to The Fairfield Inn. I was taking a class at the Parsons School and had to print out papers for a test, no problem, printing free of charge, as many sheets as necessary. Candy at the counter, cookies on Sunday, everyone extremely happy to help out with great personality as well, it was just a great experience. The room was $249.00 a night. There were additional taxes and fees upon leaving but I knew that would happen and I think that is the case at any hotel in the city. Those totaled about $40.00 per night and seemed if anything, slightly lower than other hotels I was pricing. I was pleasantly suprised to see the breakfast choices available, also included in the price. Bagels, scrambled eggs, sausage, starbucks coffee, yogurt, more than enough choices.

The room was a little dusty in the corners but this could be just me. I'm a little wary of bedbugs so I gave the place a good going over and saw nooks and crannies that hadn't seen the light of day for awhile. Overall, the room was clean, a decent size, up to date, elevator time was always short, I've got nothing negative to say about this hotel.

title: Rapport qualité prix excellent, emplacement idéal
text:
Excellent hôtel, je dirai bien sur tout rapport. Staff accueillant, convivial, et serviable. Mon épouse et moi étions dans une chambre au 16 ème étage, sur cour, spacieuse, et très bien équipée (bureau, 2 chevets,  cafetière électrique), décorée avec goût. Le lit King size XL était super confortable. La salle de bain est suffisamment spacieuse, et la douche est également King size. 
Le niveau "Penthouse" avec terrasse offre une vue magnifique sur l' Empire State Building. Cet endroit est calme et reposant.
Quant à l'emplacement de l'hôtel, il est vraiment idéal, à deux rues de Time Square, proche de l'E.S.B, entre Broadway et 5th avenue. De plus les 2 stations de métro proches permettent d'accéder aux 4 coins de Manhattan, ainsi qu'à JFK airport. Cependant, rien à voir avec l'hôtel, prendre le métro à NYC se rapproche de l'aventure (suppression de lignes ou changement d'itinéraire impromptus, bien écouter les annonces, 10 à 15 mn d'attente entre chaque rame) - A part quelques stations célèbres, accès difficile pour les personnes âgées et les handicapés, cependant pas d'insécurité.
Je conseille cet hôtel pour passer quelques jours agréables à NYC.

title: Good price, good location, great customer service
text: I found this hotel in a desperate online search after other accommodations turned out to be a disappointment. I booked this at 11:00 Saturday morning at an excellent price, and hustled over there by 12:30. All of the staff behind the desk hustled to accommodate me, and Joanne in particular helped arrange for me to get checked in quickly. The room is clean, the furnishings are new and, particularly important for NYC when it gets above 90, the air conditioning is excellent. Marriott's higher end brands have been third or so on my preferred list for business travel in the past, and I've tended to favor Hilton Garden Inn or Hampton when paying for my own travel. Service was cheerful, proactive and created an excellent impression of the hotel and of the Fairfield brand. I spent twelve weeks in six trips to NYC on business last year and I've bookmarked this hotel in the browser and will continue to check it for availability. Thanks Joanne and crew for your help! Great experience.

title: Wonderful four night stay!
text:
My husband and I stayed at this hotel for four nights at the end of May 2013 while on vacation.  It was even better than what I expected.  We arrived on Thursday morning (we took the red eye from California) at Newark and took the AirTrain to NJ Transit to Penn Station. Super easy!  Then we walked 5 blocks to the hotel and even though our room wasn't ready, they held our luggage and let us use the restroom to freshen up.  They even said that we could help ourselves to breakfast even though we weren't checked (it was 9:30am).  So nice!  We returned around 2pm and we were quickly checked in and given our room keys to room 1002.  Our luggage was already put in our room.  What a great room!  Tenth floor, overlooking the street below, with a fabulous view of the Empire State Building.  

The room was bigger than expected (one king bed), very clean, had a nice little closet, and the shower was great (no tub, but I'm not a bath person).  The bed was a dream! The only downside was hearing the sounds of honking cars throughout the night, but after one night, we quickly got used to it.  Plus, we ran the fan and it basically zeroed out the traffic noise.  

The breakfast was very nice with a wide range of items, including English muffins, toast, muffins, bagels, fruit, cereal, scrambled eggs, hard boiled eggs, sausage patties, and juice (orange and cranberry).  There was also a coffee station with Starbucks coffee and hot water, with a large assortment of tea and hot chocolate.  Yum!  On weekdays, breakfast ends at 10am, 11am on weekends.

There are also two computers in the breakfast room with printers.  What a nice touch! We used the printer three times so we could print tickets for the 9/11 Memorial and Top of the Rock, in addition to our boarding passes  And best of all, free Wifi in the room!  I find it so crazy that some of the high end hotels out there still charge an arm and a leg for internet access.  It's so nice and refreshing when it is included in your stay, free of charge.  Did I mention that we got a sweet deal on this room?  We booked pretty far in advance, and it was worth it!  We checked the price of the room a few days before we left and it had nearly doubled. 

My husband and I also used the breakfast room one night when we brought our dinner back to the hotel.  It was so much nicer than eating in our room.  There is a large TV in there and it's very relaxing and no one else was there.  

For being my first time in NYC, you can't really beat the location.  We got around mainly by foot, but we occasionally took the subway which was conveniently located on the half a block away.  We walked to most of the sites including Times Square, Theater district, Rockefeller Center, Central Park, High Line, West Village, Chelsea Market, and SoHo.  While some of these sites were farther than others, it was so much fun to see the city by foot.  

A major plus was the local flower market.  It was so nice to step outside the hotel and see these beautiful flowers and plants lining the sidewalk.  

I would definitely recommend this hotel and can't wait to return to NYC.  I'll be back at the Fairfield Inn without a doubt.

title: View of Empire State Building
text: I looked long and hard to find an affordable place to stay in NYC.  I was more than pleased to find that the Fairfield Inn and Suites in Chelsea was more than to my liking.  The rooms were very clean.  Yes, the space is small, but then we are in NYC.  I was also very pleased with my decision to upgrade to the higher floor, with the floor to ceiling windows and view of the Empire State Building. Especially at night with the colored lights at the top. Breakfast was included which was great, with a good variety of food including some style of eggs each day.

title: Great Base for NYC 1st Timers
text:
This hotel is in a fantastic central location in the Flower District. We got to the hotel using the AirTrain and subway from JFK and just walked the 5 short blocks from Penn Station. It was well placed for getting the subway uptown or downtown and we could walk to TS within about 10 mins. The street outside was lovely during the day, with all the flowers laid out and it never felt unsafe when we walked back at night.
Check in was very quick, but we were initially a little disappointed with our room as we looked out at the building(yoga studio) directly at the back of the hotel (4th floor). The room itself was small but had everything we needed and to be honest we only slept and showered there so it was ideal. The bed was very comfortable and by putting our cases under the desk, we had enough space to move about easily.
The complimentary breakfast was ideal, enough choice for us and replenished frequently. The hot drinks were available at any time day or night.
The rooftop terrace was great to see if we were missing out by not paying extra to have a front facing room (great view but as I said we wernt in the room very often). It was fun to be able to pick out the hotel from the top of the ESB - which was only 5 blocks away.
The hotel staff were always lovely and friendly and were happy to answer any questions we had.

title: Best Staff!
text: Had a stressful trip to NYC to move my daughter out of her dorm at FIT and pack her for study abroad in Shanghai. The front desk staff is beyond friendly and helpful! From printing out a final exam project to making a copy of her passport, the staff treated us like family. Especially, George and Brandi! This hotel is located close to FIT on 28th, but also easy to walk wherever you need to go- located between 6th and 7th and close to Penn Station. It is in the flower district which was beautiful during the day. The rooms are clean and nice. We had a view of the Empire State Building. Great experience! Won't stay anywhere else.

title: Good value
text:
Staff: friendly and responsive to your requests.  I pointed out that coffee had run out and they replaced it in less than 2 minutes.

Rooms: clean if a bit small; the restrooms are not only small, but the door opens into the restroom.  In Room 803, you have to almost push yourself against the shower door in order to get the door open and get out.  I strongly recommend adjusting the door to open outward or replacing the bathroom door with the sliding type.

Food: Starbucks coffee. The muffins are very tasty.  The sausage leaves something to be desired and the shake n' bake eggs look absolutely terrible.  

Terrace: Great view of the Empire State building. Could use some more sturdy chairs.

Overall: Great value for your money in NYC, walking distance from Penn Station.

title: Nice & conveniently located Chelsea NYC hotel
text: I was in NYC for a surprise birthday trip for my son.  The hotel is right around the corner and within walking distance from Penn Station. The streets are lined with flower shops so their are beautiful flowers everywhere. We arrived Friday afternoon and the staff was very acommodating. They upgraded our King room to a city view. The bed was extremely comfortable. They also have breakfast daily. (boiled eggs, bagels, cereal, muffins, fruit, juice, milk, breakfast sandwiches) There is no mini mart inside the hotel but there is a Duane Reade right around the corner. I had a great experience Friday-Sunday and I would stay here again.

title: Good choice in Chelsea
text:
I stayed at this Marriott property for two nights on business and was very pleased.  As others have noted, the hotel is clean and well-managed.  A shout-out to everyone on the front desk - uniformly friendly, knowledgable and helpful, no matter the hour or how many people were in the lobby.  My room was small but that did not matter to me as I was on my own and seldom in the room.  The heat/AC system was not noisy like in many other hotels and so did not disrupt my sleep.  I was on the 11th floor, speaking of sleep, and heard very little street noise.

The breakfast area and food served are typical for the brand, and yet I would once again give extra credit because the breakfast area was pleasant, clean, well-organized and had a reasonable amount of seating.  For those of us who don't drink coffee it was a pleasant surprise to find higher-quality Tazo Teas on offer with the hot water, instead of just generic tea bags.  

As others have noted, Penn Station is a 5 - 7 minute walk away and the subway is quite nearby.  

My only quibble  - and I would call this minor - has to do with the bed pillows!!  They are oddly small and not overly comfortable.  Otherwise, well done!

title: Great location
text: I stayed here for 2 nights and had a great time in NY. Comfortable bed, good breakfast, great location, you can easily walk to many attractions (and Penn Station is also not very far). Subway is nearby as well. Staff is very friendly. There are some rooms with city view, mine was out the back... no view but very quiet instead. This will definitely be on top of my list for a place to stay on my next visit.

title: Friendliness personified!
text:
Living in CT, we normally take the train in to the city (New York), go to a show or museum and return home by train at night. For my birthday treat, we decided to stay overnight at this Fairfield Inn.  We were unable to bring any overnight bag items because we went to the musical "Newsies" and the Nederland Theater has no leg room, coat room nor lockers.  So with toothbrush and meds, on the 14th floor we did fine  at this hotel, enjoyed a sense of quietness and had a great breakfast in the am.  

As others have mentioned, the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff here was A1 okay. Loved the block outside too, filled with fresh flowers for sale up and down the street. 

Only wish it had been easier to get a cab on this street.

title: Quiet rooms, nice part of town, great breakfast.
text:
My husband had a business trip to NYC, so our 3 year old and I decided to tag along.  We wanted to stay somewhere close to Times Square without blowing our budget, and we thought this was a great option.

We traveled by Megabus from Washington DC, and we were dropped off very close to this hotel.  We were a little early for check in, and they gave us the option of checking in right then, or waiting until actual check in time for a room with a fold-out chair for our daughter.  We opted to wait, and they were happy to hold our bags while we killed some time.  All of our dealings with the staff were very professional and personable.  They even gave our daughter a little cow toy, which she played with the entire stay.

The room itself was smaller, but that was to be expected in New York City, and for our short stay we didn't mind it.  Our three year old thought the fold out chair was one of the coolest things in the world.  For an adult, it would be a little tight, but she slept soundly on it all night.  We enjoyed the king bed, it was very comfortable.

I'm a big fan of anywhere that offers free breakfast, and this spread did not disappoint.  They had lots of good options for all of us.  To name a few options, they offered cereals, toast, bagels, yogurts, Del Monte grapefruit and fruit cups, hard boiled eggs, orange and cranberry juice, apples and bananas, coffee and hot chocolate, and Jimmy Dean breakfast sandwiches.  It was so nice not to have to worry about breakfast every morning, especially with a child in tow.  There was plenty of seating available.

The location was great.  Walking distance to Time Square and Penn Station, and a Subway station on the same block.  Lots of reviews mention the flowers outside, which is true!  It is a nice touch.

As we checked out, we grabbed some cookies from the front desk. I was impressed with the staff who were friendly and happy.

Overall- this was a great deal, with a comfortable, quiet room and free breakfast, and friendly staff. Our room was on the smaller size, but perhaps they offer bigger ones, or this is good for smaller traveling groups. Easy access to public transportation, and also walking distance to many attractions.  We enjoyed our stay here!

title: Mother/daughter trip to New York
text: I normally stay within the Hilton brand chain so this was my first time trying a Marriott. I must say everything about this hotel was fabulous. Joanne and Brandi at the front desk were so accommodating with everything my mother and I needed. They provided prompt service, gave us a room before the designated 3pm check out time which was great since we needed to get dressed and head to a TV show taping. Rooms were very clean. They weren't the most spacious, but it's New York so what do you expect? But the amenities were very modern and the location is to die for. Right smack dab in the middle of Chelsea. Breakfast was good too! Would definitely stay here again. Thanks for making our stay so fabulous front desk!

title: Amazing hotel
text:
We have never been to NYC so we were kinda shocked to get a large room,new and clean. As we have heard from other people on their visits to NYC the complete opposite.

Rooms are excellent and the staff this hotel are amazingly helpful and sooooo nice and kind....loved it and we will back.Thank you to the staff for everything!!!

title: GREAT STAFF
text:
This is a simple and small hotel that has reasonable rates ( FOR NEW YORK ) but boy the service by ALL the staff was simply fantastic! I have never come across such sweet and friendly hotel staff........  THANK YOU GUYS
my first trip to New York and I was not expecting people to be so friendly.
The room was on the small side but very nice, with great views of the empire state building and it looked like it had been recently renovated. Breakfast was included, very basic, but it was ok. the location in the midle of the Flower district was very cute and the hotel is only five minute walk away from 5th Ave and Empire State Building........if your like us and only use a hotel to sleep and wash, this is a very good one thats closs to EVERYTHING. well worth a stay

title: Good hotel, great location
text:
We spent 4 nights at this hotel in April, in a king room. As previous reviewers have said, rooms are small but this is the norm in NYC. Our room didn't have a view but was really quiet, something we have not experienced in NYC before. 

We paid $250 + taxes per night which was reasonable compared to other hotel prices as it was just after Easter.

The best bits - friendly helpful staff, complimentary Starbucks coffee & tea 24/7, very comfortable bed, view from the rooftop of ESB & the skyline, close to the subway, reasonable continental breakfast, and delicious free cookies in the afternoon.

title: Exceeded expectations!
text: Absolutely no complaints at all during our four night stay.  Can't think of a single thing to gripe about since this inn exceeded all our expectations AND was a great value.  The staff is excellent, the location is really good and very quiet, the bed and pillows were comfortable, everything spotless and in good condition/working order, breakfast was a cut above, plenty of lighting in the room which is rare, plus the elevators are fast and larger than many.  I could go on and on, but you get the idea - we're really happy campers!  Be sure to take the elevator to the rooftop for a wonderful view of the Empire State Buiding.

title: Comfortable stay - great location
text:
I had a gallery opening on W 25th St and was searching for a reasonably priced hotel for my stay.
The Fairfield was in an interesting neighborhood and a short distance away from the gallery and many other interesting attractions. You walk out your door and you are in the middle of the Flower District with flowers everywhere - a great sight for March ! and a view of the Empire State building.
Also walking distance for sight seeing and photo ops. Our walk included a vist to the meat district undergoing a grand transformation and a visit before leaving to Battery Park.
And yes, as other travelers have mentioned - the front desk people are super !

title: Great spot for Madison Square Garden
text: Great location for MSG. Polite, helpful staff, parking easy to access and NYC reasonable, clean, we'll appointed, comfortable. Continental breakfast adequate, nothing to right home about. Internet was free. Area seemed safe we walked back twice from MSG after midnight without concern.

title: Excellent choice for a central location
text: We stayed here for three nights during an anniversary trip to NYC.  The hotel is clean, comfortable, sand well-appointed.  We liked the location being near a couple subway stops.  We bought a week long subway pass so we could hit all of the Manhattan sights whenever we wanted.  The folks on the front desk were super helpful and friendly.  They mailed post cards, offered advice on parking, schedules, etc.  The breakfast was good enough-- no frills... Nothing hot other than a toaster for bagels and hot coffee/tea.  They had a good selection of cereals and fruit.  The immediate street that the hotel on is ok... Not the nicest, but we didn't feel uncomfortable.  Overall, a great hotel in a super location, we would stay here again for sure!

title: Friendly hotel
text:
We stayed on 8th April 13. The check in was late 4pm but we were able to drop off our bags early. Very nice clean room with a lovely large walk in shower. Shower products in bathroom. Coffee maker with complimentary coffee and water. Bar area very casual, if you require something to eat they call next door to get you a takeaway, great if you are tiered and want a sack, i.e. burger & chips, salad or sandwich, however the food was good. Friendly waitress who gave us a complimentary drink to take to our room, we did buy 2 drinks beforehand these were not cheap but nothing is in New York !
Breakfast was very good with a good choice go hot and cold food.  We asked for a slightly later check out, this was not a problem and there was no charge.
I would certainly use this hotel again, it was about a 10 minute walk to Times Square.

title: Buon albergo, sicuramente consigliato!
text:
Sono stato in questo hotel a fine marzo, e devo dire che la struttura è molto buona, camere piuttosto piccole (non si sapeva dova appoggiare le valigie) ma sempre pulitissima ed ordine, unica osservazione, il convettore per il riscaldamento un po' troppo rumoroso. Anche gli spazi comuni non sono enormi, ma sempre tutto ben tenuto e pulitissimo. Personale molto cordiale e disponibile, anche se il nostro inglese era un po' scarsino, hanno sempre avuto la pazienza di ascoltarci. Personalmente abbiamo trovato ottima la colazione, con muffin, panini, marmellate, caffè, the, frutta fresca, ecc... insomma, per noi tutto quello che serve.
Il punto forte della struttura è senza dubbio la posizione centralissima, l'Empire State Building a 5 minuti a piedi, e Times Square a 10 minuti... ottimo punto centrale per girare tutta Manhattan a piedi, come abbiamo fatto noi. Dietro l'angolo c'è anche la fermata della metropolitana, quindi posizione servita più che bene. Anche il prezzo, confrontato con altre strutture simili è buono, quindi lo consiglierei a chi vuole visitare la città.

title: Clean, safe, budget friendly for NYC.
text: The place is still fairly new, clean & in a decent area. Close to subways & restaurants. 5 Blocks from Whole foods. Our reason for choosing this locale. Staff was pleasant & helpful. [However, we arranged for car service to LGA & were burned twice. The drivers ask for more money than the service is advertised. And on our departing trip, the driver refused to take the quicker tunnel & went 30 min out of the way because we told him that the hotel told us that the tolls were included for the $50 fee. Jut take a cab or if you have time to spare, take the M60 bus to LGA.]

title: quality hotel at a good price
text: Great location and pleasant flower district, as an oasis in the bustling metropolis. The room rate includes continental breakfast. I would say that the breakfast is quite monotonous. Really pleased, it's a free wi-fi and free tea and coffee around the clock. The room is quite spacious for New York, we had a city view room with king size bed. The room was a good sound insulation.  Staff friendly.

title: A 'little' gem in the 'street of flowers'
text: We researched Mid-town to find a reasonably priced hotel with good reviews. We are so glad we chose this one! Just returned today from 9 nights in Manhattan. On arrival we were a little apprehensive, night staff not overly welcoming and room seemed small, but as the days passed, it grew on us. Most staff very helpful, especially Thomas, who sums up the spirit of the city. Room small but very clean and managed very well. Breakfast adequate and coffee 24/7 a bonus, with occasional complimentary cookies, perfect! Easily accessible between 6th/7th Avenues its well placed for touring the Island. A few good bars on 7th and diners at hand. Look no further.

title: Great Staff and Nice Hotel
text:
My husband and I stayed here for 7 nights and we had a great time.
The standard room is very, very small. The only picture you see in the web site, with sofa, is very different from the reality. Our stay was long, so we were very worried about the room size and small wardrobe. Our decision to say at Fairfield, was based on the photos we saw. 
So we decide to show them the web site photos, and ask for a solution. Mia, a very professional staff, was very helpful and move us the next day to another room.
Good continental breakfast, bagels, juices and coffee. Our room was nice, comfy king size bed, cleans lines and towels, free wifi and coffee maker.
Close to subway, Whole Foods Market in a walking distance.
Thanks Mia for a great stay!!

title: Great, Inexpensive Accommodations
text:
Had a chance to stay at the Fairfield Inn and Suites/Mahattan-Chelsea on March 30th thru April 1st.  I was in New York for a concert at Madison Square Garden that Saturday night.  Ley's begin with the location.  It's on West 28th Street between 6th and 7th Avenues.  You are going down a street that seems to be all strew front stores, and then poof, you see at tall, skinny, 18 floor hotel that is the Fairfield Inn and Suites.

The Lobby:  The lobby is a small as everybody says it is.  And I could see if a large group showed up, that it could get very, very crowded.  That being said, I found the lobby to be clean, the front desk staff to be most pleasant and comfortable.  There is a small 4 seat seating area in the front lobby.  Straight ahead is a set of 2 elevators which zipped you up to and down from the floors.  Around the elevators to the rear is a separate seating area which contained the continental breakfast, which I did not use, but it had the usual bagels, fruit, cereal, and assorted coffees and juices.

The Room: I was in room 707 on the 7th floor.  As I said the hotel itself is a very skinny building, and the hotel only had maximum of 7 rooms per floor.  I have been in some small rooms in my travels over in Europe, and I have to say my room was a very tiny room.  That being said, I found the bed to be extremely comfortable, with 5 pillows.  The room had a 42 inch plasma/lcd TV mounted on the wall.  The room had a small work desk and a small cabinet that held a ironing board, iron, coffee pot with setup and the ice bucket.  Plenty of hangars were available, and there was 2 small drawers on the bottom.  There is a temperature interface that hooks in with the wall mounted heating/air conditioning unit that is mounted on the wall under the window.  When its on heat, it purrs like a kitten, but, when the air conditioning comes on, it is somewhat noisy.  However, when the ac is on, it's like the north pole is coming out of the vents, great for a hot day.  The window did not have much of a view, basically the buildings next door, so if that is important to you, ask for higher floor.  It was not a problem for me.

The Bathroom: The bathroom had a 2 person shower, that I found very clean, excellent water pressure, and plenty of hot water.  The sink/vanity area was fitted with Koehler faucets.  The bathroom had the standard bath soap, body soap, and hair conditioner.

The hotel is very conveniently located, only 3 blocks from Madison Square Garden, Empire State Building, etc, and also to plenty of restaurants and bars.  Closet subway stop was up on 33rd Street, at least that is what I found.

Overall the Hotel is in a great location, close by everything, excellent staff, and a comfortable bed.  I was charged $224/night for a King bed, a great price if you ask me.  Would definitely stay here again in the future.

title: Excelente hotel en todos los sentidos!
text:
Antes de viajar a New York investigamos por internet muchos hoteles, y leímos que unos cuantos tenían el problema de los bedbugs o pulgas de cama. Primero habíamos contratado otro hotel que había tenido un caso de estos insectos, por lo que poco antes de viajar decidimos cambiar. Y gracias a Dios encontramos el Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea!!
Hace 3 años estuvimos en Los Angeles y nos alojamos en el Residence Inn by Marriott y nos atendieron de maravilla, por lo que esta vez también quisimos encontrar otro establecimiento de la cadena Marriott. 
Primero que nada, el servicio de parte de todos los empleados fue excelente. Llegamos unas horas antes del horario de check-in pero igualmente nos asignaron la habitación y pudimos subir a descansar. Estuvimos en el 3er piso y no tuvimos problemas ni con el ruido de la calle, ni del ascensor, ni de la calefacción... Nada. Habitación bastante espaciosa para ser New York, cama gigante! Televisor de plasma, cafetera, café de Satrbucks, vasos... Hasta pedimos un refrigerador y nos lo llevaron a la habitación.
La ubicación buenísima. El McDonald's de la esquina significa que hay gente a todas horas y que si uno vuelve tarde, siempre puede encontrar algo para comer ahí. Cerca de estaciones de subte (metro) de varias líneas y a pocas cuadras de Macy's.
El hotel cuenta con un gimnasio abierto las 24 hs con toallas limpias, agua y máquinas que funcionan TODAS y perfectamente. También hay un microondas en la zona de desayuno que puede usarse todo el día. Nosotras le sacamos provecho ya que lo usamos casi todas las noches dado que de tanto cansancio, no queríamos salir a comer. Buena forma de ahorrar unos dólares a la hora de cenar.
Buenísimo el desayuno. Café de Starbucks, jugo Minute Maid, cerales de Kellog's,muffins, mermeladas, bagels... Muy bueno.
La verdad, sólo tengo palabras de agradecimiento. Si están buscando un hotel limpio, espacioso, cómodo, con buenas personas a su disposición y un precio razonable, esta es la elección perfecta. Volvería una y mil veces más!

title: Buon albergo in buona posizione
text: È una buona struttura con camere mediamente grandi per lo standard newyorkese. Quelle che affacciano verso nord godono della splendida vista dell'empire state building. Il servizio è impeccabile la pulizia pure.  La colazione forse potrebbe essere rivista:  Non c'è una grande varietà di scelta e soprattutto si tratta di cibi confezionati o surgelati. Tutto sommato vista anche la ragionevole richiesta economica e la Ciccio ho fatto un'ora di coda all'NBA store sulla 5a.... Non esistono portachiavi ufficiali con i nomi dei giocatori! Gli abbiamo preso un braccialetto di James che non indosserà mai xche taglia unica ed è enorme e quindi gli abbiamo comprato un cappellino dell'NBA. Baci ottima per visitare la città direi che questo albergo merita quattro stelline su cinque.

title: Rooftop patio with amazing views
text:
I stayed here for one night last October with 2 kids. At the time we went, the price for the room was one of the cheapest I could find in the Manhattan area. But traveling with kids, price is not as important to me as a clean, secure property with amenities and a good location. We lucked out on all accounts. Here are some of the things we appreciated most:

1. Flower district location -- so cool coming and going. For a city that otherwise smells like cigarettes and sewer, the fresh vibe on this street sets it apart.
2. The staff was extremely friendly to me and my kids. Friendly like, offered to call me a cab. Brought me a bottled water while I waited for a cab. A food item had run out at breakfast and one of my daughters asked an employee if they had any more of it and he happily sought it out. We felt very welcome.
3. The rooftop patio. We made hot chocolate down in the dining room at night and brought it up to the rooftop to enjoy while we took in amazing views of the city. The Empire State Building is just a few blocks away and made for a breathtaking skyline. Nobody else was up on the rooftop. The seating area was comfortable. We felt pretty lucky to have this special time in NYC.

This place is a little treasure.
Thanks for a great stay!

title: 25th anniversary
text:
This hotel is very quiet.  We had a great sleep.  Not great to drive to but there is a parking lot one block away, then you can walk to restaurants, bus or train.
You are surrounded by flowers since you are in the flower district.  There is a very nice breakfast in the morning included.
We totally enjoyed our evening before retiring.

title: How little you can get for how much
text:
Yes it's Manhattan and yes it's expensive for $350/night for this place is not bang for buck. Unfortunately, I had to book last minute and there were slim pickings. 

The Fairfield is clean, relatively quiet if you're on a high floor and comfortable after a long day on the town. But it's no frills. As a Marriott Gold member I expected a little more, heck for the price I expected a little more. But I guess a warm cookie in the evenings will have to do.

title: One of the quietest nights in NYC..nice place, street so so..
text:
I have to give this stay a thumbs up for quiet. I have never had so little noise, especially in a relatively low rise building. I was on the 15th floor, facing away from the street. I was dead silent during the night. So if you want a quiet place, this is it. I was in 1501, and this hotel is like many midtown hotels, room face front and back only. No side views. So I know rooms ending in 01 and 03 face the rear for sure. Not a great view, but quiet.

Other than that I have to also say the staff here was very nice, helpful, and efficient. Gave great restaurant suggestions, directions, and other advise. 

Room was good size, clean, big bathroom, shower only. No refrigerator. Breakfast was typical Fairfield fare, which was fine. Fitness room was also typical. I went to Planet Fitness on 27th to work out.

Parking is $25.00 per night if you validate, and is about a block away from hotel. The one thing about this location is the street itself is pretty grim, especially when the daily flower vendors are wrapped up for the day. Not a pretty block. But a walk a few blocks away will change that perception. Did feel safe in the area.

title: Great stay
text: I stayed here the weekend of 3/15/13 to 3/17/13. I was very surprised how well my stay was. The staff was the best. They had a smile on their face and would greet me every time I went out and came back in. The room was great. It was clean and everything worked. The even came to my room to check and make sure the room had been cleaned. I thought that was a great touch. The hotel is in walking distance to everything, Penn station, Times Square and a lot of great places to eat. The free wifi worked great and did I say free. I will stay here on my next trip to New York City. Thanks to the staff and the Fairfield inn for a great stay.

title: Nice Place to stay in Midtown
text: Rooms are clean, nice bed, close to Madison Square Garden Events and other Midtown venues, Typical small rooms for New York, and truthfully on the pricey side given the size of the room. Great Location

title: Great Location to MSG
text: There are a couple Marriott properties near Madison Square Garden. This one is in the "garden district", flowers everywhere. Safe, clean and just a couple blocks from everything near MSG. Stayed here for a basketball tournament over an extended weekend. Prices kept creeping up, so book early! It also was a quick walk from Megabus' drop off stop. Very convenient! Breakfast was good, muffins were like they were homemade. Rooms was clean. View was probably typical NY view, of another hotel next door.

title: Great stay!
text: I loved everything at Fairfield Hotel. It's in a good location, close to the subway and within a walking distance to the most important places in the city. Really comfortable and clean room, very friendly and helpful staff, excellent breakfast (continental style). I'd stay there again and totally recommend it! It was a great stay!

title: Consigliatissimooooo!!!!
text:
Ho soggiornato in questo hotel con altre due amiche, e siamo rimaste soddisfatte di tutto. Soprattutto la posizione é ottimale: a due passi dal l'Empire State Building e a dieci minuti da Times Square, e collegato bene con la metropolitana.
Le camere sono pulite e accoglienti, dotate di tutti i comforts, e la colazione é abbondante e varia!!! 
La sera sono disponibili a qualunque orario the e tisane e il personale é davvero molto simpatico e disponibile.
I prezzi sono accessibili, sicuramente si trovano hotels più economici, ma considerando la zona, la qualità del servizio, e la sicurezza che offre, vale esattamente quanto richiesto!!!
Se dovessi tornare a Manhattan, prenoterei sicuramente di nuovo qui!!!

title: Sehr solides Hotel in guter Lage
text:
Man sollte sich bei diesem Hotel von der "Nachbarschaft" nicht erschrecken lassen :) 
Die Zimmer und die Lage des Hotels sind super und das Personal sehr hilfsbereit.
Der Preis ist vollkommen ok und daher wird dieses Hotel bei nächster Gelegenheit von uns wieder gebucht!

title: Very good!
text:
Nice hotel near Macy's and flatiron building. Room was very clean, huge comfortable bed and big bathroom. Staff was helpful and nice. We can recommed this hotel and we will come back! 
Hyvä ja edullinen hotelli, huone oli siisti ja sänky oli erinomainen, hotelli tarjosi myös aamiaisen mikä oli ihan ok. Hotellilta on lyhyt kävelymatka Macylle, Empire state building ja Flatiron buildingille, metropysäkki löytyi myös ihan nurkan takaata.

title: Great choice!
text: We had a great time exploring the city.  The staff at this hotel was always helpful and went out of their way to take care of us with a late check out and hours to wait until our train left.  The rooms were small but clean and perfectly fine. Breakfast was cheerful and plentiful.  We would stay here again! Very conveniently located and lots to do within walking distance.

title: Excellent rapport qualité/Prix et très bien placé
text:
L'hotel est tres bien situé, entre la 28th et la 6 ieme avenue. Il se trouve a la station 28 th sur la ligne rouge et jaune, a deux stations de time's square. C'est tres pratique d'avoir deux lignes de metro.
Le personnel est tres sympa et la chambre est tres confortable. Nous etions au 5 ieme etage sur cours, donc la chambre etait calme, ce qui etait tres agreable.
Le petit moins serait peut etre le petit déjeuner qui est assez sommaire. Mais il y a quand même des bagels, des céréales, des oeufs durs, des fruits. Cela reste tout à fait correct quand même. (pas vraiment de service car on va se servir et ensuite il faut débarasser).

title: Started great, faded fast ...
text:
I have stayed at this Marriott property multiple times and enjoyed all visits prior to my most recent trip. I stay here due to the amazing proximity for work and really love the location, it's short walk to the subway and other things.

But this was an overall subpar visit for two reasons. The first? I arrived from the West coast via a red-eye flight around 11 a.m. on a Sunday morning and was told my room wasn't ready. That was totally cool, as check-in isn't until 3 p.m. However, the woman at the front desk told me she would give me the first open room that became available. I told her I would sit in the small waiting area not 15 feet away from her in her eye line to make sure she remembered I was there and ready. More than two hours later, at least one other person checked in successfully and it was only when I went up and asked if a room was available did she say "yes," which made me irate because she knew I had traveled without sleep to NYC.

Second? I woke up Monday morning and prepared to depart. As I was gathering my belongings on the bed, I noticed an array of blood stains all over the white comforter. Absolutely disgusting. I took multiple pictures of the inexcusably laid comforter and delivered my complaint to the desk upon check-out.

As a Marriott Rewards and "Friends & Family" member who has numerous business associates inside the Marriott Worldwide walls, I was appalled to only receive $20 off my stay having spent thousands of dollars at various Marriott establishments nationwide.

This whole experience has made second-guess staying at this property in the future after enjoying every other prior visit. Very disappointed.

title: Nice hotel
text: I just stayed there for a quick work trip and found it very clean, comfy and modern. Great staff as well- they are very nice and helpful! The welcome bags with water and cookies are a nice touch! Would look to stay here in the future,

title: Excellent !
text:
Oui, en un mot : Excellent !
Je sois dire que j'étais sceptique quand j'ai vu la plupart des commentaires très favorables. Je pensais qu'il s'agissait, au moins en partie, de commentaires de complaisance...
J'avais prévenu mes amis : attention, à NY, les hôtels sont mal insonorisés, les chambres et équipement peuvent être vétustes...
Et quelle surprise : ici chambres modernes, propres, confortable (lits douillet) et très bien insonorisées !
Petit-déjeuner très copieux et inclus dans le tarif, ce qui est rare.
Le personnel est très agréable et souriant. Il y a même un québécois qui parle français à l'accueil. 
J'y suis allé du 22 au 25 février 2013 avec un groupe d'ami. J'avais réservé 5 chambres pour 9 personnes.
J'ai juste eu une petite frayeur, lorsque j'ai reçu des notifications SMS d'American Express (carte avec laquelle j'avais réservé) m'indiquant des montants de prélèvement bien supérieur au tarif avec lequel j'avais réservé. Après renseignement à l'accueil, la réceptionniste m'a aimablement expliqué qu'il ne s'agit que d'une garantie. En effet, au final c'est bien le tarif prévu qui a été prélevée.
J'y retournerai volontiers l'année prochaine car j'ai d'autres amis qui m'ont demandé de leur faire visiter NY.
Le métro "Pen Station" est à 800 mètres et il est direct pour l'aéroport JFK.
Time Square est à une dizaine de minute à pied.
Dommage qu'on ne puisse pas réserver plus de 3 chambres sur leur site ; il a fallu que je passe par Booking

title: Average Hotel
text:
The hotel pictures are misleading, therefore you should keep your expactation low. Hotel rooms are very clean, I can't tell the same thing for public areas. Breakfast area was in mess for the most of the time. None of our special requests (such as bed type, high floor preferance, close rooms) were taken care of. Rooms are very small, no space to place the luggage, if you travel two, forget about second luggage. Small wardrobe, no shelf on the bathroom.
However for a city like NY, you shouldn't expect more on this price level, I think this sub-brands do not promise more than this. Just good to know what to expact in advance. One more thing regarding payment; Although every room either guaranteed or paid on arrival with their individual credit card, my credit card (as I made the reservations at the first stage) was charged for the first night fee, which is non-sense, I had to find it out on my return through my bank statement. I had to call the hotel and sort it out. They were kind and quick on the phone though. Staff is professional in general.

title: Between Freedom tower and Empire State building great location
text: Wife said find me a place near the Empire state building that is safe with free breakfast! First trip for our family of 6 to NYC! I went to trip advisor and saw that this location was a few blocks from Empire state building and seemed nice. The picture of the facade appealed to her so we booked! We were very suprised with the room in comparison with some of the competitors we looked at. We had 2 bathrooms and 2 separate rooms with a sliding door which was excellent way to have kids sleep while parents wound down. View on 18th floor south was very intersting. The breakfast area was congested and the hotel staff had a hard time keeping up with the crowds. Parking was free out front on weekend night which was pleasure since parking structure for hotel was a few blocks away. To our surprise in the morning we thought our car was gone for sure when we went outside and in all directions we see plants. Eventually walked into the street and saw our car amongst the rain forest that had appeared over night. Turns out this was the florist/garden district. Very nice people helped me load the car since they needed the room to help unload more flowers.

title: Decent Hotel, Good Rates, Very Nice Service
text:
Once I got passed the fact that this is a New York City coffin size room, I came to like this hotel. The bed was very comfortable. The complimentary breakfast very good. And any time I had to ask for something they were extremely polite and helpful. On my arrival when I noticed my room did not have a hair dryer, I called down to ask if there was supposed to be one in the room or if they did not offer hair dryers. They apologized on the phone and sent one right up. The person who brought up the hair dryer profusely apologized.

Two drawbacks. There is very little shelf space in the bathroom to store cosmetics, etc. And the free wifi is very slow.

But I would return to this hotel. The location is very good and as i said, they were really friendly and the breakfast was good.

title: Muito Bom
text: Estivemos cinco dias neste Hotel com um casal amigo nosso, e nós os 4 adoramos. Ficamos no 407 e 507 que sao virados para o inetrior. Não tinhamos vista mas era muito tranquilo. Não se ouvia barulho vindo da rua. Estava bastante frio, mas o ar condicionado do quarto era excelente. O serviço de limpeza era muito bom, como todo o pessoal do hotel... Funcionarios amaveis e prestaveis. Simplismente Adoramos.

title: God placering-ved shopping etc.
text: Dejligt rent og ordentligt hotel. Ikke så store værelser- men helt fint til prisen. Centralt i forhold til shopping- gå afstand til teater osv. Personalet smilende og hjælpsomme  og hotellet har en fin morgenmad med tag selv- hvilket passer os rigtig godt.Kommer gerne igen.

title: Excellent stay in Chelsea
text: Clean room, great location, helpful staff, great amenities for the price.  This hotel is a fantastic value for Manhattan, a gem staring you right in the face.  I plan to look here first for future stays in New York City.

title: Great location and price
text: my wife and I just spent four days at the Fairfield while in New York for the Gift Show. We followed the advice of travelers on Trip Advisor and once again are very glad we did. Although the rooms are extremely small, even our King Size room was very tight and we needed to be quite creative to find any storage space we managed and enjoyed ourselves completely. The complementary breakfast is fair, cold cereals and bagels, egg muffins and yogurt Ian good supply, better than most chain complementary breakfasts but not great. Location was fabulous whether a tourist in New York or business traveler ya sous are right in the middle of everything. We always choose  hotel with a fitness center and the one was better than most that chains have to offer with elliptically,  treadmills and all with televisions attached. The front desk service was exceptional, pleasant, helpful and full of spirit employees on all shifts were professional and seemed pleased to be able to help. Can't beat the price, especially if you know your dates and can book and pay in advance. All in all a wonderful experience, would recommend highly as lassoing as you can be flexible and deal itch a smallish room.

title: Affordable and Nice Rooms, Good Location and Fresh Flowers Outside Your Door
text:
I have stayed at this hotel several times and It is my hotel of choice. Prices are good, rooms are clean and new. The rooms are on the small side, but typically the price point is also small compared to other similar properties. Breakfast is included making the price point even more attractive.  

The hotel is located on the street as the stores that make up the NYC flower market. In January, you walk outside the hotel and on the sidewalk are narcissus and hyacinth along with their wonderful fragrance. 

The hotel is is a block away from the 1 subway -  2 stops away from Times Square. Easy walking distance to Penn Station - easier than maneuvering the stairs of the subway.   Get an unlimited metro pass $29 for 7 days and use the subway and busses unlimited and all of NYC is yours to be had. 

I found that I was more knowledgable than the staff regarding restaurants.  I would suggest that the hotel get a couple of copies of New York Zagat guides to let guests borrow. 

For extended stays- I might send over some better feather/down pillows.

title: A GREAT LONG WEEKEND
text: My wife and I and another couple spent January 18-22 at this hotel in Chelsea. We had a wonderful rate from Marriott on line and our rooms were modern, reasonably sized for NYC with good bedding, a great shower and enough space for all of our belongings. Location was superb for us - 2/3 block from the 1 train. The staff was friendly, gracious, helpful and efficient. [Our companions were NOLA4158] We highly recommend this hotel.

title: Great Hotel
text: My husband and I just returned from spending 4 nights at his wonderful hotel. We were with friends celebrating birthdays. We come to NYC at least once a year and decided to stay in an area we had never stayed in before.  The hotel was perfect -  clean and roomy.  The front desk staff could not have been more professional or helpful.  We will definitely stay here again.  Thanks for making my birthday celebration so memorable.

title: Nice stay but oh that Febreze smell
text:
This property offers a convenient quiet location and wonderful staff, particularly the man at the front desk (did not get his name) and friendly Mia who has the best food tips for an out-of-towner.

But the hotel smells very strongly of Febreze or something like that they must spray in the rooms and lobby. We had to air out our room from the noxious smell. If you have allergies you may have a problem like we did. 

Also, would like the TV volume down or off in the breakfast room. Don't need to hear about the latest infamous murder as I eat my cereal. There was loud music from someplace in the back of the property but it turned off by midnight both nights.

The bed is very comfortable and strong pressure in the shower.

If not for the the chemical smell we would come again.

title: Great hotel!
text: We had a fantastic stay at this hotel. Rooms are clean, beds are comfortable, the view from the roof top is great and it's fairly close to subway. Hotel staff was very nice....we will keep this one in mind! Thanks Marriott :)

title: Great basic hotel south of Empire State Building
text: I visit NYC for business & pleasure six times a year at least.  This Fairfield Inn on the edge of Chelsea is great.  Its new and clean with great rooms.....on the small size but so well appointed that its not a problem.....same with the smallish bathroom.  The mattress is one of the best I have ever slept on in a hotel and the shower head was super.  I guess its the little things that add up to make a decent hotel.  What makes a really good experience is when the hotel is full of knowledgeable yet friendly employees.  I have to give a special nod to MIA on the front desk....who took great care of us and was so friendly while doing so.

title: little gem in Manhattan...
text:
As a tourist visiting New York you know that Manhattan is where you should stay. We book about 3 weeks before our Jan 2013 trip to NYC and I think we had a very good deal, here are our comments :

+ points
1. Location, between 7th Ave and 28th St, a lot of major attractions are within walking distance. our room has the view of the Empire State Building. Subway is within 5 min walk. 
2. rooms are renovated recently, everything feels fresh and new. good bed. 
3. service is top class, when we complained that there might be a suspected leak in the toilet, they call the engineer to check out, after 5 mins they have already getting us another room.
4. good breakfast, free fast WIFI, star bucks coffee served in room. 

- points
1. if you have to find something, the rooms may be a but small, but this is the middle of manhattan.

will stay there again !

title: Excellent Experience!
text: Recently, my husband & I found this hotel available for a great rate and decided to take advantage of the deal. It was the best decision, as it is a gem!  The hotel is centrally located in the city and is incredibly clean & new. Actually, I was told it was built in 2009. The room was well appointed and was a decent size for Manhattan.  The bed was very comfortable.  Our room was also very quiet.  The staff was accomodating and extremely friendly.  The breakfast was perfect and the service in the dining area was great.  We were so pleased with everything this Fairfield Inn had to offer & hope to return again soon.

title: Habitaciones muy pequeñas
text:
la ubicación está bien, aunque la zona no es particularmente linda de noche, sobre todo porque a veces se acumula la basura en las cuadras cercanas y puede ser una tarea desagradable llegar hasta el hotel a pie. Eso sí, siempre es lindo volver teniendo al Empire State como punto de referencia. 
Las habitaciones están bien pero son demasiado pequeñas! yo estuve alojada en otros hoteles de Manhattan y este, sin ninguna duda, fue el de espacios más reducidos. 
A favor tiene que sirven un desayuno que es básico pero bastante decente: café, té, jugos, leche, cereales, panes, bocados pre-cocidos, frutas y yogures.

title: New Years eve experience in Times Square
text:
Just loved this hotel. Excellent location, very friendly staff and great breakfast. Could of done with tea and coffee making faciliites in room and a little more light other wise fantastic.
 Loved the fresh baked white chocolate macadamia cookies they provided free in the afternoons.

title: Terrific staff!!
text: This was our 2nd stay here and the entire staff is terrific!    Front desk are helpful, efficient and friendly.   Housekeeping very tidy and flexible.  And Tanya at breakfast runs a terrific room!   Highly recommend for reasonable rates and location.

title: Bad hotel for Marriott elites
text:
I'm a Marriott Plat, and while I understand that perhaps this hotel doesn't upgrade Plat members to suites, I was surprised to check in and find I was assigned one of the worst rooms in the hotel - a low floor room that, from the floor plan view, appeared to be one of the smallest rooms (an x01 room) facing the back alley - no offer was made of even having a decent street view. The layout of the room barely permitted use of the desk. I don't mean to seem overly entitled but what's the point of getting status if you're assigned a priceline-type room in the middle of low season? 

The room itself was very dark due to facing the alley and was very cold - I had the thermostat cranked up to 75 but the room constantly felt like it was in the low 60s. The hotel is in a decent location and is new, which is nice. The complementary breakfast is....well you get what you pay for. Enough to fill you up at least.

Moral of the story: Marriott elites, look elsewhere. Even the other Fairfield in Times Square treats elites better.

title: Wonderful Experience!
text: My husband and I had the opportunity to go to NYC and took a chance on this hotel, not knowing anything about it.  What a terrific stay we had!
