After coming from the train station early in the morning, we got to the hotel and asked to store our luggage until check in much later in the day.  Not only was the young woman at the desk friendly and very helpful, she asked if we had breakfast yet.  We had not. She immediately took us to their breakfast room and made us feel right at home!  We were so impressed with her kindness.  The hotel is very close to Penn Station (about 6 or 7 blocks), close to shopping, restaurants, etc.  There is a subway station at the end of the block as well.  A perfect location for us!  We had a great day and came back to the hotel in time to check in, change clothes, hop on the subway and zip off to see a Broadway show we had tickets for.  All went like clockwork.  The afternoon hotel crew was friendly and very helpful as well.  I have stayed in the Time Square area several times and the rooms were always small, cramped and at times, the hallways were scary.  At the Fairfield we stayed on the 16th floor, the room was bright, modern and a decent size.  Even provided a coffee pot! It was quiet and absolutely more than met our expectations!!!  In the morning the staff was great.  Breakfast was the typical Fairfield Inn start to the day, but they were right there to replenish anything that ran low.  We had another great day exploring new neighborhoods.  Later in the day we came back to retrieve our luggage, grab a quick cup of coffee to go.  The desk clerk asked if we would like two bottles of water to go with us.  She put it in a handled bag, retrieved our luggage and sent us on our way with many thanks for choosing this Fairfield Inn.  Needless to say, we have told many, many friends about our GREAT experience and will return again!  Thank you so much to all the great staff and for the very comfortable surroundings.  We stay in Fairfields often when we travel and, by far, THIS IS THE BEST ONE ON THE EAST COAST!  We will be back!

title: Buon albergo
text:
Siamo stati al Fairfield per il capodanno 2013. Il nostro giudizio è positivo. La stanza, forse un pò piccola, era pulita. La colazione buona e con molta scelta. il personale gentile e disponibile. Vicino all'albergo c'è una fermata della metro e Time Square dista solo 10 minuti a piedi.
Se dovessimo tornare a NYC permotteremo in questo Hotel.

title: Great Hotel but don't trust with your Debit/Credit cards with them
text: Stayed here for 9 nights, can't fault the hotel for location, cleanliness, friendliness and service.We were upgraded  free of charge on booking in just because we were staying for longer than a few days. The room was spacious with a king size bed and we had a fantastic view of the Empire State Building.My only grievance was in relation to payment. We booked on line using our Visa Credit but when we checked in we were asked for the card we would be using to pay the final bill with. We handed them a Master Card Debit which they swiped.We had purposly pre loaded the card with enough Dollars to cover our bill and some extra to spend.This was intended to save the exchange fees charged on Credit cards.As expected our Master card was debited on arrival with an estimate of our final bill.I was told this would be released on checkout.What they actually did was take two lots of pre authorisation fees from our Master card and a further amount from our Visa Credit card (not swiped and no authority given) and the full final amount from our Debit card totalling $6984. Our actual bill was only $3319 .All but $700 was put back on our cards. It has taken me 30 days of constant emailing to try and get this released. We were left with no funds at the airport because of this. It was finally credited by our bank. Please keep track of your debit /credit deductions and note they will debit a card even if they have not swiped it, the details will be on their booking system.

title: Convenient Location
text:
This was our second "Girl Trip" to visit NYC between Christmas and New Year's.  We reserved two rooms in August including room 1805 - a two room suite with two double beds and a sofa pull-out and two full baths for the 20 and under crowd and another two double bed standard room for the three middle-aged moms.  Even though I had called to confirm the week prior when we arrived the standard double was not available because the prior guest decided to stay an additional night.  We were "upgraded" to a King room with pull-out chair/bed.  This would have been fine except that attempting to sleep on the chair was impossible. I've never been on something so uncomfortable.  This could probably be remedied by offering memory foam toppers to use on the pull-outs.  
Other than that the hotel was great even though it was very busy during this week.  Breakfast is simple but adequate and was kept stocked.  They could use an additional coffee/hot water station when this busy to keep up with the breakfast crowd.  The large table in the eating area was great for our group as well providing us a place to sit and visit. One night we brought in take-out from the Japanese restaurant just down the block and had dinner there.
There is a large wall-mounted TV in that area along with another in the atrium eating area for breakfast.  There are also 4 lounge chairs with a TV in the lobby.
The entire staff and manager are incredibly pleasant and well-trained.
Beautiful view of illuminated Empire State Building from the roof-top which was accessible by the elevator or stairs at night.

title: Super Hotel
text:
La Chambre est vraiment top....ultra confortable, chaleureuse, douillette, propre et la salle de bain est vraiment belle.
Le petit déjeuner compris dans le prix et très bon (bagels, pancakes....  trés bon café ou thé) . Proche de times sqare (2 arrêts de metro ou 10-15 min à pieds) et super vue sur l'empire state building....
 A Recommander pour visiter New York

title: Good location, great value for money
text: We found that the Fairfield was in the right location for all the places we wanted to get to. The room was small but clean and well appointed, the staff were friendly and helpful and it had all the things we needed for our weekend in NYC. I'd agree with a previous reviewer that it can be noisy (we were facing 28th St) and if you are a light sleeper, then earplugs may be useful. After a busy day of walking and touring though, we didn't have a lot of problems sleeping through the noise. We'd stay here again.

title: Reasonably good
text: There's an old saying that "you get what you pay for."   Not sure that applies here.  Often more expensive than neighboring Hampton Inns, the Fairfield Inn is not superior.  In fact, while Hampton serves a freshly cooked hot and varying breakfast every morning, Fairfield Inn offers pre-wrapped Jimmy Dean sandwiches to heat by microwave oven.  And, although the hotel is fairly new, the rooms are already starting to show wear and tear.   So unless you're a Marriott loyalist, you may be paying a higher price here than at a similarly themed Hampton Inn and not getting anything in return.  Of course if you're a Marriott Elite, upon check in you get two bottles of cheap water with a value of less than 50 cents.  Enjoy!

title: The friendly staff makes this Hotel stand out!
text:
It is overwhelming to try and pick a hotel to stay at in Manhattan but our driving force was to pick one in close proximity to Eataly where we had a cooking class to attend.  The rooms are small but  omfortable.  The people who worked the front desk and the breakfast area were really helpful and nice to us.  The hotel is clean and for the most part price matches what you get for a NYC hotel. It also was nice and quiet for NYC.
The morning breakfast which is included in your hotel rate was very more than adequate to start your day off. Coffee is on 24/7 which is nice when you are there in the winter.. It is still close to places like Chelsea market, Macy's, and Times square.
When we go back to NYC next winter we would stay there again.  Jonathan Gersh, Assistant General Manager was very helpful. say hello to him from us.

title: Nice, Comfortable
text:
Nice Hotel. Interesting area walking around New York surrounded by vendors selling trees/flowers on the street. Added a unique twist to the experience. About 3 blocks from Madison Square Garden. Great location. I am Platinum at Marriott and wasn't even offered an upgrade of any kind. Breakfast was great and delicious. Nice indoor courtyard to eat. Wireless was fast and convenient. Fitness gym was nice, under ground and no windows but equipment was sufficient.  

One recommendation for management - Provide ear plugs to guests. I was on the 7th floor and there were non-stop sirens at all times of the day. Annoying but understandable being in NYC.

Overall a nice stay.

title: Fantastic stay at the Fairfield Inn.  Felt like a full-fledged Marriott experience!
text: First of all, the location is excellent.   Two different subway lines within a half-block.   In the middle of the flower district, very pleasant walking through the fragrant and beautiful greenery and flowers that the shops put out on the sidewalks to sell.   The hotel staff were top-notch.   Always pleasant, eager to assist, knowledgeable about the area.   The complimentary breakfast was much more than your standard fare.   Many hot and cold options in a self-serve area that was kept well stocked, as well as neat and clean.   Proteins, fruits, cereals, and multiple beverage choices.    Lots of seating, too.  It was also a very nice surprise to find complimentary hot coffee/hot tea/hot chocolate available to guests 24/7.   The room was excellent as well.   Comfortable and clean.   Not too cramped, unless you are trying to cram a family of 3 or 4 into one room.  In that case, it might be a little tight.    I did not have a single complaint during my four-night stay.   There was not anything that I wished were different.   Thank you, Staff of the Fairfield Inn in Chelsea.   Well done!

title: Wonderful Hotel!
text: We just got back from a trip to New York and stayed at the Fairfield Inn Chelsea.  It was a great hotel and the staff was amazing!  Friendly, always upbeat and genuinely helped us with all of our needs.  The location can't be beat, only a few blocks from Macy's, the Empire State Building, and Times Square.  The rooms are very clean and each morning there was a complimentary breakfast which was a perfect start to our day.  I would not hesitate to book this hotel again for our next trip to New York.

title: Flowers surround you
text: We had a pleasant stay in the flower district in Chelsea. You arrive on a street, on which the sidewalks overflow with plants, orchids, flowers, and decoratives. Rooms facing the street have a great view of the Empire State Bldg. The rooms are clean, beds very comfortable, bathrooms well appointed. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful. We liked the location, easy access to subways to Brooklyn where our kids live, and good walking area. Excellent complimentary continental breakfast with glass enclosed eating area. Great value!

title: Overpriced for a small room in a hotel with no amenities
text: Hotel room was extremely small for 3 people at a cost of $400 plus a night. The hotel was on a very noisy street and you could hear everything from the garbage collection, to the wholesale florist receiving their deliveries and neighboring construction. Do not expect for the high price tag a restaraunt, bar lounge, pool on premise etc.

title: Price Gouging during Storm Sandy
text:
We live in Zone A (NYC), and lost power during Sandy. Were desperate for a room. Only thing us desperate refugees from downtown were able to find for Thursday November 1st, and Friday November 2nd was this place. 

Rates you ask? $416 per night for a basic room, 2nd floor, facing the street.
What could we do, we paid. There's nothing special about this place. The rooms are basic, and there's nothing included in the rate (such as coffee, breakfast). 

The staff? Oh my god. When I mentioned to the "gentleman" at the desk that the rate sounds ridiculous even by NYC standards for a place like this- I was told "supply and demand".

When we finally got home and compared stories of what we did and where we stayed with a neighbor, I found out he had stayed at the same place the night of the storm and was charged $160 (of course he was!! they didn't know part of NYC would lose power yet). I WAS LIVID. Promptly filed a complaint with my local Attorney Generals Office.

title: Over Priced
text:
With the expectation of East Coast hotels being small, I had prepared my family that the rooms would be small...2 adults 2 small kids.  Boy was I wrong.  The room was smaller than I had expected and never mind the bathroom...not the cleanest hotel.  
Small and slow elevators.
The staff was nice but with for the price that I had paid for, I was expecting much better service!
Nice location in Chelsea and just few blocks from the subway station.
Maybe that I am being too critical being from West Coast, but I would not recommend this hotel at the price that they are charging.

title: New hotel just south of Macy's where free Wi-Fi really works
text: We searched the web for an economical modern hotel in Midtown Manhattan at a value price - lower than most charge. We came across Marriott's Fairfield Inn on West 28th Street between 6th and 7th Avenues, at the southern edge of Midtown, just a few blocks south of Macy's and the Empire State Building.  The Marriott Fairfield is a modern "no frills" hotel with a very good room design.  Particularly at this price scale, the rooms are ample, not tight, with a king bed, end tables, large screen TV, and a generous number of clothing storage drawers as well as an ample closet.  The bathroom has a glass shower although the bathroom was short on shelf space for toiletries. It’s one of the very few hotels we've stayed in, in the U.S. and overseas, where the free wired and wireless Wi-Fi worked very well at all times even in a fully-occupied-hotel.  There is a comfortable chat and computer lounge behind the lobby, which is also the food-service area for the free continental breakfast.  That space opens into a large enclosed glass atrium with tables and chairs for those lingering over breakfast.  Coffee and tea is available at all hours.  We had a 2nd floor room facing W. 28th Street, and the room was absolutely quiet.  The 2 elevators are fast and responsive.  The staff is friendly and accommodating.  Subways and buses are nearby, as are some moderately-priced nice eat-in and/or takeout cafes on 7th Ave, as well as some smaller food shops on 6th Ave.  Starbucks abound of course.  At first glance the block looks dreary, but you'll immediately see two other new hotels across the street.   The neighborhood is changing to condo lofts in the old garment factories.  Some wholesale and retail flower shops remain on the block.  Because of our very satisfactory 6-night-stay at this hotel, Fairfield Inns may well become a brand of choice in the future.

title: perfect
text: everything was perfect. Check in was a breeze, the location was  great, there were subways in 3 different directions,the staff was amazing even the elevator is lightning quick.we highly recommend this property.

title: Weekend Getaway
text:
Took a weekend trip to the city to see a show.  This place came in with the right price, but being a bit farther south than I usually stay, I wasn't quite sure what to expect.  The good:  it's an easily walkable 3 blocks from Penn Station; there's a subway stop at the end of the block and another a block and a half away the other direction making it very easy to get around; the rooms were clean; the location was quiet.  The bad: in room lighting (we turned all the lamps on in the room and it's still too dark, adaquate,but not bright); rooms are a little on the small size even for NYC (functional 15x15 room but no extra space - basically a bed, desk, and TV with a bathroom down the entranceway); TV service is terrible (OK, who has cable service which doesn't receive any of the major networks including all of those in the city?  Let's ditch the oddball channel selections and get normal service - not sure what was going on here as the services book in the room showed a good channel selection, but none of them mapped to what was actually on the TV).  The hotel staff was friendly and they were more than willing to hold our luggage while we went out and about to see our show prior to being able to check in.  Breakfast is included, but we did not take advantage of it as we headed uptown early in the morning and just grabbed something on the go (there's a 24-hour McDonalds right down at the corner).

We'd stay here again as the price is right and there's nothing "wrong" with the place (other than maybe the TV), it's just not as high on our list as some of the other Marriott properties in midtown/midtown east.

title: True Hidden Gem
text: I actually considered not writing a review on this hotel since it may make it harder to book a room next time, but honestly, they deserve all the excellent reviews that they receive.  First of all, it's an incredible location, the Flower District, which is between Greenwich Village and Time Square. You are surrounded by florists, but plenty of places near by to eat and explore. We really appreciated being in a quiet setting and away from the touristy Time Square area.  Secondly, the staff is so helpful and friendly.  We checked in early, knowing that the room would not be ready.  They stored our luggage and even invited us to grab breakfast. The rooms are small, which is often the case in NYC, but the space is used wisely. For example, the TV is wall mounted. Planning on staying here the next time we are visiting New York and booking early.

title: Close to perfect
text: Every aspect of our stay here was more than adequate. Friendly, helpful staff, convenient location, pristine room, high quality breakfast and all-day drinks facilities.  Cookies at reception and a flower market on the path outside every day.

title: Convenience and Cookies
text: We booked a queen room with a pullout sofa online for our family consisting of mother, father and a tall teen son.  When we checked in the pullout sofa ended up being a pullout chair.  We called the front desk and they sent someone up immediately.  She took one look at our son and said that the pullout chair was unacceptable for someone his size and she wanted him to be comfortable and walked us to a queen/queen room at no additional cost,  We were so greatful and impressed with their promptness and accomodation to our needs. The hotel is compact, but clean, modern, well appointed and well staffed.  It is conveniently located in the flower district and between two subway lines (7th Ave and Broadway) making it very easy to get to anywhere in the city.  Walking down the street and seeing and smelling the flowers was amazing.  The breakfast was pretty typical but the ambiance of being in an atrium type of atmosphere was nice and made you feel a little New Yorkish.  And at the end of a long day of walking in the city who doesn't want to come back to their hotel to a batch of cookies waiting for them?

title: Finished to a high standard.
text:
This is a compact hotel wedged in among the rows of flower and plant stores in The Flower District. The rooms are well planned, and you get what you need. I had a king sized which didn't leave too much space, but in NYC you don't want to be hanging out in your room, right? The finish was excellent, and the bathroom had a large walk-in shower which was great.

The roof terrace is a great spot, but it has noisy aircon vents and only a few plastic chairs for furniture. I bundled up my pillows and duvet and made the plastic chairs cosy for looking at the nightime skyline, the aircon noise soon becomes background.

Breakfast is basic but good and included in the rate for all guests. You eat in a spacious conservatory.

Ideally located to get to all parts of Manhattan. Right between 6th and 7th with only a short walk to the subway. And about a 10-15 min walk to Times square. 

The staff were all great [housekeeping were told politely to come back later, and they did]. came at I paid $317 inc taxes per night, which is the most I have ever paid for a hotel room! Hey, its New York City, Baby!

title: Loved it
text:
Was great from the arrival. Not expensive for Manhattan, very well located (flower district, close to lots of subway lines and a short walk from SoHo, Times square, High Line Park etc). We felt safe even at 4am! 

Front of house was amazing! The ladies at reception were so friendly AND helpful. Special mention to Mia (?) who was all smiles, we absolutely loved her. We had a king size room and I can´t understand the complaints on the size. It´s a budget hotel and the room size is great, bed is comfy and we didn´t experience any noise. 

We pretty much left early in the morning and went back late in the afternoon for a shower and out again and the hotel was perfect for our 6 night stay. We mentioned that it was our anniversary and they left a little bag with some water, chocolates, very considerate. 

Breakfast wasn´t amazing but one could go and get some fruit, cereal, muffins, yoghurt, boiled eggs and have a quick bite before going out. 

I will definitely go back if in New York again, 100% recommended. Best budget hotel I´ve ever stayed in.

title: Excellent value for money in NYC
text:
I stayed here at the start of September 2012 and was very impressed. The rooms are quite spacious for Manhattan (king bed with plenty of floor space left over) and very clean. The bathroom is also nicely finished with a large shower, even if it's all a little squashed in. 

The included breakfast is a continental breakfast which is enough, but don't expect too much from it, and if you arrive late on there isn't a huge ammount of seating.

The staff are very helpful and polite, and let me check in almost 2 hours early to make my statue tour ferry, and stored my bags for almost 5 hours after check out until my flight.

The location isn't the best for viewing the city sights on foot, but there is a subway station at the end of the street which if you take the number 1 train (every 10 minutes or so), it takes you straight to times square and central park uptown in about 5/10 minutes, or to battery park and the island ferries downtown in about 15/20. If you like shopping the best thing to do is get the subway to times square then walk 2 blocks over to 5th avenue for the major shops.

I was really happy with my stay as the rooms were nice and the subway connection was very useful. At $150 inc. tax and charges, for the middle of Manhattan it's great value for money. I would definately stay there again and reccomend it to anyone going to visit NYC.

title: Do not recommend Fairfield Inn Manhattan/Chelsea
text: The daily rate was way over priced at $479 a night.  The service was the worst I've experienced.  The Front desk clerks were rude and unfriendly.  The room was decent, however personally had to tell the maid not to clean my room at 9:00am I needed time.  She shows up comes in while I"m sitting in the room and cleaned around me.  I was staying two more nights.  She didn't speak english and she ignored my request.  She rushed through the cleaning barely making the bed.  Their complimentary breakfast was more like boxed breakfast.  NO restaurant or room service.  NO movie chanels.  I wouldn't stay their again very disappointed the whole way around.  Many other hotels in NYC that I would recommend first!!!

title: Great Experience
text: Hotel is situated in midtown, close to Empire State Building and on the "flower street".  A newer hotel, there are modern amenities, nicely decorated rooms and very clean.  Breakfast was good, but perhaps management would consider offering hot food (eggs, ham/bacon, waffles).  Hotel staff were very friendly and provided excellent service.  Do not hesitate to book this hotel!

title: Great for Penn Stn and NYC
text:
We spent a week here on a sightseeing trip and it was a fantastic place to stay. The hotel is a couple of blocks from Penn station, and was able to walk to hotel after arriving in NYC via Amtrak. The hotel itself is tucked away on a sidestreet, opposite the Hotel Indigo,and is in a neighbourhood which has access to a number of Subway lines and some good eateries. 
The rooms are very clean, have been refurbed recently. The breakfast on offer is standard, but with a really good range of food. There's usually hot coffee on standby during the day, which is nice when you get back from a day's touring. The wifi is fine, and there are a couple of PCs with printers, which were handy for printing off train tickets and boarding cards. The staff are very friendly and helpful, with a good knowledge of the area. 
I can't emphasise enough how pleased we were with this hotel, it was really nice coming back to it every evening to relax. 
I would definitely stay here again, we really enjoyed our stay and it's my preferred hotel in NYC from now on.

title: Nice hotel, great location.
text: We spent a night here and it was great. The location was perfect for us coming from Penn Station; we were able to walk to many attractions and the subway was convenient. The hotel was clean, our room was comfortable and modern looking, the staff were very friendly. The breakfast was a pleasant surprise, with more choices than a free hotel breakfast usually offers. Free wi-fi, as well. We would recommend this hotel and consider staying here again.

title: It is what it is
text:
For the price you pay in NYC this was a decent place to stay and I would stay there again.  The location was good -- walking distance to Penn Station and a reasonably short taxi ride to many other attractions.  The room was clean, nothing to complain about there at all.  Upon getting off the elevator I was dismayed to see our room was right across the hall.  I figured we would hear the elevator all night, but I never heard a thing from it.

The buffet breakfast was adequate. No gourmet food but more than just carb-heavy sweet rolls and bagels.  The bedroom was simple - the bed, a desk area, and a chest with the TV on top.  The toiletries were OK if you hadn't brought your own.  They were not a luxury brand but they would suffice.  About the only disappointment was that there was no little safe in the room.  I find that to be a nice peace of mind amenity when staying in the city, not that anything happened to our possessions.  

Everyone who worked there was very pleasant and helpful, right down to the housekeeping staff.

title: charged twice for the room
text: The room is really nice and clean. The problem is I was charged twice for the same stay. I made reservation and prepaid via Priceline.com. A few days after I came home, I found out my card was charged for another $87.95. I didn't use any paid services, and I was not being told I was charged for anything when I checked out. I called and they said the charge was a mistake promising that will give me the refund tomorrow. Except this mistake, it was a pleasant for me.

title: Location Bargain
text: Terrific central walking distance location.  Excellent windows - I think any view is buildings.  Atypical of many NY hotels - larger walkin shower bathroom.  I was happy with my high floor, next to the elevator noiseless king.  This property exceeded my expectation.  It is an absolute first consideration for my next visit.

title: Would we stay here again...in a heartbeat!
text: The hotel itself was centrally located; subway was at the end of the block, Times Square was a 15-20 minute walk away and there were lots of restaurants in the area. The hotel was very clean, the lobby always had iced lemon water available when coming back, breakfast had lots of variety with good hours. Coffee and tea were available at any time.The hotel room was great; king size, comfortable bed with a good sized shower!  Front desk staff were very helpful and friendly; Mia was amazing!  The rooftop offered a great view of the city day or night and parking was down the street about 2 blocks with hotel rates ($25/night).

title: Little gem
text: Great little hotel, within easy walking distance of Times square. Hotel and rooms were clean and well maintained.We had a great view of the Empire State building. Good free breakfast in the conservatory each day.Very friendly and helpful staff. The hotel is on a street full of flower shops, the small is gorgeous. Next doors cat is a permanent fixture on the doorstep. Would recommend highly.

title: Low Key-Good Hotel
text:
When I say "low key" I mean it's not a big fancy hotel, it's very simple with a small lobby area and the entrance is on a quite side street (West 28th Street).  It's easy to pass by if you're not looking for it.  In my opinion, Low Key is very good!

I stayed here for one night on the 4th of July and used my Marriott points for the stay.  I do think this hotel prices good for it's location in NYC, but NYC hotels are VERY expensive.  If you are a senior or AAA member you will get a discount.  

LOCATION:- very good, just off 6th Avenue and a short walk to the subway on 7th Ave.  Right along 7th Ave there are plenty of restaurants and quick service places to get a nice meal or something on the go.  There's a McDonalds on the corner of 6th Ave as well.  It's right at the tip of Chelsea, so mid-town is maybe a 10-15 minute walk that will get you to Times Square, the theater district, Empire State Building, Macys, etc.  Greenwich Village is also a 15 minute walk in the other direction.  You'd need to take a subway or taxi to lower Manhattan or Central Park unless you LOVE to walk & explore.  The 2 closest major streets are 23rd Street with a lot of stores & restaurants and 34th Street where you will find Macy's, the Empire State Building, Madison Square Garden & lots of fast food places nearby.  

As I said, the lobby is small and comfortable, there is a small sitting area there and outside there is a small area to sit as well.  The front desk staff was so friendly and helpful, they really made me feel welcome.  

THE ROOM - my room was on the 7th floor and I could see the Empire State Building from my window, they gave me a room upgrade which was nice of them.  The room isn't terribly large but very comfortable.  I had a king bed, which was one of the most comfortable beds I ever slept in.  There was a nice flat screen tv with a good amount of channels, a desk with a lamp & electrical outlet, coffee maker with coffee & tea supplied, free WIFI, phone & clock/radio with alarm.  There was an iron & ironing board in the closet.  The AC kept the room quite chilly if turned up.  The window does slide open slightly on each side if you want a bit of fresh air.   I don't recall seeing a mini-frig.  The bathroom was nice, but small.  It was odd how the door opens into the bathroom.  When you open the door the sink is then behind the door.  So you have to scoot in & close the door to get to the sink.  It wasn't a big deal though, it's NYC-space is at a premium.   The tub/shower was very nice and after a long day out & about, the shower is very soothing.  They had some amenities in the bathroom like a small bottle each of shampoo, conditioner, & lotion.  The hotel also offers a complimentary continental breakfast each morning.  Unfortunately I slept in and didn't make it down for the breakfast nor did I see the breakfast room - sorry folks!  I enjoyed 4th of July evening a little bit too much and got in very late.  Speaking of that, we left the hotel around 10-1030pm to go out and even though most stores were closed (McDonalds on the corner was open) & the streets somewhat quiet, we felt very safe walking around the area as well as coming back around 130am from The Village.  It is a major city though, so be careful. 

Parking - NYC is not a good place for a car as it is expensive to park and street parking is extremely difficult to find and you often have to move the car for street cleaning.  They have a deal with 2 parking garages within a block from the hotel.  I parked at one between 5th & 6th Aves (on 28th St).  It is $25 a day for hotel guests and you MUST get your parking voucher validated at the hotel - you pay the garage when you pick the car up.  I checked around for less expensive parking but couldn't find any.  

I would stay at this hotel again.
